+ Large restaurant with an extensive menu that can please almost anyone
+ Good for families and groups
+ Easy to make a reservation
+ Food is just average

Our meal started with fresh bread and olive oil. The bread has that crunchy crust and soft inside that made it hard not to finish our entire plate even before we ordered. But alas, the bread was the highlight of my meal.

I ordered the ravioli and while the flavor was okay, the presentation was off. I expected the ravioli to come in some kind of red sauce, but it was sitting in a combination of broth and tomatoes. I also expected the filling to have the fava beans, but instead they were just mixed in with the ravioli. The dish was topped with crispy ham pieces-- I could have eaten a whole plate of those. The dish was also smaller than I expected, even given the menu is meant for sharing.

I also tried the gnocchi pesto (also just okay) and the tagliatelle bolognese (best dish I tried).

We went in between lunch and dinner, the place was pretty quiet & it was nice. The young lady that was waiting on us was super helpful and friendly. I asked her if she loved working there because she had a smile the entire visit. She said yes of course it is like family here. The food was good, just super heavy for my liking. You can tell everything was made fresh. It was a bit too dim when first walking in but after being inside you adjust. We sat at a back booth kind of away from the front door. Not too many people walked by, even staff. Needed a refill on drinks for quite some time. They were having a problem with the ceiling leaking when we were there. The building is super old they told us so it makes it difficult to take care of these things quick and clean.

Restrooms were clean they were upstairs if I remember correctly. Loved the decor of the restrooms haha

Check it out.

The food and dessert was delicious! The manager and Andi was super nice and made sure we were taken care of!

Unfortunately, our waiter Juan was not helpful. We just came from a cheer competition this past weekend and have not even anything all day until 4pm. We weren't dressed to impress but we are still customers and should be treated how everyone else is.

Anyways, He slightly explained the menu and did not ask if we wanted anything to drink besides water. My friend had to ask for her soda. We waited for 15 minutes for water. Bread was not even given to us AND we had to ask for it. On top of that, when he brought out our bread he said, "Here's MORE bread." Excuse me but we NEVER got out bread to begin with. He hardly ever checked on us. When the food came out we had a delicious meal and we were still missing our braised beef. He came by and saw that we were still missing someone and that was over 25 minutes after. We already finished all of our other food. After we got our braised beef, we asked Andi, she's GREAT by the way! Very sweet, listened to our concern and grabbed a manager right away. The manager took care of us: offered us dessert and took one item off of our bill.

Never have I gone to a restaurant with horrible service! The food was delicious and next time if I come back, I will definitely ask for Andi!!

Called ahead to see if they had gluten free pasta. Yes!
But it had egg in it so I opted for something the server suggested and it was delicious! Service was great. Only in Chicago for a short visit. Food was great.

I must say that I was not impressed nor happy when I ate here. Service to me is EVERYTHING and this place under delivered.
Came on a Saturday afternoon and it was steady but NOT slammed. Waited 15 minutes for our waitress to come to us and then we were rushed to order. Our waitress also was VERY dismissive and borderline rude. Like she did not want us to eat there or something or maybe she just hated her job. Frankly that isn't my problem, if you don't like your job then QUIT! I was going to ask her what her deal was but I didn't want to risk any funky business with my food.

I went with the basics, Fettuccini Alfredo and MAN was I disappointed. I have never tasted anything that bland in my entire life. I am not even over exaggerating (and we all know I love to do that) but it was miserable. It was so miserable that I asked them to bring me seasoned salt. I dumped the salt on the Alfredo and it got better but I was just turned off that they had the audacity to serve this at an Italian restaurant.
The reason we came here was because it always looks busy so we thought the food bust be amazing but NEGATIVE. I don't know what to say, I know I can't take back the gross taste I had in my mouth when I tried the Alfredo.
Now we all know I am a fair human being! If service was top notch I would've tried to convince myself to try them again and order something different but service sucked balls.

Definitely will not be coming back.

Great place for big groups!! Went here with about 12 people for dinner on a weekday and had an amazing experience! We ordered ton of food and almost everything was upto the mark. We had two servers looking after our table and making sure everyone's requests were taken care of! Their pizzas are great (better than pasta I feel) I would definitely recommend ordering these: burrata with roasted beets, fondue and asparagus risotto! Make sure to end your meal with their Tiramisu- melts in your mouth! Out of everything we ordered, the only things that didnt taste that good were the bruschetta and gnocchi!

I love this place. The concept of small plates lets me feel like I get to try a bunch of things.  And we did.  The tagliatelle was great and the short ribs were perfect. Pork was was good, not great, but it didn't matter because it was just one course.

This is our second time and we have gotten to try some great stuff.  The environment is fun and the service is great.  

The pizza even looks good but we haven't made it that far.  Too many good pastas.
The atmosphere is cozy, charming, fun. The food is delicious. Small plates are shared giving opportunities to try more from the menu.

I'm not certain where all these raving reviews come from but my gosh this place was awful. I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and being that it was an entree off the main menu and not the kids menu, I expected my portion size to reflect that - nope! I was so confused when my order arrived as it was the smallest bowl for an adult I'd ever seen. Not only that, the actual food looked like something you make in a Home Ed class. The food was bland; I had to add salt and pepper. And honestly, the only reason I ate it, was because I was starving having not eaten anything that day before or after my 10 mile morning run.

Listen friends. Never again. There are so many great Italian eateries in the city, I've no idea why I decided on this spot smack in the middle of tourist town. 1 star for the chocolate martini.

This place is a tourist trap, and the location makes it easy for Mag Mile shoppers to stop in and have a lively meal. I feel terrible, because this may be one of the worst italian places in the city. As a local to Chicago, I've had many out-of-towners tell me this was one of the best Italian restaurants they'd ever been to. After eating here, I'm beginning to question my relationship with these people.

Food is incredibly standard, it's like they aren't even trying. I think Pizza Hut may serve better Italian food than this place.

First timer to QUARTINO! Friday night. Packed. Luckily made reservations in advance! Had to still wait 25 minutes after our reservation time to get seated(oh well). Visiting the city with friends and enjoyed the dining experience! Family style small plates! Share share share! Ordered 8 items including a pizza and a bottle(liter) of house wine between 4 of us. $29 each. Delicious! Quick service! Loved it and would return.

We were able to snag two seats at the bar upstairs on a Saturday night. The service was great and quick. The portions were perfect sizes and the food was delicious! They have a great selection of beer, wines, and ciders. We were thoroughly impressed!

Walked in for a late lunch after searching Yelp. Very pleasantly surprised by the food and old school design. The house made pastas were a highlight, as was a pomegranate sorbetti. Special thanks to Michael Friedman who was especially gracious and made us feel really welcome.

Came here twice to celebrate birthdays, I must say the staff is very attentive and is always making sure you have a great time. The server we had gave us all shots for my friends birthday and made the time very enjoyable.

My favorite is the truffle risotto and the ricotta bread !!! All the dishes are shared so make sure you have room to try different dishes.

This place is just convenient in many ways...they are located in an accessible spot. The menu is diverse enough for a group that like to share.  They have a good outdoor seating ambiance. In my recent visit, I was pleasantly surprised by the cocktail menu. I had a drink that had some strawberry and some balsamic..it was very yummy and balanced...not sweet or tart.

Foodwise, the veal meatballs seemed microwaved...a little rubbery with raisin sauce. The dates were not as addicting as I had hoped. The octopus with spinach just lacked some flavor (salt?).

The dessert with 2 sets of lemon cake and ice cream was large and impressive that can be shares by 8 people. It was certainly too much for 2 people.

Service was attentive and friendly. Foodwise, it didn't impress too much.

It's like tapas style for Italian food. We tried EVERYTHING on this menu (okay, maybe not everything but certainly felt like a lot of food). Had the spaghetti and meatballs, the octopus, the pappardelle (a little oily but still tasty), the chicken soup...mmmmm! I particularly enjoyed how "home-y" the atmosphere was. It was inviting and a pleasure to sit in a restaurant with lots of wood decor pieces, large machinery that they actually use to cut the bread in, loaves of bread on display that were being used as complimentary bread...I can go on. It is worth the visit to try some delicious Italian cuisine for date night (or a day type of date).

It is simple, sweet, and romantic. Our server was excellent and truly made it a memorable experience. A little on the pricier side ($100+ for lunch) but that included all our food choices and a drink split for two (gelato plus prosecco plus vodka---mmmm!).

This place is good, not great.

Food:
I guess it really depends what you order. I am not impressed with most of the pastas I have tried. I am obsessed with Gnocchi in general, but theirs is just not good. So disappointing. The Tagliatelle also left much to be desired. Just not great.

Some things I did enjoy were the Calamari, the Veal Meatballs, and my favorite is the Campania Pizza.

Beware:
It is extremely loud in here!
They do not accept to go orders over the phone. (So annoying!)

Pricing: not bad for Chicago.

During our 2.5 days stay in Chicago, we somehow ended up here THREE TIMES.  In part due to our close proximity to Quartino but mostly because the husband is obsessed with Italian food (and we don't often eat it back home).  This place is allegedly one of the best Italian restaurants according to one of our Uber drivers and my native Chicagoan friend and the husband most certainly agreed.

Our first visit was a little after the lunch rush, which was perfect because you know, as a vegan, I always have a bunch of annoy vegan questions. As luck would have it, our server was a vegan and was able to provide me with an exhaustive list of all their vegan items as well as some veganizable entrees the kitchen could throw together for me.  I opted for the White Bean and Garlic Spread and substituted raw veggies instead of the Toasted Filone - which was freaking delicious by the way.  We also opted for some delightful beverages, of which I can no longer remember our selections.  

The manager actually came out to chat with us on account of my husband's Astros cap (right after the Astros won the World Series) and ended up hooking us up with a free orange sorbet, which was quite thoughtful and appreciated.  

Our following two trips occurred within two hours of one another, one right before the dinner rush (and boy does it get crazy up in here on the weekends!) and then after.  I just had the minestrone soup and some wine, but the husband could not get enough of the pasta.  I don't think I had seen him this overjoyed over food in quite awhile to be quite frank.

So overall, definitely recommend this joint for some high-quality delicious Italian food and awesome service.  I could foresee us returning here should we ever visit Chicago again.

I visited Quartino because their prices looked surprisingly affordable and in the land of deep dish I wanted to see how thin crust was done.

I dined on the patio and though the restaurant was busy, I was well taken care. Complimentary bread with olive oil and balsamic held me over until my $12 margherita pizza arrived with a plentiful helping of fresh basil. The sauce was delicious and as I packed away the last piece I found myself secretly wanting more. Sadly, I did not care for the polenta fries at all. The polenta was so bland all I could taste was the grease from the fryer. I found myself wishing I could dunk it in marinara rather than the red bell pepper sauce they served with it. Overall, not the most outstanding thin crust pizza I've ever had, but I would go back again.

I don't remember where I got this recommendation from but it was a Tuesday night, our movie plans had fallen through, and we were looking for a last minute dinner without an hour wait and this was on my bookmarked list. When we got there, there was no wait but it was packed and so loud we could barely hear each other. I thought I'd made a terrible mistake. Then we started eating. We started with Dates Wrapped In Pancetta, had the amazing veal meatballs, mushroom and truffle risotto, and to cap it off, a very impressive dessert strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla gelato with strawberries and whipped cream and hazelnuts. It was so beautiful but also so delicious so no pictures. Everything was fast and good and a grand total of about $50. Impressive.

We came here for dinner and really enjoyed our meal. The place was packed and we waited about an hour for our table at the bar. Despite how busy it was, service after being seated was attentive and things came out pretty quickly.

We ordered the tortellini and the linguini with clams. Both entrees were great. We shared the profiteroles for dessert and that was also delicious. The prices were very reasonable given the location and popularity of this restaurant. Would come back to Quartino's but preferably at a time when it is less busy.

This place is always packed. I have to guess that tourists love it, but the food could be better. Also, it was incredibly hot in the main dining area. I don't know if it was just an off night, but it made for an uncomfortable dining experience.

Fondue: who doesn't love a cheese fondue? The cheese itself is delicious, but the bread that it comes with is super tough. Each bite is like trying to rip through what could only be described as 10-day old bread. It's dry and tasteless and impossible to eat. I ended up using the regular bread that comes to every table.

Burrata: part of the burrata was really tasty, but half of this burrata was tough and doughlike, making it hard to even cut into, which is not typical of most burrata. I've never seen anything like it, but it wasn't good. The beets were fresh and tasty.

Gnocchi: it's okay. The pesto sauce is tasty, but it doesn't leave you craving more.

Tortellini: this dish is delicious. The alfredo sauce is perfectly creamy and cheesy, and the prosciutto tastes fresh and pairs nicely. Favorite dish on the menu -- you should definitely order this one.

Beef short rib: tender, flavorful. This was good.

The service was fine throughout the night. The space is beautiful. There are two levels, and the interior is nicely decorated. I can see why it's a tourist hot spot, but there are so many better Italian places here in Chicago. Even Osteria Via Stato next door knocks the socks off this place. Given the bustling neighborhood this place is located, I would not choose to go back here.
Love their pizza!!! This is Quattro Formaggi with arugula and shaved Parmesan. Amazing!!

Sooo...let's start with the positive. At our lunchtime visit today, the service was spot on. The hostess gave us a warm welcome as she seated us in the bright porch area. Our waiter, whose name I didn't catch but he had cool glasses, was attentive and friendly from the start. Also, I was impressed with two visits from important looking men (owners? managers?) who came to check in with us during our meal. Really, the service couldn't have been better.

We ended up getting the weekday lunch special - $25 for a three course meal for two. Now, it's important to remember that these are small plates we're talking about here. We started with the pancetta wrapped figs with gorgonzola and honey. They were rich but pretty tasty. Next we moved on to the cavatelli pasta. This was my favorite dish of the day. Italian simplicity at its best. We ended with the shrimp. My advice would be to avoid this dish. It was teeny tiny and tasted fishy to me. We did order a pepperoni/sausage pizza too for the kids and it was delicious. I think the next time, I would opt for a couple of different pizzas and a couple glasses of wine.

What irked me about our meal was the $5.50 charge on a small side of plain spaghetti. I'm talking small, like 4-5 ounces at most. I mean, c'mon now. That's just crazy.

Anyway, you'll overpay for sure, but you'll enjoy some tasty food and solid service at Quartino.

Pros: Great prices, beautiful locale, service was excellent. Went with a group of 10+ and they did an outstanding job handling our large group. They have an excellent wine selection and stunning bar area.

Cons: Food was "meh" and everyone in my group felt the same. I had the arugula pesto gnocchi, it was okay. My buddy had the veggie pizza, she wasn't impressed. Another buddy had the veggie risotto it was average.

Will prob not return.

This place is kind of a tourist trap and a claustrophobic's nightmare.
My friend and I came here on a Friday night, and we were squeezed into a table on the second floor, right next to a rowdy group of tourists (probably). This place had four stars on Yelp, so I was somewhat hopeful about the food. We shared the wild arugula salad which had a dressing that was way too sour for my liking. We then split the Penne alla Vodka and Tortellini which were both pretty solid. I appreciated that Quartino takes reservations because I can't imagine the wait without it; however, I really was not a fan of the atmosphere as it was just overall too packed and loud. This would be a good place for a large party but probably not if you're looking for an intimate atmosphere.

I love this place, and it is a nice mid range restaurant to visit if you are in town. You can get bottles of wine for decent prices, and all of the food is great! Their chicken soup is AMAZING, and pastas I recommend are the penne a la vodka and the Bolognese. If you like clams the sauce is great and you get a large portion! This place will have a wait, but if you go by 5 and hit the bar you can usually find a table!

One of my favorite restaurants in downtown Chicago!

Quartino features small plate, Italian style dishes that are made to share with the table. They have a variety of cheese and charcuterie that you can try as well as a good selection of wine.

My favorite dishes are the caprese, fettuccine alfredo, broccoli rabe, and ESPECIALLY THEIR POLENTA FRIES and CLAMS. The polenta fries come with a bell pepper sauce for dipping- this dish is something I always look forward to when coming here. Another one of my all time favorites is the clam- it comes in a white wine broth and is served with buttery pieces of bread that is perfect for dipping in the delicious broth. The pizza here is decent too and a good size for sharing.

I also love the ambience here- it's rustic and trendy. It is fairly loud in inside though!
Everything here is amazing!!!! (Minus the pesto gnocchi) This place is definitely a Chicago staple!

First visit and the other reviewers were not wrong. The food for the price is unbelievable and the service is top notch. We had the fennel sausage pizza to start (could have used a bit more oregano), a serving of calamari and the penne with vodka sauce (I normally avoid cream sauces, but Quartino's sauce was rich, but not too rich).

My only complaint is that it's LOUD!
Nice Italian place with reeeaaally good food. Service is great most of the time.

I really, really enjoyed my experience at Quartino. Italian food is already fancy, but Italian food tapas-style is a whole new level of impressive.

I had dinner here with my boyfriend and his family on a Sunday night (actually, to meet my boyfriend's family for the first time. IT WENT WELL, FOLKS!!!). We had reservations for 6:00 pm, and right when we walked in, our table was ready for us. Quartino looks and feels exactly how you'd expect an Italian/pizzeria-like place to look. Except it's more upscale than your average pizzeria.

I didn't catch our waitress's name, but she had what she herself described as "bold red"-colored hair, she was informative about the menu, and made sure we always had water and that our glasses were never half-empty when it came to wine. My boyfriend splurged and ordered an entire bottle of wine for the two of us anyway, so that wasn't really going to be a problem anyway. But I digress.

We ordered quite a bit of things to share, because what you order comes in smaller plates. This included eggplant parmesan and a delicious kale salad. I'm not going to lie, there were a lot of other things ordered to share, but Quartino has good wine... which affected my memory ever-so-slightly. But I do remember being pleased with it all! We each also got our own meals as well, and I ordered tortellini, which was SO great. The plate was lined with prosciutto, for heck's sake!

Quartino was fabulous for an important family night out, and I'd recommend it for date nights, birthdays, and other special occasions as well.

Oh, and a bathroom tip: It's up the staircase in the middle of the restaurant. I saw quite a few people (in my party included!) get lost while trying to find the restroom!

Great Italian place in the heart of River North. My wife won a gift card to here and we came and stuffed ourselves on delicious pastas, breads, cheese, charcuterie, and wine. The Travel Channel was filming some sort of food show while we were there and we got to participate in being filmed "enjoying our meal" which was pretty fun and exciting. It's definitely a loud and fun "family" atmosphere and I'll be back for sure.

I see this place in my dreams. It is a staple when my family visits Chicago. A treasured part of the trip that we always look forward to. I have had everything on the menu from pasta to pizza to salad to dessert. Each dish is of the highest quality. Expertly executed. AUTHENTIC. Handmade. Just...amazing. The service is always excellent too
-- although I do wish they didn't pack people in there like sardines. You're always rubbing elbows with the tables next to you. Alas, the food makes it all worth it. Once you're digging in, you hardly notice. One thing I order every single visit without fail...the Gran Coppa Quartino for dessert. Chocolate, strawberry and vanilla gelati with strawberries, whipped topping, hazelnuts and biscotti. Oh. My. God. Just GO!

pics.caption: Gran Coppa Quartino -- chocolate, strawberry and vanilla gelati with strawberries, whipped topping, hazelnut and biscotti. AMAZING!

review.des: Amazing Italian food, truly authentic. Fried calamari was bomb, pasta (we tried a variety) was cooked perfectly and flavor was exceptional, and the pizza we ordered on the side was also fantastic. Everything had a variety of fresh ingredients and truly was satisfying. Also, if you're at the bar and encounter a younger looking guy named Iggy, just know the guy is amazing and is extremely helpful. Overall a fantastic experience, 100% would come back.

This is a fast pace place. Loud and lovely. I ordered my pasta with chicken and very spicy. It was so good. They give you a lot of bread and the olive oil is nice with it.

I will come here again and again. Great food  and great company.

The staff here are very friendly. This didn't happen at my table but the table next to us. I overheard that the resturant made accommodations for a party who had children who was allergic to certain foods. It's always awesome to know resturant would ensure that all food is safe for the party.

When ordering appetizers, I recommend getting the bread with honey and cheese. It was delicious. First time eating something like that. No regrets. The table was pretty small as we had a table of 6. Not much space for elbows or plates. I personally order the gnocchi which I felt was not savory enough.

This place encourages sharing which is awesome.

Nice restaurant and I like the concept of sharing so a big thumbs up for that aspect.  The tables are very small so our party of three felt a little crunched especially when you start to bring out the plates to share.

It does get loud inside but we were still able to carry on conversations and I really liked the options on the menu.  

Would certainly come back here when in town.

Came early right at Friday open time at 11:30 am. Amazing weekday lunch special plus one entree with attentive service! Really surpassed our expectation! Best Italian lunch you can have in Downtown Chicago.
This is one of my go to favorites here in Chi-Town! Great food, great service & fantastic abvionce!

Walked into this amazing place !  The smell of greatness hit me first , the smell of fresh garlic basil and fresh breads. The looks of an older well established Italian restaurant filled with breads stacked high and a old deli meat fridge fill the wonderful place.  The friendly atmosphere is filled with even more romantic Italian music and the aromatherapy of good food.  I was greeting by my waiter Ryan who was as professional any restaurant around the world. Managment is very attentive and friendly. Adam Z. Who runs a great crew ensures the customers are well taken care of. The selection of foods is equally incredible from Pizza to Zeal you can't go wrong with any dish here.  If you miss coming here , you've missed amazing Italian food done the right way !

Great place for larger groups (6-10). It's like an Italian tapas place. 3 dishes serves 2 people. I highly recommend the steam clams pasta. It is spicy but it's really good. The campania pizza is delicious and the amount of cheese is just enough. It's fresh and light. For dessert, the profiteroles is yummy and the ratio of all the ingredients are just the right amount. If you have a big sweet tooth, the torta al cioccolato is really good and it's served warm.

I really wanted to like this place but it just wasn't working for me. The atmosphere is great and the decor is rustic, almost like you're in your Italian grandmothers own home. I walked in and the host told me that it would be a 45 min wait and I agreed to wait but the wait ended up being for an hour and a half. It's not the wait that pissed me off it was the fact that the host never came and told me that the wait was extended. I was about to walk out when i was finally seated. The bread and oil they give you was good. Bread was nothing to write home about but the oil was really good and so was the cheese. I ordered the spaghetti pomodoro and honestly it was garbage. I mean the fact that they even call this Italian good has my nonna spinning in her grave. The sauce was acidic as hell and the pasta was over cooked to mush. The meatballs were also kind of bland and had a strange texture, like they were packed too tight. Also had the caviatelli and although the pasta itself was cooked great the sauce was too sweet for my taste. I'd probably give this place another try but idk I'll have to see.

Another 5* service!  And food is phenomenal!

My girlfriend and I visited last night, we were catching up on patio and almost every 10min a service staff promptly checked on us, even the restaurant manager stopped by to double check everything.  

Towards the end of the night, our server Ramon offered us Burrata which was extra.

Im a fan of Quartino's and definitely recommend to anyone who loves authentic Italian cuisine.

We were looking forward to trying Quartino- not only because of the stellar reviews but who doesn't love pasta???

When we got there, the restaurant was fairly empty but at the end of the meal, almost every table was full.
Our waiter was very attentive and explained the menu to us in full.

We opted for their lunch for 2 special: a bowl of soup for the both of us, penne vodka and crispy calamari.
We also went with a bottle of rose because why not?

Not only was the food exceptional but we were also given warm and toasty bread when we were seated, which was very tasty when dipped into the pipping hot sun-dried tomato soup.

I highly recommend this place if anyone wants delicious Italian food; I would also recommend making reservations.
Although the building is large, seems as though tables fill up quickly.

I found the perfect Alfredo fettuccine here at Quartino. No wonder this is one of the number one rated Italian restaurant!

We made a reservation at 8pm for three girls. The restaurant was already crowded inside and outside. Our waitress was nice and attentive. She recommended my friend a glass of red wine and my friend said it paired really well with the food we ordered. The atmosphere and interior of the place was just like any other Italian restaurant but had nice vibe and ambience. We ordered shrimp risotto, Alfredo fettuccine and a meat dish (I forgot the name). We didn't like so much with the meat because it tasted very similar to this traditional Korean side dish we often eat. The meat was soft though. We liked shrimp risotto but it was bit salty. We really loved Alfredo fettuccine. Whenever, I go to an Italian restaurant, I try to get fettuccine. Not only I love cream pasta but also many Italian restaurant can't get it perfect even though it is a simple traditional dish. Quartino has masted Alfredo fettuccine; It was the best Alfredo I had in my life.

It has been weeks last time I visited here and I still miss their fettuccine. It was perfectly balanced with its cream and pasta itself. It wasn't too creamy, dry or watery; It was just perfect. I would love to go back to get their fettuccine again.

Popular Italian restaurant downtown.  Been here a few times for dinner.  The food is pretty good.  Pastas are well made, seasoned well, and lots of various entree options.  Typically we order a few things and share.

Make a reservation before going, since it seems to be crowded all the time. Service has been always fairly good, sometimes just a little slow.  Prices are fair for the area.  It's cool they still give discounts to those who work in the industry.

I visited Quartino while attending a business conference in town.  I extended my trip by a day just so I could experience a bit more of what Chicago has to offer.  At the suggestion of a bartender at another establishment, I walked to Quartino for dinner and I really should have tipped him a little heavier because I came away very impressed with the food, decor, and service.

Since I was solo, I chose to sit at the bar, first ordering a Negroni which I highly recommend.  Very nice!  I was unable to decide on a dish or two so at the suggestion of the bartender, I ordered three half plates.  My Gnocchi came out so fast that I told the server that it wasn't mine when he brought it.  I also had the Veal Meatballs Napoli and the Orecchiette.  All three were fantastic.

Ordinarily, I like to try different places when I visit the larger cities, but Quartino is most definitely up for a return visit on my next trip to Chicago.

pics.caption: Negroni and gnocchi. Negroni is awesome, getting ready to dig into the gnocchi

review.des:
Pros:
- I really like their homemade tagliatelle. It has a nice homemade texture and inconsistency in size, which I adore. Just love it
- Calamari is also seasoned well and good, but Carmine's is better. Quartino's calamari is thicker in consistency and denser in wash. Both are soft! But Carmine's is heavenly soft and light. You will feel fat after Quartino's calamari (I still like it!)

Cons:
- Inconsistent, and the chef has been changing every year or so. And I notice the difference in taste, especially with the tagliatelle
- AWFUL ordering-out policy. We like to order out. They have an early cut-off time to order out, and if you need to order out after this time, their first answer will always be no. You'll have to request a manager to override this (it can be done). Makes no sense to me

---
I generally prefer Carmine's, but Quartino's has longer hours. Also, Quartino's tagliatelle is my favorite in Chicago (and 2nd favorite calamari). But Carmine's is my favorite for calamari, stuffed mushrooms, square noodles in vodka sauce, and skirt steak velasco. Try both!!

- Recommended: homemade tagliatelle, calamari

pics.caption: Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo. Tagliatelle alla Bolognese is better

review.des:
Quartino is a fun, bustling, and delicious Italian restaurant.  Make reservations, because this place gets crowded with everyone from sports fans on their way to games to bachelorette parties to large families.

The menu features a wide variety of medium-sized entrees, intended for sharing. My party enjoyed the Caprese salad and olive assortment as a starter. For dinner, my dining partners were very happy with the Tortellini served with prosciutto. I also enjoyed my Farmhouse Chicken, which was plain and simple in the best sense--a generous portion of delicious and tender chicken with minimal season or preparation.

The only food disappointment of the evening was that no one liked the Margherita pizza.  We all found it strangely bland.  It tasted like the wrong cheese was used, as if they replaced the usual mozzarella with cheddar.  We'd definitely avoid the pizza next time, but the pasta and entrees were all delicious.

Service was generally very good, and I think three people stopped by our table to make sure everything was to our liking.  But, for some reason, the great service stumbled when we ordered dessert. The dessert course (a sorbet and Toral al Cioccolato) took longer to arrive than did our main entrees. To give credit where it is due, our server proactively noted the lengthy delay and apologized, but were about ready to cancel our dessert order by the time it arrived. (Once there, dessert was tasty. The raspberry sorbet was tart and the chocolate tort was almost too sweet.)

Despite a couple missteps, we found the place fun, interesting and delicious.  We'll definitely be back.

Honestly this place was a let down on our visit to Chicago. We were looking for some Italian food and came across this place from reviews and google. The restaurant allows reservations which is nice, considering the wait was quite long Friday night. The aesthetic is nice however the restaurant is so cramped and very noisy. Our waiter was often never to be found when we wanted something and we had to flag down another waiter to get our order in and more bread. Also while there were four of us and we all ordered, they tended to be stingy with the bread -_- overall when we got our food nothing was remarkable, the vodka sauce was pretty good but the Alfredo was average.  Our waiter had told us everything was portioned as family sized so we expected leftovers, the portions were actually pretty small and we were left wanting more.

We decided to do dessert and that was delicious! We had the tiramisu and it was such a creamy consistency and such a strong flavor. Definitely recommend the tiramisu

I love the food. We got some gnocchis with arugula pesto and it was fluffy, spicy, and delicious. We also ordered the pappardelle with braised beef and the taste was so nostalgic to me and reminded me of a dish my mom used to make I almost cried. Obviously I was too hungry to take any pictures lol..

We also got some deserts. DO NOT MISS THE ZEPPOLES! The fluffiest and lightest i have ever tasted.
I just wish that the server told us that the second  sauce were an extra 2 dollars because it's not really about the money as much as It being about how much I hate it when restaurants offer you something then charge you for it.
But overall a good experience.

This is one of my favorite places for dinner in Chicago! They have an extensive wine list and as the name implies you can order wine in sizes of 1/4 liter and up, which allows you to sample a variety of wines if you're there with a group rather than having to choose between a glass or a bottle. Their menu includes Italian tapas, thin crust pizzas, salads, pastas, and charcuterie, and everything is really good and fairly priced.

I also love the atmosphere here - servers wear European soccer jerseys and the tv's inside play old Italian movies and everyone appears to be having a good time. It's often very busy so I recommend making a reservation in advance, trying to grab a table outside or at the bar, or going at an off time.

I recommend starting with a couple carafes of wine, the veal meatballs, and the goats milk ricotta and then go from there!

pics.caption: The veal meatballs with tomato sauce
The house made goats milk ricotta

review.des:
My flight landed at 11:30pm so I was looking around trying to find a top notch restaurant that was still serving food around 12:30am and stumbled across Quartino.  When I called to confirm that their kitchen was still open, they were kind enough to allow me to place an order on the phone so that the food would be ready for us as soon as we arrived.  And lo and behold, within a few minutes of being seated in the bar area (the main restaurant was closed), we were already eating :)

The pizza that we ordered was fantastic, as was the cavatelli dish but unfortunately the gnocchi dish that we ordered was bland and flavorless.  We didn't say anything to the staff, but our waitress noticed that we had polished off the first two dishes and barely touched the gnocchi and expressed concern when we didn't want to pack it to go.  When we received the bill, she told us that she had taken the gnocchi off the bill (completely unasked for), which I really appreciated.  What a great introduction to Chicago hospitality!

Despite being on the busy State Street in the busy modern downtown of Chicago, Quartino Ristorante feels like a piece of Italy that has been imported from overseas! Even out in the outdoors street side patio with cars passing by, sitting there certainly reminds of my time at the quaint, slow living Rome thanks to the decor with very details (down to even the salt and pepper) that were obviously meticulously chosen to deliver the most authentic Italian experience in the midst of a bustling American city. The vibe alone was enough to win me over.

One thing I found strange though was that all the waiting staff wore football jerseys (soccer in America) when no restaurant I went in Italy did that, but oh well.

Anyway, more importantly, the food here is great as well and definitely adds to the Italian experience! Although slightly smaller than expected, my choice of risotto was on point with the taste and the texture. The rice was simmered well that it struck the perfect balance between soft and firm, and the creamy sauce was also perfection in delivering flavors to augment the rice without being overwhelming. You can definitely taste the high-quality ingredients that this restaurant uses!

On the side note, I also love the olive oil that they use to accompany complimentary bread because of its nutty undertone.

Okay, enough with the tangent! The prices are reasonable compared to other Italian restaurants (about $20 per person for entree and dessert), but the experience is well worth it. Despite of its high-quality food and well-decor environment, the restaurant is super casual so you won't have the pressure of fine dining. If you are seeking an excellent Italian meal with great vibe and good food in downtown Chicago, go to Quartino!

pics.caption: A fine Italian meal in the bustling downtown!

review.des:
This place is fantastic. It will not let you down.
The burrata here is ridiculous - the beets they serve it on are fantastic, and I'm not even a big fan of beets! I even appreciate the little things such as providing Parmesan for your bread in a nifty pepper mill-like device that grated a solid block for you.
After multiple visits and trying dishes like the veal, tortellini, carpaccio, chocolate cake & gelato - we have not had a disappointing pasta, appetizer or dessert yet!
Oh and their off-menu tiramisu - WOW

Really enjoyed this restaurant! I came here last weekend with a group of 9 and we were seated at a large round table, which we all loved.

The service was fantastic and the food was delicious (especially the pasta!!). I liked the tapas style italian because we were able to order a bunch of dishes to share. The menu itself is massive, honestly a bit overwhelming, there are just so many options! We ordered a liter of wine for 6 of us which was perfect. We each had about a glass and a half.

For food, we decided on burrata, cavetelli, penne alla vodka, margarita pizza, and funghi pizza. I gotta say, the pasta was out of this world. It was definitely on the heavier side, so it was good that we shared, but I definitely could've eaten the entire plate by myself. The cavatelli was by far my favorite - so flavorful! The funghi pizza was also really delicious. I thought the margarita pizza was a little boring, not the best marg pizza I've had.

Great vibes, I would definitely come back here again!

Tried this place for the first time last night and it was awesome!! Reservations are a must especially on the weekends since this place was PACKED from the time we were there to the time we left. Our server was awesome, she gave us great recommendations. We had the limoncello martinis (yum!), and rose with dinner. We started with calamari, then had the asparagus risotto, bacon wrapped dates, and farmhouse chicken. All delicious! Plates are meant to be shared so its great to go with a group. We also had tiramisu which isn't on the menu but our server offered to us so we took it and it was pure heaven! You won't be disappointed.

Quartino is exactly what you're looking for when visiting Chicago! It's close to all the action off Michigan Avenue, the prices are affordable, they take reservations, and the food is consistently delicious every time.

I've been a handful of times with and without a reservation. Luckily the place is huge and has a nice bar area with tables designated for walk ins as well. So even if it's busy, you may get lucky with little or no wait time.  

The food is comforting and delicious for just the right price! I specifically love the goat cheese ricotta served with warm toasted bread, the penne a la vodka and any of their pizzas. They also offer heavier main dishes, meats, cheeses and salads. The menu is designed to share so it's perfect for girlfriends or date night. We usually get about three things for two people and are satisfied.  Then comes the wine. It's divided into 1/4, 1/2 and full liters and at a good price. A 1/4 liter is about a standard glass and a half ranging from $9-14. Not a bad price at all!

The only downside is that the tables are small and they pack you in there (which is probably how you get that short wait time). And it's loud! No so much that it ruins your time but it can't be ignored either.

It had been years since my last visit to quartino and after this visit, I don't know why I took such a long hiatus.

My magadang babae and I arrived for a late-night dinner on a cold night and were quickly warmed by an old-school Italian ristorante vibe, soft light, pleasant din of other tables' conversations and laughter, warm, friendly service, and a loaf of warm, crusty, fresh-baked bread.

Our great conversation all evening was only interrupted by sips on our Souza margarita grande and Tanqueray negroni eccellente and delish food.

We started with a warm bowl of zuppa minestrone and a wild arugula salad with nuts and more. Both were freshly prepared, flavorful and filling.

Service all the while was polite, friendly and attentive.

We moved on to a beautiful salmon filet with a unique glaze. It was definitely something different, and acquired taste but tasty. A side of broccoli was steamed perfectly, with enough crunch yet warm and soft, bright green and still rich in flavor. We had a crispy calamari appetizer as our other entree and it, too, was a large portion and filling. The calamari could have been just slightly less cooked but I know that can be tricky when it's lightly breaded and fried.

Wait staff had no problem with us talking and enjoying our time together, not rushing with our food. Eventually we made it to Desert and ordered a beautifully crafted, old-school Italian sgroppino -- a fun, frothy, bright-note, sweetly romantic and potent dessert drink! We ordered gelati which was blow-your-mind yummy and light, and a slab of tiramisu big enough for an entire birthday party.

The bill was reasonable, exactly as expected and in my mind a great value for a perfect evening.

Not really big on Italian food but this place was great. I love how it's all small plate family style meals. Went here with some coworkers after work so it was a great way to share a bottle of wine and some food. Great vibe and service. I recommend as a good place to go with a group of friends or family.

Had such an amazing experience here! This restaurant has a very cozy Italian vibe. You do not necessarily have to dress up to go here. Went out with coworkers for a night out in Chicago and it didn't disappoint.

We got different kind of pasta, all is very good. I got their amazing risotto and their red sauce pasta, with very tender meat. The sauce was very rich!

They have a very good list of wine - when in doubt, ask! The dessert is really the stars here! Do not miss the Italian donuts as they are my favorite! Will definitely come back! Remember to make a reservation before you come though, as it seems to be very crowded, but I have seen people just walked in and they had to wait for quite some time. Very fun experience! Don't hesitate!!

For being right in the heart of River North, this place took me by surprise. I know there is good restaurants, but  you just never know.

My friend and I were craving some homemade, fresh pasta...and after a search, this was one of the places that served it. Whoo! and it was close to her house and not far from work for me. There's a big dining room, that extends onto the second level. Then there's a rather spacious bar.

The feel of the whole place made me think more old-school big steakhouse (lots of wood) than it did Italian restaurant, but no worries. The staff is super nice and it's a good place for a quiet-ish drink/meal.

We were there around happy hour time, so I choose seats at the bar. There were no real drinks specials, but if you ordered one of the "happy hour drinks", you got a free meat or cheese. I had to once I saw duck proscuitto on the list of available items. Also, the bread is delicious...we just couldn't stop eating it and ordered more to go with our pasta.

My friend got the fettuccine alfredo and I got the parpadelle with braised beef. They were both very delicious and we cleaned our plates. I would definitely suggest getting one of the fresh pastas. Not the very best I've ever had, but very good. The sauces were also very delicious. If you're not sure what to get...or what the pastas are, just ask the server. Very nice people,.

TLDR: definitely worth checking out. fresh homemade pasta

Poor service, mediocre food, and rude bartenders.  Perhaps if this place was in a desert and the only option... there are top class options in River North. Don't fall for this noisy tourist trap. Spend your money elsewhere.

Came here with 8 others for my bachelorette party and it was the perfect place! The atmosphere was lively and fun, service was excellent, and food was delicious. The dishes came from the kitchen as they were ready in a tapas-style sharable plate. Some dishes I liked were the penne alla vodka, margarita pizza, dates wrapped in pancetta, short rib, and baby octopus. The octopus looked like actual octopus, which was a little strange, but tasty. We split 2 bottles of red and 2 bottles of white between the 9 of us. At the end our waitress helped to orchestrate an adult-themed banana dessert, which was hilarious. A great time all around. Overall, I would very much recommend this place for great food and a great time. It does get very loud, so it's hard to hear your company, but it's all fun!

Relative to the other restaurants in River North,  this place gets 1 star.

We've been to many restaurants and bars in the area. And, I am sad to say this is one of the crappiest joints in River North.

It primarily stays in business because of tourist traffic. I don't know of any locals who have been here more than once.

The food is so so and the staff always look overwhelmed. They don't even try to compete for customers.
Very disappointing...So much so that the one time I did go here I didn't feel comfortable leaving a tip. But, I did leave them a nice note on the back of the receipt.

I came here with a large group, and they suggested we each order things and they would bring it out to share family style.  It also allowed us to try a variety of dishes, all of which were okay.  There was nothing special about any of them, but they didn't suck either.  I wouldn't recommend that this be your first Chicago restaurant, but it wouldn't be terrible to end up here on an evening either.

The food: 3/4. I tried a caprese salad and a charred octopus. The salad was fine, it could use more balsamic, but octopus was a little disappointing. The serving was not very generous and the greens it came with were overcooked and tasteless. My friend tired eggplant parm and said it was too mushy. I didn't like that you couldn't order just one glass of wine and their smallest serving was almost two glasses.

The service: 3/5. Fast but not very personable.

Overall: 3/5. Decent for tourist packed River North, but pretty meh for Chicago overall.

I've walked past this place many times but have never eaten here. Such a loss because this is a wonderful restaurant.

Service was super. And it was really crowded. A little noisy but I cannot imagine a crowded restaurant being quiet.

There were four of us for dinner. Since it's restaurant week, we took advantage of their special. Dinner for 2 for $44. Four yummy courses which took care of our table. We started with the house made goats milk ricotta.  Then a pizza. Next course was roasted Brussel sprouts and beef short ribs. We also had shrimp risotto. Dessert was the Copa Alla banana. The margarita pizza was an add to our meal. Honestly we could have skipped the pizza and still have plenty to eat.

The wine is very inexpensive. It's served in splittable carafes.

I can't think of any cons. Good food   Good service. Good atmosphere.

There's a reason this is one of the number one rated Italian restaurants in River North. The service and food are both incredible!

We didn't have reservations so we ended up waiting around 45 minutes for a table. Time flies when your in the bar having a few drinks, anyways. The hostess was super nice and apologetic about our wait (even though it didn't feel long at all!) and we were seated on the rooftop deck.

Our server was great and after stuffing ourselves with pasta, we did what Americans do best and ordered dessert and decaf Cappuccinos (which were amazing).

You'll probably leave feeling stuffed and satisfied... the exact reason why you came to Quartino.

Pro tip: make a reservation in advance and come hungry!!!

They served me salmon which was past its sell date. Not ideal but understandable given the amount of volume they do. But what was regrettable was that I wrote to them twice and they didn't bother apologizing. I won't be going back.

I went here for a late lunch with my dad mid week. It was quiet, but the wait staff was just as attentive and friendly as if it were a Friday night. The menu items are made to share, so we order the calamari, the gnocchi and the beef short rib. We also got the Italian donuts for dessert, which is basically fried dough. The calamari was great, lightly fried and very tasty. The gnocchi was okay, but too salty for my taste. I would have liked the gnocchi in a different sauce. It came in a pesto sauce that was just so salty. The short rib was delicious. It was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.

Next time, I would get a pizza, the calamari and the short rib, but skip on the gnocchi. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful!

pics.caption: Gnocchi with pesto sauce- not worth it.
Beef short rib- delicious! So worth it!

review.des:
This is one of the restaurant in Chicago I wanted to try for a long time. Came here on a weekend with my family with reservation. Lucky we had reservation, the wait was pretty long and big crowds.

The menu was very extensive. We opted for few items to share.

Salumeria Tasting - a great way to try out a bit of everything. I forgot the types of meat we have, but it was very enjoyable. The portion was very big, we couldn't finish it.

Gnocchi - love house made pasta! soft pillowy potato dumplings with arugula pesto sauce.

Braised Pork Shank - cooked in red wine, so tender, falls of the bone.

Love this place. Do recommend getting reservation.

Hidden Chicago gem.  Not really hidden, but you may not have heard of it.  Quartino's is a really nice Italian style restaurant perfectly situated in near Michigan Ave near the hotels and restaurants.

Great place to have dinner or sit out on the patio for drinks.  We had a wedding today at Quartino's and they did an excellent job with everything.  They were willing to put in extra time and effort to help set everything up, as well as pack everything up when it was over.

Servers were on-top of everything, ensuring to stop by frequently to every table.  Glasses were always filled, and the food was delicious.

You have to try Quartino's if you're in Chicago.

We were really excited to eat here for dinner Saturday night! The menu sounded delicious. We were upstairs which seemed a little bit more quiet... but it was SUPER loud regardless where you were sitting. You can't even hear yourself talking. Our waitress was friendly and so was the gentleman that walked around to all the tables and said hi. I got the sun dried tomato soup which was good. We also got the penne alla vodka, gnocchi, and brodetto al frutti di mare. The penne alla vodka was alright... nothing spectacular. The gnocchi was extremely salty... it tasted like each dumpling was dipped in salt. A lot of their dishes seemed salty... even the olives & brodetto al frutti di mare were super salty. But the brodetto dish was really good and had lots of clams. We also got the donuts... which were horrible. I'm not sure why everyone likes them & were recommended. Not good. It seemed overcooked. The gentleman who clears the plates (busboy maybe?) was super attentive! He was constantly clearing people's dirty plates, gave us new water jugs, etc. He was excellent! Great customer service from all the staff. Food, however, was not up to par.

I came here with a group of 7 on a Friday night and was impressed at the decent service and food. We had a reservation and I think that was a good thing, since it was super crowded (and on the loud side). We were warned that the pizzas would take half an hour, but it didn't seem like it took 30 minutes before they came out. Here's what we ate:

- House made goats milk ricotta: really creamy and easily spread, I would definitely recommend this appetizer
- Gnocchi: the texture was okay, not as bouncy as I was expecting, the flavor was kind of lacking
- Stracci di grano arso: broccoli rabe (my favorite part of this dish), tomatoes, onions, garlic and large strips/sheets of flat pasta that I wasn't a huge fan of
- Margherita pizza: mozzarella, tomato sauce, and a basil leaf on top, it was pretty basic with a nice crispy thin crust
- Quattro stagioni pizza: artichokes, roasted peppers, grilled zucchini, portobello mushroom, I could eat this pizza all day! My favorite dish that we had here. I did have to eat it with a fork and knife probably because the ingredients  weighed heavily on the pizza and made it wet and harder to hold its shape, but it was very delicious

I liked that there were containers of water at our table so we didn't need to flag down our server, but when we needed him, it didn't take long, even though it was busy. Overall, I had a good meal here!

pics.caption: House made goats milk ricotta - so creamy and flavorful
Really delicious quattro stagioni pizza with artichokes, roasted peppers, grilled zucchini, and portobello mushroom
Margherita pizza with mozzarella, tomato sauce, and basil

review.des:
We arrived at this restaurant around 11:30pm for a late dinner on a Saturday night and got seated right away for a party of 2.

We ordered the San Daniele pizza and it was pretty good. It was a thin crust pizza and came with a lot of the toppings. I liked it because it wasn't too greasy/heavy and was more on the healthier side. The other dish we got was the linguine pasta with clams. The pasta noodles didn't seem fully cooked, but we didn't feel like waiting for them to remake it. The clams, on the other hand, were SO GOOD. It had flavor to it and it was very soft and easy to eat. They also put a lot of clams in it, which was a big plus!

Overall, the restaurant has a nice ambience and perfect for those who want a late night bite since they are open until 2am. 4 stars because of those clams, but if the noodles were more cooked- it would have been perfect!

pics.caption: San Daniele Pizza - Prosciutto, Wild Arugula, Grana

review.des: Loved the pizza. My wife and I shared the meatballs. We had a great experience with the bartender Eric. He was quick to serve us and really took a passion in the food. I wouldn't recommend date night there though because it was very loud.

So many great restaurants in Chicago, but this is not one of them. Definitely a tourist trap: Lackluster food and very noisy, and expensive for what it is. I would say the food is comparable to Olive Garden both in menu options and quality.

I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one because the staff is nice and accommodating. Otherwise, would definitely not recommend.

Quartino's is the BEST for a team gathering, a party or a large group. It's great for smaller groups too but I would definitely recommend the family style dining. It is so easy to order, the servers are always helpful and the food is BOMB. Make a reservation on OpenTable and go now!

I come here at least three times per year!  It's small plate style so you order your food and it comes out as it is done!  It's fun to try many different things and get a taste instead of one big meal.  My favorites are caprese salad and calamari.  Other than these two we usually try different things.  Everything is good and my kids love it too!

The food is so good here, and the place is really large.

It's always packed full of people, so do expect for it be loud!

We must have walked past Quartino nearly a dozen times before stopping in to grab dinner. While the food was decent, there were a handful of things about it that I found odd.

Everything felt a little gimmicky to me -- the servers outfits, the decor, and the music was all reminiscent of a Buca di Bepo! It felt like they had jammed 5 too many tables into our section, and I was quite literally rubbing shoulders with the table behind me.

Our group ordered a bottle of wine for the table, and it was served with teeny tiny cups instead of your standard wine glass. I'm not sure that I'll go back on my own, but they have a fan following so maybe it's just me!

Cozy date night spot for this upcoming winter or a great place for drinks with family or coworkers. I was craving pasta, and their portion sizes are manageable and don't leave you feeling exhaustingly full.

One of my favorite restaurants to visit when I visit Chicago! I love hanging out at the bar and the intercom system they use to alert patrons as tables become available.

The pasta here is cooked perfectly (al dente, just the way it should be) and plates here are made to be shared. I found their bolognese hearty, flavorful, and satisfying. Their calamari is also breaded delicately and served piping hot.

I also appreciate that the seating options here are varied and exciting -- I've been able to sit at a different spot each time I come to this restaurant. I can't wait to come back!

After walking around trying to find this place, I came to the conclusion that Chicago is similar to New York City (in terms of weather) but with bipolar GPS navigation system.

Seeing the high reviews for this place, my friend and I just had to stop by. We ordered the Quattro Stagioni pizza ($15) and Burrata salad ($9.75). Our server was super attentive and came by often to check up on how we were doing.

The burrata salad came with burrata the size of my fist and beet salad. The burrata was so so so creamy and really paired well with the refreshing beets. Unfortunately, (fortunately for me, hehe) my friend is lactose so she only had a couple of bites and I had the honor of finishing the rest.

The pizza was A M A Z I N G. I feel like you really can't go wrong with any of the choices. The one we got, all the veggies were fresh and cooked only so slightly to the point where it wasn't too mushy.

All in all, def a spot to check out if you're not feeling the deep dish!

pics.caption: Quattro Stagioni pizza ($15) and Burrata salad ($9.75)

review.des: I love this place. The food is good, the service is always good, and the $20 carafes of house wine are the best. I've taken visitors here and I've gone for girl's night, it never lets me down. The pizzas are great, I need to try the pastas, and the desserts are tasty. It's always busy, so clearly they're doing something right.

The food here was really good--and they had that delicious bread you dip in oil and vinegar! Our server, Amanda, was fantastic. She was friendly, explained the menu,  and knew which dishes had lactose in them to accommodate my food allergy. The food was fantastic, just shy of five stars because I didn't eat the crust of my pizza, which is blasphemous considering my addiction to carbohydrates.

**Vegetarian Friendly**

Gosh, this place was incredibly busy! Great place for date night, family time, or even with friends. All of their dishes are tappa-size but are intended to be shared family style - which worked out great for my party because we were able to taste everything! They have a bar area, as well as a full dining area.

Extra points for having their own vegetarian menu! We ordered a variety of items to share: White Bean Dip, Polenta Fries, Gnocchi, Penne al Vodka, Fettuccine Alfredo, and Eggplant Parmesan. Eggplant Parmesan wasn't anything special. The Alfredo was delicious but incredibly creamy and rich. The Gnocchi is a very popular dish and was probably at every table I walked past, and is definitely worth the taste!

Food, service, and the prices were great! Disappointed that I ran out of space for dessert, but I'll be back!

Not sure if I have given this spot a review yet or not but honestly it doesn't matter because this place is AWESOME!

I've been here many many times and almost every time I have friends in town visiting I tell them they must go to Quartinos!

You can't beat the house wine taste or price.. usually when we go we get two of these, red or white, take your pick, they are both great.

We always have to start with the margarita pizza, add sausage, pepperoni and basil... yes... it's as good as it sounds! This is a very close contender for my favorite thin crust in Chicago. The Alfredo is also bar none, fresh beautiful pasta with a great creamy sauce makes me happy, we usually add grilled chicken and the shrimp to it, so AWESOME! The short rib literally melts in your mouth! We always finish with the zeppolis and get vanilla bean gelato on the side(they should make this an official dessert).

The ambiance and the vibe is awesome too, sometimes a little tight but hey, people like to go here.

Finally, if it's a weekend or Valentine's day I definitely suggest a reservation.. the wait can get long.

We recently had a bunch of friends come into town for a mini college reunion. We decided to come here on Friday night for dinner. One of my friends made a reservation, which was a great idea, because this place was packed! Once we arrived, we were seated right away. After sitting and looking over the menu one of my friends and I decided that we couldn't decide between the margherita pizza and the Ravioli so we decided to get both and split them. The Margherita pizza was delicious. The mozzarella cheese tasted so fresh. The ravioli was delicious as well, however I expected more than 4. The braised pork inside the ravioli was very tender. To wash it all down I chose the sun's out rum's out, mostly because I am a sucker for good names, but also because rum is such a fun summer drink. It was a fantastic blend of all the ingredients. The pineapple juice and lemon juice were not overpowering either! Would recommend coming here whether for a small group or big group!

The waitress made our visit worth it. We went for an afternoon snack and drink. We shared the gnocchi and carpaccio. Both were really good. The gnocchi was a little dense, but the pesto made up for it. The beef was tasty and paired with shaved celery. It was close to our hotel. Sweet balcony with flowers on the second floor. Perfect for a hot summer day and a bite. The prices were comparable to the rest of Chicago.

Came here on restaurant week so we had a four course meal for $44 that left the two of us stuffed. Quartino is super popular but they take reservations. The inside is incredibly spacious and it was packed when we went on a Thursday night. Since there are so many people in one room, it was loud. Quartino offers a large menu that is great for vegetarians and it is also on the less expensive side. They have a large selection of pasta, soups, and seafood options.

We started off with the polpette, which are veal meatballs in tomato sauce with fresh basil and ricotta on top. This was absolutely delicious and I cannot say good enough things except that you have to get this. The sauce was incredibly flavorful and the meatballs were soft and fluffy. Everything was perfectly seasoned and I found myself taking spoonfuls of the sauce because it was that good.

Next we had the tortellini, which was my least favorite dish. It came with peas, alfredo sauce, and prosciutto. I'm not a fan of alfredo sauce, so that could be why I wasn't a fan.

The brodetto al frutti di mare was this giant dish with shrimp, clams, calamari, octopus and whitefish. It was similar to a soup with a rich tomato broth. Wasn't what I expected but I enjoyed it nevertheless.

My favorite dish was dessert. They also have a large dessert menu so it was hard to pick just one. We ended up with the zeppole, which are hot Italian donuts. I was so surprised when they arrived because the plate was filled with donuts. Each one was perfectly light and fluffy. They came with honey and dark chocolate, which both complimented the donut so well.

With reasonable prices and so many dishes that it's hard to go wrong, I will definitely be back at Quartino!

This is my dad's FAVORITE place to go. Its like italian tapas and has super great food. On our most recent visit, we got proscuitto wrapped dates, grilled asparagus, mushroom risotto, tagliatelle and meat sauce, and pork shank. The pork shank is always pretty big, fall-off-the-bone tender, and DELICIOUS.

We also got a pizza which, if you're like my fam and disagree (haha) you can get half and half! Perfect!

We arrived at around 9 on a Sunday night and this place was still poppin'! So try and call ahead and put your name on the list or get a reservation if you don't want to wait! Otherwise, the bar serves the full menu too!

Food was great but the customer service was horrible! The gentleman at the front Would give free half glass wine samples to the "pretty girls" and when asking about it to the hostess, she said that they only gave those to people who had reservation and had to wait over 20 minutes.. even though we were there for 35 with a reservation. And because of that I will never go back and it's such a shame. I was raised to treat everyone the same! Poor choice on the management! Feel free to reach out if you have any questions!

Ohhhh my.  Great Italian ambiance in the middle of the city.  Get a bunch of stuff to share and drink a bunch of table Chianti!

Eat foods you like, they have a lot of it.  Don't tip if you're truly convinced it's in Italy!!!  If not 15-33%

The house wine was solid.
The bread service.
Our anti pasti ensalada was fresh.
The gnocchi tricked us again. It was a bit bland for our liking.
However, the steak and Limon sorbet really left us happy as can be. I've had success with the linguini and clams before.

Love their outdoor patio and their Manager was attentive to guests needs between bringing a guests dish and making sure the pedestrian traffic out front isn't interrupting their guests' experience.

pics.caption: Sir I don't know why you brought us an empty sorbet cup. Please remedy this problem.
Loved the patio in April. Got lucky with the weather

review.des:
The place is seriously so crowded all the time because the food is too notch for not being ridiculously expensive.

We came for dinner Friday night and it was completely packed. They did some finagling but they were able to put two round tables together for our party of seven around 7 PM.

The eggplant parm is just amazing. I've come here once before and it wasn't that great but maybe that was a fluke because today it was exceptional. The eggplant was perfectly cooked. I couldn't stop eating it. I was supposedly sharing it with my friend but I ended up eating most of it. Sorry not sorrrry.

I had heard about this restaurant for years, so, perhaps, my expectations were too high?

We were originally seated in a doorway even though we've had reservations. The noise level was so high we would have had to shout at each other to be heard. Thankfully, we were able to move to a better, more quiet location.

This food was good, but not over-the-top as I have been led to believe. Our server was not as attentive as I'd hope and we sat with an empty olive oil container most of our dinner.

With all the great restaurants in Chicago, I won't be returning to this one.

Very nice Italian restaurant! Take advantage of sitting out side of the weather permits, especially at night. The food is great and good portioned to share. The waitress was very informative and friendly! Great experience overall.

pics.caption: Chard grilled octopus and crisp calamari were great!

review.des:
Enjoyable affordable small-plates Italian with cheap table-wine in a pretty loud, poppin, giant Italian restaurant.

Headed here to catch up with a girlfriend wanting a fun, affordable, wine-filled tasting experience. We walked in and the placed was packed, and we put our names down to wait 30 minutes for the dining hall. We then were told we can get any table at the bar if it was available-- we glanced over and there was a cute small high-top table sitting right there for us!

Water and comp'd fresh bread and imported DELISH olive oil on the table within minutes. The drinks menu is extensive, and we decided to go for the 1L of table wine for $20 (GASP! also it was that kind of evening). Drinkable, totally reminded me of being in Italy in that moment.

We went to town on the bread and wine and finally decided to order. Got the Caprese salad to start-- it was good, fresh mozz, delish balsamic glaze. I got the rigatoni with lamb sugo and stracciatella di burrata. The pasta was al-dente, the lamb was plentiful, and the tomato sauce had some nice depth but was missing something in the spice department. My lady friend got the shrimp risotto and practically licked the plate. We splurged and got the chocolate lava cake which I thought was okay... but really wished it had a little more pzaaz.

Overall, it made me feel like i was in an Italian factory restaurant. A little big and loud for my taste. The plates were good, solid, but nothing fantastic. I would definitely come back here with a group for a solid and affordable meal with cheapo wine.

Never really had a bad experience here (except for the loud-mouthed woman on her phone & wouldn't shut her face outside on the balcony during lunch - luckily a friend of hers shut her up after a few minutes).

Order basically anything, its all good. Great drink selection & I can never decide what I want to eat b/c its all good.

Not what I had in mind. Family style. I GET family style. Chaos would be a better descriptor. Party of 13. Waitress went to one end of the table and explained things. Then she went to the other end to explain things. Me, in the middle, didn't hear a thing. LOUDEST restaraunt I have ever been in.

Some of the food came out just as some at the table finished ordering. Other items came along long after the food on the table was finished. Last item rolled out a good 20 minutes after everything else. That person was not eating family style. Had to prod wait staff for bread.

On the upside, quality of the food was phenomenal. Wait staff busted their tails.

Poor delivery of the product. Overall negative e experience.

Had a great meal here for Mother's Day. Pretty busy in the middle of the afternoon but service was right on point, never missed a beat. Stated with the Salumeria Tasting, everything we selected was outstanding. Duck Prosciutto was a highlight for me. We shared roasted Brussels sprouts, which I thought we very good, ravioli , shrimp and sausage. Plus a nice bottle of Italian wine. My wife was most happy with everything, which is what mattered most.
Good for what it is, but not somewhere I'd return to. The pasta is perhaps slightly above average, but not better than what I can make at home really.

I met a few friends here for Sunday brunch. We were quickly greeted, our server was prompt and friendly. Bread and balsamic was complimentary which was nice. The actual menu had a lot of yummy options where the brunch menu was limited. 3/4 dishes were really tasty. The frittata fell short, there was a weird hard cheese on top that just didn't taste right. Belinis were good though.

Very good authentic Italian restaurant everything is super delicious I love the pizza and chicken parmigiana it's probably my favorite place to eat Italian food at..

The cannolis are awesome I recommend it with chocolate chips instead of pistachio buts that's my opinion.

Everything comes in different sizing portions so there's never to much food which is great cause I hate leftovers lol

Here for the Chicago Marathon and the all important carb loading. We chose Quartino this year and it was terrific! Great vibe. Good service. Positive energy. Food was very good. Pasta cooked perfectly al dente. This no easy task on this particular evening! My cocktail of choice was the Thyme Machine, Rye + lots of goodness was yummy. Orchiette with Fennel sausage tasted great but the sausage went missing in the sea of sauce. Spaghetti Pomodoro was good. The perfect night before the marathon fare, look forward to a future visit and trying their Piazza Bianco!

I just love this place. The first time I came here, I loved the food and the environment and service. This was back in September, and i came here again recently and I finally have saved picture to share my experience.

The service here is amazing, the waiters are super friendly and attentive. First time I came here, it was super packed and I got amazing service for dinner, and recently I went for lunch when it wasn't as busy and I still got good service.

What is unique about this place is the fact that all the food is shareable, affordable, and authentic. I would recommend to try the pizza and pasta for sure!

Lovely Italian restaurant in River North. I love the upstairs area. They have a communal table which is great if you're going with a group of friends. Love their pizza and pasta. Service is nice. Highly recommended.

I was in this neighborhood on a recent Friday evening. I was the only one in our group who had no idea where we were going. We passed a bunch of great pizza spots, (which killed me), but Quartino ended up being a excellent choice!

I have a big appetite... and I was a bit apprehensive to try a small plates type place. Plus I don't like sharing my food... but this turned out to be a very experience.

The restaurant was super packed when we arrived. It was around 6:30ish... I'm guessing we had a reservation, but I'm not sure. The hostess area was a serious fire hazard when we arrived and when we departed... yeesh!

Anyways... the restaurant is very, very loud because of all the people. You don't need to yell to have a conversation, but you can not use a normal voice.

Onto the foods... MMMMM...

Polpette al Sugo di Pomodoro
Veal Meatballs in Organic Tomato Sauce with Fresh Basil & Fresh House-Made Ricotta
AMAZING. Super tender and the sauce was boss. Used it for their table side bread, too!

Tortellini
Alfredo Sauce, Peas & Prosciutto
The table seemed to enjoy, but I did not partake.

Penne alla Vodka
Vodka, Tomatoes, Garlic, Red Chili, Basil & Cream
Also very good. A little bit of zest in the sauce... but nothing overbearing.

Tagliatelle alla Bolognese
Traditional Meat Sauce
Table ordered, looked okay, but this is the standard and I did not want to waste stomach space on this.

Eggplant Parmigiana
Baked Eggplant, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella
Never had a bad Eggplant Parm... and the trend continued. Super cheesy and yummy.

Roasted Brussel Sprouts
Parmigiana, Pork Speck, Charred Lemon & E.V.O.O
Got these because mom said to eat veggies. Nothing special. Some sprouts were tender and good... others were not, and not as tasty.

Beef Filets
Broccoli Rabe, Red Chili, Garlic & E.V.O.O.
Wanted a bit of protein... these were good, but nothing to write home about. Cooked medium rare. I'm not a big steak guy, so that might have been why I was underwhelmed

Quattro Formaggi
Pecorino, Mozzarella, Fontina, Parmigiano.
My favorite dish. Perfect blend of sauce, crust, and cheese. Came out piping hot... would love to go back for this, even with neighborhood offering great pizza options.

DESSERT

ZEPPOLE
HOT ITALIAN DOUGHNUTS
WITH HONEY OR DARK CHOCOLATE
To die for... I really enjoyed these and would highly recommend capping your meal with these. Dark Chocolate/Honey sauces offered for dipping, but not necessarily needed.

PROFITEROLES
VANILLA GELATO, CHOCOLATE SAUCE
& TOASTED ALMONDS
These doughnut sandwiches were basically ordered by me and for me. Probably a bit extra that I didn't need, but the gelato was excellent.

CANNOLI
Very good. Lots of Ricotta in and around.

Table also ordered House Red Wine before their Espresso Martinis.
