Very impressed with Quartino. Homey, but also upscale. No issues with the service. I will be back.

Boyfriend and I came here to celebrate my birthday. Fancy that. We had a reservation and waited about 5 minutes for our table. I was hoping they have have a birthday surprise of some sort, but I was not surprised that they didn't (many yelpers had already reported). However, I was a bit agitated since after our waiter had told us that there was no birthday treatment, he gave the table next to us a pasta plate "on the house".

Portions were not very large at all. Margerita pizza was listed as their best simpleton pizza, boyfriend got the bolognese pasta that was praised on food network, and I got the linguine pasta with clams. Nothing spectacular about the pizza, bolognese pasta was pretty good (very small portion), and the linguine pasta with clams was mediocre since it was basically noodles in a white soup with clams sitting on top.

The prices were pretty okay, not super pricey, but portions were very small so it adds up to be significantly more. Not sure if I would return. Service was so-so and not sure what else I would want to try.

Great for a group, but so, SO loud. I've been here twice - once with a group of 5 and once with my spouse. When I was there with my spouse, I really noticed how loud it was -- I couldn't hear him and had to keep yelling and repeating myself to be heard. When I was there with the group of 5, I felt like it was a much more pleasant dining experience. Our tables were in different rooms, so perhaps that was the issue. They don't let you split bills which was annoying in the group but somewhat logical because it is tapas style dining anyways. Pace yourself when you order, because they bring out the food very quickly. In a larger group, you can order a variety of plates and dine more leisurely. When I was there with my spouse, I felt rushed because we ordered what we wanted and it came very quickly. 4 stars for reasonable prices. Make a reservation if you can!
Pasta is never been the same after I eat this pasta thenk you for a birthday cakes with the candles also very fun place to be either friends and family

I have to go 5 STARS for Quartino for one main reason, customer service! The food was tasty too but... I had been out and about solo for quite sometime - exploring the zoo and my phone died so I couldn't uber here even if I had wanted to. I suppose I could have flagged down a cab but I stuck it out and nearly froze my fingertips off. Turns out Hermes is nice, but my gloves did nothing to actually keep my fingers warm in freezing temps and wind.

As soon as I arrived, about 10-15 minutes before my reservation I asked the gals at the host stand if I could please have a table near an outlet if they possibly had one in the restaurant. They had a good feeling they did, walked to the table to check then back to get me and I was seated to thaw out my hands over a nicely lit candle on the table (on their front inside patio terrace area) and charge up my phone with their electricity! :) I really appreciated the service right from the start.

Enjoyed a 1/4 Litre of their Donati Ezio 13 Cab and the following:

- Polenta Fries (the sauce was awesome the fries themselves ok, maybe not my fav version of polenta)
- 1/2 order of their Baby Spinach salad (very good)
- Pappardelle dish (very nice) and...
- 1/2 order of their tiramiso (soooo good!)

All in all this was the perfect warm spot to tuck away at for a fulfilling solo dining experience while in the city. I'd recommend it! The place was abuzz by the time I left. Great energy and great service.

This place is just awesome you can't really knock it for anything.  Drinks are great and well priced, food is exceptionally well priced, tasty, and generously portioned.  It's loud and busy but if you walk to the bar area you can find a seat just about immediately any time you visit.  The service is also phenomenal, our server and the people bringing out food and busing the table came by often and took good care of us.  

We had the calamari and the cavatelli, some Nebbiolo and a montepulciano from abruzzi.  Skip the calamari and Nebbiolo, they weren't great.  The calamari was tough and under seasoned, the Nebbiolo was just too aggressive it tasted very woody like it had been corked.   I will still be going back often and taking friends--it's just so good and reasonably priced.

Italian food done right! Chicago is gifted with so many good Italian restaurants .. we were walking around the magnificent mile when our tummy started growling. After seeing so many good reviews for this place, we wanted to enjoy it for ourselves. We walked in without reservations for lunch, and was promptly seated. This place did not disappoint! The menu is largely tapa style but I really enjoyed its fresh aesthetic. We got the lunch special that allowed you to generously pick an appetizer, a pasta, and a seafood/meat of your choice from the menu WITHOUT restrictions (none of that prix fix business). We also added on a burrata and a veal slider, as the lunch was designed to be shared amongst two people and we felt it wouldn't be enough to satiate us. The appetizers were all great. Got the dates wrapped in pancetta and it was delicious, albeit slightly oilier than I anticipated. Really enjoyed the contrast of the sweet and soft dates with the crispy and salty pancetta. Veal sliders were also good but I think one can never go wrong with veal. The burrata was to die for IMO! My partner felt it was a bit flavorless but when you sprinkle the slightest amount of salt and pepper, it hit the spot so well. The cheese was fresh fresh fresh and it was so creamy and rich. MmmMm! We got the gnocchi as our pasta order and it was excellent although I felt it was a bit too hard/chewy for me to render it exceptional. I guess I like my gnocchi a bit softer .. but the pesto sauce that drenched the gnocchi was great, although I did wish it had a stronger basil flavor. The octopus was also excellent and featured a gentle balsamic vinaigrette typical of many Mediterranean dishes. Overall, would I return? Definitely - there were plenty of other dishes to try and, if the beginning was this good, I can only imagine how the entire menu is. Highly recommend if you're in the area!

pics.caption: Burrata!!! MmmmmMm.. so fresh and creamy!
Pesto gnocchi .. Solid choice but wish the pesto had stronger basil flavor and gnocchi was softer.

review.des: This Italian Restaurant is exceptional. The Pappardelle past was so delicious! The calamari tasted fresh and was lightly breaded, even the tomato dipping sauce was amazing! We also had the veal meatballs which were super tender and juicy! Overall great meal! Definitely going to come back!

I came here frequently when it first opened. Then it became a tourist magnet. The tables were too small for the small plate concept, the service was often spotty, and it lost its appeal.

We met a group of friends here a few weeks ago, the first time I've visited in years. Had to wait 15 minutes for a table, even with an open table res. The bar was packed, so we couldn't even sit and enjoy a cocktail while we waited. Once seated in the dining room, things picked up.

Our waiter was friendly, and the service efficient. The food came out quickly. The polenta fries used to be my favorite, and glad to report they're as yummy as ever. The veal meatballs were chewy, and I didn't care for the raisins. I order grilled octopus in Greektown all the time, and the Quartino version pales in comparison... an almost tasteless portion served with overcooked greens. (If you love grilled octopus, order it at Athena.) The mushroom pizza was almost a winner, if they'd been more geneous with the mushrooms. The burrata and beet salad was great, the best part of the meal.

Dessert was hit and miss. The miss was the biscotti, which tasted stale. The hit was the profiteroes, among the best I've ever had.

There are many fantastic Italian restaurants in Chicago, but Quartino is not consistent enough to join the ranks. Come for the crowds and noise and people watching, if that's your thing. And for the drinks... they make a wicked dirty martini.

This is one of my go-to restaurants to take my friends who visit.  I always order the house made ricotta (get it with honey on the side--its amazing!), the pork shank, and one of the pastas (they're all delicious, you can't possibly go wrong).  The pastas that I get more often than others are the gnocchi, fettuccine alfredo (you can add chicken to it), tortellini, and the tagliatelle. Their pizzas are also delicious, and you're able to get half/half flavors.  I've eaten here for 3 years and their pork shank has always been fall-off-da-bone, with the exception of one time, and they took it back and brought back a perfect pork shank. Some of my family and friends prefer the short rib to the pork shank, but pork will always be my #1.

If you have room for dessert, their desserts are worth the calories.  I've never been disappointed.

I don't remember being wowed by their vegetables, so I'd just focus on the actual good stuff without worrying about being healthy when I eat here--veggies can wait for the next meal.

Yes, yes, and yes. I have walked by this place so many times without the thought of ever stopping in due to the wait. Finally went and wished I had done it sooner. There is something special about this space that makes you feel warm and fuzzy inside. From the low and warm lighting to the tile floor, the antique wood, the glass in the bathroom...it all comes together nicely. It almost feels like a time warp into the 1920's. I ordered the soppressata and pecorino plate for starters. Came with some cranberry walnut bread and a spicy jam. There was more cheese than meat, which I am fine with, but both have super intense flavors: the cheese was rich and nutty while the soppressata was spicy and gamy. Got the clams and linguini for the main course. Dare is say this but it's better than my grandmothers. Okay, that's not fair to say because it's a different style of execution but there were 13 clams in the dish. The sauce was buttery with a lot of herbs in it. Noodles were perfect al dente. Had the zeppole for desert. I wished there was more powered sugar on there but I'm being picky at this point. Came with a side of chocolate and honey. They were airy and light with a touch of nutty flavor. Great place to bring a date, friends, or family.
Great for big groups - had my birthday dinner here. All the food was amazing! We had about 4 tapas for 3 people and were set.

It's probably not fair of me to finally write a review for this tapas place after I'd just returned from a two week trip in Spain, but I'm going to anyway.

Been here a number of times and I still don't think I'm a big fan of tapas restaurants for groups of people. Be warned: this place can get LOUD! If that's your scene, by all means, don't listen to me. I however think it's difficult to share "small plates" with large groups. (I know you can figure out ways to make it work, but it's just my preference).  I much prefer this place with a group of up to 4.

The baby octopus is tasty, if a little bit dry. I'm a big fan of octopus though, so this one is easy for me to like. Their tortellini was one of my favorites! In the classic "I'm not eating the last one..." situation, the waitress tried to take the plate away with the last tortellini on it. I stopped her so that I could grab the last one :) Eggplant parm is very good, stayed warm and had a great amount of melted/crisped cheese on it. The calamari is good too - not rubbery. I wish they'd give just a bit more tomato sauce with it though. We enjoyed the sausage A LOT!

11/24/18 - I had high hopes for this place. So much so that this was the first restaurant that I took my out of town guests. I am embarrassed that this was the first restaurant they experienced in Chicago. After this 'meal', they no longer trust my restaurant picking prowess.
Our meal was beyond awful! We ordered the octopus. The octopus tails were crunchy and charred liked burnt beef ends, yet the body was mushy. The accompanying spinach was so incredibly salty that we couldn't eat it. The gnocchi was chewy with an underwhelming and (surprise) very salty sauce. Our waiter William forgot our fettuccini alfredo. As we were seated near the kitchen, I saw him run to the kitchen when we asked about it and ask for a rush from the man running expo. He emerged w a plate of cold alfredo drowning in sauce. I had to fish for the noodles....were there noodles in there amongst the sea of cold alfredo sauce? On top of it, how is my food late, yet cold?! William never came back to check on us. We hardly touched the dish and he never asked why when he came to drop the check.
At the beginning of the meal, William insisted we keep a menu at the table in case we wanted to order more food. As we had no where to put it, it end up on the floor next to us. The table of older ladies next to us stood up, stepped on it, and slipped on it. No worries Bc William made them keep a menu too and theirs was also on the floor. We all had a chuckle about the ridiculousness of menus strewn about on the floor. Seems that if we wanted more food, certainly our server should be able to fetch a menu...if he had bothered to check on either table.
In the end, I had to apologize to my guests for making a bad restaurant choice. I should have taken them next door to Osteria Via Stato. My experience here was head and tails better than this joint.

I would consider myself to be an absolute expert on Italian food and culture, having spent one week in Italy. I also watched the Naples crime drama Gomorrah on Netflix and learned how to say "I am a stupid American" in Italian.  Therefore, I can give the food at Quartino an unofficial Italian ambassador's stamp of approval.  We had a sampling of meats, cheeses, and salads that were made in-house, as well as a bottle of wine.  I felt like I was back in Rome at happy hour - well, except for the currency, language, natural beauty (sorry, Chicago!), and statutes and paintings of buff naked dudes.

The service and for were both amazing. Thank goodness for the bar- my friend and I were late to dinner but the bartender kept my other friend (who was waiting for us) entertained. All the dishes that we got were phenomenal. We got a little bit of everything and nothing disappointed:)

Walking into this establishment first thing you notice is the noise of large groups enjoying a great meal. We came into the restaurant at 9:00pm and the place was packed. Couldn't believe how many people were here eating dinner.

We ordered the porcini truffle risotto and it was quite delicious. Very rich but not overpowering on the truffle. Also had tagliatelle bolognese which was average.

Overall, the food here is pretty delicious. Do recommend if you are craving semi affordable Italian food

Went to Quartino for my sisters 30th birthday. Not only was the food out of this world but our server, Micheal, was attentive, made great recommendations, knew the menu, and brought out an extra special dessert! We were able to enjoy our dinner and gain some laughs. I would recommend 10 out of 10.

The food was average, nothing really blew us away. The veal meatballs and mushroom risotto were our favorites though. The portions are smaller and are meant to be shared so keep that in mind as well as the delivery is as it's ready. They were upfront about it so at least you know what to expect. I felt like of all the Italian options available in Chicago I could've probably picked a better place

Definitely one of my favorite places in Chicago. This is a great place for a date or for a fancy dinner. I've been there a few times now and each time the service and food has exceeded my expectations. I can say that because I've tried a bunch of things on the menu and they've all been great. I love their margarita pizza, Brussels sprouts, bruschetta. They always have a good collection of wines and desserts aswell.

I was a part of spoon university and made a reservation there for 25 people. We tried a number of things on the menu and towards the end the manager knew that we're a part of a food club so they were kind enough to not charge us at all for anything! Which was extremely nice of them. Besides that each time I've been there the servers have been great and friendly. I 100% recommend this place!

This is a great place to go to when you're craving Italian but aren't ready to commit to just one dish.  

I came in with 4 other people and we ended up ordering an array of pretty tasty dishes.  For me, the best deal and best tasting dishes were the cheese and meat board, tortellini, and the artisan Italian sausage.  The tortellini had just the right amount of creaminess and the sausage was seasoned well.  And of course, it's so much fun making your own cheese and meat board and I would imagine is a huge hit for most tables.  My least favorite were the octopus and the portabella risotto.  The risotto was gritty to me like the mushrooms used were still a little dirty.  The octopus was definitely chewy and not something I would get again.  Overall, a great restaurant option and a very fun place to come with a group of friends.

pics.caption: Tortellini, octopus and salumi board. That pasta though!
Artisan sausage, mushroom risotto, pancetta wrapped dates and donuts. Sausage was the best!

review.des: Fantastic place!! Food was great and atmosphere was fun.  Linguine and clams, caprese salad, veal meatballs...all so good.  Two thumbs up!!!

I. Love. This. Restaurant.

First off, I love small plates and family style, which is what Quartino Ristorante is all about. Authentic Italian cuisine which tons of pasta, salad, pizza and seafood options. Freshly baked bread brought to table which is equipped with olive oil, balsamic, salt and pepper.

Bottles of wine are well priced and we enjoyed a 2015 Santa Cristina Sangiovese which was wonderful. (Not served in wine glasses to give you a traditional Italian feel). The ambiance was casual, intimate and authentic.

We ordered the orecchiette, porcini and truffle risotto, steamed clams and tagliatelle alla bolognese all of which were superb!

For dessert we ordered the tiramisu (which isn't on the menu) and a latte and cafe americano...all of which were the perfect end to our culinary experience.

I can't wait to visit again with friends and family. There is also ample room upstairs for private gatherings (looks perfect for rehearsal dinners/etc).
We enjoyed the veal meatballs and the grass fed Australian steak.  Service was just okay.

Best tapas restaurant in Chicago!!! I love love love tapas because I always want to try everything on the menu and with tapas you really can! Quartinos truly embraces this by letting you order just about anything in a HALF ORDER (which also makes your meal very affordable!). It's not an option on the menu but all you have to do is ask. I always order 5-6 things to share for 2 people. Start with 2 and order more as you nibble so everything stays warm and fresh. Then enjoy a smorgasbord of wine that are very reasonably priced. After tasting just about everything on the menu the house red is my go to - really good for the price! If you like something you can take a bottle home for a fraction of the price. I always get a bottle of Rosso to go and it's only $6. One more tip - the wait is always insane especially on weekends. If you're party is only 2-3 go to the upstairs bar. Walk right past the host and go up the stairs. 99% of the time I've been able to get a seat within 5 mins. Oops! I lied one more tip - always save room for desert. Their tiramisu is not on the menu but delish!! And their Zeppole is a must have! We always get the half order with vanilla ice cream a la mode.

As for food I've tried just about everything and here are my favorites - seafood stew, meatballs with the ricotta, house made goat milk ricotta, grilled octopus, burrata salad, Tuscan kale, skirt steak. Also, all their pizzas are good.

There are only two things I didn't really care for - cavatelli was a bit chewy for me but I think I just don't prefer that particular type of pasta.  Romaine salad was a bit boring.
The veal meatballs were fantastic. The service was great. A very nice spot for anyone looking for some good Italian food.

This place is amazing. Excellent service, great menu. It gets a little busy but the staff carries it well. I've stayed at the Dana Hotel 2 years in a row because it's a 2 sec walk to Quartino!
Get the Pinot and Beef Carpaccio, you won't be let down. Sit in the bar area if it's open!

We had an awesome experience tonight, from the date wrapped prosciutto to the veal meatballs, pasta with vodka sauce. Everything was yummy. Try the donuts with chocolate sauce and the tiramisu
It is like a fluffy cloud of goodness. Thanks to Ethan and the staff we had a wonderful dining experience!

Hands down to one of the best Italian restaurant I've ever had. At least better than what we have in Dallas. Food, price and service is definitely worth the bang for your bucks. My friends and I were vacationing in Chicago and we came across this place through Yelp search. So glad we decided to stop by.

Everything was delicious from appetizers to dessert. To start off, we ordered the salumi taste board and the calamari. Both were two thumbs up. The calamari is addicting! One order just wasn't  enough. And so we ordered a second. The clam pasta dish was divine. We also tried their pizzas. My favorite is the duck prosciutto pizza with arugula drizzled in olive oil. I usually don't have room for dessert but I was glad the waitress suckered me into trying their beignets. They were fluffy and airy. Dip it in the chocolate dipping and you will fall in love. I am salivating as I am reminiscing about this restaurant.

If you can get a chance to sit on the second floor patio, I definitely recommend asking. The atmosphere is perfect. Let's just say everything was so good we came back the next day before headed home.

pics.caption: Their pizzas are very tasty. Must try the duck prosciutto pizza! (left side)
Must try the calamari!! These are addicting.

review.des: They changed. Last year was a Italian restaurant now the pizza is not Italian anymore they have a thick and DRY crust. In addition, the margarita pizza looks like a cheese pizza instead of margarita.... Also, I ordered a eggplant parmigiana and it tasted like BURNED  OIL. This place used to be good, but not anymore. I'm so disappointed that they changed that I don't think I'll come here again because if I want a regular pizza I can go elsewhere. To make everything worse, when we asked for the check they just dropped a piece of paper on the table without any support to put the cash or money on.

I liked this place a lot! I'm vegan and was with two non-vegan coworkers. Vegan options included a cheeseless veggie pizza with great crust and some different veggies. Also bread with olive oil: you can never go wrong. It's always a struggle to find nice restaurants with vegan options in areas like this, so I'm thrilled we found it.

I'm not a sommelier but thought the selection seemed great. It did get extremely loud upstairs toward the end of our visit; we were almost yelling at each other (several big groups surrounded us on a Tuesday night). Not a reason to avoid it, though.
Excellent restaurant - the great variety of foods, fun atmosphere and very good service. We have a team dinner here and everyone enjoyed the food.

Noise level is extremely loud! Came here on a Monday night with coworkers and it was packed out. Warned, portions are small.

Food was delicious! I really enjoyed the Beef Short Rib, Formaggi (Four Cheese) Pizza, Tortellini, and Cavatelli. The Arugula salad was a good starter but it had a strong taste and aftertaste.  We chose dishes and ordered it family style so it kept coming in multiple quantities of select dishes we chose.

Great service though! Took a while for food to come but it was obviously because it was very busy. Would come again!

Came here late at night and Alyssa took really good care of us!!! The pepperoni pizza, and the spaghetti Alfredo was on point!!! Thanks Alyssa for taking care of us and having such good energy and positive attitude!!!

Everything we had were just delicious. The campania pizza was just sooo good. We also had the beef short rib, so tender and juicy. Clam linguine also delicious. And he gelato for dessert were all so rich, creamy and full of flavor. Loved the lemon gelato a lot.

Had brunch here today on what was the 1st pretty day in Chicago in 2 weeks. We chose to sit inside just because the outside patio was so crowded. Walking in, the smell of the garlicky and peppered salume kind of hits you in the face. It's delicious-smelling once you realize what it is but definitely strong.

For cocktails, I ordered the supersamic, which is a Hendricks cocktail with balsamic and strawberry liquer. They had me at Hendricks, to be honest, but the taste profile was unlike anything I've had before. Perhaps, the balsamic made me think of a wine?

Next up were the polenta fries, which are served with a tangy red sauce. These are really something. They're crispy but not greasy because they are baked and the sauce is a red pepper purée so I wanted to pour it on everything!

We also had a split pizza - 1/2 fumo and 1/2 suprano. The suprano had a house-made giardniera , which will turn you off from any jar-stuff for the rest of your life!

Finally, we had the papardelle. Whoa! Delicious but salty so go in cautiously!

All in all, I loved it! And the prices were reasonable considering that all food items were house-made! I'll definitely do it again!

pics.caption: My nickname in high school was Papardelle
Check out this pizza from heaven!

review.des: So I'm not from Chicago, but I am from Chino Hills, California and I must say that this Italian restaurant really disappointed me. I don't know how this place compares to other Italian restaurants in the area, but if this is the best this city's got man I am disappointed. The pizza was not bad but nothing spectacular. I forgot the exact name of the fries, but since there is only one type of fries there, it shouldn't matter. The fries were just so bad. It tasted more like it needed to be a dessert item. The frute de marie was actually okay. It wasn't what I was used to since it didnt have noodles, but the broth is what saved this placs from not being horrible. If you are looking for a Italian place to eat at, there is actually this other more appealing place called Eataly. I'm not sure how the main entrees taste over there, but the smells and atmosphere were wonderful.

Excellent food but the tile walls means tons of echo and the restaurant is very very loud for table conversation.  Every meal I've had here has been very good and prepared well, service is good.  It's just too loud so I stopped going.

I like the style of this restaurant, how everything is meant to be shared. I was worried we would all leave hungry because of small portions, but all of us left full and happy. It was cool getting to try a bunch of different things! I tried the caprese salad, gnocchi, marinara pizza, vegetarian pizza, and pasta pomodoro. My favorite was the pizza with vegetables, delicious! We also all shared zeppole for dessert which was pretty tasty, I especially liked the chocolate sauce. I got a grapefruit limoncello as well and it was good. Prices weren't too bad I thought!
Service wasn't the best. It was super busy so I understand, but it would've been nice if she would have checked on us because there were times where we needed things and she was nowhere to be found haha. Also the restaurant is like jam packed, like the tables are kinda all squished together. Overall cool restaurant though and I'd be down to come back!

Great food! We got their House Made Goats Milk Ricotta. Delicious! They also served up their Veal Meatballs Napoli. Not the biggest fan of veal generally but they made me fall in love with the dish. They then served their Dates Wrapped in Pancetta. Scrumptious! Their Eggplant Parmigiana and Shrimp dish were delightful and definitely hit the spot. They can expect me to return again for sure.

What a wonderful, wonderful place! Not having dined here since last year, we were craving some Quartino as memories of the last visit were oh-so-sweet!
We had a wonderful experience... so much so that we came back the next night!

Our #1 favorites would be the Kale Salad, Beet Salad (topped with ricotta and walnuts- makes this unforgettable!), the Farmhouse Chicken, Polpette (meatballs) and Caprese Salad... fresh, beautiful, tasty and so, so classic. Every bite was savored!
Paul took care of us the first night and Spencer the second- both fantastic! Both were very professional, friendly, efficient and knowledgeable.

Needless to say, we can't wait for the next meal at Quartino!

This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant. The food is exceptionally outstanding and the service is top notch.

Me and a friend came here for lunch and even though it was packed and we had no reservations the wait was not long. Of course we started with some apps and a bottle of wine. Which we really didn't like so the manager came to our table and gave us a few samples from which we finally picked a wine which we like.

We love to eat here . Great pizzas ... delicious pasta and a huge wine selection . Waiters are always in soccer jerseys and tvs are always playing soccer or Italian films . Gelato and sorbet are good too

pics.caption: Fresh Parmesan in a dispenser that lets you grate it yourself at the table

review.des: I have actually lost count of the amount of times that I have been here by now. Absolutely love this place, having grown up eating Italian food and hearing from my father how a true Italian meal is where you order platters where everyone shares everything and multiple courses, I'd say Quartino hits that right on the head. Love how all of the waiters are wearing Serie A jerseys to go with it all. Also, ordering wine by the liter instead of the bottle is great as well. I realize that this is in River north, and a majority of the food there is chains, and tourist traps, etc. But Quartino is by far my favorite place in that neighborhood and definitely one of my favorite in the city.
Good food! Good service! Good atmosphere! What more can you ask for.  The sampler and a pizza was more than enough food for two.

Outstanding experience.   We had the Arugula Salad, Pesto Gnocchi, Sausage Pizza, Cavatelli, and Veal Meatballs - basically some of all of the highest rated dishes.  Business dinner, and all of the food was shared family style, which always seems to enhance the conversation, especially work dinners.  Delicious food, great experience.

On a Friday afternoon service was fantastic. We got seated right away and our server tended to us kindly and appropriately. But the food is not what I remembered it being a few years ago. I got clams and linguine it was basic, flavorless (needed more salt & garlic... maybe the addition of some lemon). The pizza my husband had looked under whelming too if your looking for Italian I'd say you can give this one a pass.

pics.caption: Looks much prettier than it actually is... (Clams & Linguine)

review.des:
We went to Quartino years ago and wasn't that impressed by it.  However, we decided to give it another try this week and we're so glad we did.  Our meal was delicious!

I'll start with our drink - Limoncello Martini!  Wow!  Outstanding!  It was strong and absolutely delicious.   The bartender knows what he is doing and we'll be back just for this drink alone.

For food, we got the Romaine Hearts salad, Baby Octopus, Linguine with Clams, and Tuscan Sausage Risotto.  Every dish was really good.  The Octopus had a little spice to it with the red chiles that my husband and I greatly appreciated.  The salad was nice and refreshing and I loved the risotto.  The complimentary bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar was also great b/c the vinegar was very good.

We had no room for dessert, but it's definitely a place we will be back to....for the drinks and the food.
Overall good experience. The cheese platter is fantastic. But personally, I am not a fan of other food we ordered. Also, the place is overcrowded. People can hardly walk through two tables of people.

This restaurant has a lot of charm and some European influences in terms of decor. Unfortunately, everyone is packed on top of each other (the waiter literally had to hang over us multiple times while other waiters passed with food which was quite awkward) and it seems to be the norm for people to shout at each other while eating.

That said, none of this would matter if the food was worth it. It was the worst food we had while visiting Chicago. We ordered the margarita pizza and clam pasta. Both dishes were bland, and mediocre at best. Also the bread that they serve is not fresh.

If you are looking for a popular and overcrowded place with disappointing food, this is your spot.

Had dinner here last night with my in-laws. There were six of us and we did have a reservation and got seated right away, which we were thankful for because it was already packed at 6pm! We all enjoyed our wine and they made a nice old fashioned. We took recommendations from the waiter and overall enjoyed our food. The short ribs over potato purée was a stand-out dish and the rest were good: rigatoni, veal meatballs, a charcuterie board, asparagus risotto, and prosciutto wrapped dates. Overall enjoyable and service was excellent!

Bad Italian.  When I went on a Sunday evening, it was busy and loud on the first floor, but the second floor was completely empty, so the restaurant was only half full.  Yet there was a 40-minute wait.  I think they were deliberately not seating people because the kitchen was overwhelmed.  I sat in the bar with open seating.

It took a good 10 minutes before anyone noticed me, bringing water and bread.  Another 10 minutes before a server showed up with a menu, then 10 more minutes before she took my order.  Then it was a 40 minute wait for a simple dish of gnocchi.  After I finished it was 15 minutes for the check, and another 10 for her to pick it up.  The only thing quick was when she brought the check right back.  So service basically sucked.

Then there was the food.  I feel in love with gnocchi and pesto from one of Marcella Hazan's cookbooks.  It's a relatively simple dish if you have enough basil.  Lots and lots of basil, lots of garlic, olive oil, some salt and pepper, maybe some pine nuts, a couple of spoonfuls of the water you boiled the pasta in for dilution, and there you go. You can use pre-made gnocchi, but making your own isn't that hard either.

Quartino's take on it adds green beans and arugula.  I was curious enough to try it.  

The dish is small for a pasta dish, but gnocchi is heavy.  I was disappointed.  The Pesto was bland and the green beans/arugula just didn't work.  I couldn't figure out how a sauce made of herbs could be so bland, but it was. It was bland to the point of being awful.

If an Italian restaurant can't pull off a simple Pesto sauce it makes me afraid to try the alfredo (which is even more simple yet ruined by restaurant cooks everywhere) and the very complicated Bolognese sauce.

Great spot in River North for some Italian, with a big group or on a date. Everything is tapas style and great for sharing and trying everything. Everything low priced including wine. Been here multiple times and will be back!

Excellent homemade pasta!! Totally recommended!!
Our waitress from the bar we were before said is like a gem! Very casual! And the outdoor seating area is very cute! I had the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo(braised beef marinated for hours) delicious and my husband the Tagliatelle alla Bolognese very good too! They are open until late night

I ordered the Tagliatelle a la Bolognese. Thought the taste was less than special. Wish I would have ordered something different. Although, the people sitting at the table next to us didn't seem to enjoy their food either.

Heard this place was good from a friend who had previously visited Chicago and ate here, but I won't be recommending it.

My family came here for lunch during our staycation downtown in December. We ordered about 4-5 plates including the Salumeria Tasting. Everything was quite good!m, especially that Tasting platter. It's my cup of tea for sure and had unique flavors.
It didn't really fill up my brothers though, so either order more plates or go somewhere else with bigger portions.

We were seated off to the side in the 'sunroom' type of area. It was nice and sunny that day but it was crowded and people kept bumping into my dad's chair. Overall though the decor looked warm, inviting, and cozy!

Love this place. I've been on multiple occasions, and it never disappoints.  I got the eggplant parm with a half order of spaghetti, and it was DELICIOUS. My boyfriend got the chicken fettuccine and also loved it. The entire wait staff was wonderful. Their wine menu is also solid and reasonably priced for a good bottle.

The food here is reliable and good. Decent portions. Usually pretty good service. I am pretty surprised that considering I've been eating here regularly since the restaurant opened, I've rarely had the same sever twice, and almost every time I go there, I'm asked if it's my first time dining there. When I say no, they continue to explain the "concept" of the restaurant, even though I've been dining there since most of the servers were in middle school.

One of the things I don't like about this place is that it can get very very loud, and there are often large groups of loud obnoxious customers. Sometimes the first floor dining room is like a casting call for America's Next Top Douche Bag. But if you go late at night, you can usually avoid this, and luckily the kitchen is open late.

How have I never written a review for Quartino before?!

This is one of our go-to date night spots, and it consistently exceeds our expectations. The food is really delicious and an excellent value. It's not over priced like a lot of the other restaurants in this area tend to be. The servers here are extremely friendly, and knowledgeable on the menu. We always ask our server for recommendations since they know the menu best! The last time we came in we decided to sit at the bar and we were so glad we did! Our bartender Chris took care of us the whole time and kept us laughing! They also have homemade limoncello behind the bar which is a must.

Oh, and the paperdelle with braised beef? MUST ORDER. This is one of those dishes that haunts my dreams and keeps me coming back for more!

pics.caption: Meat/cheese board with all the extras!

review.des: This is honestly one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! I love the idea of all the small plates because my family and I were able to sample the different plates and try something new! I had heard that this place had such a fun atmosphere with great quality food, but now I definitely believe it! This is an amazing place for special occasions. The pasta dishes we had were superb and I think next time I want to try one of the pizzas because those also looked very good. Dessert was also excellent and enough to share. The soups were incredible and everything had good prices. I can't wait to come back!!

pics.caption: penne with vodka sauce. soo yummy!

review.des:
My beautiful Quartinos! My fiancé and I go here way too much. When we first moved here from Dallas, we lived a block away from the restaurant.

It's the perfect place for an intimate dinner for two or a large group.

Please do yourself a favor, order the goat ricotta toast and add for honey on the side.

The only time we had a negative experience, the server was gracious enough to bring us a complimentary platter of the toast with the cheese... it restored my faith in humanity.

Quartino's has some really great food! Guests order from a variety of small plates, but all of them are terrific. It's a bit on the pricier side and the restaurant is very noisy and crowded. Not a great place for a romantic meal, but fun if you're catching up with a few friends and want a nice night out. Also, their bathrooms have attendants and plenty of convenient toiletries if you need to freshen up.

We came upon this beautiful spot when we decided our late night reservations were just too late, having travelled that day from Dallas for our anniversary. We were lucky enough to get a wonderful corner table in the bar, and feel so lucky to have scooted in on a very busy night!

I don't know that I've ever seen such efficiency from a restaurant. Our waitress recommended beautiful wines, and we started our adventure with a gorgeous Caprese salad - a fantastic start!

My husband goes for the tried and true, so we selected a Margharita pizza, and I decided on the linguini and clams in their white sauce. The pizza was delicious, but the standout was the pasta dish. I don't know how they put out such a perfectly prepared pasta, velvety and sublime, with a sauce that had just the right weight, while serving such a tremendous crowd, but the first bite brought a little tear to my eye.

We finished with a gorgeous dessert of bananas and biscotti with a drizzle of perfection, and a couple of ports. I would have kept ordering just to stay all night and enjoy one of the best meals in years, but it seemed selfish not to let the other patrons, clearly eyeballing our table, the joy of our experience.

The entire staff was amazing, the crowd made for great people watching, and our anniversary was as perfect a night as we've ever had.

We will come back to Chicago again, just to experience the joy they brought us, and thank them for making everything so truly memorable!

We love quartinos we come every chance we can come to the city! We love the penne vodka, gnocchi, pizza, filet & chicken the Cheese and Salumi selections literally everything the risottos and homemade pastas are to die for and the dessert is amazing! Try the banana sundae it's so awesome! Also for those who didn't like the sauce in the gnocchi u can order it with vodka sauce  the gnocchi with their vodka sauce is drool worthy!

The food was SO good. Tapas Italian style done right. We made reservations on a Tuesday night around 7p and the restaurant was bustling. The dining area is large but the tables are very close to each other, the only qualm I had was that I kept bumping the lady sitting at the table next to me. The service was quick and our server was very knowledgable and pointed us to the popular dishes and her favorites. She did not lead us astray.

The wine menu was extensive...there is a wine on there for everyone!

The food menu additionally was just as extensive with small to medium sized tapas and pizzas. They first bring out some fresh, warm bread which we dipped in olive oil that we mixed with freshly grated parmesan cheese and fresh cracked black pepper. SO GOOD. We then ordered the brussel sprouts, caprese salad, fried calamari, and stuffed dates with panchetta to start off with.
Brussel sprouts - perfectly cooked with outer charred crisp with a very smoky flavor - very good.
Caprese salad - tomatoes, mozzarella and basil with balsamic drizzle - pretty hard to mess this up honestly, I wish there was more mozzarella to tomato ratio.
Fried calamari - another classic that was very good paired with a spicy red sauce.
Stuffed dates - easily the best thing we ordered, creamy gorgonzola stuffed wrapped with pancetta and drizzled with sweet honey = perfect flavor explosion.

We then ordered the Rucolina pizza with prosciutto, fresh arugula and freshly grated parmesan cheese. The crust was thin and crunchy. It was lacking a bit in the flavor department, I think more garlic could have done the trick. But it was a good pizza overall!

Overall, the experience was pleasant. If I am back in the area, I would go again. I would probably try more of the pizzas and get a couple orders of the stuffed dates because YUM.

Solid Italian Restaurant On A Budget:

Reason for going to this restaurant:
A casual, but delicious Italian restaurant with the father on a cool Thursday night in Chicago.

Ambience: Not too noisy, restaurant was half full.

Service: Our waiter was excellent. We accidentally spilled some of our wine and asked us if we wanted a half bottle on the house. Classy stuff bro!

The food:
Overall: Everything we ordered was cooked well, affordable, but I wouldn't consider anything memorable.

Chianti Colli Fiorentini 2014: (waiter recommendation) a young, light-medium bodied, fruit forward Chianti that paired well with our meal. I was happy with the recommendation.

Veal Meatball Sliders: These bad boys were cooked well, surprisingly not too heavy, and light on flavor.

Pepperoni Zzzzaaaaaa: A quality thin-crust Italian pizza. Not necessarily special, but can't go wrong ordering it.

Gnocchi: I expected this dish to be heavy and creamy, but ended up being very light and a little bland.

Overall was a good experience and was very affordable!

The ideal time to go to this restaurant:
Celebrating the conclusion of your final exams, which you know you aced, with your fellow college comrades. (Remember its tapas style so more people = more dishes to share = better experience)

Amazing food!!! Lots of small plate options. Amazing service!!!
Recommend the shrimp plate and the fondue!!!

I am baffled at the vast number of high reviews for Quartino's. Want good Italian? You won't find it here. This place is a tourist trap. Chicago is home to so many great restaurants and is one of the top cities known for having great food, I mean, it IS the third largest city. So do yourself a favor - check out any restaurant other than Quartino's.

The restaurant itself is rather large. It is two stories and has tables indoors and outdoors on both floors. They pack in as many tables as possible so you will find that you are sitting very close to strangers. It is very loud inside - better luck dining outside where you can actually hear yourself think. Anytime I asked the waiter about a dish he would say "oh I love it, it's amazing." Yeah, lies.

The bread SUCKS - don't even bother. Yeah, it's free and "free food is the best food" blah blah blah, but Quartino's bread is some of the worst food I've had. Quartino's states all their plates are meant for sharing. Hmm...okay. If we are meant to share the pastas...why are the pasta dishes so small? The size of one pasta dish here would satisfy your hunger but not fill you up. Their house-made pasta, the tagliatelle all bolognese, was awful. The texture of the pasta was just all sorts of wrong. The flavor of the meat sauce was no bueno. Think salty cardboard. How ironic that their imported pasta dish, the linguine with clams, was better than their house-made...but only barely. The flavor of the white sauce was decent and the red chili gave it a good kick but the flavors did not seep into the linguine at all. There were plenty of clams but were they fresh? Highly doubtful. The crisp calamari was expensive and average.

I was really not impressed and extremely disappointed I wasted a meal at Quartino's during my 5-day trip to Chicago. Save your money, folks.

pics.caption: Linguine with Clams - Imported Pasta with E.V.O.O., Red Chili & Pinot Grigio, Red or White Sauce
Tagliatelle alla Bolognese - House Made Pasta with Traditional Meat Sauce
Crisp Calamari with Organic Tomato Sauce

review.des:
This place is pretty good. I went here with some family on a Saturday night, and boy was it packed. There was seating outside, there was a seating inside. Looked like there was seating on the 2nd floor. Looked like there was seating outside on the 2nd floor.

On a saturday night, at 7pm, make sure you have your reservations otherwise you will be waiting for a while. This is an Italian Tapas... small portions which were meant to be shared with your table. They had a huge wine list, various Italian sodas, coffees, and normal coke/pepsi. This place is a little big, our server was very friendly and accommodating but he disappeared many times and we only saw him for a few minutes at a time. Keep in mind that this is Tapas. The food will show us as it is finished so you will get random items at random times.

I ordered D'Anitra Pizze with Duck Prosciutto which is cured in house I beleive, with onion and wild agugula. Overall, the pizza had a nice flavor, was able to hold up to the ingreidents well without falling but it was a little charred on the bottom. Duck Prosciuitto was delicious and had a lot of good flavor and it was enjoyable.

Polpette al sugo di pomordo aka: veal meatballs in organic tomato sauce with fresh basil and homemade ricotta were very tender and juicy. The cheese was hidden but it gave it a nice balance to the overall flavor.

Polenta Fries left a lot to be desired. I expected them to be a little crispier and were a little bland.

Rigatoni was delicious. Pasta was nicely cooked, lamb sugo had good depth and balance. I did enjoy the stacciatella di burrata which is basically buffalo mozz.

Asparagus Risotto was very bland. Asparagus was a little rawer than I prefered. Risotto was lacking in flavor and depth. It was just mushed and wet rice. It was not creamy.

Broccoli Rabe was bland and I had to add some salt to it.

Braised Pork Shank was amazing. The presentation was basic but it was delicious and it allowed the meat to talk. Very tender meat and seasoned nicely. Fatty shank which gave it a good rich flavor that melt in your mouth.

Overall, the food was delicious but a few things were lacking. Some needed salt or more depth to it. I could see why this place was very busy but they almost need more servers otherwise you wont see your server for a while. The bill was a lot cheaper than I thought. It averaged to about 35 per person in my group and we all left with full bellies. I could see myself returning in the near future and it is a nice place to eat at.

The idea of a tapas style Italian restaurant was great! I ordered a few different items such as the tortellini with Alfredo sauce, the penne al vodka, shrimp in a lemon garlic herb sauce and a margarita pizza. Everything was delish and great to be able to share among others. The service was amazing. The staff really care if you like the food and are enjoying your time. Definitely will be going back!'n

+  w/  (8/10)
The pizza was a bit on the blander side. Overall an average tasting pizza that could probably obtain from a pizza chain. On the other hand the pasta was really good which makes up for the lacking in points. It was well mixed and not too dry. It wasn't too cheesy while still having the taste of the ingredients permeating though.

Honestly the pasta was nothing special- I could probably make them at home. Everything is so small and overpriced and the restaurant so dark I could barely see the people around me. I'm only giving this place 3 stars because the dessert was very good and very generous in portion size. If I ever come back it'll be for dessert.

We had a great dinner at Quartino - made reservations for a party of 8. Lots of great bread (olive oil and balsamic on the table, 3 kale salads, a couple of primavera, linguine with clams, asparagus risotto.  The place was pretty quiet when we got there at 5:30 and jam packed by 7:00 when we left.

Noteworthy: the dishes are smaller and intended to be shared as they come out, which was fun.  Not everything was ready all at once. Our server told us this up front, so it was no big deal.

This is my favorite restaurant in Chicago!!! The food comes out as large, sharable plates designed so everyone at the table has a chance to sample. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu but I love the bacon wrapped dates and the pizzas.

Also, when you order wine, they give you a "house pour". The staff describes it as "the type of pour you give yourself at home."

I visited Quartino for a birthday dinner and my experience was so awesome. I had a party of 15 people and was having trouble finding a spot that would take us all, but I'm so glad I happened upon Quartino! I made the reservation, so when my party arrived, we were seated in under 15 minutes. We were taken to the second floor in a side room that was nicely intimate, which was a huge bonus because the restaurant was pretty busy and loud, but everyone was still able to talk to each other without yelling.

The waiter was so understanding and patient with us. I'm sure dealing with 15 different people at once can be extremely overwhelming, but he took everything in stride and got our orders in. Our drinks were all brought within 5 minutes, and he made sure that we had some bread to munch on while we waited for our food to arrive. The food comes out as it's ready, so if you have a larger group, you'll definitely have some people halfway done before the last gets their plate. BUT, it still wasn't a bad wait time given the number of people.

The food itself was really enjoyable. I ordered the prosciutto wrapped dates and tortellini with chicken, and it was exceptional. The dates were the perfect sweet/savory/creamy bite, and I would go back just for those! The pasta tasted homemade and the sauce was creamy without being heavy. I also sampled some of my friends' dishes, like the spaghetti with meatballs and fettuccine alfredo, and they were also delicious. Overall, superior quality food. I can't wait to revisit in the summer when their balcony patio is open.

Thank you, Quartino staff!!!

A small plates Italian restaurant. A large selection is offered and ordering is fun; however the food itself is just average in my opinion. We ordered 7 plates for 4 of us and had more than enough food. While the dining area is quite large, it is very busy and loud.

I went here years ago with an old friend who was visiting from the UK. This place was one of her favorites when she lived in Chicago and she wanted to go back to it.  The menu items were very delicious and the portions, although a little on the light side, where perfect for sharing.  The ambiance was subdued yet energetic and the service was very good. I found it to be a little on the pricey side for what was given; however, the location and ambiance more than made up for it.

Whenever my friends visit from out of state, this is one of the top choices I choose. There are reasons for it!

This time, I tried their lunch special. I didn't notice they offer lunch special for 2-3 people till I saw the special menu. You can choose three courses from a great variety of items including soup, salad, pasta, seafood, risotto, etc. As I have been here for many times, I would share my experience with the lunch special. I had the minestrone soup - fresh, light, and hearty. People speak highly about their tapas sharing plates and pizza. You know this restaurant is a good one when they offer good soup although it's not their big items; they pay close attention to prepare fine quality food.

Truffle risotto is good with strong mushroom taste. If you are someone who loves mushrooms. I'd suggest to try. Otherwise, I'd suggest asparagus risotto or shrimps one that are both amazing. Not every place cooks good risotto but you can definitely trust this place.

The biggest compliment this place wins my heart is their seafood. I particularly recommend their steam clam and combination seafood. My picture is the combination seafood. The sauce is great, the seafood is fresh, and the bread is buttery and crispy from the grill. I know Midwest is not the best for finding seafood but you can trust this place.

If you are looking for a nice place to catch up with friends though, this place might be a bit crowded and loud for you. As their high quality food and service, lunch and dinner hours get very busy so sometimes the tables and chairs might feel a bit too tight.

I've lived in Chicago for four years now and I can honestly say this is my favorite restaurant in the city. Their pizza is the best thin crust in town and you can get carafes of good wine for cheap. The bartenders are awesome and always remember their regulars- I even came here the day my dog died and had a very nice interaction with the bartender that helped cheer me up! I usually sit in the bar but on special occasions make reservations for the dining room where there is great service as well. Only warning is this place does get very loud but that's just cause it's always so packed! My go to meal is the San Danielle pizza (prosciutto!) and also the pappardelle pasta which is amazing. Other menu items I love are the veal sliders and meatballs, the bacon wrapped dates, and margherita pizza- but honestly I would eat anything on the menu. I love Quartinos!

Came here for a private event and was not disappointed.  Often private events at restaurants have bland food and lame offerings, a step down from their standard menu, this was not the case at quartino.  The bartenders were pouring some solid negronis.  Check it out if you like Italian, not my favorite type restaurants to dine at but they do it well.

Really enjoyed our meal here. Went with a group of four. Loved that it was tapas style Italian so we could try lots of dishes. Every single item tasted great. Loved the sausage risotto. Grilled octopus was great with a hint of lemon.  Ravioli was delicious. It will be a place I will bring work associates in the future.

TLDR: great food at a reasonable price.

I'm not a connoisseur of Italian food but the beef carpaccio and duck prosciutto pizza was amazing. I had an espresso martini which was good. The wine list looks good. Service was solid, our waiter was a little surly but food came out quickly. The bathroom was also adorably old. Great place I'd come here again.

Great spot for a group so that you can sample the entire menu! Italian food as tapas is dangerous but well worth it! The kitchen and staff do a great job of bringing food out as it is ready and taking away all the empties so you can have fresh plates. Make sure to save room for dessert

Quartino is amazing. Reasonably priced, good portions, fun atmosphere. The bread is ridiculously good. Don't miss the Orrechettie (no clue how to spell that) and the eggplant Parmesan is SO GOOD. And the gnocchi. Oh, the gnocchi. I've been here so many times, I honestly can't even tell you what the best thing on the menu is because everything I've ever had has been delicious.

Fantastic food, especially for the price and ares.

My Go-tos:

The Beef dish is phenomenal
Gnocchi
Sauteed Spinach
Pizza

The sizes are larger than normal tapas, but smaller than family style.  Really great to go to for groups of 4-8 people.  You MUST get a reservation they are constantly booked, especially on week nights.  Thank god for Open Table!
Out of this world.  I only took pictures of appetizers but both were amazing.  I had a pasta with bolognese, which was incredible.  Service and atmosphere were perfect for a night out in Chicago.

Went here for dinner and the food was absolutely amazing. It was a bit busy so the service wasn't the best, however to me that's not the biggest deal as the food is what's important. Everything that I ordered came decently quickly and was fresh from the kitchen. I would also like to comment on the ambience. I loved the vibes this place gave me. Would definitely recommend this place and I would suggest the Italian sodas.

Overall pretty good!

Everything is served tapas style which kind of stinks if you want to just order your own dishes because they will all come out at very different times.

Everything we had was really good. The short ribs were a good portion and was cooked perfectly. The tortellini had the perfect consistency and cheesy flavor. We had the zeppole for dessert, very soft and light, delicious!

Overall, the food and service was great! Just not a fan of the tapas style dining.

cute place. neat building/design.  BUSY and this was Tuesday night.  We had a bottle of Moltepulciano Di rossa - it was nice and peppery.  The bread is warm and crusty and the olive oil and balsamic were appropriately good.  High virgin etc.  Then we had the PAPPARDELLE AL SUGO DI MANZO which could have used a little seasoning but once we got the bottom of the bowl and you get to the braised beef it was quite yummy so maybe a little mixing woulda been in order, lol.  But the real standout here is the ROASTED BABY OCTOPUS with BRAISED ESCAROLE, RED CHILI & E.V.O.O.   It was SPECTACULAR.  Coulda eaten two of these.  Service was good.  Not white gloveish or anything but appropriate for the sporty themed little joint.  I recommend it.  It's good.

pics.caption: ROASTED BABY OCTOPUS with BRAISED ESCAROLE, RED CHILI & E.V.O.O.  ......is amazing!!!!!

review.des: Found this little spot on yelp, and honestly it's become one of my favorites in Chicago. The atmosphere of the place just feels so authentic. It's one of my go to place when I'm in Chicago. The pizza are delicious and the cocktails well I'm not complaining either.

Quartino has a good Rating with north of 3,500 total reviews for multiple good reasons. The food is delicious, the prices are reasonable for a go to restaurant in River North and the atmosphere is electric. Tell me someone who has a bad meal here and I will question all of their decision making. With the pitchers of wine, you know you are in for a good time.

The classic Italian offerings and European soccer focused theme, Quartino delivers delicious Italian eats. The octopus, pastas, pizzas, chicken entrees are a handful of the better dishes and options on an ever plentiful amount of Italian options. The fish stew is also a special and superfluous seafood meal meal. The pizza and orchoetti pasta are both incredible too. Go to Quartinos with a little room because you are going to order and enjoy a lot of meals here.

The price point on yelp of $$ is deceptive as the portions are very small. For example the ravioli dish we ordered was approximately $13 but couldn't have had more than 7-10 raviolis on it. The taste profiles at this restaurant did not blow me away, the way I would have expected based on the pricing model.

Absolutely beautiful. Best prices hands down in Chicago. I got eggplant parmigiana for $9!! And a craft of two glasses of Cabernet for $9 as well! Amazing food, and the service was phenomenal. I went here on a date and it was a cute romantic setting with views of the city from the street. I will be back on my next visit to Chicago!

I have not been impressed with a restaurant from start to finish in a very long time. This is my first visit to Chicago and I went with my friend who lives in Chicago who had never been to Quartino either. She said she liked that the restaurant was buzzing with people. It's a good sign of great food.

Our waitress was phenomenal! She was entertaining, helpful, and so nice from start to finish. She knew all the menus and let us take our time in deciding. We had a blast with her and she made the experience fun for all of us. Everyone who stopped by the table from clearing plates to placing an order was great. You can tell they get along as a team there!

The food was so good! We got a 1/2 and 1/2 pizza with  Margherita pizza and Campania pizza, mushroom and truffle risotto, dates wrapped in pancetta,  and the chocolate cake with vanilla gelato. Everything that came out was so full of flavor and downright delicious. The waitress mentioned that the dates are made all day and are popular. We also split a bottle of wine which was perfect for us and our food. The wine selection is great! They have options for pretty much everyone.

Another fun thing - when they give you the check, they give you a postcard that you can fill out and they will mail it out for you! My friend filled it out so it is being mailed to me at home. I can't wait to get it. Best dining experience of my whole trip!

This is by far my favorite italian restaurant in the Chicago area. I've been to all parts of Italy and they're food tastes just exactly like italy!  I come here all the time and the food is always deliciously consistent.

My favorite is the ricollino pizza and the Quattro formaggi pizza. They also have an amazing selection of pastas such as the tortellini and the vodka pastas.

The only complaint would be that the servers disappear for a while and then show up when you no longer need them. I would definitely recommend making the drive out.

As a vegetarian this place has some great dishes. A lot to choose from compared to most other Italian restaurants. Service was quick and on point even though this place was packed. Overall great service.
From the outside, it looked quiet and empty. Walk in and the place is bustling. From the bread, to the salad and tortellini... fantastic. We did the little donuts to boot!!

I was staying at the Renaissance on wacker about 6 blocks away across the river. Walkable and seats you on time with a reservation. Great atmosphere and reasonably priced food. Went with a big work party and got to order almost everything and share. Veal meatballs are the best I've ever had hands down, and a must eat! Thin crust pizza was amazing - we got pepperoni and sausage. Shrimp and cauliflower appetizers were delicious as well. I love a place where you can tell they put care into their cooking by the sauces. Also tried the linguini and clams and it was small but the sauce had the perfect blend of wine and cream and brine to it. If you want to get a feel for the hustle and bustle of the Chicago loop whether you're visiting or a local, I'd recommend this place for fun, fast, casual, Italian dinner.

BEST ITALIAN RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO

*especially if you like wine

Why you ask? Because they charge per quarter liter (a glass). So no more questioning if you should just buy a bottle and save or go glass by glass. Pricing is the same.

The environment is very cozy, lots of energy, and it's a bit loud. Food always comes super fast (brought out as it's finished). Service is always good, etc, etc.

I could write a short novel but I don't want to keep you from your dinner (hopefully at Quartino's)

The only reason I have given this restaurant to stars is because of the great service.
Besides that, I didn't really enjoy the food at all.  With my friend we got the beef carpaccio, the bacon wrapped dates, the tomato sauce cavatelli, the shrimp and the chicken.
Out of all those dishes I can tell you the dates and the cavatelli were good but not exceptional. All the rest lacked flavor and the shrimp specially tasted like plastic.

Amazing amazing amazing! I loved this gem so much.

If you want Italian - this is the place to visit.

My waiter Juan recommended splitting the polenta fries and polpette meatballs - great choice. Both were so flavorful, and hit the spot.

I followed that up with the housemate gnocchi - cooked perfectly, melted in my mouth but not too much give. The asparagus pesto sauce was creamy and rich.

The manger Ian stopped by and was also super courteous.

Shout out to quartino. You guys rock!!

I've been staying at the connected Embassy Suites hotel for the last two nights.  The days have been so long (work) that I've opted to eat at the bar both nights.  The first night the bar was very slow and the bartender took care of me, but he was extremely slow!  Sincerely a very nice man, but he didn't do anything quickly and a couple of us waited for service.  The food on night one was good and the drink I ordered was $13.

Now, on to the second night, again the same gentleman was working the bar.  Yet again he was very pleasant and friendly, but extremely slow.  I ordered the exact same drink as I did last night, but tonight the drink was $26.  The food was also very tasty tonight, but I didn't get my bread and oil/garlic until after the meal was presented.

For a hotel bar/restaurant this place is top shelf, but the bar is a bit lower for me than a regular restaurant.  Food is good....drinks are overpriced (but it's Chicago) and non-consistent!

Ordered spaghetti. The noodles were extremely soft and the sauce was watery. I had high hopes for this place, sad that they got such a easy dish all wrong. BUT they started me off with bread and butter so I can't be too mad! That's my comfort food!
Such an underrated spot. Feels very homey and the dishes are lovely. You know when you walk in that the quality will always be the same. No suprises. Sometimes, it is just like coming home.
Perfect Italian restaurant for the occasion. Had multiple courses cheese, pizza, Pasta and of course some wine. Everything was amazing except for the risotto which was a little underwhelming.

Except for the grilled octopus, which was dry and tough, the food was good and our waiter was attentive. But when they tell you the food comes out as it is ready, that means it comes in no particular order and it is paced for the kitchen, not for you. As a result, we had all our food on the table immediately and at the same time. We had a 6:30 reservation and were done by 7:15. There was no time to relax with our guests or to savor the meal. As I write this, I am downgrading the experience from a 3 to 2 stars.

We love ordering a bit at a time and sharing each plate while sharing a bottle of wine! This time around my favorite was the bacon wrapped dates. You cannot go to this restaurant without trying this dish.

I love Italian food and this spot was a great choice for our last night in the city.

Their olive oil is amazing and truly organic. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo and my boyfriend ordered the penne vodka pasta. We demolished our plates.

For dessert we ordered the Italian donuts. Wish we had more powdered sugar but so so so yummy!

Came here tonight at the recommendation of a friend. I called to place an order over the phone for pickup and while the hostess told me they typically stopped taking phone orders at 5pm, she was able to take mine (at 7!). I was here from out of town and she saved my night!

I was a little worried about the whole "small plates/sharing" reviews but these are all very normal sized orders. I chose the cavatelli and the goat cheese app. When I requested about bread the same hostess assured me she'd make sure there was plenty, and there was. I walked over, took a seat at the bar to let the bartender know I was here. I ordered a glass of wine for what I assumed to be a wait since the place was packed but no sooner had my glass of wine arrived,  my food was right behind it. Whoa. That was quick!

However, once I got back to my hotel room I noticed while there was a ton of bread, my main dish (the cavatelli) was missing. While it was frustrating to trudge back, the bartender who rang me up originally was super chill about it and apologetic. He went and got it taken care of in literally less than five minutes, bagged it all up and was way kind and friendly. Love him! Bonus points to this place for good service.

Related: I'm thoroughly enjoying all the carbs and the goat cheese! Visit! You won't be sorry.

The meal I had here was absolutely delicious. The wait can be long, but I was dining alone so opted to sit at the bar. To drink, i had the passion fruit Italian soda which didn't taste too much like passion fruit, but was good nonetheless. For appetizer, I had the tomato soup which was delicious! Very tasty and flavorful. For dinner I went with the pappardelle al sugo di manzo. It was the perfect size dish, not too big and priced well. I was full, but had room for a bite of dessert. The bar tender said he could do a half slice of the tiramisu, and that hit the spot! Perfect amount of sweet and chocolate. It was deeeelicious! One of the best all around meals I've had.

Great experience; came for weekday lunch with a 1:30pm reservation. The restaurant has two floors and some outdoor seating. We ordered the $25 lunch special for 2 people where you get three plates (an appetizer, a pasta, and an entree). The ricotta appetizer was especially good as was the $10 1/4 liter Bellini (nicely sweet which is how I like it!). The server was efficient, and we were checked on by our server and the friendly manager. It does echo inside the restaurant so be aware that noise travels and the atmosphere is quite lively.

Been here many, many times over the years (long before Yelp) and now time to write a review. Went for lunch today. ALWAYS great. Sat outside on this beautiful summer day, which we have often done, and ordered something different from my usual clams and linguini (always great, and some of the best in town-except maybe Mart Anthony's and that place in the South Loop-see reviews). We shared something simple-spaghetti and meatballs which was delicious. So simple, but yet sooo good and so much better somehow than THE other places in town. So flavorful. Pasta cooked perfectly and the sauce (like East Coast "gravy") was fantastic. Ordered a salumi salad which was fresh and delicious and some ham wrapped dates which were great. Can order wine by the carafe here, so I had a small 1/4 Lt. of Chianti which was really good. Got to get the name of it. At this point I have probably have had everything on the menu and have never had anything less than a great meal. Service is always right there. This Gibson's owned place is run very well. Nice to sit outside and watch the city go by. Fun to sit at the bar too. Great bartenders too, or there used to be. You will see some obnoxious patrons and some annoying street scenes, but that's the city. This place is for family, friends, and I would bring clients here in a minute-maybe I have and don't remember. GO, GO, GO for lunch or diner.
Amazing service, atmosphere, food! The gnocchi are wonderful!!! Had the stuffed dates as an appetizer and it was wonderfully different from anything I have had!

We were walk ups, seated right away, Saturday at 8 pm, then the reality sets in,packed in like cattle on the sidewalk, starts raining and it took 10 minutes put awning out! We were totally wet along with the bread. Food was pretty good, I had truffle risotto, took longest to serve and of my party of 4 I ate alone.
