review.des:
Last night was our first time back in over 3 years since we moved from Chicago.  We were so looking forward to our visit - the food had always been exemplary before.

Things have certainly changed.  It wasn't awful, it definitely wasn't great - it was unremarkable and forgettable.  We began with the dates wrapped with pancetta.  Those were good as per usual, pretty hard to mess up.  Then came the polenta fries.  They were crispy, but lacking in flavor.  They are served with a cold pepper sauce, which I've always thought would be better served warm.

The main plates were the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo and the Veal Skirt Steak.  The pappardelle was overcooked, and the sauce was bland.  The veal skirt steak was technically medium rare as ordered, but there were no charred edges, it was as if the grill wasn't hot enough.  In the past, it was always served as three pieces that were placed artfully on the plate with arugula and roasted tomatoes.  This time, it looked like the three scrap end pieces were tossed onto the plate with no consideration at all.  The flavor was again, bland.

Finally, we ordered the Coppa alla Banana for dessert - usually it's vanilla gelato with fudge sauce, caramelized bananas and chocolate shavings.  The bananas *maybe* saw heat for seven seconds, barely browned and still raw on the outer edge.  The gelato had ice chips throughout, ruining the creamy texture - it's either cheap quality or old.  There was *maybe* a spoonful of chocolate sauce - it used to be a bath of chocolate in the bottom.

Overall, the food just seems to have slipped.  It felt lazy.  The only reason I'm giving this three stars is for their great service and wine selection.  From now on, we'll be skipping Quartino.

While searching online for a restaurant to spend the last night of our anniversary in Chicago, we came across this gem. My gf and I were both in the mood for Italian food and based on the pictures of the interior and the menu we decided to make reservations for Quartino. As soon as we walked in this restaurant reminded me of Mediterranean Tavernas I had been to in my home country. All the waiters were wearing Seria A (Italian soccer league) jerseys as uniforms which I really liked as I am an avid Juventus fan. The small platters gave us an opportunity to try different appetizers like cheese and salami. The Napoli style Margherita and Stefano pizza were delicious and the dessert, a signature Coppa Quartino was delightful. Would definitely come again during our next visit.

The food at Quartino was really good. We had 3 of the homemade pasta dishes and you can tell that it's fresh.

The restaurant is cramped and service, while excellent, was obtrusive at times. Sometimes you want to go out for a meal and take your time between courses. I felt rushed. The food comes out quick, so no reason to be in a hurry except to turn over the table.

We stopped by for lunch today at Quartino. It wasn't packed at all, we got seated right away. We ordered the d'anitra pizza and the linguine with clams. the linguine was okay, more like a down side for me, but my bf liked it. the pizza was goooood, definitely should try! recommended ;)

This literally is the most overrated restaurant in Chicago. I had such high hopes and thought I lucked out when we found a table at the bar in 2 min with a 45-min dining area wait but the food is the most bland and tasteless Italian I've ever had. Disappointed. As a new founded conspiracy theorist, I am convinced they buy their yelp reviews.

The food here was mediocre but I don't know if that's because I always find Italian so-so. Service was very matter-of-fact, yet they gave us a free Red Bull at the end of the night which made me feel good about it all. Yet, I'd rather have friendlier, better service than a free energy drink so I'm still not impressed. I don't know why the workers were so dry and lacked enthusiasm. At least they're open late compared to their lazy neighbors.

Really nice place the appetizers are really good and the service is perfect
Just didn't like one dish otherwise 5 star

I can't figure out why this place has so many stars - it was quite possibly one of the worst restaurants I've ever tried. The service was fine, our waitress was nice. We were able to get a table despite not having a reservation on a Sunday evening, even if it was all the way in the back of the restaurant.

We had read all the reviews and were stoked to try this place as many people said the food was good. We started out by ordering a couple small plates - ordered the mushroom risotto, garlic shrimp, and a salad. The mushroom risotto was undercooked, the garlic shrimp was not like traditional garlic shrimp( I wish I could describe the shrimp dish but there are no words, also didn't help that they used tiny little frozen shrimp instead of fresh real shrimp), and the salad was overly doused in dressing. We let our waitress know we just couldn't bare to eat any of it. She was nice about it at least and offered to recook the risotto and offered to switch out our food for something else. We thought we couldn't go wrong with a pizza and selected one to share off the menu. While the pizza was edible, it was certainly far from being anything like a real Italian pizza.

We honestly couldn't take being there anymore and let our waitress know we just had to leave. We paid for our wine and the pizza and left. I will NEVER come back. Not sure what standards other people have for Italian restaurants, but this certainly was far from living up to any good Italian restaurants I've been to.

Been here three times and Quartino has never failed to disappoint! Everything is incredibly fresh, you can tell there's 2 minutes tops from when the pizza is out of the oven to table side. Affordable wine menu as well. Portions are quite large for the price point, and you get bread to start. Veggies are phenomenal - have had broccoli rabe and sautéed spinach and looking forward to trying more. If you're a seafood fan, ai fruitti de mare is a must - incredible amount of clam, shrimp, kalamari, and incredibly fresh octopus. Their veal meatballs are tender and delicious as well. Server was polite, knowledgeable, and food came one entree at a time so each dish could be enjoyed while piping hot.

review.des:
I love the food here! So many tapas to choose from, fast service. A great place for friends who like to share. The only down side is the noise level. But the food will not disappoint. Reservations a must.

My suggestion is a seat upstairs or if seating downstairs, ask for a seat up against a wall- just NOT by the kitchen.

I am SO torn about this place- on the one hand, the food was fantastic. But on the other, the atmosphere. My god. My ears are practically still ringing from the noise caliber.

I made a reservation here for dinner, and the place was packed. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated, and were walked upstairs and seated in the back room, smack between a large party of about 16 women on one side and a large party of about 10 people on the other. Our table was also shoved against a wall with a shit ton of stuff on it (plates, plate holder, etc) when the table was pretty small in size to begin with, and it was next to the kitchen so my chair was either kicked or in the way of every single person going in and out of the kitchen (due to the narrowed walking space because of the large 16 lady party).

Both parties on either side of us were SO extremely loud, to the point that they were all literally yelling to each other and shouting over each other to be heard. My husband and I were so incredibly irritated. Who yells in a restaurant? And who does it with zero respect for the other poor victims who were sat near you? There were 2 gals clearly trying to have a girls night out dinner and those poor souls were sat behind us so they had to deal with the noise too. I heard them complain to the manager, but she offered really no sympathy. The noise literally ruined what was supposed to be a nice celebratory dinner for my husband and me, and we couldn't wait to eat and get the hell out and find somewhere quieter to get dessert.

Pappardelle- delicious. It's my fave kind of noodle, and the sauce was hearty

Sausage risotto- really good and creamy. Sometimes risotto can be too chewy but this was cooked to perfection

Cheese tortellini- decadent alfredo sauce, great chewiness

It's too bad that the noise level is so awful, this could be a great place. Perhaps some of the other seating areas are quieter, but I don't think we'll be back

Great reviews, but we definitely did not find the place as amazing as stated.

Came into town for the day. Ate and upon leaving a few hours later the children were feeling ill and now the adults. Called to let the manager Derek know. Derek was insistent that food poisoning takes 24 hours to set in and he inquired as to what we ate yesterday. I did not want to be argumentative with the manager who had all the "right answers." When in doubt YELP it out and GOOGLE food poisoning which MedPub, Medline and Wiki all state two to six hours onset of symptoms. Photo is attached.

pics.caption: This is the photo to go with my review.

review.des: We had a wonderful dinner there this past weekend, it was 5 of us, we ordered family style, the portions are small, we had fettuccine alfredo, eggplant parm, pep pizza, brushcetta,  and the best chocolate cake with ice cream. Everything we ate was very tasty!

My husband and I walked in for a reservation on a Tuesday evening at 6pm. Unfortunately there was no seating until 8:30pm unless we wanted to sit at the bar on a walk in first come first serve basis.

We walked across the sidewalk to Embassy Suites where another Italian restaurant was super busy but the wait time was only an hour instead of 2 1/2. For what seemed like an eternity, we cancelled our reservation at the Embassy restaurant since there was over 3k reviews for Quartino which everyone seemed to be raving about.

Finally seated at 8:30, we ordered an app and soup each. The calamari was tender and crispy pairing well with the tangy marinara. He said the chicken with risotto soup was tasty. I had the minestrone soup which was a bit different. Full of white beans and no tube shaped macaroni. While still quite delicious, where the frick were my macaroni noodles? Did they forget it or was it Quartinos take on minestrone?

Super speedy service and entrees were delivered quickly to the table. The bread was rather stale and nothing to write home about. They also think a 750ml water for 2 will do when the entrees are a tad bit salty. Rigatoni was not al dente, but rather undercooked as the kitchen was trying to spew out orders and the ground lamb was minimal as can be. The papparadelle was also undercooked and 1 long ribbon was drenched in stew like consistency topped with unforgivable Kraft Parmesan instead of fresh cheese cranked beside your table. Portions were on the small size even though the waitress insisted on how gargantuan the meals were and how most people share. I left still hungry after an appetizer, soup, and my 1 ribbon of noodle.

Overhyped "authentic" Italian fare. Perhaps it's better to just have a drink and order a charcuterie plate to share.

Quartino is one of my favorite places when I am in Chicago, open till 2am, laid back atmosphere, great service great fresh food everything is homemade including most of the "Salumi", the quality is superb all at an incredibly fear price.
I recommend to try the Brodetto, you won't regret.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants for group dinners! The food is good, it's affordable, and spacious. Lamb meatballs and fettuccine alfredo are two of my favorite dishes. Ask about the prix fixe menu if you are dining with a group. For $42, we had unlimited house wine, beer, 2 appetizers, 3 pasta dishes, 1 entreé, dessert and coffee (includes tax and tip).

Shoutout to Paul, our waiter, for a great sense of humor and for putting up with our obnoxious party.

They were the only restaurant open on a Sunday night around 10 pm so major props

The veggie pizza, Eggplant parm and tortellini were all delicious and very affordable

Server was pleasant and kind

My manager and coworkers flew in from out of town, and Quartino is where we had our team dinner (14 people.) Obviously we made a reservation for 5:30, which ended up being a good time before it started getting gradually louder through the night.

Service was eccellente for our large group, and the food was delizioso! Other Italian restaurants typically overwhelm you with dishes that can feed a small army, but Quartino takes a different approach by creating dishes that serve 1-3 people. This way you can order multiple dishes and eat family style. Also, orders come out as they are ready from the kitchen. No waiting for everybody's orders to be complete all at once.

The waiter and staff were incredibly friendly and took the time to explain the menu and answer any questions we had. A few of us got curious about the cured meats (made in house) along with the equipment near the kitchen. Our waiter invited us to the kitchen and gave us a tour. We met the executive chef and they took the time to show us how things were run even with it being busy on a Tuesday evening.

We were all very pleased with the entire evening. The red sauce pastas were perfect, and weren't swimming in sauce. The pizzas (especially the margherita) were baked wonderfully. I can't wait to come back to Quartino. I wish more restaurants were this friendly and good!

pics.caption: Hand cranked meat slicer. Cutting house made, cured meats

review.des: I heard Chicago was one of the best places for Italian food so when I got here I had to put it on my list and this was one of the top spots. The wait was about 2 hours on a Saturday night which in downtown Chicago is normal. So we order the calamari and polpette al sugo di pomodoro which is veal meatballs for short lol for an appetizer. For our main entrees we order beef short ribs ,braised pork shank, tortellini, and pepperoni pizza. The calamari was sooooo fresh crispy on the outside and very tender. Got to be one of the freshest calamari appetizers I ever had. Calamari is calamari but the freshness made it excellent. Now if a Italian place can make a excellent meatball then it's a legit place to me and this place meatballs are out of this world. The meatballs was so tender, juicy and seasoned so well. Even the tomato sauce was delicious. Both the beef short ribs and pork shank was tender and seasoned well. To me they both kind of taste the same like they use the same sauce. It didn't really wow me but cooked very well. The pizza was very good. Very fresh ingredients they used. This might be the freshest pizza I ever had along with the calamari. The tortellini was Home Made so the paste was very fresh but other then that it's just a average Italian dish.This place was well worth the two hour wait. I do recommend trying everything I order.

I love this restaurant, I've been many time and continuously go back. However, Last night I went in with my girlfriend and ordered a bottle of wine and some food. Our pastas came out before our bottle of wine and our server had no clue how present the wine. She cut a crude circle above the lip of the bottle and just peeled the foil off all messily. Didn't present the cork, didn't let the host (myself) taste the wine or introduce the wine to the host. Just plopped it down on the table and ran away as if she wasn't comfortable with it at all. Otherwise the food was delicious and the restaurant was very accommodating.

The best date night spot! My boyfriend and I love to get the shared plates and always a bottle of wine! I've recommended it to all my friends for their Bumble dates! I would recommend going during the week since it can get pretty crowded on the weekends.

Fantastic Italian food.  The tortellini was very good.  It was very cheesy and tasty.  One of my favs here.  Egg plant parmesan great.   Bolognese was great.   Pepperoni pizza was good and wasn't greasy.   The crust was perfect.   We were definitely in a food coma afterwards.

Ate here with a very large group, and Quartino pulled it off like a champ.  Food came out at a rapid pace despite the fact the restaurant had every single table full.  Our server was knowledgeable and helpful and took care of us expeditiously.  Very well done!

The group shared so many plates.  We had the charcuterie, fried calamari, tortellini, meatballs, brussel sprouts, shrimp, ravioli.  Probably even more than that, but I couldn't bring myself to eat it all.  Everything was good, especially the tortellini.  The sprouts needed more flavor, but I was fine passing it off to someone else in favor of the next plate that got passed around.

I did have a minestrone soup that I did not share, and it was delicious!  I wanted to eat the whole bowl of it, but had to somehow save room for dessert.  Chose the blood orange sorbet for something nice and refreshing - and it was!

Overall, a great choice for the group. It was pretty chaotic and noisy in there, but we never lacked for anything.

Let's put it this way. We were only in Chicago for 3 days and we ate here twice. I highly recommend checking it out. Both inside and out is very fun and quaint, but we always enjoy sitting at the bar and chatting up the bartenders. Rob was awesome and very friendly as well as knowledgeable. He poured a great drink and made great menu suggestions. I highly suggest coming by and checking them out. Every course we had was delicious.

The dessert was great. It was my first time (ever) trying the Bolognese and at first I thought the taste was weird but it turned out to be great. The service was good as well and I liked the atmosphere. It's authentic Italian so if that's your thing I'd recommend to give this place a try.

On this night of Biblical rainstorms, three of us Funksters ventured to downtown Chicago for a meal of Biblical tastes and copious amounts of the crushed grape!

First, the joint is huge...two floors with a constant relaxed movement. Walls of white subway tiles intermixed with fine wood panels and trim. A beautiful hand crafted bar and bar-back cabinets on one side. White shirted servers with aprons rolled at the waist deliver plates of meats and pastas to all points within.

The ambiance is a throwback to Prohibition. Plates jostling and glasses clinking. I Close my eyes and any moment I expect to see "Papa Johnny" Torrio head of the Chicago Outfit sitting at a corner table twirling Tagliatelle alla Bolognese on the end of his fork as he quietly dines with Michael "Hinky Dink" Kenna one of Chicago's most corrupt politicians as they discuss their next bag drop!

We are delivered to that corner table just off the top of the stairs.  Our backs to the walls, we watch the evening move in front of us.

Over the course of the next two hours we simply "dine" in the best sense of the word. Coppa and Prosciutto San Daniele, Taleggio and Pecarino Romano, Roasted Beet Salad and Giardiniera Romana and an assortment of red, green and black italian olives; plates of Tagliatelle alla Bolognese and Tuscan Sausage Risotto, a fine loaf of sliced ciabatta. All accompanied by a liter of Sangiovese IGT Santa Cristina - Toscana 2014. To finish the the evening a shared Coppa alla Banana - Caramelized Banana, Vanilla Gelato, Biscotti, Whipped Cream, Chocolate Sauce & Shavings.

Did we burn through a few dead presidents this evening? Yepper... and even one guy who was pretty famous just for kite flying! Would we do it again? In a John Lee Hooker Boom Boom Boom!

Wait a sec... is that a Ark floating down State street?!? Crap, we gotta go!

pics.caption: Some Guys and their Dolls wait'en for a table at Quartino's

review.des: If I could give his place no stars I would. We had a horrible server that did not even ask how the food was or ever come to check and see if we needed refills. Then my friend that was with me asked him a question in which the waiter replied I already answered that but it's...  extremely disrespectful. We had the vodka pasta and if you want to compare it to something imagine chef boyardee ravioli sauce out of a can. Then we had the bolognese and I asked the waiter if it had cheese and he said no. I am extremely allergic to cheese so when a server brought it it was completely covered in Parmesan. He so rudely proceeded to tell me of course it had dairy and cheese that I messed up by saying I didn't want dairy or cheese not that I was allergic to it. We went to celebrate my birthday and all together horrible service and food.

Definitely a top 5 favorite spot downtown. Perfect atmosphere whether it's summer and you're on the patio people watching, or winter on the inside patio with old Italian movies on the screens. Go with a group and share stuff. Wine comes in fun carafes. All of the salads are great - light and refreshing. The meatballs and dates are a must to start. The pasta is super comforting. The pizza is delicious, thin, and authentic. You really can't go wrong. Get it all!

I came here last Thursday night for dinner.  Booked through OpenTable so it was an easy process.  I was with two other people and we split a bottle of wine, margarita pizza, gnocchi, polenta fries and some sort of seafood stew that came with bread.  

Polenta fries were not my thing but they are super popular so I can't knock them too much I just didn't think they had any flavor at all.  The gnocchi was very dense and flavorless but the sauce added something to it.  The pizza and the seafood dish were awesome though- the basil on top the pizza was absolutely perfect.

I think overall this is a solid River North spot and I'd definitely come back, I just probably wouldn't order some of the things I did this time, next time.

One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to, with excellent prices. The service was quick, the food was hot, and the flavor was outstanding. The restaurant itself has a great appeal to it. We sat outside, which is right on the street. For a personal dinner, sit inside, but if you are visiting the city, it is an exciting way to see the surrounding buildings while getting your belly full.

I have a problem with Quartinos . I always over order and leave food behind and feel stuffed.
I love their small plates varieties.
Pastas and meat dishes go together so well.

Service: At par with 5-star rating. You couldn't ask for more.
Food: Tapas style so ask your server how much to order. They are very helpful.
Drinks: Vino was awesome and variety of drinks should satisfy most customers.

Story: My then boyfriend and I decided to get married on a very fine day by ourselves and we decided to celebrate it at Quartino. That's how good I think it is. This place will remain in my memory for rest of my life.
Great food, especially the pasta. The atmosphere is energetic and fun and the staff is super friendly. If you're in Chicago for more than a few days you should visit!

Amazing how busy this place is all the time- it's so large but always filled up. Must be doing something right!
My husband and I randomly came here as our original reservation had to cancel bc the heat failed. We grabbed a small table at the bar where the waitress was patient with us as we waited to figure out what to do over a drink. Once we decided to stay for dinner we had a great meal.
Get the bruschetta! 3 different options and so big and flavorful. We had some olives and cheese pizza which were good as well. The kitchen messed up somewhere so we benefited from an extra order of pasta with sausage in the house. Idk what it was bc we didn't order it, but had good flavor.
Overall good experience.

I cannot believe that it took us so long to make it to Quartino's since we live downtown.

Everything is top notch - the food, wine, and service.  Eggplant Parmesan was reminiscent of the Como Inn days.  The short ribs with potato purée is not to be missed.  Our party of three loved everything.  The Caprese salad, linguini clams, fettuccine Alfredo, and sautéed spinach were very good.  The Italian donuts are a must.

Andy, the manager, made us feel so special.  Checked in on us several times and was so warm and friendly.  Lynee, our server, was excellent.  

You must give this place a try!
Will be going back soon!

Fantastic food and atmosphere.  I visit this restaurant every time I come to Chicago. Don't miss it. The sharing portions are very fun and let you experience more and different items.

See you there.

First regarding the food- there are lot of options for vegetarians. The food plates are right sized. The outdoor seating area is very comfortable and desirable.

The reason for low rating is the service. There was no one to attend us for first 10 minutes. Once the drinks ordered was taken no one for next 10. The place was not packed when we visited. The waiter gave an expression that he didn't wanted to serve.

Will return for food with lower expectations of customer service

The gnocchi was so soft but chewy and delicious--like a pillow and a marshmallow had a baby. The restaurant is very good about the timing between your appetizer and entree so you can chit chat and make your visit the primary experience of your evening. But because you get a healthy 20-30 mins between the appetizer and entree, you might be tempted to graze on their bread basket so don't fill up too much on it. Entrees are $12-18 and my total was about $70 for two of us so extremely affordable and a great value for the quality of food + service. I'll absolutely be coming back. Get a reservation on Open Table (just in case) because I did overhear a walk-in guest being told a 45 minute wait as they were walking me to my table. The valet is $12 so that was cheaper than using Park Chicago or Spot Hero for my night.

I made a reservation around 8:30 the same night on OpenTable and was able to make a reservation for that same night. I came here on a Friday night around 9:30 PM to meet a friend and we were seated quickly by an attentive and kind hostess. The place was pretty busy, but not overly loud or crowded at all. Waitress was great - she was able to point us toward some vegan options as well as house specials and favorites. Food came out quickly, warm and was well-prepared. Price-wise, very reasonable and affordable for a dinner in Chicago. I got basic spaghetti and raspberry sorbet and was happy with my choices.

The dining area is spacious, comfortably lit, and very beautiful; the upstairs was not seated when we were there, but was similarly laid out. If I'm back in River North, I will be back!

Loved loved loved this place.

This was a date night for my husband and I. Score heading to a friend's birthday party. Although the restaurant was sooo busy, we were accommodated really well, a small table for two by the bar in the back for privacy, attentive staff and served as well.

My husband and I are vegetarian so the server was very patient and accommodating to our requests. Just added cherry on the top to our date night.

Would definitely return if ever in the city with Italian food mood.

Ahhh I miss the days of being within walking distance from this restaurant. It's an excellent first date place as the place is set up for wine and tapas.

The place is very large; an outdoor spot, upstairs and two separate spots on the 1st floor.

Again it's a great place to go to in the warm summer months and if you are an Italian tapas fan, it's a classic.

The scene: The place was crowded with an hour+ wait on on a rainy Wednesday night. It is really LOUD inside with an obnoxious speaker calling "Robin, party of 3 your table is ready!" every few minutes. I was able to grab an open seat at the bar. Though you can order food at the bar, be warned, the stools are REALLY close together so you'll be bumping elbows with your neighbor and hopefully not sitting next to someone with a lot of big hair! :-)

Food and Drink: Everything sounded good, but was just OK. I always think a spritz sounds good, but per usual, they put so much ice and soda water that the end result is watery with barely any hint of aperol. The free bread is fine, but nothing amazing. I did like the olive oil in a groovy canister that came with it. The arugula salad ($9.75) was a nice pile of greens with a good amount of hazelnuts and slice oranges, oddly hidden at the bottom of the plate. The goat milk ricotta lacked flavor and if there was any of the promised farro, I couldn't find it. I also tried the burrata and roasted beets ($10.75). The burrata was beautiful and had perfect texture, but needed more salt. The beet presentation seemed odd to me. A few raw slices on the bottom of the plate lacked flavor (as raw beets tend to) and the roasted beets came in tiny little cubes. The dish needed some acid and salt to bring it together.

Service: Super friendly bar staff, 5 stars!

Though other things on the menu sounded good, and I love the concept of a small plate Italian place, my samplings weren't tasty enough to bring me back.

pics.caption: Arugula salad- lots of hazelnuts and orange slices hiding underneath this mountain of greens.
Aperol spritz- I think I'm just not a fan of this drink, though it always sounds so good when I see it on menus.
Bread is nothing special- but the olive oil is tasty and comes in a groovy container.

review.des:
I had been to Quartino's several years ago, and I recall loving the experience. I have found it to be one of the more affordable sit-down dining options in downtown Chicago, and I love the tapas-style pasta manner (because who doesn't want to snitch bites off of someone else's plate?).

Quartino's was literally a stone's throw away from our hotel, and the atmosphere and staff were warm and inviting. We had reservations so we were seated quickly - I definitely suggest making reservations, because even though the two of us came in on a Monday night, it was non-stop busy.

It was our last night in Chicago so we pigged out and over-ordered. Our server was Miguel, and he was excellent: very attentive and kind without being overbearing. Their Italian sodas (we had the raspberry and the blood orange flavors) were absolutely delicious.

The first pasta plate we split was the tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce. We are more used to the ground meat-type of Bolognese sauce (i.e., a mix of ground veal, pork, beef, etc.) and this sauce seemed like more of a shredded pork ragout. It wasn't bad but we did not love it. Our next shared plate was the porcini and truffle risotto. Again, this plate was a little disappointing, since I remember ordering it several years back with two girlfriends and we had LOVED this luxurious, rich dish. The risotto was VERY over-cooked, my daughter said it was too mushy. And every bite was oddly gritty, like the mushrooms hadn't been properly rinsed (it literally felt like I was crunching on sand). We next split the fettuccini alfredo and the sauce was extremely delicious and silky. HOWVER, the problem I had with both the tagliatelle and the fettucine was that both pastas were extremely chewy and dense (not al dente, but undercooked/chewy) and needed a heavier hand with the salt. I wanted to salt both dishes but resisted since this seemed sacrilegious...but someone back in the kitchen really forgot to salt the pasta water.  Our last shared course was the steamed clams and these were STELLAR. The broth was gorgeous and tasted delicious but unfortunately we were too full with the mediocre pasta dishes to fully enjoy this excellent dish!

I really think this was an off night for the kitchen, pasta-wise. I still love Quartino's and I fully intend to come back the next time we are in Chicago. The total bill for TONS of food and two Italian sodas/refills was about $60 (before tip for the excellent service) which you will be hard pressed to top elsewhere downtown.

pics.caption: Our server was Miguel, and he was very nice!

review.des:
I've been coming here consistently for the past 6 years and I will continue to keep coming.

The prices are reasonable
The service is amazing
The drinks are exceptional
The pappardelle is to die for
The place is open late
The employees make you feel special

Go and thank me later!

My coworkers and I from Houston, Texas were in town and looking to get some great pizza and Italian food.  Well look no further, we settled on Quartino's. We had fast, friendly service and the most amazing food. The drinks were well poured and appetizers were sensational.  Meatballs perfectly seasoned and we had the best calamari we had ever eaten. The pizza was thinner crust seasoned spicy and flavorful. Spaghetti was exceptional and fettuccine Alfredo was delish.  Oh and did I mention home made pasta? Excellent night and meal.

This was one of the only restaurants open super late night after my coworkers and I got off work-so we decided to stop by based on the Yelp reviews.

The menu is surprisingly diverse and great Italian food open late night in the middle of Chicago amongst all of the people going out in a popular area.

I was happy with the food and I was very happy that it was fresh late-night, you could tell my vegetables had just been grilled and it was very tasty.
The service was great and the price points were deserving. I ordered the lemon curd desert based on the yelp reviews and it was pretty good. Def shareable !

pics.caption: Lemon curd dessert, pretty good & shareable 8$

review.des: Pretty decent, nice ambience. Great wine, didnt have any food. I should be a professional wine reviewer....whatever that means. ha!

I'm going to start off by saying, if you are looking for a more intimate and quiet experience, pick a different Italian place.  Our reservation was at 9:30pm on a Friday night, and when we left at around 10:45 the place was still wall to wall people and we couldn't really hear each other well.  Expect this to be noisy and very busy.  Also, it is good to note that if you are expecting to order appetizers and dinner here don't order all this at once.  They bring food out as it is ready.  You may get everything at one time, or have one person in your party get their food far before the other.  I would recommend just ordering this as if you were sharing everything in sequences.  We orders the veal meatballs in organic sauce and they were the most amazing meatballs ever.  The goat cheese ricotta was good for people who like that goat flavor.  The in house made prosciutto was really good, and I would recommend the salumi/cheese tasting plate to pick on in between other things coming out.  We ordered the pappardelle and it was good. The sauce was great. I found the pasta a bit too thick for my taste though.

Quartino has been our "go to" restaurant for years, as it has consistently high quality food with good prices and service; ie: great value. Recently we hosted a birthday party upstairs at Quartino for 100 people, and everyone was overwhelmed. Valerie, their event planner was outstanding. Her advice on space, layout, food packages, the bar and timing were all right on. And Roberto, who runs the catering staff, was wonderful; he gracefully managed the excellent staff so that everything seemed smooth and effortless. There was always enough of their great food, which tasted as good as their single servings. Everything and everyone exceeded our expectations.
Chef John, the managers and staff at Quartino have  always felt like friends for us, and that's extremely unusual for a business of this size.
If you are planning an event, you can't go wrong with Quartino!

Amazing variety of Italian delectables! Best dessert menu for choices. Gluten free options. We had a large party and everyone was happy except those with-shrimp n risotto. Risotto with sausage great pizza, kale salad w butternut squash has a hint of nutmeg-delish-not tough and chopped nicely. Huge portion of spaghetti. Look for shared dinner special. We had a large picky group and mostly happy.fantastic service!

The wine selection was incredible and the old fashion my fiancé ordered was delicious. The cheese we tasted were very fresh. We got there during a pretty busy time and we were pretty hungry so we didn't wait 30 mins and sat in the bar area which was great service.

Absolutely one of our favorite restaurants when we visit this city. The food is always consistent and the staff and mangers make our dinning experience easy and enjoyable. We have great conversations with the staff and love that the company promotes within, so the managers really know the ins and outs of this restaurant and knows their clientele. We had the pleasure of speaking with Derek and Brendan both managers who were promoted within this restaurant and delivered excellent customer service. They actually love talking to the guest which we believe managers should have contact with their guest and not hide in their office! Our server's name was Lauren, wonderful personality and always had a smile!
Now let's talk about the food- lots of different types of meat and cheese boards to choose from. One of our favorite dishes is the Organic Veal Skirt Steak, so tasty and tender like a baby... delicious
I highly recommend this dish, also the veal Meatballs Napoli.. yummy.
Even their pizza was delicious, definitely worth the calorie splurge here and we finished off dinner with an espresso martini, tiramisu and homemade gelato!! When in Rome.....

I'm a little bias because I just love the idea of Italian tapas which is what this is. The food is not Your to-die-for homecooked italian but it's decent food and it's all shareable. This is an awesome spot for after work happy hours or to take a bigger group for birthdays, etc.

The food was excellent with nice balance of flavor in the homemade pastas. I'd recommend trying the Italian sodas for they are delicious! Also, the gelati to end the meal is far above average. With a great waitstaff and a nice interior and open late. It's a great place for family style Italian fare. Also, if you're into wine this is definitely your place!

I dined alone for lunch on a Sunday on the patio, as my friend had recommended it. It is a beautiful setting with lots of plants and great city views. The server was polite and informative. They start out by giving you a plate of bread and in traditional Italian fashion olive oil and vinegar- yum! I ordered the burrata salad and the octopus. The burrata was incredible and soft and came with beets and greenery and it was a perfect, light salad. The octopus was great in presentation but unfortunately was very fishy and chewy. I'm assuming that this was likely just a bad batch because it seems to be pretty popular. The server was so polite as to switch my octopus out for the calamari when I didn't like it without any hesitation, great customer service. I also had an aperol spritz and it was great and pretty strong which is never bad ;-). I'm excited to come back and try more food here! The pizzas look deeeeelish

We ordered it all. Closed with coffee but this 5 Star shout is for Sierra (sp?) our waitress (know I put 4 stars just to stay true to the experience-- meaning the waitress and the veal meatballs were 5 stars but generally 4 star goodness, nothing too mindblowing  but tasty no less). Food was a little late and a missed order but the attitude is PACE (performance after critical error) and this wasn't even her fault! She went out of her way to correct and make sure our experience turned around for the better. This is grade A customer service. She represented the restaurant very very well. Thank you again!

Very good place. They serve food in small portions, but it's less expensive then normal meal, so you can try different dishes. There were a bit noisy, but we seated near huge party. Overall very good.

We had dinner here a couple of nights ago with family and loved it! This is such a fun tapas place and pretty reasonably priced when you're sharing multiple plates with others. The Polpette al Sugo di Pomodoro (veal meatballs in marinara) were delicious, as was the goat cheese ricotta. We also loved the quattro formaggi pizza and pappardelle with braised beef. Everything is delicious and the service was great. This is a busy place, so I definitely think a reservation is in order.

This was my favorite restaurant we tried on our trip to Chicago. I highly recommend going with a group of 4 or more and getting different pasta dishes and sharing them all. Every dish we had was sooo delicious. I highly recommend the tortellini, penne alla vodka, and the fettucine Alfredo. The red wine was a great pairing with all the pasta as well. Service was really good for a packed Friday night. Would definitely return !

It's no wonder this place is always packed. Simple and excellent. Live in the neighborhood and frequent often. Just got back from an Italy trip and appreciate the authenticity even more. Highly recommend any time of day.

Came here on a Saturday night and the place was packed! The bar always had a few open seats so I would highly recommend heading there if you're with a small group and everyone's over 21. We were visiting from Seattle and if we're ever in Chicago again, we'd be back for sure!

Fast service, all the servers were so nice and helpful. Food comes out as it's ready and they're decent portions especially when you're drinking. We had a bottle of wine, rigatoni, bruschetta and sausage risotto - so flavorful and true Italian food! We had these donut pastry things (forget the name) with Nutella and honey on the side for dessert, so yummy would definitely recommend.

Omg where do I start. This place is amazing. Probably some of the best Italian food I've ever had.
It's always super busy so make a reservation to make your life easier. That being said, it's a little cramped and very loud so sit outside if it's nice out and you're on a date.
I had the rigatoni. Our waiter said it was his favorite and I agreed that it was my new favorite too. The sauce was so good and the pasta was perfectly al dente. We had the bruschetta for an appetizer and it was so delicious. I tried some of my friends eggplant parm and I would definitely order that next time.
Service was great, food was great. Eat here.

THIS PLACE WAS SO GOOD!

Good prices and amazing food.

So I walked all around River North looking for a good place to eat and finally stumbled upon this place on Yelp and was thoroughly pleased. I knew from the moment I walked in that the food was going to be delicious. The hostess was very nice to begin and sat us right away. The server started us with bread and olive oil/vinegar and we ordered a bottle of the house red (Rosso) which was  a good choice with our meal!

The style of this restaurant is meant for sharing (family style) and I was happy they warned us in the beginning about this. We got the Margherita pizza which came with eight slices (12 inches). The pizza was super good because it had a very authentic taste and was different than any other pizza I've had.

The server was very helpful by letting us know that we could order a half pasta for half the price and it was a good amount of pasta for even one person. So we split the gnocchi as well which I thought was good but wasn't necessarily the best gnocchi I've had. Still was pretty tasty though!

The way we finished off with the hot chocolate cake and ice cream which was basically just a lava cake but wow it was SO good! The perfect amount to split with another person.

Overall the three dishes we got and the bottle of wine was $45 which was SUPER cheap and a perfect amount of food.

This reataurant was the best I've been to in Chicago. By far.

pics.caption: Hot chocolate dessert (basically a lava cake) $8.00. One of the better deserts I've had

review.des: This restaurant hits all the marks when it comes to great tasting Italian food for a an incredible value. The pizzas and risotto are phenomenal. Also the drinks are great you get a lot for the amount you pay. Also the city of Chicago has tons of similar restaurants but the pricing can become an issue. This place is extremely price conscious and they offer plenty of portions. Bread is a must make sure you tell your waiter/waitress for some.

Great food, great atmosphere especially in the summer time its worth the wait to sit outside between may and sept!
Prices are well priced for the location and the amount of food they give you
If you like vino, check this place out, excellent wine and excellent service, 5 stars!!

Delicious food, a fun (albeit loud) Italian-inspired atmosphere, and friendly service.

Extensive wine selection--I am no wine connoisseur by any means, but it's safe to say there is something for everyone on the menu.

Food-wise, there are almost too many amazing options to chose from. We got the arugula salad, eggplant parm, and the artisan sausage to split between two of us. All three were delicious, and it was just the right amount of food to fill you up without being too full. My only qualm was the salad was a bit light on the dressing.

Great spot with a warm and vibrant atmosphere that works for happy hour drinks and appetizers or a full meal. Definitely NOT the place for you if you want to converse at a normal volume level.

I wasn't given a wine glass and when they returned with one after asking it was a water glass. I got thebutt end of the burrata so the cheese was hard. Final straw was ordering the fra diavolo which I've always had as a pasta dish. Not here, it's just spicy shrimp so I had to order plain linguini at $7/small bowl. Not impressed and definitely would not return

I came here a few months back with my friend for her birthday and we were pretty disappointed by the sub par food here. HOWEVER, after having been kindly reached out to by the staff and assured a wonderful experience, we decided to give Quartino another go.

I left the restaurant with a full stomach and happy heart. We were sat at a table near the kitchen which was nice and roomy which I appreciated as the rest of the building was packed. The manager and wait staff were extremely attentive and friendly. They made sure our experience was great as well as the food.

We started out the meal with some bread (I still feel like the bread they give you at the table isn't that great, but the rest of the food made up for that) and some seasonal cocktails. I had a pumpkin spice mai tai and my friend got a moroccolo (or something like that!). Both were pretty boozy but delicious.

Next some appetizers were brought out for us. A toast with a DELICOUS fluffy goat cheese spread, bacon wrapped blue cheese filled dates, and a meat platter with (I believe) pickled onions of some sort. All of the appetizers were delicious, especially the meat sampler and goat cheese.

For entrees we went with fettuccini (homemade noodles, yum!) and the shrimp risotto. Both delicious. The alfredo sauce was light and not too overpowering. The risotto was heavy but nice and creamy. Portions were a bit small but that was fine because we had so much other food.

For dessert, the manager sent us THREE different things to try. The warm donuts with dark chocolate and honey dipping sauces were nice and fluffy. The dark chocolate dipping sauce was incredible! The tiramisu was rich and fluffy and moist and was exactly what we were craving. Best of all was lemon cream gelato sandwiched between some sort of lemon cookie/cake on top of a lemon curd that I could eat spoonfuls of. So good!

I felt like a queen and a food critic at the same time with the variety and amount of delicious food that was sent our way. The staff here was so kind and I am so glad to have given this place another chance.  Thank you Quartino for an amazing dining experience, and thank you to Alysia for having us.

I realize that everyone has their off days and that my dining experience the first time didn't correctly reflect the quality of food here. I will definitely be returning here for another meal due to the quality of food and the genuine staff.

pics.caption: Bacon wrapped dates filled with blue cheese

review.des: One of my favorite spot in Chicago for an Italian dining. Service is always fast even if they are packed. The atmosphere is warm and nice. I would definitely bring my friends here.

I've been to quartino a few times and every time I feel like they haven't quite decided what they're gonna be. They straddle a weird line between trying to be casual in some ways and fancy in others but either way the food is very good. It's all small plates and it's great to go with a big group so you can try a lot of different stuff. You start your meal with delicious bread and really good olive oil and balsamic. All their handmade pastas are the best part of the menu by far. They also have a very good wine selection that is super cheap. Overall actually the whole place is very reasonably priced. The service tends to be pretty good. Unfortunately their dessert is nothing to write home about. Skip dessert and get an extra pizza

Looking for a pasta place and found this on yelp. Was a bit unsure as it showed open til 2am. We called to see how long the wait was on a Friday afternoon and were told 2 HOURS. We made a reservation and arrived about 15 minutes early. We were told we wouldn't be sat until closer to our reservation time. Let me just back up and say the place was beyond crowded. Inside and out! So I was thinking this had to be a good sign. While the noise levels did rise to almost unbearable at a few moments during dinner, I have to admit, if you can get past that, it's totally worth it! Not your quiet date night type spot. The energy in here is non-stop. The pizza + pasta were delicious, and our server Margot was efficient and pleasant! We will be back.

I came here on a Saturday night for my cousins birthday.  Luckily, we were smart enough to make a reservation because this place was packed!  I couldn't believe it.  We got seated right away and watched the staff move swiftly through the tables of guests.  All of our food was delicious!  We enjoyed the goat cheese spread after the complimentary bread.  Both loaves tasted so fresh!  We absolutely loved the gnocchi and fettuccini Alfredo too!  We opted for the caramelized banana with vanilla gelato for her birthday dessert and were happy with our decision.  Our bill was inexpensive for having a full course meal, with a beer and a glass of wine added too.  We were impressed with how fast & efficient the staff was.  I definitely wouldn't mind coming back!

Quartino is a chicago gem that everyone has to try at least once. The food is italian food brought out in small plates/tapas style. The food is pretty good, but not AMAZING. It is a great place to bring big groups though, and people who aren't from chicago and come visit us really love coming here. Good wine/drink menu too.
Average italian food! But this place is always soooo busy. But it's a good place to come late night as it is open late

Girls from work highly recommended it but it's been 6-7 years and I'd have to assume it's under new management or has went downhill.  It was very busy and it was a cute place .. and they got us seated right away without reservation.  The service was fine and they gave free postcards which was nice touch.  But we dine out to have good food and thats where they really missed the mark.
           This is were the happy ends .. the food was  across the board lack luster ... we added salt to everything which never has happened at any restaurant.  The portions and price was small which is fine .. gives you chance to order a few things and share around.  But the food was flat out bland and disappointing ..  we were in town for 9 days so plenty of opportunity to try other places. I am shocked the majority of the reviews are favorable.

First time here. We sat outside.  People watching. Tried a little of everything.  We are from California and this was an eclitcic gastro experience. 3 type olive plate. Yum. Brischita.   And some cheeses and home made salami.  Amazing.. everything was 5 star. The manager spent alot if time with us. WELL DONE Quartini!
Good authentic Italian restaurant. You could tell everything was made right over there. The waiting staff are a bit unresponsive though..

I've heard so many great things about this place, so when my mom was in town, I knew we had to go! Some people even say its their favorite tapas place! To be honest though, I'd probably give this place 3.5 stars if I could.

# Ease of making reservation: 5/5 surprisingly
# Service: 2/5 - seemed like everything took forever, and we could never find our waiter so we were constantly asking other servers for stuff, which I felt bad about. The waiter was a bit standoff-ish, but that didn't bother me too much because I don't blame him - this place was packed and he must have been super busy.
# Ambience: 1/5 - I've never seen a place so crowded and packed. I can't believe their head count is in compliance with safety regulations! I could barely hear my family members - and believe me, we were super close to each other. I felt super stressed the whole time (but maybe that's a personal problem haha).
# Food: 4/5 - YOU HAVE TO GET THE SHRIMP RISOTTO. The minestrone soup is also quite good! The filet medallions were just meh, and it only comes with two small pieces. The brussel sprouts were delicious, but in my opinion, its hard to screw up brussel sprouts as long as you add tons of oil/butter.
# Price: 4/5 - cocktails are WAY overpriced - but other than that, seemed pretty standard for tapas in the city.

Bottom line: If you don't mind being packed like a sardine and meh service, this place is worth going to. Prices are comparable to other tapas places. You HAVE to get the shrimp risotto! Perhaps come on a non-weekend day to get a better experience?

If you want to have one of the best, classic pizzas ever in Chicago, this is the spot!

Not only are their pizzas amazing and drool-worthy, the rest of their menu is as well. I absolutely love that all the waiters are wearing soccer jerseys, huge brownie points!

Communication seems to be a little difficult amongst the hosts and servers though, I've waited at least 10 minutes before seeing a server every time, sometimes more. However, I won't let that stop me from coming.

I stopped by here for lunch with a friend on a nice day and was seated outside. You will be served with complimentary bread which actually tastes pretty good with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. We settled for the $25 lunch special which essentially allowed us to choose three different dishes from the main sections of the menu. Our choices ended up being the beet salad, linguine with clams, and the calamari.

I am a fan of beets and the salad did not disappoint. The salad contained beets and burratta cheese. It seemed as if there were two different kinds of beets in the salad. One came in the cubed form and was juicy and flavorful while the other came in a sliced form and tasted more like sliced carrots. I definitely enjoyed eating the cubed beets more since the sliced beets were pretty flavorless and dry. The burratta was extremely creamy and burst when I cut it with a fork. Although the flavoring of the cheese itself was a bit watered down, it complemented the strong flavor of the cubed beets well.

The linguine with clams dish was actually smaller than I was expecting. There was the option of a red or white sauce with this dish and we opted for the white. The sauce was a wine sauce so it was not creamy. For pasta, I thought the linguine dish was actually pretty light. After I finished eating, I did not feel weighed down. The clams were pretty tiny and there weren't that many unfortunately.

Ordering the calamari was a mistake. I need to remember that eating fried foods in large quantities is neither enjoyable nor desirable. The portion size for this order was pretty big and we were unable to finish the dish completely. In addition, the calamari was a bit soggy which made it even more difficult to consume. This was definitely one of the weaker dishes we had ordered.

On top of the lunch special, my friend and I mistakenly ordered the Gran Coppa Quartino dessert. The description of the dessert may seem tempting, but let me warn you that it is actually just a very mediocre, overpriced dessert in disguise. The gelato tasted extremely artificial and the screaming shade of pink of the strawberry gelato did not help one bit.

If you are looking for a reasonably priced meal for lunch, stopping by Quartino and getting the $25 lunch special is actually not a bad deal. I certainly regret ordering the dessert which cost an additional $8. Skip on the dessert here and you'll walk away with a decent lunch experience without having your wallet drained.

pics.caption: Gran Coppa Quartino-$8, definitely pass on this very mediocre order

review.des:
Best Italian I've had in the U.S. The other best Italian was in South Korea. Best italian meaning a balance of both amazing pizza and pasta.

Dinner: It's small plates to share, tapas style. New York or Chicago pizza? New York if I have to choose. But Italian thin crust is always my favorite. I've tried a few pizzas, all are good. The gnocchi, and pastas all taste hand made.

Ambiance: I came here looking at yelp's star rating just expecting another basic Italian restaurant with fancy chairs and plates but wow, it was so much more than that. The service is always great despite how busy they are. I'm happy they staff enough people to have good service. Last time I went, they were all wearing soccer jerseys which was cool and the waiters were playful instead of stern or strictly polite. It toned down the vibe of being very fancy to fun.
I've always sat outside so I'm not sure of the noise level inside.

This place is too cute! Sit outside to get a nice view of people watching and soak up the amazing weather Chicago has to offer in the Spring/Summer time. Or get inside and get social but the bar, table tops, or even dining area. This restaurant scene is active and lively, so you're bound to have a great experience regardless if you come alone or with a group.

The menu consists of a broad range of items. You want something carb heavy, go for a pasta dish! You want some simple snacks you say, well how about a classic charcuterie! How about something simple, refreshing, and just decadent enough without the typical Italian fare guilt.. definitely opt in for the ricotta! All the items on the menu are priced amazing fare, if not a bargain for the quality and flavors of the dishes! You really can't go wrong coming here and trying this place out!

Dishes I tried:

-Ricotta: To be honest, I've never been a fan of these cheese. But this is the one place that has changed my mind.. get it. done deal!

- Veal meatballs (traditional style): Tender, juicy, and just the right about of sauce without masking the natural flavors of the meat itself. Get it.

-Baby Spinach salad: lackluster and the table did not finish it. Pass on it..

-Penne alla vodka: I love a good vodka sauce and this was a perfect touch to getting a few bites of a heavy pasta without feeling weighed down. Creamy and silky with bold but simplistic flavors.. get it!

-Broccoli rabe- it's is rabe and not traditional broccoli florets, it tastes similar to a sauteed spinach with more texture. Pleasantly surprised with the bold garlic notes and a pinch of spice. Get it!

-Octopus: If it haven't said it enough in my reviews, Chicago is my all time favorite city to get octopus plates, and Quartino did not disappoint! Charred perfectly with bites of smokey flavor. Must get!

-Porcini & truffle risotto- Creamy, heavy and lacked the truffle notes. Also was a bit undercooked. Pass on this one!
Food was so delicious and I loved the family style where everyone orders food and shares so you get to try many different things. Very filling and very affordable. Highly recommend.

The food here is really outstanding. Great place to take family or a large group. Everything is meant to be shared. Last time I came here was with my in-laws who were visiting from out of town. It was a hit.

This is one of the restaurants that my sister always requests when she comes into town. They hit it out of the park every single time. The service is great. The food is delicious. The atmosphere is elegant, but fun. Very lively, and always busy.

This last time we ate here (Saturday night), we showed up 1/2 hour before our reservation because we were in the area, and they accommodated us right away.

The cheese fondue is outstanding. Any of the flatbreads are great (my favorite is the Campania; add proscuitto). Can't go wrong with meat / cheese plate. Their cicchetti options are also wonderful. Make sure to get the Zeppole for dessert (Italian donuts).

Saluti!

Our go-to shared plates restaurant when friends come to visit us!  Great vegetarian and gluten-free options and a wide selection of thin crust pizzas and pastas!
Favorite dishes that we order almost every time we go: tortellini with peas and thinly sliced prosciutto, veal polpette with fresh ricotta cheese, and the manzo pizza (with braised beef short rib, fennel, and creamy gorgonzola fonduta).  For vegetarians, try the quattro stagioni pizza!  It's topped with artichokes, roasted peppers, grilled zucchini, and portobello mushrooms-- all fresh and generously piled on the pizza.
For dessert, definitely get the zeppole! Their sugary goodness with chocolate and caramel sauce will have you wolfing down every last bite!
One note about the atmosphere-- it does get pretty loud and the tables are close together so it's not the restaurant to go to for a romantic intimate dinner.

Ambience - hopping
Service - friendly and fast
Pasta - GOOD but not great

**The pasta was less al dente, a bit too cooked while the sauce was rich and a bit too salty. We got the rigatoni, pappardelle, and classic spaghetti -- rigatoni was the clear winner.

Not worth coming if you're looking for fantastic Italian and pasta, great for an energetic friendly restaurant for friends or family.

The best Italian find in the city!

Quartino's prices, food, drinks, service, atmosphere, and convenience are all AMAZING.

Food comes out in small plates, as it's ready, which makes it the perfect place to go with a group, or on a date.

Whatever you do, get the tiramisu.

Make reservations!  This place is huge and noisy.  We went on a rainy Tuesday night and the place was PACKED.  We'd allowed 2 hours for dinner and needed every minute of it.
The salumeria tasting was great: the beets with ricotta salata were delicious( prosciutto San Faniele, salty and melt-in-the-mouth; sapprossata was spicy and flavorful; the artichokes were a bit bland but the Gorgonzola and Grana Padano more than made up for that (make sure to try the mostarda and apricot purée with the cheese).  The porcini and truffle risotto was earthy and fragrant.  The Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo, rich and tasty - the pasta perfectly cooked.  When a table of 24 we're seated next to us, we expected to be forgotten but, surprisingly, our server made sure we were looked after, and we were checked on several times by managers.  We left full and happy and would definitely go back.

Stumbled upon this place on a rainy Sunday night and was pleasantly surprised to see it so busy. Ordered a few appetizers and a bottle of wine. I'm a fan of the free bread with olive oil and I absolutely loved the meatballs and the bacon wrapped dates. The environment was perfect for the night I wanted and the service was outstanding. Shout out to Trevor for being super friendly and gave my boyfriend and I house-made limoncello. I can't wait to come back when I'm in town next!

Came here late at night after the Drake concert and I'm so glad we did. The setting of the place was really cute. The waiters were so nice. Our table was under the AC and I was freezing and they were kind enough to move us and make us feel comfortable.

We got two different pizzas and both were so good. I'm sure the other ones are just as good.
The calamari was AMAZING. One of the best I've had.
I also got the gnocchi. Didn't think it looked that appealing but when I tried it, I was so impressed. It was delicious.

Over all I loved it!

I wanted to take my mom out for a great dinner to celebrate her 70th. Unfortunately, I took her to a mediocre one.

We arrived for our reservation and were seated by the hosts who were doing their job without any degree of enthusiasm. One person at the host stand told another a table number, looked at me, and said to follow him. We arrived at the table and he asked if we were 3 or 4. I said just 2, but noticed we'd picked up a straggler en route to the table. She said "I think you're seating us." Host looked confused. We looked confused. She looked confused. He told us to stay and told her they'd get another table together. I think the host who told him the table got the parties mixed up.

The place goes just past cozy into crowded. The woman at the table adjacent to us elbowed one of our dishes just trying to get her purse from the back of her chair. If they took 3 or 4 tables out it would be a different experience, but I expect it's a cash cow and they'd like 3 tables more cash.

The food was a mixed bag. The spinach arrived first. It was very garlicky, but that was hard to taste in the absence of garlic's essential partner-- salt. Once we added a bit it was delish. It needed twice the salt and half the oil. The cavatelli, however, was from heaven. It was light for a potato based pasta, which you can only achieve making it in house. The sauce was a simple, fresh-tasting tomato sauce, with loads of flavorful ricotta. This dish was a winner. The final dish was the vegetarian pizza, which I'd been excited about. With zucchini, eggplant, cauliflower, and asparagus, how could I go wrong? Well... I did. First bite was weird and bitter. Arugula? I usually love it in salad or on pizza, but *could* this be unusually bitter. I took it off. Still weird and bitter! My mom didn't taste it on the first couple bites, but when she did she couldn't get rid of the taste. We discovered it was the eggplant. It was bad. It smelled and tasted like an old sock. Nothing can convince me it wasn't old and spoiled. The server, who was also doing his job with no enthusiasm, apologized, gave us a ridiculous line about eggplant being bitter this time of year, and took it away, but it remained on the bill. It should not have.

The caramelized banana dessert sounded different and yummy. It was fine, but it's not really a banana dessert. It's vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce with a 2 inch piece of banana cut in half and placed on top. The sorbet trio was refreshing, with the lemon being the standout and the orange and raspberry being a standard sherbet.

I really loved that pasta dish, but I wouldn't go back due to the spoiled food and lackluster service. I paid $100 for a $50 meal.

Delicious food, reasonably priced, lots of small items to share which lets your group try a bunch of different things.  The only problem I had was that it was VERY loud inside - I was with family visiting from out of town and it was really hard to have a conversation.  In fact, it was so loud that the waiter was literally yelling to us and we still struggled to hear him!  So if it's a nice night, try to sit outside to avoid all of the noise.  Otherwise I have no complaints, Quartino was good.

I gotta say, Quartino has become one of my favorite spots in Chicago!

It's become our go-to for special occasions, and has yet to disappoint! Though pricey, it's always worth it. It's become our favorite spot to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, holidays, etc. We know that we'll plan on spending a decent amount of money, but we love that it's small plates - it allows us to try a variety of items on the menu. We've also always has great service - the servers, managers, and bussers provided such a welcoming and warm experience.

The wine is always delicious. Twice, we've asked for the waiters' recommendations and they've had yet to disappoint us. We typically share a 1/2 carafe of wine between two of us and feel it's a great amount for a meal.

Mostly recently, we've shared the shrimp in a pinot grigio sauce, the gnocchi with pesto and green beans and the fettuccine alfredo. There is nothing better than homemade pasta, and Quartino executes tremendously. Homemade pasta truly makes all the difference in an already delicious meal.

There's 8,000,000 tables in Quartino - the place is huge and takes up two floors. However, the service is tremendous and the food is delicious - you really feel that the food was made specifically for you. You will NOT be disappointed!

Nice Italian restaurant with reasonable price. We ordered a duck pizza, seafood platter, meatball appetizer and spaghetti. The duck pizza is literally the best pizza I have ever had. On the thin, cheesy layer of bread, there are duck sausage slices and plenty of arugula. We will definitely go back again! The line up can be very long so I recommend you make reservation.

First off, this place is way bigger than I had expected. 2 stories with tons of seating and even has some special event space on the 2nd level. We made reservations for 5 o'clock and it wasn't that busy yet but when we left at 630 pm it was filling up quick so make reservations!

Food:
They serve as soon as the food is ready so your dishes come out at different times which I personally liked since I was starving. We got the margherita pizza, tortellini with prosciutto, parppadelle al sugo, and truffle salame. Pizza was decent - thin crust and good balance of cheese and sauce. Tortellini was good but didn't amaze me. I will say the prosciutto was good and normally I don't like prosciutto. But the tortellini itself was lacking in flavor for me. Parppadelle was also pretty good although the meat was a bit salty to me. And lastly, the truffle salame was good from what my boyfriend said - not a salami person so I didn't try it!

Service:
Very fast which is surprising for how big and busy the place is. The server also was good about checking in but not so often to be disruptive.

Overall:
Enjoyable dining experience and would definitely return. I personally like Balena a little bit more for the taste but I thought prices and ambiance here were better. Very reasonable prices for the dishes ($10-13) and a great location in the heart of the city.

pics.caption: The tortellini with prosciutto and peas - not a big fan of prosciutto but I liked this one so that's a plus!

review.des:
100%! Great wait staff- hugely busy yet always on time, provided he correct meals, and checked up on us. Manager also came to every. single. table!

Ordered penne vodka. Others w me ordered lamb shank- SO tender and great portion, mushroom risotto & eggplant Parmesan.

Overall, loved all the food, the high energy atmosphere and warm glowy feel of the restaurant. Great outdoor seating too perfect for summer nights! (We ate in- personal preference).

I've never written a bad Yelp review. But my experience at Quartino tonight was so unpleasant, it has unfortunately merited my first one.

I've been to Quartino a number of times. Until today, I would have given it a solid 3.5 stars. Pretty tasty food, good place for a group. I went for dinner with coworkers tonight and we were having a nice enough time - our server was very pleasant, food came out promptly, most of it was good (fettuccine alfredo was weirdly soupy...).

Quartino always has a loud, bustling vibe but as we were nearing the end of our meal, the very large table of young men next to us had gotten so obnoxiously loud it was hard for us to even hear each other. They were drinking so much that we were surprised they hadn't been asked to leave. And keep in mind, this was a Monday night. One guy in my direct line of sight had gotten so drunk he was swaying and actually looked ill. You could tell he was about to throw up...and then he did. AT THE TABLE. It was absolutely disgusting. His friends just screamed and laughed and took videos of it, until finally some of them walked him outside. This was the very end of our meal, and now WE all felt sick just from watching this.

We asked for the manager who came over a few minutes later (meanwhile, the vomit still had not been cleaned up). He apologized and explained that the guy (and presumably others at the table - they were all being very friendly with the staff) is actually an EMPLOYEE!!

How unbelievably inappropriate to allow your employees to be overserved to the point of getting sick (at the table!!), in their place of work, while the restaurant is open and the dining room is packed with customers. Not only did it ruin our meal, it was SO unprofessional and shocking that it has completely turned me off from Quartino.

It used to be a go-to spot for group outings and work dinners. I will absolutely not be going back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants to go to for any occasion. I've been here for a bachelorette party, a small date night, and with a group of family/friends. I love it!

The small plates are so delicious and are reasonably priced. I love the selection of items and the service is always top-notch.

I love the atmosphere and will continue coming here!

What a great spot in the heart of river north to bring a group for some authentic Italian tapas! Such reasonable prices also, and not to mention great wines. Service is impeccable, and makes you definitely want to come back. Here were our picks at this lovely restaurant:

The Orvieto was a lovely sweet white wine that everyone at the table enjoyed. The Toscana was an excellent red for those who enjoy red with their meats.
Arugula salad: light and refreshing start to the meal! A recommend for the salad
Brussel sprouts: I always enjoy Brussel sprouts, but the others in my party thought there was nothing great about this dish
Calamari: a crowd favorite and quartino does it best!!
Gnocchi: excellent pesto sauce, great pasta texture
Linguine with clams: the favorite of the pastas
Penne a la vodka: nothing special, a little too al dente
Organic veal skirt steak: a superb meat dish here, excellently marinated
Braised pork shank: soft and tender, delicious
Brodetto: kind of like a seafood stew, nothing too special

Overall, quartino will not fail you if you're looking for an Italian crowd pleaser! Enjoyed my experience thoroughly!

Hands down the best restaurant in Chicago!
The menu is described to be "tapas" but the portions sizes were definitely not small.
We ordered the Quattro Formaggi pizza, fried calamari, and tortellini.
The calamari was perfectly cooked- it was very soft and juicy on the inside and had a great crispy coating.
The pizza was perfectly cooked- had a great crust and the cheese was ooey gooey perfection!
The tortellini was on a bed of thinly sliced prosciutto that just melted in my mouth! The house-made pasta itself had a great bite and the cream sauce was perfectly seasoned.
Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Definitely enjoy the nice outdoor seating if the weather permits!
Enjoyed a great table of shared plates and wine.  The food was delicious and the wait staff attentive and professional.  Definitely will be back -great place for family and friends to share a meal!
This was an awesome place to eat! First time ever eating tappas and I loved it! Busy atmosphere but great service. Everything was fresh to order.

pics.caption: This yummy platter for $29!! Great way to try everything and the pizza was so fresh full of veggies!!!

review.des: I dont know who posted all these great reviews- but if you are expecting authentic italian you are not going to get it here. The food was awful. I felt like I was eating olive garden. The shrimp risotto had no flavor whatsoever. This is why you cant always trust 2000+ yelp reviews. It was the worst food we had in chicago.

Eat here!

The food is top notch,  amazing flavor,  and perfectly sized portions.

We had mixed olives for appetizer with wines that were really good.

We normally don't order pizza,  but we did and have no regrets... it was stunning!

I Will eat here reach visit to Chicago,  what a great find!

Great place to take a large group. Regardless of all the diet restrictions of a large group, it's family style so everyone leaves full and satisfied. Service is really good. Noise level can be kind of high for anyone in your group that is hard of hearing.

From the white tiled walls to the bathroom attendant's R&B playlist, I loved everything about this place. Small plates are to be shared and good thing because I couldn't pick just one entree! Got a pizza, beef carpaccio, olives, and prosciutto wrapped dates. It can get pretty crowded but that adds to the old school Italian aesthetic. Grate your own cheese on all of it!!

I met two of my friends here for dinner, and since it was a Sunday, I made reservations to be on the safe side. We had initially planned on being seated outdoors (and people watching!) but the weather was too warm and sticky for that.

The hosts (there appeared to be 3!) were all smiles and seated us quickly to a window facing table for a happy compromise. The place was packed and got noisier with laughter and banter as the evening progressed.

The ambience is all mood lighting and on the fancier side, so we were happy that we'd all dressed up.

Side note: the tables are close enough that the group next to us tapped me on my shoulder twice to ask me what we had ordered because it looked SO good.

Speaking of the food, it was one those meals that I'll reminisce about for a long time! We split a bottle of prosecco, and ordered one entree each, skipping the appetizers in favor of dessert (which is my favorite thing to have when I'm out dining). The menu had plenty of non-meat entrées, which pleased my vegetarian friend. We asked the server for suggestions and she made up in friendliness what she seemed to lack in knowledge of the menu.

We got the potato gnocchi, which came with one of the most delicious pesto sauces I've had in a while; the linguine with clams in a marinara sauce that was seasoned and spiced perfectly, and the eggplant parmesan, which was my least favorite dish, but which my dining companions seemed to enjoy a lot.

The portions are decent sized, and unless you have a really large appetite, stick to sharing dishes like we did. Also, all our dishes came out at different times, which was kind of awkward.

Then came dessert, and we agonized over the ridiculously tantalizing menu until we decided on the profiteroles and the Nutella panino. The sugar sprinkled Nutella panino was a great Nutella toast, but too simple and easy replicable to be on that menu. The profiteroles were the MVP, and honestly, we ate them up so fast that I didn't even have time to note the ingredients.

I'll definitely upgrade this review, because I want to sample more of their stellar offerings. I'll just be prepared to talk really loud to be heard!

pics.caption: A lot of self control was exercised while taking this picture! Nutella panino in the foreground with  profiteroles in the background.
The linguine with clams in a marinara sauce, and the potato gnocchi like. YUM! :)

review.des: We came here for dinner. It was a busy night even for a Sunday dinner. It felt crowded since the tables were close to each other, and it was busy. They offered some bread as an appetizer. We didn't get any extra appetizers. We got a couple of entrees to try on. Be mindful that the sizes are tapa style. The lemon shrimp was rubbery. It was overcooked. I didn't think the ravioli was all that, even if it won a James Beard award. First, the presentation was neither appealing nor inviting.
