Second, it had fava beans that I felt shouldn't be in the ravioli. I understand you want some crunch texture component, but the flavor profile didn't fit with the rest of the dish. When I think of a dish that won an award, I would imagine that all components marry well together. The risotto was underdone and lacked salt. It wasn't creamy as it should have been. The best  dish of the night was the beef short rib. The meat was so tender it melts in your mouth!

If you are looking for a place to eat at 230am, do not bother coming here. Although it says it closes at 3am, they won't let you in. The staff will even put a chair to block the revolving door just to show you how closed they are.

My team had a work dinner here recently.  The food was overall very good.  There was so much of it.  Very big portions all served family style.  I think we did the 6 course menu from group dining.  There was a little bit of everything. Here is the long list of items.

Chef's section of cured meats and cheese
Assorted bruschetta
Crisp Calamari
Veal Meatballs Napoli
Caprese salad
Baby Spinach salad
Gnocchi with Arugula Pesto
Taglieatelle alla Bolognese
Shrimp with EVOO, garlic, wine and lemon
Roasted Tuscan sausage with onions and peppers
Farmhouse chicken with lemon & herbs
Chocolate fondue with fruit and biscotti

I really enjoyed a lot of this - the meats and cheese and bruschetta at the beginning were flavorful and fresh. Lots of different flavors.  The taglieatelle was good.  Loved the meat sauce.  Shrimp were huge.  The chocolate fondue at the end was awesome.  All different kinds of fruit with yummy melted chocolate.

We had very good service.  Always refilling drinks and wine glasses.  Food came often.  We had a nice private room upstairs near the bathrooms which is always nice.

Definitely a great family style Italian restaurant.

It's hard to describe how great this restaurant is! The food is delicious with seasonal drinks and entrees you can't find anywhere else in the city. Salads are shareable and the pizza has great crust! My favorite items are the dates, the ricotta cheese, and the fondue! I've been here so many times I can't even count, all due to the incredible staff. I miss Liz so much! All of the ladies in the bar area are so friendly and so respectful though. The bathrooms are always clean and if there is a bathroom attendant, he's super kind and not bothersome. I also love the vintage powder soap in the bathroom I'll continue to come to this restaurant for as long as it's standing!

Went on Yelp to find a restaurant for dinner near our hotel and was delighted that Quartino was 1 block from our hotel. With such a great rating I didn't think we would get in on a busy Saturday night in the city, without a reservation. We were seated within minutes. It was a small 2 seat table against a wall, very close to other tables. The only positive is we were the windows in the front, so we had a view of the street. We ordered the gnocchi and the assortment of olives. The gnocchi was hot and the sauce was delicious.

Consistence is the name of the game. Quartino's will forever have my heart! Each time I am in the area, I make it a point to eat at Quartinos. From the house cured meats, cheap wine and amazing service, this place will always be my favorite restaurant!

Be sure to try the meat and cheese platter. It came with your choice of meats, cheeses and small salads. My friend had the sausage and peppers dish and that was so very tasty!

I think its safe to say that everyone loves this place as you can see all of the awesome reviews!

I came over to meet with a friend, a colleague and another associate to grab a late lunch around 1:30pm mid week so there weren't too many people inside. We decided we should share plates as the portions would be a nice enough size for all four of us to try 4 different dishes.

I went with the awesome rigatoni which in my opinion was the best dish.
My friend chose the most vegan pizza he could find on the menu and it was very good
my colleague/quasi-friend got the shrimp and it was delicious as well.
Our 4th person got the shrimp risotto which was awesome as well!

I see why this place is so popular...awesome food, prime location and good service!

Wow the other reviewers were not kidding about the noise. I'm all for energy and vibrancy, I have no issue with noise, but my friends and I couldn't hear each other.  It's more like being at a rock concert than out to dinner.  Must be the flooring and walls because the place is huge enough that you wouldn't think the noise gets trapped as it does.  The service is slow but friendly. The food was average to slightly above average.  You could do worse, but much better, in Chicago for dinner

My favorite place in all of chicago. It's always a hit w my out of town friends/family. The menu has everything. You can go there time and time again and have different experiences each time. Fun great environment. Every single server or bartender is phenomenal. Every single trip here is amazingly lovely! Please check this pace out!

Someone wrote on the review that its $3 for three veal sliders. Thats not true. Its $3 for each. The veal sliders were ok, mediocre. The meat was soft but veal is supposed to be soft so very little credit. It was pretty bland.
The pizzas are ok. Its thin and bland. The crust isnt that great. There werent enough cheese on it.
The pastas here are pretty good. They arent as salty as other italian restaurants so that was a huge plus for me. I got the braised beef homemade pasta which i recommend.
Everything else was bleh. But then again, im not a easy pleaser so.... ‍

Long standing staple. Been here several times, and it can be hit or miss. But by hit or miss, I mean decent food or excellent food. Service is fast and drinks are good too. Great location. Little pricey when considering all the new more exciting competition in the city.

Yes! This place was fantastic! My friends and I who went decided to share everything and it made for a really wonderful experience. We ordered two liters of wine, a few pizzas, some main dishes, plus dessert and our bill was only $25 each! I was blown away! I've heard countless good things about this place and after experiencing it first hand I'm a full on believer. I'll be back... and soon!

One of the few small plates places I will continuously go back to in Streeterville!

I think the whole small plate concept has become a bit overdone, and can often yield itty-bitty portions for a hefty price tag and mediocre food. Not Quartino! Everything I've had here has been delicious, from their meatballs to their fondue, salads, meats and even accompaniments with the cheese plates!

Some personal favorites: the fondue is a MUST!! It's sooo good!! It's a couple bucks up charge, but it goes great with apples!!

I'm not a veal eater, but I will make an exception for their veal meatballs! The initial intrigue of this dish was that it has raisins and sun-dried tomato....weird, but it worked splendidly to the point where I'll set my ethics aside to eat a few of these bad boys!

White bean and garlic spread is good! It's a simple dish, which sometimes can yield the best dishes.

The short rib is also a must! It's hearty and very well-prepared! I love it!

Even their salads are worth ordering! The Brussels sprouts salad is my absolute favorite! It's super-light, but incredibly flavorful!! Love it!! The kale salad is pretty great, too.

One of their cheese plates at one time came with green grapes with parsley, lemon juice and EVOO. Weird, right? Wrong!! DELICIOUSLY WEIRD! I've replicated it at home, because it was so yummy!

This place take a lot of pride in their attention to detail, variety in food, and more importantly, consistently tasty food!

A bottle of wine at this place is a must! Ask the wait staff if you're not a pro at picking wine; they know their stuff, and can usually make recommendations based on your palate. They also offer full bottles of wine, or a smaller amount (1 liter? 1/2 liter?)

This place can add up with the price of food, and does get quite crowded when all the tables fill up, but the food and great wine makes it a worth while trip!

My friends and I were looking for a nice Italian restaurants that's also affordable so we came here. Our waitress and service were amazing! They were so kind and the food was brought out in a timely manner. The dishes here are meant to be shared with your table but they aren't large portions.

Food: we ordered the fettuccini alfredo (creamy and yummy), the shrimp risotto (amazing with so many flavors), a margarita pizza (perfect crispiness) and bruschetta (kinda messy but still delish).

Ambiance is nice and crowded and busy - classic Chicago.

A great experience and I would definitely come back.

Wow wow wow!!  Can't say enough good things about our experience   We stopped here for a drink on the way to dinner and ended up cancelling our other reservation and eating at the bar here. The bartenders Rob and Trevor were fantastic. Attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. The food was spectacular. The dates and the ricotta were standout apps and the seafood bordetto was really good. We will be back... often!

Pretty good, high energy italian joint in River North.  The food didn't really blow me away, but it didn't disappoint either.

It was rather crowded and loud, so expect that.

As a pizza snob, I found the pie tasty but underwhelming.  They claim Neapolitan style, though the crust/dough is clearly not made in the same fashion that most proper Neapolitan pizza joints do it.  I almost suspect that the crust here is frozen.

Some interesting drink options, I think I may come back in for a drink and an appetizer sometime, but will seek full dinners elsewhere.
Food and service is great! Never a wait for a table. Had the cavatelli pasta and it was very tasteful!

Extremely busy but quick 15 minute wait! Great service! The food is amazing.. small portions so order accordingly. I had the Penne Vodka and it was easily one of the best I've had. Highly recommended!

Been here before.  Liked it.  This time was lousy.  Slow service.  20 min to get first drink (pausing for gasps).  Pappardelle was basically stouffers lasagna.  Margherita pizza was great.  They mixed our order up... well the portion on the pappardelle was such that the couple next to us who had ordered the same but to share was convinced it had been divided into two plates (one mistakenly delivered to us and not them) and we gave it to them.  Long story... small portions.  Overall, underwhelming.  Three stars and not two because there have been non-post worthy experiences in the past.
Quartino has great food, great service and a great environment. Today was My first time here and I will definitely be back!
Amazing food, stumbled upon this place walking around the city. Try the short rib parpadelle and the limoncello desert!

Delicious food, lively atmosphere, super fast & friendly service, all around great experience!

We ordered the Veal Skirt Steak with tomatoes and arugula, wow!  The steak was fork tender, perfectly cooked.  I don't know what they did to those tomatoes but they were the best I have ever eaten, omg, delicious!

Following that we had the Rigatoni with Lamb or Veal Ragu (can't remember) and burrata - the sauce was the best ragu I have ever eaten.

Then on to the Eggplant Parm, which was good.  I won't tell you it was the best I've ever had because it wasn't.  Same with the calamari.  Good, but not original.  I was wishing by this time that I had ordered one of the pizzas instead, they looked beautiful and light and so happy.  Also I was extremely envious of the ceasar salad my neighbors had ordered - it looked great.  

The table bread is wonderful, and the wine selection is generous and nicely portioned to your needs.  Although not being "wowed" by every single dish, I was very happy with what we had - and the stand out dishes certainly made you want to go back and try more from the expansive menu.

I have eaten here twice now a few days apart. First day I had the gnocchi and a minestrone soup. Second time around I had the spaghetti pomodoro. The food is about average. It is very difficult nowadays findings restaurants that truly distinguish themselves among the pack. I would describe quality of food to quantity of restaurants as a bell curve. The vast majority are average with very few falling out side of the pack.

There is nothing wrong with being average, but I would think if you really want to be successful in the restaurant business you must reach the food that consistently
above average. That does not mean you need eat in high priced restaurants, cause the vast majority of those have average food. I have found many great food establishments that are stands or small shops.

So, if you come here you will probably like the food. Don't expect greatness though.

Excellent selection of wine and food. We sat at the bar and the atmosphere was great. I ordered a white wine from Orvieto that went well with the delicious food. You can order half portions so you get to try more variety of food items. Loved the gnocchi, dates and the grilled octopus. Sorry no pictures because the food was so good it went down really fast!!

Quartino is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. Yes. I realize how enormous that statement is. I come here frequently, always bring my out of town visitors here, and literally have never been disappointed.
 The vibe is real. Not pretentious. Not snooty. Just like being at home, which I love!
 Service is always on point. Servers always make great suggestions, they don't pester too much, and they also rave about the food which helps make some great choices when ordering.
 You really cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. It's delicious, flavorful, and comfy like a big bear hug. I don't recommend going out after this meal because you'll be in a severe food coma.
 Some of my favorite appetizers: dates wrapped in pancetta, their cheese platters are amazing, the roasted beet salad, and the burrata.
 Can't go wrong with any of the pastas- penne ala vodka is always a good way to go if you're getting sides. Shrimp risotto and asparagus risotto are also some of my faves.
  Extensive wine list, cozy atmosphere, overall amazing experience. Highly recommend this place!

Quartino is fantastic for a lot of reasons: yummy food, shareable options, ambiance, nice wine list, and good service. It works well for lunch, a romantic dinner ... it is a versatile spot.

I'm partial to the pasta and the pizza, but they have a ton of options.

Only criticism I can offer is that this place is sometimes PACKED. You probably won't snag a seat at the bar on a Friday unless you get there early.

I absolutely adore Quartino. I frequent this place with girlfriends and family alike - it NEVER disappoints!

You must use the cheese that they put on the table with the bread and olive oil/vinegar. That cheese is one of my favorite parts about Quartino, I swear!

Another great thing about this place is that it's really inexpensive. My friends and I always joke that no matter how much food/wine we order, it never exceeds $20 per person. The wine carafes are large and cheap - just how I like my wine. And the food is soooo good. My favorite is the penne alla vodka - super simple but delicious. I'm also a fan of the gnocchi!

All in all, Quartino is great for groups and dates alike. It's also great for showers and small parties!

Probably my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago.
Mixed crowd, authentic Italian food (family style)and upbeat personal.  The place has a classy traditional touch. Moderately priced.

We had an excellent experience. There were some rough patches but the staff was able to make things better. If we had a special request because of an allergy, they made sure we knew they made sure every dish didn't contain it. Our party shrunk last minute and they had no issue giving us a smaller table. We needed a separate check for the wine, and the food divided into different fractions across 3 additional credit cards; no problem. And then kitchen forgot 3 dishes, somas they made them they comped us two
Additional dishes while we waited.

And all the food was fresh and delicious. There wasn't one dish we didn't enjoy. The shared plates was so much fun with our larger Party.

Al in al a wonderful experience.

Great experience! Delicious food! Good service!
We enjoyed the white bean spread, gnocchi, broccoli, margarita pizza, ravioli, and tortellini.
Unfortunately I thought the dessert would be included since I called ahead and told them we were celebrating 4 birthdays with you. The
zippole, Lemon gelato and torte chocolate were delicious!  Unfortunately, the disappointment of the night was getting in our vehicle after using valet and having all the settings changed. After paying for this service the least they could do is put it back how they found it!

Service was good, had better! Food was delicious as well, the tortellini was well made and had a home taste to it. The shrimp risotto was great , even though I wasn't in the mood for seafood. Each plate is good enough for one person if your hungry, or get 2 different plates if you want to share and have variety. Wine was good, they give you options just like Italy based in 1/4,1/2 or a full liter which is pretty cool, and it's open till about 2am which is a plus if you want good Italian food for a reasonable price . Didn't get to try the pizza but I saw the table next to me and by the looks of It they chowed down the whole thing!

Came here for a large group birthday party. I got a bottle of wine with my friend and we split it at the bar while we waited for our table. Once we got to the table, we ordered a few dishes and they were HORRIBLE. I couldn't believe how packed it was based on the quality of our food. I'm putting two stars because of how accommodating they were for our large group.

The service, atmosphere, and hours at Quartino are excellent, and they dish up some pretty solid pizza and pasta as well.

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Historic and lively at more or less all hours of the day, the service and atmosphere at Quartino are arguably the biggest assets. The bartenders are fantastic, and balance classy and casual depending on who they're serving (an understated asset). Even with a diverse menu you should expect to have your food no more than ten minutes or so after ordering. Star Granted.

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

My Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo (recommended to me by the bartender) came in at $12.50, which was exceptional value given the generous portion, and the entire menu was priced accordingly. Good stuff. Star Granted.

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

My dish was a tale of two components. The house made pasta was excellent, with thick pappardelle noodles cooked to perfection in a way that absorbed the sauce and beef around it.

That sauce and beef; however, was a bit weak. That tomato sauce was, for lack of a better word, plain, and the accompanied beef didn't really add all that much to the equation. This wasn't a bad dish, but it didn't blow me away. Single Star Granted.

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Quartino has a great atmosphere, great service, and a great menu. It's worth a visit, but I can't say it's the best italian in town. No Star Granted.

My wife and I ate here while visiting Chicago last week.  I can't say enough good things about it.  It was the perfect start our greatest night there.  

We had Ensalata Caprese, Gnocchi, Salmon, and Chocolate cake for dessert.  I had an inexpensive red, and my wife a white.  Everything was perfectly delicious!  I always say you can judge a restaurant by their gnocchi, and Quartino's did not disappoint, nor did the rest of our order.  We are big on chocolate cake, but picky.  We both loved theirs, even though we couldn't finish it.  We stuffed every last bit we could fit into ourselves, but we were too full by that point and had to surrender.

I prefer to drink wine out of a wine glass, so I was a bit skeptical when they served my wine in a small carafe with a little juice glass.  It turned out to be a great idea because you could only fit a few sips at a time in the glass, so I got a fresh pour every few sips.  Lame tangent, still relevant.

We wore jeans and t-shirts, and sat at the bar, but everyone there treated us like royalty.  The bartenders were all super friendly and accommodating, and even the manager came and greeted us at one point.  Everyone made us feel very welcome there.

Not only were the food and wine delicious, the whole experience was great, and certainly a highlight of our trip.

It was our first time in Chicago, and we plan to return someday.  When we do, we will definitely be stopping back in Quartino.

If you are considering eating here at all--do it. The food is so damn delicious and fairly priced. Food is served family style and comes out as it is ready. Yes, this makes for an untraditional meal in Western culture, but it is so worth it. Everything is piping hot. Their ingredients are quality. Bread is served with the most delicious balsamic vinaigrette and EVOO. It's so worth it. Get the fresh pasta or risotto.

Came here for a valentine's dinner and I was a bit underwhelmed. Everyone I've spoken with has said great things about this restaurant however, my experience left something to be desired. The atmosphere of this place is definitely on the noisier side and felt crammed.

Ordered a bottle of Pinot noir and 5 dishes to share: bruschette, crisp calamari, roasted baby octopus, gnocchi, and tortellini. Everything was just okay. Wasn't blown away by any of the things we ordered, to be honest. For the bruschette, I wish that they would've put all the toppings on each piece of bread instead of having just eggplant on one and mushrooms on another. It made it difficult to get a taste of each one and we ended up having to take turns taking bites. Sadly, the gnocchi was ended up being our least favorite. It was not light and fluffy like you would expect, and it would get stuck to the fork when we took a bite. The texture of it was totally off and tasted bland. Big disappointment (especially because it's a house made pasta). The only dish that we thought was worthy was the tortellini with prosciutto. Our server, Aldo, was great though. He was very personable and friendly. Overall, would give this place a 3.5.
Nice little Italian spot for late night dining. Never been here before 11 pm, but have always enjoyed my food and service.
This is my first time visit Chicago, I read some reviews on yelp, and decided to go to this restaurant. The truffle risotto is excellent ,must try !!

Oh. My. Gosh. After multiple recommendations from locals and regular Chicago visitors alike, I booked a corporate dinner here this past week. A gorgeous building with vintage details, we walked into the private room with a wonderful bar set up and nicely set tables. I was greeted by Manny and his staff who took care of our every need with a smile. And oh the food. Everything was absolutely delicious. We had calamari, polenta fries, white bean dip, caprese salad, romaine salad, tagliatelle bolognese, fettuccini alfredo, beef filets, sautéed shrimp and tiramisu.  My group requested from now on we host our corporate dinners at Quartino's!

I finally made it to Chicago and have wanted to try some good Italian food, so I stopped by Quartino.

Food:
I ordered the Spaghetti Pomodoro and Eggplant Parmigiana.  Both were amazing!

They give you a lot of food and I devoured all of it.

Sides Notes

Ambiance:
This place was packed on a Tuesday night.

Service:
Bartender was super friendly and offered me water while I waited.

Overall:
If you're looking for good Italian food, stop on by!

pics.caption: Spaghetti Pomodoro and Eggplant Parmigiana To Go

review.des:
Beef short ribs: 10/10, absolutely delicious, even without the chimichuri ontop, so soft we didn't need a knife. Melted in our mouth. Absolutely perfect dish. I was tempted to order a second serving.

Calamari with sautéed escarole: delicious escarole wonderfully flavored with onion & garlic, but the calamari were overcooked and chewy.

Calamari: 10/10, perfectly cooked with deliciously fresh and hot marinara sauce; calamari were cut into thick rings that were not overcooked.

Service: courtesy, attentive

Atmosphere: we went at 5pm, so the restaurant was fairly empty

Final verdict: definitely a place I would revisit.

First night on Chicago and we haven't eaten since breakfast in Orange County, CA.  It's 9PM and we be hungry.  So, after we unpacked, we looked at yelp to help us determine what would be the ideal place to eat.  Quartino was close by and had an amazing rating- off we go.  We were greeted by a lovely young lady with a touch of sass.  She could see we were starved and had a little fun saying they were all booked up.  I was rewarded with a twinkle in her eye and an immediate table.  The lighting in the room envelopes you in a warm glow as the patrons loudly rejoice around you.  Looks fun and fabulous.  The gentleman who seats us somehow knows that my wife and I sit next to each other and not across.  Nice.  Our waitress, Amanda, has a little rebel in her, but she knows her menu like the back of her hand.  We decide to trust her suggestions.  She was spot on with every one.  We started with a salad and meatballs for appetizers.  I've never had meatballs as an appetizer, but Amanda was right- awesome.  She suggested a half bottle of a Syrah Pinot blend that was quite tasty.  My lady had the tortellini and I had the short ribs.  Both were divine.  I wanted to try the risotto and Amanda brought the perfect variety to complement our meal.  For desert, I wouldn't even look at the menu- I knew Amanda would bring the best.  Wow.  The lemon ice cream thing was the perfect finish to a terrific meal.  In short, I highly recommend.  Ask for Amanda, you won't be disappointed

Tried this place while taking a getaway to Chicago. Type of place I have wanted to try forever. This is an Italian tapas place.  The idea is great.  We tried a few different items. We tried there pork meatballs. Sauce was excellent meatballs were ok.  We tried a fontina fondue and it was amazing.  We also had a salami and cheese plate and they were both excellent.  I wish I was staying here longer so we can go again because the pastas dishes people had looked amazing.

Nasty. Waste of money. Wish I would have walked out after I ordered nasty palenta fries. Pictures and reviews are way off. Can't believe this place has 4 stars with over 3k reviews. Siena tavern is a much better option.

Wonderful service and the food was fantastic. I felt as though I was IN Italy! I was in Chicago on business and eating alone later than normal. I felt well taken care of and safe. Right across the street from my hotel so also very convenient. Great to find a nice restaurant open later than most.

Great restaurant in the middle of busting downtown...and when seated outside, for whatever reason, it doesn't feel like you're on the corner of a busy intersection.  Pizzas were great- give them a shot.

PS  We have not sat indoors so I cannot comment on that experience.
One of our all times favorite places to eat in Chicago! My favorites are the  cheese and chocolate fondue. The kids love penne vodka

Ate here at the bar,l. Bartender Trevor was delightful and offered helpful menu suggestions, makes a mean martini! Was happy to learn many dished came in half sizes. Had Italian 75 martini, started with their house cured DUCK prosciutto and fontina cheese plate....amazing flavors! Duck procuitto!! Then half sizes of the polpette and parpadelle, the sauce and ricotta on the polpette were perfect, the braised beef ragu with the homemade parpadelle melt in your mouth. Definitely recommend and will be back!

pics.caption: House cured duck procuitto and fontina cheese, both with accompanying spreads

review.des: The food here is really good, however I don't like the fact that the food comes out at different times. I had my dessert before someone in my party received their entree. Also, some dishes do not have sides.

I imagine the people who come here are those that 1) don't care about good ingredients; 2) just want Italian food for dinner and don't care that it was made nothing like Italian should be; 3) typically enjoy food courts in malls.

Love this place! I made a reservation on OpenTable about 5 weeks before and we had an 8:15 pm reservation. It was a Saturday night and pretty packed with a loud, fun, drinking environment, but still a semi cosy (dark) and authentic vibe. We ordered a greek salad (really good), brussel sprouts (nothing special) and 2 pasta's. The fresh pasta with tomato, ricotta, and basil was really good! The Penne Alla Vodka was good, but a little too rich for me. It also wasn't a fresh pasta so not nearly as good as the previous one (to be expected). Next time, I'd order fresh pasta only!

As always, the food was delicious. We ordered the charcuterie board-chefs choice, gnocchi, fried calamari, dated wrapped in pancetta. That was way too much, but we had to try it all. We purée it with a rioja 1/2 bottle and that was tasty!

We had made reservation weeks in advance because I know how packed the restaurant can be and we had planned on going during the May long weekend. Unfortunately, we were given a tiny table upstairs in one of the most awkward corners of the room.  I wasn't very happy with the location of the table but the food made up for all of it.

What a wonderful setting in a beautiful city. Outside of a light rain on our way to the restaurant, the weather was perfect for outdoor seating. The wait would have been pretty extensive had we not decided to sit outside. The service was pretty good and the meal even better. The prices are pretty decent although the portions are small, so it is comparable. This is family style so they bring the food as it is cooked so I got my dish before my husband's dish. He received his pretty soon afterwards so no issue with that.

We had a dinner here with 18 friends and we tried a lot from the menu. Everything was great! All the deserts and appetizers were especially delicious. Among the desserts I liked Torta al Cioccolato the most (chocolate cake with gelato). Salumeria Tasting is a great way to try different appetizers. I'm not a wine lover, but Bianco was good.
Pizza was fine, especially the one with duck.
Waiters were very nice and professional.
The only thing I didn't like here is the fact that we had to wait until the majority of our group came to finally get to our table.
The service here es incredible!  The food was pretty good too.  Nice vibe inside & out but get there early or it's standing room only in the bar.

Great food! Italian tapas is something I haven't had before and this place is highly recommended to try if you haven't had it before either! Gnocchi, penne alla vodka, meatballs, spaghetti...all great choices!

Sooo good! Great for our team work dinner. The spicy clam linguini, tortellini with prosciutto and peas, and the pizzas were just a few of my favorites but really, everything we ordered was really good. The wine selection was excellent and the bar tender and our waiter were both great with exceptional suggestions.

Absolutely love this place. Amazing food and great service. I bring not only my family who is loud and Italian here but my out of town friends. Great food for a reasonable price. Always get the braised pork and anything with truffle here. Very reasonable for price in Chicago.
I had been here 2x before and I had wonderful experiences. I am not sure if they had switch the chef, but the food no longer wonderful. Almost all the dishes I order no longer "wow" me. What happen?

I came with a group of 6 on a Sunday evening around 8 PM.  They told us there was about a 30 to 45 minute wait, but then seated us within 10 minutes! The ambiance is warm and inviting. You just feel like you're hanging out with family in there! The space is really large, but the decor and lighting make it feel cozy. And this might be strange to mention, but the old timey decor in bathroom is cool. The restaurant location is great. Nice for an evening in the theater district. It's just a short walk over the river.

The waiter kept telling us that the servings are small to medium so we had 2 orders of the bruschetta as an appetizer, which is assorted  (a mushroom, a traditional tomato basil, and an eggplant one). We also got 2 caprese salads, which was really tasty. For 6 people, 2 orders of each were a perfect amount.

They have house made pasta! I had the cavatelli and it was so good! It was flavorful, but subtle. The pasta was excellent! I also had the beef short rib and it literally melted in my mouth! Make sure to get it. They bring the dishes out as soon as they finish cooking them in the kitchen so the short rib came out 5 minutes before all the other food (which all happened to be pasta dishes). Also, I shared the two dishes with another person and that's why I had 2 entrees.

Had canoli for dessert. Pretty good. Great place! Worth going!

This is my favorite restaurant in the city by far. My friend and I always come here as our go-to place. Food, drinks and service are amazing. They make you feel welcome and genuinely care about customer service and not just about making money, no matter how busy it is. Would highly recommend this place if you are looking for tasty Italian cuisine. There is not one bad item on their menu. Love you guys!
Excellent restaurant! Amazing food! Great service! Bartenders were fantastic.  Rob, Trevor and Marucio are really good at their craft.  Def recommend!

I wouldn't go to this place if my only two options were Olive Garden and here. It was fine. Nothing to write home about. Luke warm food and nothing special. Having been to Chicago multiple times we were definitely disappointed.

Pro's: no wait, dates were great.

Con's: expensive for nothing special. Small plates. Nothing you couldn't make at home.

This is by far a favorite for me- especially in the warm weather months. Their patio is great!! The menu selection is phenomenal. I love the vast choices for charcuterie and their fondue is downright addicting. The wine menu is probably one of the best I've found in the city. Prices are a little bit on the high side but I can promise you that the quality of the service and food warrants the price tag. I do recommend making a reservation as they fill up quickly but then again, it's always worth the wait!

I made reservations for a Bachlorette party, and made it clear that we were there to celebrate someone, sadly when we arrived we were crammed into a table with other tables on all four sides, making it nearly impossible to get in or out of our table without disturbing strangers around us. The main room was so incredibly loud we struggled to even have conversations at our table, it even resulted in the bride loosing her voice because she had to speak so loudy that the table could hear her.

We are informed that the portions were more family style and that we should order multiples to share, which we did. Our table of four order threes pastas to share and we were very surprised when they brought out the first pasta, as it would be enough for one person. I would recommend each person ordering the pasta dish of their choice, as the serving is not family style in my opinion.

The food was just okay, nothing spectacular.

This restaurant was recommended by the concierge at the Palomar hotel (another five star recommendation).  The fresh bread that greets you when you arrive is amaze.  Basked in the fresh olive oil and vinegar provided only makes it all the better.  I ordered the salmon and my friend ordered to octopus!  We both had soups to start, I had the minestrone and my friend had the minestrone!  Everything was super fresh and amazing!  Service was quick and courteous.  Sitting out on the patio is recommended - a great place to people watch.

Amazing small plates Italian place. Prices were very fair for the neighborhood. Bottles start at around $35. Outdoor patio is gorgeous during the summers. And interior is trendy, but not overly upscale. Pasta was savory, but not too heavy. Risotto was incredible.
Yummy italian! A must try for authentic Italian in Downtown Chicago. Fresh pasta was a hit!!

Food was great with a lot of options especially when they have a lot vegetation options which is generally hard to find at an Italian restaurant. Service was quick and friendly. Would recommend if looking for a nice Italian restaurant.

Busy place- but was seated quickly. Service was fast. Food was decent. Ordered the bruchetta and polenta fries for starters. Pasta for mains- portion was perfect for me but I don't eat that much. Great place to grab a quick dinner before heading out !

Used to one of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood! However after we revisited this place last week on a Saturday late night, we were very much disappointed. Probably because it was a little too late in the night, but that shouldn't be a reason for less tastier food.

We decided on this restaurant because of its patio and great reviews. The menu looked great and we were seated in like 15 minutes. I do have to say I've never seen a more attentive waiter. Every 5 minutes, she would come by asking if we need anything.

So we tried the veal slider, which was good. Then we had the caprese salad, also pretty good, really just tomato and mozzarella slices. Then we got a pizza that was half veggies and the other half with meat. Don't remember the names but both from the $15 dollar selection and waiter recommendations. It was meh, didn't have much of a taste for all the stuff that was on there.

We also had two desserts, the chocolate cake with ice cream and the beignets. Both of them were alright, but again nothing too crazy. With all these other Italian places nearby, I don't know if I'd come back. Maybe the pasta is what the hype is all about?

Delicious in every way. Everything we ordered was executed well, and the atmosphere and bartender were delightful elements that added to the overall experience.

Husband came here a few months back when he was in town for business, and he along with 2 other colleagues came and enjoyed a slew of small plates. He enjoyed it so much that he wanted me to experience it as well on our recent trip to Chicago.

Boy was he ever so right! We ended up ordering calamari, soprano pizza, pappardelle in a braised beef tomato sauce, shrimp with garlic, red chilis, olive oil, and white wine. Each were well-made and had fantastic proportions for the price, but the stars out of the bunch were the calamari and soprano pizza.

The calamari had a light coating and it was crispy and yummylicious. The meat itself was tender and seasoned nicely. I only spotted 2 tentacles, but the other pieces were so well done that it didn't matter. The soprano pizza was divine, and the crust made it. Sure the veal meatballs brought the base flavor profile, but the crust had just the right amount of chew and crispy texture. We had to be so careful not to devour the whole thing in one sitting, otherwise, we would have not been able to eat the rest of the food!

We ended the night with a delicious dessert of zeppoles. They are fried doughnuts, but so airy and fluffy. To accompany each bite are dark chocolate and honey. The combination of the two sauces together is like experiencing nirvana. Absolutely loved every bite, and for $6.25, it was plenty for the two of us.

Each dish that we had ranged in prices from $10-$15, and there was plenty of food to take home. We ordered 4 savory dishes and 1 dessert, and we could have easily just gone with 2 dishes and the dessert. However, the leftovers reheat wonderfully.

With a convenient and central location to Magnificent Mile and River North neighborhood, Quartino is easy to find, and will leave you and your family members happy. For bigger parties, make reservations online or via phone. They have an upstairs area that offers a great view of the city if you're looking for that. I'll definitely be back next time I'm visiting!

pics.caption: House made Pappardelle in braised beef tomato sauce

review.des: This one was done of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Still doing ok. I think they still performing well on Chicago food scene.  Like their pizzas and drinks.  Good place. Little on noisy side, good for groups though.

This was an excellent Italian restaurant. We came here on a Monday afternoon around 1:30, so we decided to split the lunch special for $25. It was a great price for the meal we received! I'm vegetarian, so we started with the cheese fondue (delicious). Then we had the brussel sprouts which was my boyfriend's favorite part. We finished the meal with the pesto gnocchi. The gnocchi was a little heavy on the sauce for him, but I thought it was great. The costumer service was outstanding! We had 2 managers come and check on us while we ate. The group sitting at the next table over was delivered cold soup. They instantly heated up the soup then comped them with something else. Not too sure, but they clearly have great service.

My daughter and I ordered Eggplant Parmigiana, Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo, and Fettuccine Alfredo. Very good food, small plates to share made it fun and interesting. We arrived just before 8pm on Friday Aug 31st, it was perfect timing. We ate in the bar, no wait. Very loud! Ask for parmesan cheese-it's imported from Italy. The eggplant was my favorite but the ribbon pasta (house made) was delicate and unforgettable. Cait, our waitress, was very nice and helpful. Looking forward to our next visit. $45.91 including tip

I came to Quartino on a Friday night for my birthday and I must say their service was excellent! I originally made a reservation and ended up having to wait 15-20 minutes for my table to be ready but they gave my table a bottle of wine on the house so I really appreciated the service! However, the servings were SO SMALL.It is definitely smaller than a normal serving size that I have seen at other Italian restaurants. I wasn't under the impression that it was a tapas restaurant prior to going in but I do not recommend coming here with larger groups if everyone is not comfortable with family style.

The noise level was also incredibly high, which I am guessing was because it was a Friday night in River North but we could barely hear our waiter and we were all basically screaming across the table to have a normal conversation.

Now the most important part: the food. I can't say that it was the best Italian food I have ever had but it definitely isn't the worst! The meat was incredibly tender, which I appreciated and the pasta wasn't too chewy (which I've noticed with a lot of Italian restaurants). I may come back in the future but I don't know if I would ever become a regular!

The atmosphere is great, especially if you are coming with a larger group. The food unfortunately disappointed. Expensive for flavorless Americanized Italian food. We had several pastas and antipasti. In the $50/bottle range, the wine was really disappointing as well.

This was my friend's and my first time and we loved it.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere was inviting. Our server, Dino, was excellent. He was very friendly, and knowledgeable, but not intrusive. He made the whole experience that much better. We look forward to returning next time we're in Chicago.

We had a ridiculous experience here. The meal was good enough, but we had a party of more than 30, at three tables. Rather than separating bills per seat, our waiter combined them by table, without asking how we wanted them. Then after the meal, they gave us the burden of separating the bills. We spent over a half hour trying to do this work for the restaurant. We added each party up and noted the last four of the card number. In the meantime, we could have been on our way, and they could have had three open tables. After we did all that work to figure it out and gave them the cards, they came out and suggested we just divide the total by the number of cards we provided. Really? What a joke! Not very smart, courteous or professional!

Reservation made for 6:30, but we showed up early and were sat 15 min early. Our server was fantastic, so much energy. We even got to meet one of the chefs to take a picture with our future bride!
Took 1 star away only bc the downstairs was PACKED, loud, lively, but tables in such weird places, and when I went to use the bathroom (with classic powder soap!) upstairs, it was practically empty. Kinda weird. Anyway, if I crave Italian food, I'll go back!

"I just want to live here and eat nothing but cheese and pizza." -actual quote from the night.

We were a little daunted by the menu, but our waitress was fantastic and made us feel less-dumb.

Our dinner included:
The assortment of olives: the only thing we didn't care for.
Taleggio that comes with a raisin bread and grape salad: all amazing! Probably my favorite part of the meal was this board.
Fettuccini Alfredo: creamy and delicious!
Gnocchi: an amazing dish, the potatoes and green beans were an unexpected, but fantastic addition to the pesto.

And free bread? This place is a winner (we could tell by the atmosphere just walking in that it was going to be good!)

I'll be back for sure. I want more cheese! I'd love to try the pizza and the house-cured salami!

pics.caption: Grape salad, olive assortment, raisin bread, Taleggio.

review.des: The food, location, atmosphere and overall experience at quartino is great! In addition, the prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend the gnocchi and penne a la vodka. We got the donuts for dessert which in my opinion were just okay. The prosciutto was good. the sausage risotto was good but I wouldn't get it again. This is a great place to go with big groups. The menu has something that everyone will enjoy!!

This place is awesome!  Love the ambiance, menu and drinks.  This is a great place to go with a group or on a date.  The food is fresh (the homemade pasta is amazing) and the flavors are perfect.  This is my go to place that never disappoints!

Great place to go for a work dinner. Order a bunch of plates and shared. We ordered a variety of items and all were good from calamari to risotto, paperdalle and pizza. We also got the donuts and chocolate cake for dessert. Very worth it and would highly recommend.

This place is amazing  Food is delicious and such a great price !
We order many appetizers all of them deliciousness.
Risotto as main dish and small portion but good really good !
frutti  D mare was a big portion and amazingly good

I truly don't understand who all of these people are writing these great reviews...the food is AWFUL. People, if you have any bit of respect for Italian food you will not go here. Trust me on this. All of the pasta dishes taste like nothing except pure salt. Disgusting. And with a group of 10 of us, we were able to try it all. Pizza- bland and basic. Pasta- Cavatelli, Gnochi (worst dish of the night), Vodka Sauce, Eggplant...all way too salty. The mushroom risotto that the waitress said was the "best thing on the menu" was pretty much inedible due to salt content. And we even had to send the fruit back that they gave us with the fondue because it was old ("fresh" apples were brown and SOAKED in lemon juice). All ten of us walked out of there hungry and extremely disappointed.

Before we event went, my friend warned us that this place was nasty. The last time she had been there, she found plastic wrap in her calamari. Instead of management comping the calamari off the bill, they gave her a free shot...wtf? Absolutely bizarre.

We went against her advice as it was my other friend's birthday and she really wanted to go there because she heard "great things" on Yelp.  I use Yelp a lot, and generally trust the high reviews I see. I have only been lead astray by Yelp a few times, and this was sadly one of them. If you want great Italian in the River North area, try Sienna Tavern, RPM Italian, or il Porcellino. Even Eataly!! All so much better than this place.

Great Tapas Italian restaurant but always super loud and crowded . Service is hit or miss sometimes because of huge crowd . Tables are little too close for my choice . They meatballs are really good and so their !

Noise levels during summer are really annoying ( typical river north restaurant problem ) ! Patio is also pretty okay on busy state street ( doesn't have a good vibe to it )

5 starts for the food though !

This place was very good! The reviews said mixed things but we decided to try it out. The food is big enough to share but not big enough to fill you up. You definitely need to bring friends and share. Loved the eggplant parmesan and calamari. Also we had fettuccine and tortellini. Not a quiet pace but has great atmosphere. Really loved our waitress who explained everything to us. Definitely make a reservation because lots of people were waiting around when we got there.

Quite loud and noisy but the food felt quite authentic. The portions are small and are for sharing so expect to order a variety of items. We ordered the octopus, linguine with clam, veal slider, polenta fries and the gnocchi. The gnocchi was definitely the most disappointing with a distinct lack of flavor but everything else hit the mark with flavor.

Make sure to get the duck prosciutto if it's available.

One of my favorite restaurants in all of Chicago!

1st review but I've been here several times. I've taken my Mom here, my girlfriend here, my friends here, you name it. Smallish Italian plates that are great for sharing in a very loud and lively atmosphere. You'll definitely want a reservation for a Friday or Saturday night, although the bar are is first come first serve. They can even accommodate larger groups: I was recently there with 12 + a baby and we got a private room!

I'd say to aim for 1.5 to 2 dishes per person. There's lots of good things to try!
Some personal favorites:
-Gnocchi in pesto sauce
-Tortellini with peas and prosciutto
-Tagliatelle in bolognese sauce
-Pizzas are neapolitan style and really good too

For dessert the chocolate torta and zeppole (Italian delights) are delightful.

You really can't go wrong at Quartino!

Our family of 6 liked this place! It was VERY loud but other than that it was a hit. We liked the community table-sharing, the bread and balsamic/oil/cheese to mix at the table. Our cocktails were so-so, and pretty small. Food was tasty-spaghetti/meatball, gnocchi, caprese, pizza.
Amazing place for big groups. A little loud so better for a rowdier crowd. The food is very tasty and the wine selection and pricing is great. I love taking out of towners here!

So I'm back AGAIN. Seen my fav manager Alysha again and that's always a good start to my visit coming here. She's a highlight to this restaurants forte.

So it's -5 outside today and I'm thinking pasta and coffee. I had an Uber to my condo in 20min.

Our waiter Chris, always expeditious
Tantalizing Prosciutto dates
Unsurpassable paradelli
And that lava cake w/ coffee

Home run for my belly tonight guys !!

pics.caption: Heaven in a bowl; well I'm told they actually call it lava cake. I think my name is better

review.des: Bunch of things I love about this place! I was in a group of 6 and we got seated at a cute round table so we could all talk to each other. The vibe and aesthetic was super cozy. I ordered the fettucine alfredo (which is a classic favorite of mine) and it was really yummy, but wish they gave more food. My favorite part about this place was hands-down the desserts! The chocolate cake with ice cream was a perfect combination, and the donuts just melted in our mouths. Definitely going to try to go here again the next time I'm in Chicago!

Great place and food... we ended up following the reviews about going to the upstairs bar to sit and it worked! We didn't have to wait at all. The downstairs bar was packed. Everything we tried was great.  The gnocchi was our favorite but there were many things we didn't get a chance to try. We will be back to try more!
This place is super tasty! I love their service and I have lots of food allergies; they were more than understanding and accommodating. Highly recommend!

HANDS DOWN THE BEST RESTAURANT ITALIAN I HAVE EVER HAD! I grew up with a Nonna and several Aunts who always made the BEST home made Italian from scratch. This restaurant is the closest I have ever tasted to any of their cooking.

They suggest ordering an assortment of plates to share around the table because the portions are "small", but I honestly thought they were the perfect size if paired with a salad or soup! I went with my parents and we ordered 3 dishes (1 per person) along with 1 soup and 1 salad and it was almost the perfect amount. We had a small amount of left overs to take home which were still just as delicious the next day.

They are open super late which is also really nice, so its a great option for a late evening. The service was also amazing as they provided team service (they each helped with each others tables) and we never went without empty glasses.

Over all this was one of the BEST dining experiences I have ever had in Chicago! Highly suggest!

I love the Italian tapas style.  We ordered and ordered and ordered.  I don't even remember what all we had, all I can recall is that it was a wonderful meal with wonderful service right on the patio to enjoy the exceptional weather and some people watching.

Very convenient to a days shopping on the mag mile.
Excellent, friendly service and delicious food! The restaurant can be quite loud, but we found this to be a great place to bring family to try new dishes.
Everything so good and service is FANTASTIC! Thank you Spencer for being so gracious. You're amazing!

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place during our short stay in River North since we were craving Italian food. We grabbed some seats at the bar so we wouldn't have to wait and the bartender kindly greeted us and got us started on some drinks. We ordered the gnocchi, meatballs, and two drinks. The food itself was very tasty! We love tapas and small plates so if you're into ordering a bunch of small dishes, you should definitely check this place out! There aren't many Italian restaurants serving tapas - I'm so used to having such large portions! Overall the ambiance is pretty nice. The only downfall would be the priciness of everything. I understand that tapas are supposed to be small, so if you're serving small portions the portion-to-price ratio should be more even!
We come here every year on our trip to Chicago. Food city scape and location can't be beat

AMAZING food!! You will definitely need a reservation and the place is very loud and crowded so I would recommend a smaller group. I would plan for at least a 2 hour dinner. The food also comes out as it is ready instead of all being delivered at once. Overall, good experience.

I love this spot!!! I would come here for shared plates. You can eat a dish on your own, but it's so much better when you get a group of 4-6 people and order different pasta, 2 bottles of wine (pretty fairly priced instead of all just $25 and $30 bottles) and having one big, Italian dinner! I especially liked their Margherita pizza. It was so fresh. This place is huge with a nice upstairs. If you can, go during summer for their patio - I always run into people I know here.
Even though it is in a touristy area - still a favorite of the locals.   Consistent good food at a very reasonable price.  We always seem to end up here when we venture into city.
Excellent on all. Only exception was our waiter forgot to tell us about the specials.  I love the Seafood Carbonara.

Walking distance from our hotel - my husband and I decided to stop in Quartino's for a late lunch after dropping off our luggages.

Perhaps I should have done my research and planned my meals better - we only learned that their lunch special offer (3 courses for 2 people $25) was only available Monday - Friday! Nevertheless the price was fair and the dishes were tasty.

Truffle mushroom risotto - creamy, buttery, perfectly cooked. Two cups worth - perfect to be shared for two!

Brodetto - loaded with fish, clams, shrimp, and squid! All of which were beautifully cooked! Paired with two hearty, brick sized toasts. Perfect for soaking up every drop of the aromatic broth!

Lamb ragu rigatoni - a little too al dente for my taste. I prefer home made pastas over imported. Tasted fine but nothing to write home about. I wished I tried the pappardelle or the gnocchi instead!

3 dishes for 2 - along with tax and tip ~$60. Compared to $25 we could have gotten during week day lunch, my wallet def wasn't happy for my lack of planning. Nevertheless, a great starter meal in the city!

One of my favorite Italian places in the city. Dishes are meant to be shared. My all time favorite dish is the penne a la vodka. It is some of the best penne a la vodka that I have had. The Farmhouse Chicken is very good, the veal meatballs are great. I haven't ordered anything that I did not like. Affordable prices. Service is rather quick and it is a nice laid back atmosphere. Note, that tables are all packed together, so it doesn't get very tight when the restaurant is full.
Had an amazing evening! The food was simple and very delicious, reminded me of sitting at a restaurant in Rome :) will definitely come here again!
Good service, good food. Surprisingly full menu for the bar section.

Good food and lively atmosphere.  We shared the spinach salad (large enough for two people) and each of us had a pasta dish - mine was linguini with clams and my friend had fettucini alfredo.  Food arrived hot and fresh, with plenty of bread and olive oil for dipping.  Reasonable prices and just the right amount serving size.

One of my favorite places in the city. Great gluten free options, awesome burrata and the low key ambience is often what takes me to Quartino. I have been here on a date and with small and big groups. The place suits every occasion. Weekends can be tough to get in without a line but they do take reservations.
Love the Linguine w/ Clams.  I would definitely be back.  I enjoy the smaller portions that allow us to order and experience a lot more dishes

Food is consistently good. Prices are pretty amazing for the area and the quality. Definitely get a reservation if you want to come on a weekend. Staff is always super accommodating and friendly. Only turn off is the bathroom attendants they have on busy night. Just completely unnecessary and I hate places that try to squeeze more money out of you. It's tacky. I don't need help washing my hands and I certainly shouldn't have to tip you because you're hoarding the paper towels and I have to get one from you. I understand these people need jobs but perhaps have them do something more useful.
Absolutely amazing meal all around & great service! My husband and I enjoyed Shrimp Risotto, Cavatelli (delicious in-house-made pasta) and Coppa alla Banana (pictured)! Highly recommend!

Pros: HUGE space. If you have a big party, come here and they will seat you for sure AND bring out your food super fast. Our server was even nice enough to split our bill for us because my group was not good at math or something

Cons: the food is just not that good. Sad but true. Had the parpadelle, which was too salty and missing the satisfying meatiness (that's what she said) of the ragu. The steamed clams were a miss too - they were small probably frozen clams. I guess I'm used to juicy Manila clams. Maybe Chicago doesn't do clams?? I do highly recommend the mussels at Publican though...

Conclusion: I've definitely seen better. Will not be back. If you're craving Italian, head to Siena tavern few blocks away instead!

Had a great dinner with coworkers at Quartino. The small plates are just perfect to share with friends or work colleagues. The wine list is also pretty extensive. They have plenty of vegetable and seafood options for the non-meat lovers. The service is prompt and courteous.

Went here for New Years and they were very accommodating to a large party. We shared several items, my favorite being the pork braised ravioli and the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo (braised beef ribbon pasta). I was very happy with my experience here.

I found this restaurant by typing in "cheap drinks Chicago" and saw it on FourSquare as top-15.  I highly recommend this place - and already have to so many! At the bar, we ordered an Aperitvo (a Campari drink - don't need another but for the experience) and got a free gardeniera with toasted bread (because we got there before 5pm on a weeknight). OMG so delicious. My husband got a 16oz German beer. Yum.
We sat at our table and ordered olives, gorgonzola, which came with the same delish bread and a yummy SAUCE. We split a half-order kale salad and a half-order of penne all vodka and we were stuffed! I also drank 1/2 liter Sangiovese. The bill for our meal at the table (not including bar BUT including $18 wine) was just over $42!!!! Half-orders are actually half-price. And the amount was just right. Holy Moly!
The bathrooms WCs are super cute, as the atmosphere is so Italian!
We were too full for dessert, unfortunately, but I guess there's no free dessert for birthdays (my 40th).
We were grateful for the perfect November weather and mile walk back to the theatre to see Hamilton. Best night ever!

Loved this place !

The ambiance is nice .. you can see the sausages hanging around. It gives you a homely kind of effect.

We ordered a few small plates of chicken and seafood. All of them were great. Infact everything about this place is great.

A must place to visit in Chicago !

Quartino offers a great ambiance, a wide selection of food options for all diet preferences and space for small and larger groups. You can't go wrong dining here. Pizzas are great, service is pretty good too. Expect a little wait in busy days but it's worth it.

Food is great, very tasty and well prepared. Service is pretty fast. Small plates to share.
The restaurant is big so a little loud but perfect for group events.

The food here is great, my boyfriend and I have been going for Valentines Day the past 3 years and we always enjoy ourselves. Good wine selection, pricey but no more than any other restaurant. Food is family style small plates so it's fun to try a lot of different things. We have had some issues with service there almost every time we come they have forgotten an item of food however we were given the food item late once and the manager removed it from our bill as well as gave us free dessert. Oh and The fried donuts are to die for!!!
Last note, although we do go there for Valentine's Day it's not the best romantic spot, loud and more of a family atmosphere and always crazy crazy busy with many tables very close together.

Quality food for an amazing price. Was seated promptly at arrival, the restaurant was very busy. Ordered a bottle of wine and was served immediately. Server gave a variety of recommendations for a variety of tastes. Yet the 'meat and cheese' tray that we ordered lacked in a variety of meats and cheeses, but the the food was amazing. Very pleased with service, food, and by far overall price; will be back.

Great food and the service is always quick. The small plates is great because you can try a bunch of stuff. We got pepperoni pizza, linguini alfredo, shrimp risotto, veal meatballs and Brussels sprouts. All sooo good. The espresso martini was amazing too.

It is kind of loud inside so go if you are looking for a more rambunctious atmosphere.

Quartino is located in River North and a great option for a fun night out on the town. I would recommend this for a spot to check out with family or friends if you are in the mood for small plates. I had the burrata beet salad and tomato basil soup. It was amazing! The food was delicious but the service a little slow!

Been to this place twice, and PROBABLY will never be back again.
Why 3 stars?
First time I went with my date, we ordered 2 pasta dishes, the tables are so small and the space is so tight, and when you are walking in and out of the restaurant it felt like you either need to lose 15 pounds or suck in your stomach 5 times to get through. We waited for a long time for the pastas to arrive, my pasta was way too watery and they got my dates' pasta sauce wrong (he wanted white sauce and got red instead). The price isnt bad for a river north restaurant but my first time experience was not very pleasant.
Second time we came for a friend's birthday since one of my friends was working there at the time we got special discount for the amount of food we ordered the price was great, and service was obviously great since my friend was dining with us there. I enjoyed their calamari a lot but some of the pasta dishes did not really stand out.
Probably wont come back now that she no longer works there... however, if you are looking for a reasonably priced Italian restaurant in river north, definitely give it a try.

First impressions: Very loud and packed with people. We made reservations and got seated at our reserved time. Pastas were great and the steffano pizza was amazing. We got two deserts almost exactly the same a lot of gelato very little everything else. Our server was on it but hard to understand and hear. I recommend the pizzas all of them looks good and smelled good when they passed our table.

Ravioli 3/5 delicious crispy bacon on top but the Ravioli itself is kind of blend
Supersamic 5/5 delicious!! Not too sour..just the way I like it
Zeppole 3/5 it's the dark chocolate that does the trick...the dough was just...dough.. I would recommend to people who have never tried it but I wouldn't order it again
Waitress 5/5 very friendly and sincere and patient...wish I got her name~
Would definitely come back to try their other items on the menu

I've been coming here for almost ten years, and I can say the food is consistently amazing. I highly recommend the truffle risotto, polenta fries, and veal sliders. They are known for their excellent wine. The only downside is that the restaurant can get crowded and noisy, and it can sometimes be difficult to hear your dinner companions.

I can't say enough great things about this place. The hostess was a doll, the manager, Ian, was attentive, our server, Miguel, was phenomenal, the ambiance is perfect (not too formal, not too casual), and the food is outstanding. I'm very grateful when I go out to eat and get good food and service, and Quartino's staff delivered. Coming here for our anniversary was a great decision, and I can't wait to go back. Thank you, Quartino!

This came very highly recommended by a local resident. While I wasn't completely over the moon by anything we had, it was fairly solid Italian. They like to focus on small plates to share, which is actually my favorite way to eat.

We shared some charcuterie, cheese and some various spreads that were all pretty good. We also had a risotto dish that was just OK. The consistency was a little bit runny, which is not how I like my risotto. We also had a tagliatelle with the heavy meat sauce that was decent. This is one of their house made pasta dishes and the consistency of the pasta was pretty good.

They have a pretty extensive wine list offering primarily Italian wines, but some California wines thrown in for good measure.

We sat on the patio outside which was really lovely and had excellent service. The price point is very good, and I think it's a great value for the money. While  everything was pleasant I can honestly say I don't know if I would come back. They are just too many other Italian restaurants that really wow you in the city.
I love this place. Try the fondue and be sure to add apples. So far we've tried the ravioli, the fettuccine, and several pizzas. They were all great! Try this place out
As always they don't disappoint with great food and most affordable liquor option the city. I'm a big fan of the salmon dish and soup option. For sure one of my favs and will always come back.

I genuinely hate giving restaurants terrible reviews, but the food here was just awful, mediocre at best. My boyfriend and I flew in from NYC for the Chicago Marathon and were looking for some delicious pre-race pasta. Instead, we found cold, bland, and undercooked pasta served with a side of poor service.

We checked in for our reservation right on time and were told to wait for just a moment.  I noticed several tables being seated immediately upon checking in, so I asked the hostess for an update.  She simply told us that she already called us several times and that we missed our table. Given that we were standing literally in front of the check in the entire time, I don't see how this was possible. Not a big deal, but an apology instead of some made-up excuse would have been nice.

As for the food, we ordered the arugula salad (pretty good, but can't say I've ever seen anyone botch a salad), minestrone soup (bland and lukewarm), tagliatelle bolognese (cold, clumpy, cardboardy), and truffle porcini risotto (flavorful, but cold). Both pasta and risotto dishes were entirely undercooked to the point where they still tasted grainy and almost crunchy.  

On the bright side, our waitress was really sweet and got us in and out of there in under 45 minutes.  Super disappointed in such a well-reviewed place, to say the least.

One of the fewer places that have late night kitchen hours in the vicinity we were in for the night....the food was amazing, the service was sub-par. Luckily the Manager, Derek, was attentive, understanding and very generous with his time to listen to our service concerns and took care of us.

Wow. This place is delicious.

Maybe it's because I came starving, but everything I had was on point!!

We started off with bread & olive oil. We asked for some parmesan cheese and we got this cool little twist and grate contraption, take a look...(agriform.it/en/prodotti/…)

For dinner I ate:

-Polenta Fries - Red Bell Pepper Salsa
-Tuscan Sausage Risotto - Tomatoes & Fresh Peas
-Shrimp Risotto - Zucchini & Sun-Dried Tomatoes (which I had on accident, it was someone elses haha)
-Porcini & Truffle Risotto - Porcini Mushroom & White Truffles

The polenta fries were good, just a little bit heavy. One polenta fry would have been enough, but come on, I had to eat at least three. I couldn't make up my mind between the sausage and truffle risotto, so Jay (our waiter) suggested I do half and half. So I did! My favorite was definitely the Porcini & Truffle Risotto. The creaminess and truffleness was amazing. Is truffleness a word? Well it should be.

Our server did a great job accommodating 13 of us. There was a little mishap at the end, but Jay took care of it right away. Service was prompt, atmosphere was that of a classy Italian joint, and it wasn't a hassle to get in. I would definitely recommend this place.

PS. Anyone know where I can get the Twist & Grate Grana Padano?

Always amazing when I go.

The pizzas, pasta, and beef short rib are a must. All the pizzas and pastas are amazing. The service is average but it's an amazing spot for groups, families, etc. Open late night too which is awesome.

Italian tapas. Brilliant!! In chi town for a wedding that was awesome. Ate here twice it was so good. Service was attentive and quick. Food portions were exactly right, wonderful flavors and variety.  Angus beef carpaccio is incredible. If you miss this place you loose.

Very good restaurant . We sat outside , which was very nice . Our server was wonderful , explained to us about the menu and was very attentive throughout the meal.
We ordered the pasta with pesto and fettochini alfredo, and for dessert we had the Tirramusi that was amazing ! The entrees were both delicious .
Overall very nice experience . We would definitely go back there.
We had dinner here with friends & had a wonderful time.  Loved that dishes are shareable every bite we ate was wonderful.  Be sure to make a reservation!

Go!
And get a table outside! Homemade pasta, creamy burrata, great wine selection, what more can a girl ask for?! This is the type of restaurant where it's okay to leisurely nibble on food while sharing a few bottles of wine (we were there for 3 hours!)
Book reservations in advance since it gets busy!

We were so excited, such a cute little italian restaraunt with outdoor seating, well take some advice, skip it, terrible food, terrible service.  Ramon was server, horrible and not nice.  Only ate about 1/4 of our meal and he never asked how anything was.  Wish I could rate 0

If you like sharing food then you'll love this place. However, if you are like me and sharing food tapas style stresses you out then you are in for a hard time. Overall, the actual was was pretty good. The octopus was bomb, but the pizza was meh. Also, they serve the wine in pitchers and give you a small non wine glass to use. I have big hands and it made me feel like a giant.

When it comes to ambiance the place has a cool vibe, that might be good for a first date. Our table was way to small for 4 people and people kept bumping into the back of my chair.

It was good. Tasty and pleasant but nothing out of this world. The vodka pasta sauce is not the best I've had. While the caprece salad did taste yummy and fresh. The pizza was okay as well. I liked the cheeses they use.

Been here a couple of times with friends.  Always a good time.
RSVP because is always busy, event with RSVP there is a wait. The place is huge and really loud not intimate.
The food is good, nothing out of this world.
The service is always good.
The wine is cheap!

One of my favorite restaurants in the city! Really fun for a group for sharing tapas style. I don't think I have ever not liked something I ordered on the menu. Great atmosphere and I love the bacon wrapped dates and spinach salad!
Delicious food, great service, warm but lively atmosphere. Can't go wrong at Quartino, perfect for sharing with a big group!
Truly an amazing meal! Everything was such good, fresh quality and the service was great. We even received a Margarita pizza because they had an extra one. Super awesome! Definitely will return.

A great place to stop for a quick bite afternoon a long morning. Delicious drinks, great pizza, and top notch bar service. Easy to get to and not as crowded as the "famous" pizza joints. And so much better.

pics.caption: The quattro spagioni was amazing. They even added arugula!

review.des: One of my favorite Italian places in the city. Great homey and cozy vibe, friendly and helpful wait staff, never have a problem getting a reservation and when I have had to wait it isn't long or they seat you at the bar which I great for two people! Amazing homey classic Italian food and great for sharing and tasting a bunch of different things with a group. Always a good go to!

I have struck it rich again! I love it that the portions are not huge because we are in a hotel
And cannot heat leftovers. We adored the food here in Chicago. This was one of the best experiences yet!  Homemade pasta, pork shanks, pure  deliciousness. . Chicago, I'll be back to eat!!!!!

My friends and I had come from out of town to celebrate some birthdays and we chose Quartino to celebrate.  It was a disappointment.  Firstly, the restaurant was both incredibly crowded and incredibly LOUD.  As someone with mobility issues, it was difficult to navigate through the room or to be comfortable on the hard wooden seats.  We were also seated in the middle of the room, right next to the bread cutter, so our shouted conversations were interrupted every few minutes by the even louder rumble of the machine and everyone walking by managed to bump into me, including the waitstaff.  

The food was also nothing to write home about.  It's a tapas style restaurant and, between the six of us, we got to sample a lot of the menu.  Nothing was awful but nothing was really great, either.  Don't think I'll be going here again; Chicago is a city full of great restaurants.  Too many to waste my time on the mediocre.

GREAT PLACE TO BRING GROUPS! I brought my group of 15 girls here for a dinner back in December. I made reservations ahead of time. We explained to the waiter that we would be splitting the bill evenly, and he was so helpful. This restaurant may be the best service I have received in the city. The waiter was so funny and kind and gave us all of the restaurant's best dishes. The pastas were to die for, but my absolute favorite was the brussel sprouts. The desserts were all incredible as well. If you want a good Italian meal in River North, especially with a large group, I would recommend this place.

The food is really rather good here, but seating is somewhat uncomfortable for a leisurely meal time, and the restaurant is just WAY, WAY, WAY TOO LOUD. It is so loud that I doubt I will ever return for dinner. The pastas are expertly prepared, and the copious bread is surprisingly good.

Quartino is a lively neighborhood restaurant, serving Italian Tapas style. On a Thursday night, this place was packed. Every table was occupied. I really liked their outdoor dining area located at main entrance. It gave you that "Parisian" style atmosphere.

There is also a 2nd floor where there is a private area for large groups. It is especially nice if you are dining with more than 30 guests.  I would definitely recommend ordering their Braised Pork Shank. It was so good and the meat fell off the bone. Their bar drinks here were also fantastic, smooth and strong!!

If you happen to be in this neighborhood, come by and enjoy the local vibe. If you are dining for two, I'd recommend seating outdoor where you can enjoy your dinner, and feel like one of the locals!!

Until then, Cheers! ~ :p

My girlfriend & I went to Quartino's last night for dinner! It was so great! The food was delicious- especially the risotto & we loved the roasted brussel sprouts! And our server, Paul, was the best! He was helpful, knowledgeable, and totally quirky, funny & I want to compliment him on his extremely inclusive language. I'm a trans person and he never once misgendered me or assumed anything. I want to go back! Thanks Paul and Quartino's for making my first meal in Chicago really special!

It seems like a touristy place but the food is actually really good.  My favorite is the linguine clams with white wine sauce.  Always good always the same taste.  Portions are nice and big.  Service is better than average.  And it's a fairly large place so good for large parties and families.  Definitely one of my faves in the downtown Chicago area.
Quartino has really good food. It's one of the better Italian restaurants in Chicago. Everyone should eat here at least once.

I enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant, and the service was prompt. There was so much on the menu, it was hard to choose! The bread was great, and they kept it coming! The caprese salad was good, but it was hard to share with 4 people, as there was not enough cheese compared to tomatoes. The tortellini with prosciutto was bland, honestly. We also had the shrimp risotto and quattro pizza, both which were good. The shining part of dinner was the dessert. We had both the donuts with honey and chocolate dipping sauce, and the lemon gelato sandwich. The lemon gelato was tart and refreshing, and the donuts were light and airy. Overall, for the price it was good, but this would not be my first choice of Italian restaurants.
