SO GREAT! Awesome spot for small plates and sharing with a group. My favorites were the salami salad, eggplant parm, pork shank, veal meatballs, and short ribs. Everything was great. Will definitely be coming back!!!

Ok let me tell you the truth. I was expecting to try the pizza since forever. Always pass by and there are a lot of people there and you think: busy restaurant means wonderful food, right? Well, according to my experience and 4 of my friends had the same feeling. Food: 4. Waiters 5. Pizza 3 :( not too much flavor and I was expecting more. Some people might think that because I tried a lot of pizzaria around the city and I became picky, but I know what I'm talking about because food is very important to me!

You can never go wrong with this place. Great for groups, takes reservations and everything on the menu is delicious. Something for everyone, and pricing is super reasonable!

I love their pizzas so great, fresh out of the oven to your table. Everything comes as it is prepared.  I love the cavatellis with fresh burrata. Simply incredible. The regular meatballs with red sauce are a must along with the sausage sooo much flavor!

For desserts you cannot leave without ordering the Nutella panini, mind blown, I could eat the whole order myself (and it is decent sized). Zeppolini and the profiteroles are another recommendation.  The fondue is good and I personally like dipping the other desserts in the fondue. Mmmm

This is a fun casual atmosphere, kind of loud, but a good time none the less and always someplace I stop when I am in town.

My girlfriend and I discovered this place once on a staycation of sorts at a Mag Mile hotel. We were not disappointed. We loveeee the fondue. We come here for that and the pizza and risotto. We've returned a few other times as a result.

Sadly, we moved nearby over a year ago and always thought that we'd never get in as the place always seemed packed.  We did try once and turned around.  Not to be completely deterred, we recently decided to try once again with a reservation.  Brilliant idea, I know.

Anyway, we ended up grabbing a seat at the upstairs bar on the way to our table where we were greeted by Chris who was tending bar.  Not being up on our Italian cuisine, we asked Chris to help get us started with some meats and cheeses.  He did a wonderful job of helping us decide what we'd like to try as he served up some very tasty red wine Sangria.  In the end, he delivered a wonderful plate that we really enjoyed.  The duck prosciutto was to die for.  Everything on the plate hit a spot for us.  The Gorgonzola Dolce, the Asiago Vecchio was soooo good!

We ended up wanting to try one of everything, but settled on a fennel sausage pizza.  It was delicious!  Still wanting to keep going, we ordered the Tortellini and the Rigatoni.  The Tortellini was covered in a great Alfredo sauce with peas and sat on a bed of Prosciutto.  I'm pretty sure that we would have licked the plate dry if the room was empty.  Our Rigatoni (with lamb) was equally delicious.  

What really stuck a chord with us was when a manager (Michael) made his was over to say hello and ask how everything tasted.  Classy move.  We then noticed that they have a few managers who are constantly checking in with customers.  Then another gentleman walked over and introduced himself to us and to see how we liked everything.  Turns out it was Executive Chef John Coletta.  Who does that?  Clearly, it's people who are passionate about what they do day in and day out.  

Do yourself a favor and make it a point to visit them.

Not sure what the big buzz about this place is but we came with a big party last night. Super crowded. They accommodated is well upstairs, refilled our bread and water when asked. Food was just average I've had better Italian food elsewhere. Ordered pizza the sauce was blah. Fettuccine Alfredo was not appetizing. Chicken soup was tasty. Our party left I satisfied and the bill was big.

Quartino is a pretty tight spot for Italian food. My boyfriend and I were looking for a good place to grab a bit to eat and Yelp suggested this place. With all the good reviews, we decided to make a reservation on OpenTable. I'm glad we did, it was slammed when we got there! We made a reservation for 8:00pm and arrived on time. We had to wait about 5 to 10 minutes for our table to get ready, but that's not bad compared to the 1.5 hour wait they had going on.

To start, my boyfriend and I ordered some red wine. I can't remember what we got, but it was pretty good. For our appetizer, we got the white bean paste/hummus with bread. The paste was very fresh and you can taste the white bean, but it was just so thick. It was almost impossible to remove from the baking sheet they had underneath. They also don't give you enough bread with it, so I ended up dipping my pizza crust in the white bean paste.

We ordered pizza as the main course. Being from New Jersey, we ordered the Soprano. It has Veal Meatballs, Giardiniera (pickled vegetables), Basil, & Red Chilis. The veal meatballs are perfection! They are so delicious and I wish I could just eat bowls and bowls of it. The pickled veggies took some getting used to. After the first slice, I kind of liked them, plus they added some zing to the veal meatballs, which I really liked. The size of the pizza is perfect for two. My boyfriend and I each had 4 slices and we weren't too full.

Overall, had a very nice dinner at Quartino. If I'm ever back in Chicago, I don't know if I'll come here again. I may want to try other restaurants around the area first before coming back to this place. The veal meatballs deserve a 5 star though, get them if you can!

pics.caption: White bean and garlic oil spread.

review.des: Came here on date night with the bf while we were both on vacation and under the weather. I was hesitant to eat pasta since I was afraid it would be heavy and filling. Boy was I wrong. The pasta hit the freakin spot! Our waitress was so nice and mentioned that my dish, the pappardelle was featured on Food Network. Such a great rec! My bf got the linguine with clams which was great as well. Would definitely come back if we ever visit again. Prices are reasonable and I would recommend booking a reservation (which worked out great for us). Oh and the pomegranate sorbetto was the perfect treat to end our meal :)

My friend made reservations here for four at 7pm. We were seated right away and got a corner booth. It was nice at first because we were secluded in our own privacy, but then we were at a loss to flag any waiter's attention when paying. We were in a rush to see the fireworks at Navy Pier, but failed to get our check and pay in a timely manner, so missed out on that.

Now back to the important matter of food, we ordered the Salumeria Tasting ($25), which came with two salumi , two formaggi, three spuntini (sicilian caponata: eggplant salad, olives and capers / roasted peppers: hand charred, capers, garlic and evoo / artichokes campobasso: baby artichokes, onions, carrots and evoo), and an assortment of olives (black, green and red ones). I couldn't really remember the other types of salumi and formaggi that we chose, but overall it wasn't memorable. To pair our cheese and meat platter, of course we added a liter of wine. We originally asked for a bottle of Rosso, but the waiter insisted we get one liter for the four of us ($20).

For starters, we also ordered the dates wrapped in pancetta ($7) and poleta fries ($8.50). I would say that these two were the best dishes. Both were flavorful and tasty, except you're not given much and it's gone within minutes. We also added the Brodetto Ai Frutti Di Mare seafood dish ($16.50), which came with shrimp, clams, calamari, octopus and whitefish simmered in aqua pazza with san marzano tomatoes. It came topped with two garlic toasts, which was good dipped in the sauce. It could've use more flavor as it was a bit watered down.

This place just isn't something I'm in favor of. In addition, everything totaled up pretty pricey. There's definitely a nice Italian feel to the restaurant, but the service and food did not please me.
It's just convenient - my bestie and I use to grab a few appetizers here and there.  I wouldn't recommend it as a go to but it's certainly a safe option.

I want to start by saying that the pizza (that finally got to my table after waiting for 45 minutes) was fine.

What wasn't fine was the service. I sat by myself outside and was ignored rather serviced. The kitchen apparaently made a mistake on my order and I was not told nor assured that my food would be coming out soon.

Note to manager: there's an amazing opportunity to train your wait staff to be attentive and compensate customers who are on the receiving side of a kitchen mishap.

All good....training needed!

Standard Italian fare. We came in on a Saturday night and it was hoppin' and deafeningly loud, but I'm used to that.

We got a pizza to share and each ordered a pasta dish. Our hours-long drinking fest needed carbs. The pizza was the best thing we got - it was the quattro stagioni pizza with artichokes, zucchini, mushrooms, and roasted peppers. Excellent, with a nicely-flavoured crust and good quality/balance of toppings. I would have liked it a little more well-done but that's my only quibble.

My lady-date got the cavatelli, which I found to be a bit tough and the sauce was a bit sweet and one-note for my taste. I had the pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo, which was a braised beef tomato sauce. It was similarly sweet and needed some fresh herbs or something to brighten it up, but it was OK and the pasta was well-cooked.

The best things about this place: 1/2 liters of wine, and grana padano in a crank-bottle on your table. I got the Sangiovese and it paired well with the meal.

After 4th of July fireworks we came in here for a late night bite.

This place is a tapas place. But they do Italian style tapas. I've never been to an Italian tapas place, but I was excited.

We got the following:
Olives
Prosciutto plate
Veal meatballs
Bruschetta
Cavatelli Pasta dish.
Sangria.

The bruschetta had three different types. 1 mushroom. 1 juicy tomatoes. And one eggplant. All three were great, but the mushroom one was my favorite. Overall the meatballs might have been my fav dish. The ricotta in the meatballs and cavatelli was amazing.

The sangria was eh.. and I didn't really like the Cavatelli.

The ambiance in the restaurant is great. They have the bar side and the dining room side. We opted for the dining room, which was empty when we arrived, but packed by the time we left. It's dimly lit, and has a nice romantic feel.

The service was good - our server had a lot of energy, even on a late holiday night. She was great. The gentleman that brought over our plates was a little rude. I didn't recognize the pasta when he brought it and I asked him what that was? He was obviously bothered. Eh.

Overall it was a good experience.

Went here on a busy Saturday night & had a great time! Servers are very attentive for how busy the place is and were constantly refilling the water carafe, taking away dirty plates, etc. Left super stuffed and satisfied!
Appetizers:
-Pancetta wrapped dates were ok (5/10). I've had better, but I'm also not a huge fan of honey so that was probably part of it.
-White bean spread: didn't have any, but those who did really enjoyed it! Probably the better of the two apps.
Entrees:
-Tortellini with peas was fantastic (9/10)! Definitely our table's favorite entree of the night. The prosciutto and peas were the perfect complements to the dish.
-Gnocchi with pesto was good (6.5/10). Much lighter than we anticipated, & the green beans were good.
-Rigatoni with lamb sugo was alright (5.5/10). Came out lukewarm; nothing was wrong with the dish per se, just wasn't noteworthy and probably wouldn't order it again.
-Quattro formaggi pizza was an 8/10 according to those who had it. Didn't have room for it but will have to try some pizza next time!
Desserts:
-Tiramisu was delish (8/10). It's not on the dessert menu itself but I highly recommend ordering it!
-Torta / hot chocolate cake was AMAZING (10/10). Seriously, our table could not get enough! It was huge and perfect for sharing--for as long as it lasts.
-Zeppole were ehhh (3.5/10). They weren't bad, just not something I'd order again when there are other good desserts available.
Will definitely come back--yes it's loud, but I personally loved the lively vibe of the place, and the food was pretty good. Must orders are the tortellini and hot chocolate cake!

You can never go wrong at Quartino. The food is delicious and the service is great!! I took one of my girlfriends here for her birthday dinner and we had a great time. The atmosphere is chill and laid back. Definitely worth a visit. Also, their tiramisu is AMAZING!
Very popular Italian restaurant in Chicago. The food is kind of bland. But I do enjoy the tapas selections. I also really enjoy the limoncello.

The big menu of small plates have always proven delicious! The sautéed spinach, the chicken soup (so good, I even order it in the summer!), the scallops (to die for! If they're not perfect, the chef won't put them on the menu), the gnocchi, pizzas, you can't find a bad option! The place is HUGE but it's still better to make a reservation unless you're there for lunch or just plain lucky! The food runners mean your options come out quickly and there's always more to come! Delicious!

Place was crowded, service was good, very noisy as close tables. Many large parties. One of our dishes got lost in the shuffle of orders in the kitchen but we were in no rush. Food was ok not outstanding, but the tiramisu was the best. We had a nice time anyway.

Sharing is caring, guys--especially when it comes to food. Come to Quartino for shared plate-style Italian! It's a giant restaurant with great finishes and details in every corner.

They offer all authentic Italian beverages, which is a lot of fun--Benedetto sparkling water, Peroni, Aperol, etc.

The menu features tons of charcuterie cured in house, and plenty of cheese to go with them. The goat's milk ricotta is really tasty. I love the
burrata with beets two ways (paper thin raw and roasted cubed) with arugula and celery leaves.

Don't forget the pizza...I'd suggest the margherita, which has beautiful big basil leaves--one for each piece--no skimping.

Great for a crowd, since there's so much space, but it's so noisy it's hard to carry on a conversation with the person next to you, much less across a table.

Rated #1 Italian restaurant in the country. Not even close. Fun atmosphere, liked small plates, but very mediocre food. Fried polenta was very plain, veal  meatballs had little flavor, and pasta was nothing special. Very overrated.

Incredible Italian food. The pasta is so dense and the sauce is so creamy and wonderful.  I had the fettuccini Alfredo and I wish I could bathe in it. The lunch portion was a little small, but they give you a side of bread. Highly recommend. Great quality.

This place is about as overrated as it gets. The food was not cooked well, our pasta needed 3-4 more in the water. To top it off the flavor was very bland.

Their old fashions are $16.50 and not worth $8... I've gone to plenty of steakhouses in Chicago with much better and cheaper old fashions (Boka, RPM, Bavette's)

Honestly the best part of the meal was our server who was awesome, but the food lacked flavor or identity and was overpriced to top it off. Do not waste your time

Quartino's was one of the first restaurants in Chicago that I tried upon moving here and honestly, I was really impressed. At first, the idea of Italian tapas threw me off (I'm more of an order your own meal type of girl). However, after talking with the waiter, he assured me that while it was meant to be shared, one of the entrees or pastas was enough for one person. Their wine selection is very good, and the pasta was really yummy - their vodka sauce is out of this world.

However, what really won me over is the restaurant itself. The decor is so authentic and while the space is crowded, it's lively and fun. The bar area on the main floor is very cool and I highly recommend grabbing a drink there before dinner. Also, I've hosted a private event upstairs for about 40 people, using one of Quartino's pre-selected menus you can choose from and it was a BREEZE. Very reasonably priced for that many people, including open bar. I would recommend this spot both just for a regular dinner but especially for a large group (just be sure to call ahead and reserve the spot and set the menu - it's so worth it!)

This place is YUM!!!

Generic complimentary bread which I did not care for but everything else was five stars!! Here is what we ordered:

Burrata beet salad - I'm a huge fan of beets. Therefore anything with beets is my JAM. The burrata was so fresh on this plate as well!

Shrimp risotto - very tasty and flavorful.

Tortellini in Alfredo with peas and prosciutto - Good amount of prosciutto to provide the right amount of saltiness for the dish. My husband was a major fan!!

A+ service.

The food was amazing!  Our service was even more amazing!  Trevor was our server and he was absolutely awesome!  He was very attentive, he had great recommendations and was very involved in our experience.  Everything he recommended, we ordered...  and we LOVED!!  Thanks Trevor for such a great experience.  We'll be back!!
Really nice spot! Took my lady here for Valentine's Day and she really loved it. She said no to my proposal but yes to the impressive dessert spread. I would highly recommend this place.
Most of the food is either too salty or tasteless. Waiters are very nice and effective. Soups are amazing. The fun part is that is soap in the restroom is in the form of detergent. Too touristy

OMG, order as many cicchettis, formaggis, salumis, spontinis as your budget allows - you can only go awesome here. The tapa style dishes are very good tasting and absolutely worth the try. For the more familiar ones: carpaccio, prosciutto, cotton, mortadella, fontina Val d'Aosta, pecirinos, artichokes, ... and then a pizza, veal, clams, beef filets. We're about to embark on the dolce: zeppole, profiteroles, ...
Service is very friendly and attentive. Seating is two floors with the 2nd floor for dining and first floor more of a tapas bar ambience. On the 2nd floor is an outside seating area on a first come first serve basis. Otherwise you can get reservations.

Double check your leftover box before leaving the restaurant!

We've been here more than a few times and every time enjoyed our dining experience. Food is delicious and service is great.

This is the first time that we brought home someone else's leftovers. Extremely disappointing considering that we had most of the pizza left.. No clue how our food got mixed up with another table's. To whoever that has our pizza.. hope you enjoy it.

To Quartino: maybe it might be easier to give customers a box instead of giving them someone else's leftover meatballs and bread.

Great atmosphere, service and food. The shrimp risotto is amazing and I haven't had a wine I haven't enjoyed yet. This place was a treat that my husband and I happened to stumbled upon. We definitely recommend it and will return for our next Chicago visit!

The first thing I noticed when we walked into Quartino was all of the Serie A soccer jerseys that the staff were wearing. My excitement was tempered quite a bit, though, when we sat down at the bar and the staff we encountered admitted to not really knowing too much about Italian soccer...or soccer at all. The soccer fan/player in me was fine with that, I guess, but my bigger disappointment was with the food.

The prosciutto-wrapped dates were decent, but didn't really hit the spot, and the margherita pizza we ordered had a crust that I wouldn't typically associate with Neapolitan pizza. It was overcooked and dry. We ended up only eating a few pieces and taking it to go and giving it to homeless person. It was definitely very disappointing. The plus sides of our visit were the nice staff and good wine list, but in a city with so many great restaurants - let alone Italian options - I don't see any need to return to Quartino. The interior is very dated, and the entire vibe and staff attitude is of a place that's real draw is the prime location in a tourist-heavy area, as opposed to the actual food. Based on other reviews, I'm thinking we should've ordered some pasta, but when the first parts of our meal fell flat, we didn't feel the need to stick around for more.

Quartino has become our favorite for upscale, though relatively informal, Italian on the Near North Side.  This trip, we tried their lunch special--a great deal, at $25 for two people; offered weekdays until 3 PM.  This consists of three courses:  one selection from among their soups, salads, wine bar plates (think tapas), or fondute; one from the pasta or risotto items; and one from the specialty, seafood, or vegetarian items.  We chose:

-Bruschette:  three pieces with three different toppings:  portobello, tomatoes, and Sicilian eggplant.

-Linguini with clams in a Pinot Grigio sauce.  Four clams in the shell plus lots of chunks of clam flesh; slices of red pepper and garlic.  An excellent rendition of a classic.

-Veal skirt steak.  Four tender veal slices, arugula(?), and tomatoes in a balsamic sauce.  Very tasty, though I must say that in a blind tasting I'd probably have taken it for beef rather than veal.

There is an overabundance of Italian restaurants in Chicago, and many have little to recommend them. Quartino is different, though, in that it takes a tapas approach to Italian food, emphasizing small plates of antipasti.

The best way to experience this is through their Salumeria Tasting, which lets you choose seven items to your taste, including veggies, cheeses and meat, all accompanied by several additional sides.

Everything I tried was tasty and delicious, and it was a good way to experience a broad range of offerings.

Of course they also offer pizza, other entrees, and an extensive dessert list, and they brag that they have wine that is cheaper than water.

My server was very friendly, and I enjoyed a relaxed meal in one of their spacious dining rooms. There is also a large outside dining area.

We had the most amazing service !! The manager and wait staff was so attentive and had wonderful recommendations !!Went there for happy hour and food and drinks where outstanding!!! Will definitely be back!

My son and his fiancé took a friend and me there and we just loved it.  I would say it's a bit pricey (which is my 4 stars as opposed to 5 stars), especially if you are having 5-6 small plates and drinks, but it IS in a popular area so that explains that.  The food is delicious, everything is made when you order it, and the various menu items ensure there's something for everyone.  It makes for a very social dinner, ordering a plate or 2 at a time, enjoying the company your with, ordering another 1 or 2 plates to share.  I will definitely take other people there because my girlfriend and I loved the food, loved the service and felt it was definitely worth it!

I've been here a couple of times and tried many of their food options. My go-to Italian spot anytime I'm in Chicago. Great Italian tapas and atmosphere- have never tried anything that wasn't amazing.  Their outdoor seating is adorable and it looks like it has an upper level outside! For me that is something I must go back to experience! Slow service sometimes though!

One of my favorite gathering places in the area! I love that they are open late. Service is always great. The place is jammed packed every time I've been. This is americanized Italian food and they do it well. I love the house wine. The octopus is excellent, the risottos are good I've had them all but the portion is way to small.

Great outdoor seating watching the parade of "bachelorette" parties passing by.   If I had a $1 for every girl with a super  short skit and 5" heals walk in, I'd have a $1,000 tonight

As far as the food, try the Salumeria Tasting.  For $25, worth every penny for this experience.
My family and I love this place!!!  Great good, variety and prices.  Several choices for wine. Indoor and outdoor seating.

Quartino is great for groups so I've been many times for birthdays, bachelorette parties, family dinners, etc.  They are very accommodating with large groups and provide quality service for so many people.  It's also a great place because the atmosphere can either be dressed up or dressed down, anything goes.

There are so many different options on the menu that it can be overwhelming at first glance.  Luckily the portion sizes aren't too big so you can order multiple items without having too much.  I really liked the pappardelle and ravioli.  They only downfall is that the food comes out as it is prepared so depending on what you order everyone may be eating at different times which can be awkward.  They also have gluten free options if you need that accommodation for your group.

I will definitely come back with more big groups because it's classic Italian food and you can't beat the prices.

Pizzas are great! The portions are supposed to be shared but they're not big enough to share...Great food though. Be prepared to eat at different times from your guests...The food comes out at random times.

Great meal. Love the family style. We had a pizza, a couple pastas and multiple appetizers. Service was good but not extraordinary. I love how they offer wine in carafes in case you don't want an entire bottle. Definitely a great spot for a family dinner or big group.

I know, I know, Chicago is the land of the deep dish pizza.  But Quartino had great reviews on Yelp and was only a block from our hotel so it kinda seemed like a no-brainer for lunch.  And it ended up being a great meal...

Hubs and I started with a spinach salad w/ pears, walnuts, & ricotta salata ($7.50).  Doesn't that sound good?  I thought so - but the salad had wayyy too many walnuts and barely any slices of pear.  The dressing it was all tossed in was lovely though.  Yummy salad, despite its lack of pear.

And then there was the pizza. We selected a half sausage half pepperoni and, gosh, was it good.  Chewy bubbly crust, sweet sauce, fresh melted mozzarella cheese.  So good!  And you know how sometimes you order a pizza with toppings and wonder where the toppings are.  Not at Quartino.  The entire pie was covered w/ sausage and pepperoni.  A pizza and salad are both good sizes if you wanted to share w/ your date.

Everything was really good and filling, yet we didn't leave feeling heavy.  On my next visit to Chicago I'm totally going back to Quartino!

A few other things of note -
The place is huge!  There's tables outside on the patio, two bars, a main dining room downstairs and another upstairs.
Its also beauuutiful inside.  It was one of the more authentic Italian restaurants I've been to with its open kitchen, rustic simple finishes, bread and slicer situated right in the middle of the dining room.  That bread was really good too.
Restrooms are located upstairs and past the 2nd bar.  And they are just as beautiful as the rest of the place.

pics.caption: Looking down to the main bar.

review.des: Quartino is one of my favorite places to eat in the city.  The house red wine is awesome and affordable.

This place really does live up to the hype!!!

I went here recently with my parents and some relatives. I was somewhat skeptical because it looks like an old-timey Chicago joint, and I had the impression that it was good "back in the day," but maybe not so cutting edge anymore.

I have to say, the food here is exquisite. They have such a great selection of classic and contemporary Italian cuisine, and it's all made with the best ingredients and to perfection.

The service here is also some of the best in town. I really appreciated how attentive they were, and how upscale they keep things.

A quick FYI: This place is a bit like Italian tapas, it's family style, and so can get slightly pricy. But definitely 100% worth it. (And I don't say that often).

Quartino's is a great place for a nice dinner with some broke college students .  Its easy to get to from UIC and the atmosphere is so warm and inviting.  Be warned that you cant check in for your reservation until all of your guests are present, but we got our table quickly after they showed.  The waitstaff is relaxed but attentive and they work efficiently without stressing you out.  I got the linguine with clams and it was such a blessing.  Close to 15 whole clams with extra meat in there made it so well worth the $13.50 i paid.  The pasta was perfectly al dente and the red sauce had a tang with a solid finish making the entire dish really filling.  They claim their portions are meant for sharing, but I would argue the pasta dishes are not nearly big enough to be family style, maybe just a few extra bites per person.  They were also good about honoring our request for the "special birthday surprise" (look through some of the photos, youll get it ) and the dessert was delicious! Sweet thick vanilla gelato sandwiches between huge puffy prefiteroles covered in a thick chocolate sauce.  Overall, great experience with a great value.

P.S. The managers (or who im presuming) were really sweet and took the time to talk to every table of people.  Thats a very rare experience and I just wanted to give them a shout out!

pics.caption: Linguine with clams.  Delectable and more than worth $13.50.

review.des:
We came here for din din after we missed our flight in Chicago.  It was all quite tragic and travel in general stresses me out. So this place with promise of comfort food and free flowing wine was the perfect place to come to.

The place is quite casual and cute but everyone was dressed up. We ordered half a bottle of Malbec to drown our sorrows in to start. Following that we jumped onto to entrees - my boyfriend ordered the San Daniele pizza (prosciutto arugula) while I ordered the gluten free pasta in the stracci di grano arso (broccoli rabe/tomatoes/ onion/ garlic and works). The food was good and I would rate it a 8/10. Also, my boyfriend wanted the octopus but they had ran out unfortunately. Our Malbec was delicious and go check out the bathroom they are quaint and they use borax instead of soap.

pics.caption: Gluten free pasta in stracci di grano arso preparation

review.des:
We reserved a big party and I expected a table to seat about 20 people. I even spoke with the restaurant multiple times.

When more than half my party arrived on time, the table wasn't ready. On top of that, they split up our tables so that we didn't even sit together. What's the point of a reservation? The servers were nice but rushed us completely. Our waiter rushed us but the waitress was nice and pleasant. She was the only highlight.

Outside of ruining my wife's birthday, the food is mediocre. There are plenty of other good choices and we only came here because this was the first place we met. But if we were picking for any other reason such as food, service, and ambiance, we would've chosen any place else. This is the last time we are going here and will be sure to tell all of our friends to avoid it. Severely overrated.

We had the BEST date night dinner at Quartino yesterday! We had a late dinner reservation (9 PM) and sat out on the balcony. The staff was so sweet and attentive. The two of us split the fondue for an appetizer, and it is a must order! For our entrees we had ravioli and pepperoni pizza, both of which were delicious. We topped off our meal with chocolate gelati and had the balcony to ourselves by the time we were finished. The whole experience was just absolutely wonderful, and we left with full bellies and leftovers! Our new favorite dinner spot. You have got to come here!
Been here a handle of times and I do not have one complaint! I always recommend this place to anyone looking for good Italian food in river north.

pics.caption: Fruta di mare (octopus, calamari, clams and whitefish) THE BEST!

review.des:
Was riding solo tonight on my work trip and I decided to wander around and saw this place, looked it up on yelp and decided to come here.  

This place is huge, outdoor seating, indoor seating (two floors), bar and lounge seating.  I didn't want to wait so I went to the bar.  The guy was really nice and I was able to have a decent conversation with him.  

This place serves tapas and believe it or not, I was able to get half a tapa (didn't know until he said that option was available) woohoo, allowing me to try more dishes.  

I had the:

Polenta fries - it was fried cornmeal, the batter was a little on the heavy side but I was able to taste the flavor, not a bad dish

Fried calamari - was flavorful and very fresh, still thought the batter was a bit much but it was fried pretty good and crunchy.

Linguine with clams - the clams were fresh and the linguine was cooked to perfection, decent portion for a tapas place.

Tiramisu - very bad, there was so much powder on the tiramisu that I practically choked on the powder, it's like breathing powder up your lungs, I told the bar guy the honest truth about this (cuz he asked) and he claims to agree with me.  

It is quite a vibrant place and the prices are reasonable.  If you don't mind sitting at the bar, then go for it.

Every time I'm in Chicago (about once a month), going to Quartino is a must. My whole family loves it. Order the house made ricotta, ask for a side of honey alongside- you won't be sorry! Service has always been great, food comes out quickly. It's a great place to order a variety of dishes to share with the table.

Pros: didn't have to wait long to be seated for my 7:30pm reservation
-prices are decent

Cons: -it was way too loud in the dining room. I had to practically shout across the table so that the person sitting 1 foot away from me could hear me
-BAD service.. wait staff was rude, no introduction and recommendations offered, only came by once after our meal was served to check on us, had to wave down another person to get our bill, no dessert menu offered, had to pay with host bc noone came around for more than 15 minutes after we received our check, it was a special occasion and it wasn't acknowledged
-too crowded and tables are way too close to one another

The hostess unknowingly relayed our concern to the GM, but by then it was too late. He offered to give us complimentary drinks and desserts but we didn't want to go back and give it another shot. We had enough. It's too bad, I love italian food and I really wanted to like this place. I think service is equally as important as the food.
I gave this place 2 stars for the decent food.

This place is always a great spot for good Italian food and fitting for large groups. The plates are on the smaller side, generally good for 2-3 people. We ordered various different items for people to share and each dish we had was wonderful. One of my favorite dishes was the eggplant primavera. The service was excellent. The noise level was a little louder than normal, which at times made it unpleasant. Make sure to make a reservation prior to going!

I realized that I had eaten at the top 5 yelpiest places in Chicago except for this so I had to get this as my last dinner. I was quite excited because Davanti was legit. I made reservations for a Monday night but it wasnt necessary at all since it is hugeee. I vote Davanti.

1) Polenta fries- it was just a thick fried thing so I wouldnt get it.
2) Gnocchi- This was carby and filling but I didnt prefer it.
3) Veal Meatballs- I loved the meatballs at Davanti but these were just not flavorful or as good as I would hope so.
4) Mushroom Pizza- this was pretty decent and what I mostly ate since I like mushrooms.
5) Cauliflower- this was just a head of cauliflower. It was actually not good or flavorful so I would definitely pass.
6) Seafood pasta- You can choose between red or white sauce. We chose white but I still didnt find it very flavorful. It did have quite a few bits of seafood.

Oh my goodness! Fantastic food! Great atmosphere! Wonderful customer service - Amanda was awesome!
Highly recommend!

Fun dinning space, comparable to a Marchella's or kind of like a Bravo type restaurant. We tried 3 flat breads and 6 pastas for 11 people. Although they say pasta is to be shared, truthfully they aren't huge portions.

Favorites we're the 4 cheese flatbread.

The ravioli was unexpectedly in a thin broth sauce with lima beans and prosciutto...not a combo we were prepared for (I didn't personally read this on the menu so not sure how it was described).

Also, the spinach salad was enough for 3-4+ to share, but be aware, it is highly acidic. In fact toward the bottom it was inedible, and it burned our lips for being so salty/acidic. For such a large portion it had maybe 4 thinly sliced apples on top, so primarily a bowl of spinach and dressing.

Overall my party had a great time, our waiter was great dispite appearing very busy and food was good.

pics.caption: This is the ravioli that was slightly unexpected. Despite the combo, the ravioli itself was good.

review.des: In the city for a party so my wife and I came down early for some window shopping and a bite to eat. Happened upon this place and was pleasantly surprised. My wife and I split a cheese plater and a lunch sized pasta. Wife has food allergies and they were able to accommodate her. Food was great and service was attentive. Menu is a new twist on traditional Italian. Place was crowded with families, couples and groups of friends. Would come back and recommend it to all.

This place has been a treat to go to for me every time I have family come into town visiting.  Everything just combines into a fantastic food/drink experience that combines good presentation with delicious food.

Everything I've had on the menu is delicious.  From the homemade pastas to the in-house cured meats.  There is clearly hard work put into each dish.  I highly recommend the Tagliatelle a la Bolognese which provides a deliciously textured house-made noodle that is thick enough to hold a rich red sauce that is donned with a variety of meats, you will not be disappointed.  I have only had delicious things on the menu but usually cannot pass up the Bolognese.  

The presentation of the dishes is sporadic and keeps your pace of eating at a moderate tempo.  Everything is brought out as it is completed in the kitchen so you can pace your meal to a unique food melody every time you go there.  Combine this with the tapas/family style approach where everything is shared and  you get a delicious well-rounded meal.  

Finally, the Soccer Jersey clad service staff are always enthusiastic and knowledgeable of the diverse menu.  Almost every time I've been there a manager has come by asking how the experience is. Both are aspects of a restaurant I appreciate, and combined with the delectable and affordable culinary experience I can highly recommend this restaurant.
Have never had anything but a great experience at Quartino.

Went here with the wife and parents for lunch. Great food and great service. Authentic Italian dishes every thing made fresh to order. Very spacious. Our waitress was amazing. I highly recommend this place you will not be disappointed.

Usually very busy and there's clearly a high demand because their food is delicious. I really like their eggplant  parmesan and the escarole. Leave room for desserts because they're divine! Make reservations unless you don't mind waiting. The restaurant is beautiful it's well staffed. The waiters and waitresses go through an extensive training. Every dining experience here is always pleasant regardless of who waits on me. Love them!!

Wayy overrated, not sure why there are so many positive reviews. The waiters kept mentioning how all the dishes were made to share..however if you order the pasta dishes, they're not really made to share...They also have a bathroom attendant, and dry soap (borax)...so old fashioned. Tried their sangria...which was a disappointment, they filled a cup with ice/fruits and gave you a carafe of wine for you to pour over.

Instant gratification is the name of the game. Why not have some delicious Italian dishes served in a manner of minutes after ordering while you settle a debate about what Nic Cage's full name was in Gone in 60 Seconds (Memphis Raines) and show your dad a recap of last night's mixed doubles curling championship match while he shouts "What is this devilry?" I come back here every year at least once because it's a timeless quick classic where you can share a large amount of fun Italian dishes for a decent price. We crushed 6 plates 2 bottles of wine in under 1.25 hours so we were on time for Hamilton. Must be a record.

Never been to an Italian style tapas restaurant. A local friend decided to take us out there during our first night in Chicago. I saw Chianti Classico on the menu and instantly ordered some for myself. My other friends ordered a 1/2 liter of Malbec from Argentina. I took one sip and instantly regretted ordering my Chianti.  

We ordered a few tapas and shared them amongst the three of us. The concept is great. Only 1-2 appetizers are out on the table at a time. We started with gnocchi. The flavor was nice but to be honest it was over cooked and on the harder side. This was our least favorite item on the menu. Next came out the eggplant parm. Asides from it being on the saltier side., the taste was great. There was a nice balance of sauce and eggplant and the mozzarella cheese on top was melted to the right consistency. I was personally a huge fan of the dish.

Next we got the only chicken dish on the menu. This was my favorite dish we ordered (asides from dessert of course). The flavors were great and the chicken was cooked to the perfect temperature. I highly suggest this dish as well! We also ended up getting penne vodka and it was like any other penne vodka. Nothing bad or extraordinary about it. Tasted great.

For dessert we had tiramisu (not listed on dessert menu) and torta al chocolate, essentially a hot goey scrumptious chocolate cake served with gelato! This chocolate dessert paired really well with the wine!

Wish I was able to take pics of the food! We devoured everything so fast! Another place I highly will suggest to those traveling to Chicago.

I had a fantastic experience here. I came with a big party of girls and we were seated right away on a Friday night with our reservation. The place was packed (which obviously means it's good). They immediately served us bread with olive oil and vinegar and kept the supply coming.
We got liters of the house red and white wines to share for only $20 each! What a steal for Chicago. We also ordered a bunch of pizzas and pastas for the table and everything was delicious. It seems like no matter what you order here, you can't go wrong. The best part of all was that it was surprisingly extremely affordable. I would definitely come back again and recommend it if you're craving a fun Italian spot.

This place was recommended to us by our hotel bartender. We called to make reservations but they said they didn't have any availability till after 10pm (we called shorty after 5pm).  We decided to be adventurous and chance it hoping to get two spots at the bar, we lucked out got a table! So much for an after 10pm reservation. Lol  we were glad we chanced it because it was a great meal.  Loved how they leave a whole bottle of tap water at the table! I hate waiting for water refills when I'm thirsty.  We had great service and fun lively atmosphere. Definitely a busy place upstairs and downstairs. We intended on saving room for dessert since I viewed some great pictures on yelp, but in the end we were way too stuffed from everything else.  

-veal sliders 4/5
-calamari 5/5
-shrimp 5/5
-shrimp risotto 4.5/5
-spaghetti and meatballs 3.5/5

Everything was small plate style which allowed us to try a bunch of items.  Love that. Overall 4.5, would go back.

I really like this spot. The outdoor seating is great and the food is delicious. We ordered four plates and the bill came out to ~$60.  

The free bread was phenomenal- I didn't want to keep eating it because I wanted to focus on the actual entrees, but I could not stop.

Absolutely recommend the Margherita pizza and the shell pasta with beef and vodka sauce (totally blanking on the name but it was my favorite dish.)  The risotto and gnocchi were good, but nothing special. Probably wouldn't order those two again.

Service was excellent. Will return!

Had a blast at this restaurant! I think i died three times, had way too much to drink before i got to there. Food; we shared three pizzas, several bottles of wine, and we all ordered an entrée and appetizer. The lamb dish that J and I had was phenomenal, pizzas were unbelievable, I do remember us having too much bread  and wine at one point.
The walk to the restroom was rough, thank you to the people that helped me on the way, i wouldn't have made it without you!

Came back for a second time and had a better experience. No reservation this time and just walked in and sat at a bar table with no issue. Got a good bottle of wine and this time, we did order a pizza which was great (though needed salt). We also got some pasta dish that came recommended by the waitress that I wish I could remember because it was really good and a decent size and price for a tapa. Good mix this time.

We went here on a busy Saturday night. The place was packed. It was for a friend's bday. She liked this place a lot a few years ago. But unfortunately, it didn't hold up to expectations.

Side note: they have a really bad waiting area. They should remove the two tables by the front and place benches here or something. There is no where to stand after you enter the revolving doors and it turns into a sumo wrestling match with servers, hostesses, people trying to get to the packed bar and patrons. Really bad setup that makes no sense. The people seated at the two front tables cannot possibly enjoy their meal because they have people standing right on top of them, and they have a door constantly opening letting in cold air in their faces.

The food was mediocre largely due to a lack of seasoning. Everything was under seasoned including the gnocchi with arugula pesto and shrimp risotto. I have never had to put salt and pepper on everything that came out of a kitchen before, but we had to on 4 of our 5 items we ordered. The only thing that I'd consider to be really good were the dates (with pancetta I think). The short rib was OK but kinda tasted like pot roast.

Strongly suggest some sort of quality control on what goes out of the kitchen. There's no reason a risotto and a pesto should be under salted, those are two basic things that need a lot of salt in the kitchen. We have better tasting Italian food from a little joint in our neighborhood in Lakeview. Maybe it was an off night, but for the price and location, you should have a higher standard.

I've been here twice now and was underwhelmed both times. As a business owner, I understand how reviews impact the perception of a business, which is why I wasn't going to leave this review initially. However, I received such rude service, I will not be coming back and felt inclined to share my experience.

I walked in about 10 minutes early for my 7:30 reservation. There were 3 hostesses standing at the entrance. I spoke and said "hi, how are you?" No one spoke back. They continued to stare blankly and did not respond. So I leaned in, thinking "maybe it's too loud and they didn't hear me" so I repeated myself, "I said hi, how are you?" One girl replied "oh, ok." And then looked at me like "so, what do you want?" Like she was annoyed that I was speaking to her. So, awkwardly, I said I had a reservation but my friend isn't here yet. She said "ok, let us know when they get here." No greeting. No smile. No warmth. No engagement. Nothing. It was such a rude and uncomfortable interaction.

I waited and was seated when my friend arrived. I don't know what the capacity is to violate the fire code, but I'm certain it was surpassed. So packed, I could not pull out my chair. When we sat down, I said to my friend "I think we're gonna have to text each other." The noise level in that place is unreal.

I would have forgiven the tragic host service and crowdedness if the food was good, but it was NOT! It was bland, under or over cooked, I can't really decide. I left still hungry and annoyed. Then I remembered the last time I was here, I sent a dish back because it literally just didn't taste good. That was over a year ago, so I was trying to give it another chance. I need to be clear, I have NEVER sent back a dish because it tasted bad. I would normally just suck it up. So this is not a habit of mine at all.

Our server was nice, but that was honestly the best part of my experience. I have no desire to return.

Came here last night with my good friend. Being from out of town, I'm always looking for good places to try, especially Italian food which is my favorite.
We ordered the arugula salad with hazel nuts, orange slices, and their own goat cheese. It was fantastic. For the entre, we ordered linguini and shrimp. It was the best I've had. For dessert we had the flambé banana with ice cream....can you say insanely good? We had s couple of wine pairing that went great with the food.
Our server was very polite and attentive. Adam the Manager was nice chat with us.
Excellent experience overall. I will definitely come back.

Go to Quartino!  Italian + tapas + sangria = wow!
Sat outside on a warm September evening, recommended by friends.  Good food, very casual environment with staff that seems to be having fun.
Huge tapas selection gives you plenty to choose from!

Will come again!

Outstanding service from the minute we walked into the door. Very cozy and welcoming throughout the entire place. We were on the hunt for wood fired pizza and we found it. The appetizer salad and bread we good but the star of the show was the pizza and dessert. Highly recommend

We came with a business group of 8, that's always a hard number for both everyone loving the meal and conversational flow.
Star--right off the bat for service!  I loved our waiter! He explained everything even more so because it's a unique experience.  Our group was so large that we received one dish at a time (so nothing was served cold). If this style of eating bothers you, do not come here, in fact go to shake shake and fill up and don't go to anything great!

Star for the veal meatballs!  They are really good.  I wasn't overwhelmed by the pasta as the dough had a whole wheat texture.  I've made better at my home.

I could give five stars for desserts alone!! By far the best desserts I've ever had in a fancy restaurant!  We had the doughnuts, chocolate cake, tiramisu and cannoli. Outstanding!!!!!
Biggest downer by far is again the noise level.  If you love shouting for everything, then please come here but again, Chicago restaurant owners have got to address the noise levels in those places!

Porcini mushroom and truffle risotto - it was so tiny! I wanted more. The truffle taste wasn't strong but I enjoyed the dish a lot; maybe because I was starving.
Fungi pizza - very salty dough? I was hoping the mushrooms gave it a nice kick but it didn't.
Bread with balsamic vinaigrette? This is what bread is paired with apparently..give me the butter or olive oil!!

Overall, I'm not sure what's so great about this restaurant.

This is one of those places I don't frequent often, but when I do I wonder why I don't come here more. We were striking out left and right on Cinco De Mayo and decided to come here. Glad we did! We were able to seat ourselves right a way in the bar area.

Service was great. We decided to go for a half and half pizza. Haft with meatballs and the other half veggie. Crust is thin and crispy and the toppings were fresh and delicious!

What a great experience! We really love the food and ambiance here; so much so that we returned for a second visit during a recent four day stay in Chicago. We told our waiter how much we enjoyed the meal and the manager came by, thanked us for the business and bought us a round. I guess this is my long overdue thank you. We'll definitely return next time we visit Chicago!!
This place is fantastic! Food and service was spectacular!!! You can't beat the price either. Went here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and we will definitely be back!!
Lunch was great. I would come back again for sure.  The pizza was one of the best pizzas I've had in a while.  Service was very friendly and responsive!
The food is excellent.  Not sure if they were just having a bad night, but service was unbelievably slow.  7:30 reservation.  10:00 still waiting to pay the check.

While I really wanted to love this restaurant, I just couldn't. The bread brought to the table was good and my glass of Moscato was delicious. On the flip side, the small plates of meat and cheese that we ordered pre-meal were bland at best, the salad was just OK and the entrées were just passable. The service, however, was fantastic. As others have stated, the dining area is packed tight and it felt like the tables were on top of one another. This was not an inexpensive meal - just a heads up. We would likely not return to this restaurant.
Weak Italian Food, except for the pizza. Don't order gnocchi ir tiramisu. Do go for the pizza though.

Looking for a nice Italian restaurant near our hotel and found this place.

WAIT: No wait, we made reservations about a month in advance and got seated right away.

ATMOSPHERE: It's a fun restaurant, dimly lit but lively I could see it being a good place for a birthday dinner or date.  It has TVs and lots of stuff on the walls.

FOOD: Their prices are fairly reasonable and the portion sizes decent.  

CAVATELLI - they say it's house made pasta, which I was excited about but it wasn't as good as some other restaurants I've had.  It definitely tasted fresh and fairly chewy but nothing to rave on and on about.  The dish itself had tomato sauce and ricotta cheese on top.  The sauce was a little on the bland side.

VEAL - several of the people in our group ordered this and it looked pretty decent.  They give you a good amount of meat and arugula salad.  It did look a little overcooked though.

Overall, probably a decent place to come for pizza or pasta.

This is a great Italian restaurant in the city. Everything is shareable and delicious. Our waiter was very nice and patient with our questions, since it was our first time visiting!
While we were seated on their front patio we experience flocks of bachelorette parties.

We got the following...
Appetizers:
~Fried calamari- very meaty and tender, just right. Not too much batter.
~Bacon wrapped dates- nice crisp outside, tasty cheese on the inside, right amount of sweetness. Mouthgasmic combination!!!!!!

Entrees:
~Spaghetti & meatballs- for such a simple dish... this was AMAZING!!! The marinara sauce was full of flavor and tasted very fresh and homemade!
~Linguini & Clams~ I got the red wine sauce. It had some tomatoes, sliced peppers, sliced garlic, and yummy clams!
-Shrimp Risotto- it was alright.. It's like porridge. I won't be getting this again

Dessert:
~Banana Ice Cream with Fried Banana & Biscotti- DELICIOUS!!! Sweet, of course, and a nice combination of textures.
~Molton Chocolate Soufflé with a scoop of vanilla ice cream- delectable creamy and velvety chocolate center that takes you to chocolate heaven. If you're a chocolate lover like myself, this is a must!

pics.caption: Banana ice cream with banana and biscotti

review.des:
Had an awesome meal here! Went on Saturday night at 6:30 and got a table without a wait.

For a table of 2 we left full (with leftovers), our bill was under $60 (with a bottle of wine!), and we loved the food!

We had:
-Polpette al sugo di pomodoro (veal meatballs in tomato sauce with fresh ricotta on top)
-Dates wrapped in pancetta
-Asiago cheese and olive assortment
-Gnocchi (with a different preparation)

Everything was awesome...except the olives. Just don't order them. Weird, gross flavors, bad textures, etc. Don't waste your time. Everything else, A+!

Server was attentive, helpful, and pleasant.

Would say I wish the plates had come out together because it would have been nice to eat the dates with the meatballs, rather than just eating a bunch of dates... but everything was so good we didn't mind :)

Thanks Quartino! We will be back!

pics.caption: Gorgonzola cheese stuffed dates wrapped in pancetta
Olives and asiago cheese with apricot puree -- Loved the puree and cheese -- would DEFINITELY not get the olives again.
Polpette al sugo di pomodoro -- veal meatballs with tomato sauce and homemade ricotta

review.des:
I made a reservation here for a friend's birthday. The food was amazing and we loved our server. We ordered 9 dishes total for 8 people. Our favorite was the pizza with arugula and prosciutto.

A few tips:

1. For large groups (we had 8) most dishes are too small to have more than a small taste per person, so I'd recommend ordering 2. We loved the Brussels sprouts but everyone only got 1-2 sprouts.

2. Don't show up starving and be nice to the hostess. They ran over 35 minutes late on a reservation I made weeks in advance. Apparently they are known for this. The hostess (bless her) was very kind and did her best but was still overwhelmed. Remember she can't always directly affect this, so for her sake complain to the manager if you must let out your frustration.

(P.S. if management is reading this please do something about the way you pack your reservations in. Also, those two little tables off the side of the packed waiting room would be much better as waiting benches, everyone who saw that said they hoped they weren't theirs.)

3. It's loud and the tables are extremely tight, so it might not be the best choice for elderly or handicapped guests.

Overall, a great choice for a girls night or group outing just be prepared to wait, the food will be worth it.

We had our rehearsal dinner here and I have to say everything was absolutely amazing!! The wine room is perfect for a group of 12 and the pre-fixed ordering ahead of time made the night relaxing. Each menu item was delicious! Our favorites were the meatballs and shrimp!

Delicious restaurant in the heart of downtown Chicago that will always be one of my favorites! My favorite dish will always be the white bean dip, which comes with warm bread and a fresh cut pepper on top. I loved it so much that I have even tried to recreate at home to quench my constant cravings! Staff is friendly and gave great wine recommendations. A fun, romantic environment perfect any night.

I've enjoyed eating at Quartino many times over the years, but  extremely disappointed with the past two visits.  Simple sausage pizza was terrible and flavorless - frozen dough quality.  

Sadly, another once-great restaurant off my list.

One of the most memorable restaurants I have been to because of phenomenal service and great food. The food itself is pretty great. Our table ordered a Tortellini dish, which was a white sauce pasta with prosciutto. The prosciutto definitely made the dish unique and much tastier. We also got a sausage pizza, which was pretty average. My favorite was the Orechiette, which is the ear shaped pasta. Halfway through, we decided to order the Fiocco di Prosciutto, which was a nice way to end our dinner. I would definitely come back for the food, as it really is phenomenal.

The service was amazing. Albeit, we did go 4-5pm, when there was less customers, but the servers were very attentive. Unfortunately, I did not get our waiter's name, but he was very nice and definitely very energetic. Definitely one of the best waiters I've experienced. The manager, Alysia, also came by and was very welcoming as well. She was very well versed in her introduction to the different types  of prosciutto, as we had trouble deciding which one to try out. As customers, we were impressed, and her dedication to her job makes the vibe for us that much better.

The restaurant itself is very large. There are many many tables on two floors, as I can imagine how busy the place would get. The ambiance is nice, with the dim lighting and homey interior. It's definitely a place to try out in your visit to Chicago or even just for a simple meal with friends and family.

A great disappointment. I have eaten here many times. Unfortunately, in recent times the quality has decreased and the prices have increased. No longer is this a place worth visiting. Once the food was craveable.   Now it seems that cost and ease of preparation are the most important considerations.

Tonight, my final visit, entailed a "nothing" salad  and a sausage pizza. The pizza can best be described as bland and cheap. The crust was almost tasteless and literally white in color. The sausage mays as well have been simple ground pork.

Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time or money.

Honestly, the food just wasn't very good and thus 2 stars.  We started with the pancetta wrapped dates, which just seemed to taste off as if they were old.  We then had the braised pork shank which was extremely bland, and the gluten free fusili with bolognese.  The bolognese had a hint of puttanesca which was off putting. Would not recommend.  Service wasgood and people were genuinely nice, therefore not 1 star.

I came here for lunch one day while in Chicago on business.  I thought the food was very authentic, which also means it was a bit lacking in flavor.  That's all I hear about real Italian food.  It was good but I probably wouldn't go back.  The food was really expensive and the portions weren't huge.  I ordered a sprite which was really really sweet, maybe too much syrup to soda ratio.  Anyway, it seems to be a very popular spot.  If you go by on any night its usually very busy in there.  if you love authentic Italian food, give it a shot.

I heard excellent things about this restaurant, do I decided to go on a double date here. Our table was next to this obnoxious group of people who were clearly to drunk to behave appropriately. They almost hit me in my seat a few times. The waitress seemed annoyed and did not provide good service: the calamari was very tasty, so I give them that. The alfredo pasta I had tasted like Ragu sauce. I think they try to squeeze some many tables in this restaurant that they do not realize how uncomfortable it can be.
I would definitely go to another spot for Italian food than here. It was ok tasting but not what it is cracked up to be.

The number of reviews and the overall ratings were what drew us to go...

Ehhhh, we may have just ordered the wrong things. Outdoor seating area was great as well as the calamari. The pizza was ok, stay away from the shrimp risotto. No bueno.

I would recommend checking other places out first. But again, we may have ordered the wrong things.

Been here a few times, always a good experience. Tried the soprano pizza today and was a fan. Amazing how pickled cauliflower, carrots and veal meatballs balanced out so well. The best part is when you get the bill. Quite inexpensive for the Gold Coast area. Good place to grab a drink  especially on a nice day, make sure to sit outside.

Absolutely stunning amazing both food and service. I routinely visit the resto almost weekly and I found nothing to complain. Love Italian and quartino! However,recently the clams went less in the dish no idea what's going on.. but anyway, it bn fantastic over yrs!
Tourist trap. Questionable hard dry burrata. Mediocre pasta and pizza. Forgot one of our dishes. Didn't know the menu.

Prosciutto/Parmesan pizza: pretty good.

Duck prosciutto/arugula pizza: greasy and altogether unbecoming, which is unfortunate. Duck prosciutto can be really good.

Pastas and salumi: generally pretty good.

Service: fine

Atmosphere/decor: quite nice, actually!

All-in-all, this is a decent place to eat at. Long hours are a convenience, and Quartino's does offer great value for money.

I planned a surprise birthday dinner here for a party of 16. The people who had the table ahead of us took forever to close out. The reception staff have our entire group free drinks while we waited for the table. Once we were seated, we got an appetizer also. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and professional. This was a great experience! The hostess, Annie was definitely the opposite of snobby hey you sometimes find in these restaurants. I will definitely be back.

The absolute best restaurant in the entire city of Chicago. You can order anything on the entire menu and it won't just be good it will be amazing. Home run of a spot. John Colletta is a master chef, everything his hands touch turn to gold. I go her at least once a week and I still can't get enough. I would give it 10 stars if I could!
Yum! We were lucky to get a reservation. We came in town from Dallas and wanted a real Chicago Italian experience. Perfect spot. Great service too. Ask for Jessie (Jesus)
Food is 5 star. I give 4 only because it is so loud, and the tables are a bit small for all the food you get. But the food is off the hook. Easy to recommend.

My second time in the restaurant, we were sitting outside and a torrential downpour started that caused us to move inside. Even though they were packed, the management was very quick to get everyone new tables inside the restaurant. Very friendly and accommodating staff.

Not to mention the pizza and the cavatelli are both excellent options. Would highly recommend not only because of the food, but also the atmosphere and the unparalleled service.

This place is my fav.
The food is great. I'd start with the salumi/cheese starters, all their pasta is great, dessert is awesome. White wine sangria on point.
It's super reasonably priced, and very casual and low stress for how awesome the food is. Highly recommended, especially for lunch or early dinner.

Quartino is a high quality, tapas-style Italian place, so if you're on a budget, it is key to note that some of the dishes are available as half portions (mostly pasta and seafood plates)! This means you can try more things without sacrificing too much financially!

Of course, Quartino is still by no means cheap. For my friend and I, our bill still came out to be ~$50 (with tax and tip) for 3-4 plates and a 1/2 liter of wine. But everything we ate was phenomenal!

My personal favorites were the roasted baby octopus and the duck prosciutto. The baby octopus was tender, well seasoned, and served alongside some greens. Such magic. The duck prosciutto was served in tiny pieces, but each bite was so deliciously fatty and flavorful that we were able to make it last for quite awhile.

Ultimately, this is worth the visit. Think you'll still be hungry? You can always stuff yourself with free bread (the college student way), or plan to come here for a pre-dinner snack.

4 star because their pepperoni and specially their duck prosciutto blew me away. Ordered their charcuterie sample and the whole thing blew me away. It was big enough for 2 that we shared a lunch item because I was already full. Their egg plant cheese and tomato sauce dish was absolute. Wish they had this in Cali.

I've been here a couple of times now and both were on reservations. Like other reviewer, I highly recommend them because I've seen them quote an hour to hour and a half on most friday nights.

Out of the items I have tried, I have enjoyed the beet and burrata salad, polenta fries, and artisan blend fondue the best. I love anything with burrata and their salad is no exception. The polenta fries are great and i love the red pepper salsa that they serve it with (I also love dipping them in the fondue). The fondue is delicious and for two people, it's plenty - I may get two orders if you have four or more though! I found the gnocchi and eggplant parmesan to be somewhat tasteless. The gnocchi at least had the pesto which added flavor, but I really did not enjoy the eggplant parmesan. The eggplant was thoroughly cooked through, which I like, but the sauce was lacking salt and flavor, which caused the entire dish to do the same. I've been meaning to try the pizzas, but haven't gotten around to it. For dessert, I've had the hot chocolate cake with italian gelato and the italian donuts. I expected a few donuts and you get a huge basket full which is awesome because who doesn't love extra donuts! The hot chocolate cake is so rich and decadent - absolutely delicious, and pairs well with the cold and creamy gelato.

The service has been fine  each time I've been there. However, I agree with the reviews on just how LOUD the place is. It's not loud like you would expect at a packed restaurant - it's literally piercing. And, to even talk to a person you're sitting next to, you have to yell, causing you to contribute to that noise. I'll have to try the suggestion of sitting on the patio next time instead.

I've loved this place for years. Beautifully made traditional Italian cuisine. Very welcoming environment. Always great service. Even when wall to wall occupied. Excellent service staff & great bartenders. Been going for years. Always will

Awesome spot--menu has a wide variety and great, great drinks!  Make sure to try one the Goat Cheese Ricotta and one of their homemade pasta dishes.  Awesome for groups--they have huge tables, and everything is shareable/tapas style.   Only downside is the upstairs can get pretty loud when it's packed!

Phenomenal family style eats. Shared three courses with two colleagues and loved every bite. The wine menu and service are wonderful as well. Would definitely return the next time I find myself in the area.

I had heard a lot about this place before I had visited and arrived with high expectations. We quickly found a small table in the middle of the room. Quite a lovely place, old Italian styling, and a slightly loud ambiance.

We ordered the Gnocchi which is very famous here and found it to be great, a must-have item. Then ordered the spinach pasta (I forget what it's called) which was slightly undercooked but the maitre d'hotel prepared another plate quickly and it was great.

I will visit once again to try more traditional Italian fare such as the pasta and pizza and update my review.

Atmosphere (very good): Looks very cozy, good atmosphere, waiters are very fast and polite
Food (below average): if it was a food court or some diner, food here would be not bad but for the price I pay I expect smth more. Burrata was old (very firm), risotto was salty and had a really unpleasant smell, portions were small (which is forgivable if food is good). The only thing that I really enjoyed here was soup (chicken, minestrone and tomato basil were all good).

Overall:
Good atmosphere and serving YES
Burrata NO
Risotto NO
Soup YES
This a cool place with great service but the food was really underwhelming, over salted and overall disappointing

I was tasked with choosing a restaurant for my family to meet at for a quick visit & dinner.  Quartino was near my hotel and has great ratings on the usually reliable Yelp so I figured we'd give it a shot.

The menu, and the idea behind the menu (Italian tapas!), both set my expectations very high.  We ordered 10-12 items off of the menu for our party of six and we all left very full.  With that said, none of us were very impressed...in fact, I'd say we were relatively disappointed, but fortunately hungry enough that it didn't matter too much.  

I thought there was a real lack of seasoning pretty much across the board and, for an Italian joint, some really surprising issues with the pasta.  There's al dente pasta, and then there's way undercooked, gummy pasta.  The gnocchi and penne pastas were both waaaay underdone which resulted in very disappointing dishes.  The carpaccio was paired with something completely forgettable other than the fact that it wasn't a very good pairing(I believe radish?) .  The pizzas were bland with sparse, uneven toppings.  

There were two good items we tried; the artisan sausage with peppers and onions was tasty, as was the duck prosciutto.

The restaurant was loud, tables were very close together, and as we were finishing our meal there was a busboy hovering which was not appreciated being this was the only time we all had to see one another.  Our waitress forgot to put in an order and was overall very, eh, kind of just going through the motions.  

There is too much good food in Chicago to recommend this place...I have no clue how this has 4 stars on Yelp.
As authentic as it gets to true Italian!  They even use flour that is imported for their pizzas!!  AMAZING!

Came here with my sister around 9 pm and we were immediately seated at a nice table outside.

My sister informed me that it's a small plates type of place, so we settled on 3 dishes: the spinach salad, shrimp, and the Margherita pizza.

We were going to order the Bianca pizza, but our waitress advised us against it saying that it "isn't really pizza" due to its lack of cheese and tomato sauce. I appreciated her honesty.

The spinach salad came first and it was disappointing. It was overdressed, which caused the spinach to lose its crunch. The flavored were nice together, though. I only wish it hadn't been so drenched in dressing.

The meal redeemed itself with the shrimp and pizza, which both had really fresh flavors. I wish the shrimp had been spicy, but I fixed that by adding red pepper flakes. All in all, a good meal for not a bad price. I'd come back!

Very tasty food, and excellent service.

We sat at an outdoor patio on the weekend, which can get busy. Can't comment on the interior as we sat outdoors the entire time. The wine is a little pricy. Eggplant parmesan is delicious, one of the best I had in Chicago. We also tried the fettuccine alfredo, which wasn't bad either. Overall, definitely recommend trying this place out if you're in the neighborhood.

pics.caption: Eggplant parm. A must try for all vegetarians!

review.des:
The Service here is the Best and wonderful people.
Collection of Wine is also nice.
But the food they have is soo bad. I tried Basil Pesto Pasta which tastes like uncooked and Raw basil mixed with Pasta.

If you want to try Better Italian Pasta go to Vapiano which is a Mile away or try Eataly which is closeby.

I tried a Pizza which is Soggy when made fresh.
I hated myself to order a Pizza after eating is from here.

Chicago is known for Pizza where they made their horrible mistake.

Wow, really mediocre experience. Lousy service, lousy food, lousy atmosphere. This place seems mainly set up to maximize revenue, not so much serve good food or a good experience.

Show up on a Saturday night, first of all the host area is packed to the brim. Like fire hazard packed. Can't even get through the revolving door. When we get through we find out why: they're 30 minutes late seating reservations. They told us they were 10 minutes late. if we'd known it was really 30 we wouldn't have stood around in that packed lobby for all that time. We did eventually go to the bar. They told us they'd text us when our reserved table was ready. They didn't do that either. Hostesses were completely overwhelmed and not organized at all.

So our party of 4 is seated 30 minutes late, at a table so small it would be tight for a party of two. Crammed between similarly small tables, with not nearly enough space between. Repeatedly bumped into by other customers and servers. Not comfortable at all. Again, priority seems to be cramming in as many customers as possible.

The food? Meh. The short rib was pretty good, the meatball was pretty good, the gnocchi wasn't very good, the pizza was pizza, and the shrimp (which was forgotten and then delivered at the end of the meal instead of the beginning) was terrible. Server comp'd the shrimp because of its lateness so we got our money's worth on that I guess.

There's simply nothing remarkable about this place. There are countless better options in the same area for the same or less money.

My most recent experience at Quartino certainly felt update-worthy.  I've been back several times since my initial visit, and I have been quite pleased each time.  Tonight, however, I was especially impressed.  Several of the employees went out of their way to accommodate my last-minute reservation and then to help me construct the perfect "soft foods" meal following a tooth extraction.  The Potato Puree and Cavatelli were ideal for my healing mouth, and our waitress even brought me some gelato!  The manager kindly stopped by to check in on my party as well.  I will certainly be back again soon and continue to highly recommend this place!

The food was awesome! There was about a 2 hour wait for Saturday night dinner, so my friend and I opted to wait for a table to open up in the bar area. It was worth the wait! Both Chris and William were bartenders who served us and they were awesome! When I go back, I'm requesting Chris as a server. We asked about his favorite dish and he suggested the short rib. It was legitimately THE best short rib I've ever had in my life! We were liking the plate clean. We also had the shrimp (delicious), brussel sprouts, and broccoli rabe. This place has great food!!

Delicious food and great service. A little surprised that the food was served as tapas not the traditional Chicago Italian way but hey it was delicious. Definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys Italian food.
The bathroom is nice...Carpaccio is the best thing there. The rest. Eh - I was not very happy with Quartino, gotta say it's a step above Olive Garden

Came here in need of desserts and was not disappointed. Have been back for special occasions regularly since then, and have had wonderful service and delicious food every single time. Favorites include the chocolate lava cake and the lemon gelato dessert, as well as any pizza/pasta really... it's all yummy!

With the number of reviews already existing for this restaurant, I'm sure mine will get lost. However, I love traveling to cities and finding my local Yelpers' reviews of destination restaurants, so hopefully if I've got some Louisville folks in Chicago, my review will motivate them to stop in to Quartino!

During a work trip to the Windy City, I wanted a place close to my hotel for dinner that wasn't outrageous. Quartino's menu fit the bill.

I arrived around 6pm and was seated immediately in a cozy little corner at a table for two. A server brought a glass bottle of tap water in addition to a plate of bread. Very quickly I was able to give my order and surprisingly fast, my food arrived. I had the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo (pasta with braised beef) and it definitely hit the spot.

What I really loved was that the idea at Quartino is to share plates, and so since I was on my own, the portion was a little smaller than most restaurants, so I didn't feel stuffed by the end of the meal. My server mentioned that there were options with the menu as well...if you want half portions, double, etc. I was fine with the portion that was served. However, I took advantage of the half portion for dessert when I ordered the nutella panini and capped it off with a decaf coffee. Perfect end to a pleasant meal.

The ambiance, price, and service all really add up to make this a five-star establishment in my book!
ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!! This is me and my boyfriends favorite date night location in Chicago. Very affordable and delicious!
