It's a really nice Italian restaurant. The bread just so soft. Everything we ordered just so yummy.

Quartino, I see you in my dreams. Hands down best place I've eaten in a long time. My mouth is watering just thinking of our meal. The prosciutto pizza was HEAVENLY, and my risotto was to die for. The calamari melted in my mouth, and I could eat that loaf of bread every single day of my life. Our waiter was so incredibly helpful and kind to us, I wanted to pick him up and make him my Chicago tour guide. The white sangria is scrumptious as well! Chicago, you're lucky to have Quartinos.

pics.caption: THE PIZZA IS TO DIE FOR.

review.des: I love going here for a nice dinner or a quick lunch! Food is always on point and the atmosphere is that true causal family Italian feel. Our favorite server is Alex J! He's very knowledgeable of the menu while always sporting a smile with that jersey swagger

Holy Sh!t. Just left lunch here with a large group after having the most uncomfortable experience with a manager I have EVER had. I was sweating with anxiety. The woman seemed very emotionally expressive and was standing at our table for 5 long minutes "we blew it tell me what I can do!!!" While flailing her hands. Our entire table was trying to look into our laps. Wishing it would stop  it never stopped. She continued  and continued. It was embarrassing. I finally said "I feel very uncomfortable can I have our check?" She responds "I feel uncomfortable,"  seriously woman get a grip. This is not about you.  

We were not even upset we just had been waiting 30 minutes for a dessert that we asked to cancel. Instead of just telling us that they didn't have the dessert available they tried to give us tiramisu half an hour later. We didn't want tiramisu but were completely fine with nothing.

There was some serious timing issues on our food. We received most dishes and hadn't gotten our vegetable dishes 40 minutes later. I ordered a second beef short rib and hadn't gotten in 30 minutes later so I asked to cancel it.  

All the food was spectacular. Aside from the timing, but the dramatic display by this manager was just something else. I have never experienced such an uncomfortable interaction and likely will not ever return for the possibility of round two.

I had high expectations for Quartino but I'm not sure I was blown away by the food or the atmosphere. The food was just okay but nothing that other tapas bars can't replicate or execute better. We ordered some of the more popular dishes like polenta fries, veal sliders, shrimp and sausage risotto.  My favorite was probably the polenta fries since I've never had it presented that way before. It also came out piping hot which was a plus. Veal sliders were decent and my friends seem to liked them quite a bit.  

I was not as impressed with the infamous pork shank. Ours came out dry and was tough overall.  It tasted a lot like leather after chewing my way through my first bite. However, as I got to the center of the shank, it got better and the meat did indeed slide off the bone.

My biggest gripe though, is the seating arrangement. I get that restaurants want to utilize their real estate as much as possible, especially when they're likely paying both arms and legs for competitive spaces smack-dab in the middle of downtown.  However, this place takes it up a notch as you can probably taste the food of tables around you if you tried hard enough.  Again, I don't blame them for doing this to accommodate their large volume of customers but I had hoped for a less intimate experience with the foodies that night.

pics.caption: Pork shank. Not as good as I was hoping for.

review.des:
We met our good friend here to enjoy a nice dinner and drinks.  The restaurant was cramped and noisy, but the ambiance was enjoyable otherwise.  We sat at the bar while we waited for our friend and had a few drinks.  The bar waitress was great.

The menu was diverse, offering many different things at affordable prices.  It's a tapas type restaurant, which I really liked because at most Italian places after you eat the bread, an appetizer, and the salad, you finally get a huge plate full of pasta or meat, or both.  The meals were delicious, as was the beer selection.

I dinged it a star because our meals all came out different times, with the last one coming over 5 minutes after the others.  Other than that, great place and we will definitely be back.

amazing fun and fantastic- Everything you look for in a restaurant like this one. I have eaten here several times and always enjoyed it. I actually had a very bad table being hit by every server and bus boy that walked by and Management noticed and took action. What else could you ask for- I had an issue and they solved it. rest of the meal went perfect and the food is always good.

I have heard wonderful things about this restaurant but was recently dissappointed in the service itself. We dined no a Friday night and were seated on the patio. After about 20 minutes a server showed up and took our drink orders. Another 20 minutes went buy and another server brought us some bread but the drinks had yet to show up. I eventually commented and asked about the status of our drinks and 15 minutes later another server showed up with 2 of the 3 drinks we ordered. Our meal went on like this with continuous changes in servers and it even took 30 minutes to get the check let alone another 25 minutes to get my credit card back. For such a nice establishment the server confusion was very disappointing.

We tried the Caprese salad which was fantastic and absolutely fresh and I highly recommend it. We also the meatballs which I had to remind the server twice to receive and were fairly small and somewhat chewy. (I'm guessing they forgot about it and reheated them or something). As for the pasta we ordered the Cavatelli we asked for it to be spicy. The pasta itself was great and the sauce definitely tasted homemade however there was no spice and 15 minutes later some crushed red pepper was brought to the table.

Overall I was really looking forward to eating on the patio here and I do think they have a solid drink menu and great beer selection. I wish our experience was different as the food was on point but the service was unacceptable. Considering we had guests in town and chose to take them here was a bit of a mistake. Hopefully it is not always like this. Enjoy!

The reason for not giving this restaurant five stars: 1. The lemon shrimp we had the other day was a little fishy, the taste is just too pale. 2. They don't have tiramisu on their dessert menu. 3. A guy in an Inter jersey served us, I have been a fan of AC Milan for a decade lol. (but still excited to see a soccer themed restaurant in here though!)

Excellent service.  Got us in for our reservation right in time. Prompt service. Great food. Pizza was good braised beef in tomato sauce with homemade pasta, also delicious. Dessert was the panini al gelato limone was an awesome pile of heaven. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes homemade lemon awesomeness.

Quartino's is great for a group looking to share a bunch of smaller Italian plates.  We always bring our family here when they visit- it has a fun vibe and the staff is always nice and attentive.  The pizzas are yummy, burrata is nice and fresh, and wine list is great.  A good staple to have closer to downtown!

The pastas and pizzas at this place were a bit disappointing. I got the pesto gnocchi, which was a little bit overcooked and tasteless. Came here with a big group, and based off the reviews, definitely expected more.

Very good Italian food!!!

Beef Carpaccio was amazing!!!!

The Lunch Special($25) is very good deal!
You can choose few items.

Beef Carpaccio: Amazing! Must try!

Pizza: has a lot of flavor but I don't like the texture. I prefer to Eataly pizza.

Truffle Risotto: Very good!! It has so much flavor!!

Pork: It's ok.

Banana Dessert: Very good! I like the gelato.

Delicious!  In fact.. we ate there twice before we left Chicago.  I really loved the penne vodka and gnocchi pastas.  The octopus is worth trying, but it is different!  I preferred the garlic shrimp (Incase you're between these two). The tiramisu was amazing!  The zeppoles were fine, but didn't knock my socks off.  I did not like the broccoli rabe.  It was extremely bitter.  The atmosphere is a bit loud, but I kind of enjoyed it.  It just feels homey!  Oh.. and make sure you get some wine while your here!
Real disappointment. Reviews and pics were great. Food was average at best. Not much flavor - the best thing going was the bread and EVOO. Perhaps we hit them on a bad night...

Great place for cured meats and cheeses.  The restaurant is very spacious, but it's probably a good idea to reserve ahead of time if you're going for a weekend dinner.  Prices are very reasonable and the service is fast and helpful.  I found it pretty cool that the staff members were wearing jerseys from their favorite Italian club teams

We made reservations for dinner here on the final night of our stay in Chicago.  We arrived on time and only had to wait 5 minutes for a table.  The place was crowded, and the layout of tables approaches being cramped, but they leave just enough room for everything to function pretty well.  It was fairly loud inside, from just the level on conversation and the acoustics.

The decor is dark wood and lots of Italian posters (bike racing, pasta, etc.).  It has an interesting old-style (perhaps faux) Italian vibe.  It was interesting.

The pasta choices seemed more authentic than some suburban strip-mall Italian eatery.  I don't recall what our party of 3 got, but all were pasta variants and all were good.  The wine selection was also good.

If I were in the area again, I would definitely consider a return visit.

Eh... it was okay. We came as a large group... the server(s) seemed unhappy to do their jobs. They always seemed to be upset when we tried to order something. I understand how it is annoying that we don't all order drinks at one time and want to continuously order drinks throughout the night. Please don't get huffy with me. I didn't hear you ask if anyone wanted drinks previously. If I knew I was going to get so much attitude, I would have just remain dehydrated so you don't have to do your job. The food was OK. My side of the table got the margarita and pepperoni pizzas, polenta fries, shrimp, and bolognese. The only thing good was the bolognese. That was actually really good... probably one of the better ones I've ever had. Everything else was meh. I don't know if I would go back because of the service and food. Really disappointed...
Great food, atmosphere, and price. Recommend the porcini risotto. Food is not quite 5star in comparison to few other places, but price is more than fair :)

pics.caption: Good meatballs, not bad for quick appetizer

review.des:
Ate here with a big group of people. It was fun and the food was great. Lots of small plates so we were able to basically order one of everything off the menu and try everything. That's my favorite thing- being able to sample all sorts of stuff.
Fun location, full of people, great staff, great food.

The food at Quartinos was pretty fab! A group of 5 girls shared the calamari, the bruschetta, and a pepperoni pizza. We could have and wanted to  order plenty more because everything on the menu sounded so delish but we were just stopping for a smaller lunch.

The calamari was so wonderful. Perfectly tender and crispy on the outside. I wasn't crazy about the marinara sauce on the side but the calamari was definitely one of the best I've ever had.

I would have skipped the bruschetta if I could do it over again. It was three pieces of a toasted bread and each one had different ingredients. Wasn't really what I was expecting. It was kind of bland and weird. Skip.

The pizza was so fresh and gooey and hot, literally right out of the oven to our table. I just had a small piece but the pizza was devoured super quickly by our table.

Service was so weird!!! Our server came by only twice and he wasn't very friendly. Like at all. Borderline rude. But the atmosphere was very cozy and I would love to return for a full meal someday.

Walked in at 10:00pm on Saturday night and had to wait 30 minutes for a table. The place was packed! The service was a bit slow and our waitress kept disappearing. We had to flag down other waiters to get silverware and water refills.

I thought the food was mediocre. We got the pork ravioli and fettuccine alfredo. The alfredo was a bit bland and we all kept adding more salt and pepper to try and make it taste better. I just wasn't impressed.

This restaurant has really great pasta and salad. The alfredo sauce they use is really good, like no other place I've been before. The only bad thing is that the pasta was a little tough to chew, because of how thick it is. Also the portions of the pastas are really small so be sure you do not come to the restaurant starving. The bread they give is a little hard to chew as well and the oil isn't the best tasting. The prices for the food are fair, so you don't have to break the bank.The setting of the restaurant is very nice and relaxing. I loved the staff, they were all very nice and helpful.

The process is a little confusing, but simple once you get it. We found out that they bring each meal seperately so you can share it. My wife order the Sausage risotto and I ordred the penne with vodka sauce. The vodka sauce was amazing and very flavorful. The sausage risotto was great too. Drop in if you are in the area. The place is inexpensive and the wine list is extensive. If you sit at the bar, ask for samples, they will be more than happy to make sure you have a wine you like.

Everything on the menu that we tried was absolutely amazing!!! The meatballs in pomadoro sauce was to die for!!! Made with organic tomatoes really comes thru in the flavor!!
I highly recommend the Moloqo Plus cocktail. An adult eggnog!!!
This is one of our go to places when family visits Chicago! Italian tapas that are tasty and fresh. During the day it's a great kid friendly environment.
The food here is really flavourful and inexpensive, they also have a pretty nice wine selection. It might be a little noisy inside specially on weekends so I would suggest sitting on the patio.

Had a great meal here!

First off, valet parking on the ONTARIO side of the street. Took me a couple of times around the block, but the boys in the green jackets and I eventually met up.

Excellent menu - Authentic Italian, some of the top in the city. Skeptical? All the waiters wear Italian soccer jerseys. If this doesn't silence your criticism, you may as well jump ship and work for Trip Advisor.

For as good as the meal was, the service was better. We ordered a few appetizers to get started, with some GREAT WINE. the 2013 Banfi Col di Sasso - smooth initial taste with a vibrant, sweet finish. Anyway, our server forgot to tell the kitchen to make our pizza. He felt awful, and immediately apologized. Furthermore, he brought us free lemon jello shots. They were so good - had I not drove, I would've gotten a few more. He also told us to give his name when we come next, and that he'd get us right in. Talk about customer Service.

Ultimately - one of my new favorite spots in the city. It can get a bit noisy - but, it's Italian!
Great place to brings friends for tapas and wine.  All seasons, great atmosphere inside and out.  Very consistent.

Service: I absolutely loved the service here, so friendly and always checking in to see if you need anything. Plates were cleared almost immediately after finishing with them. Drinks were received almost moments after being ordered.

Atmosphere: Weird little layout, we sat in the front porch area which is what we wanted (love people watching). Clean and very homey.

Food: Fantastic, my boyfriend and I split a lunch special which is a 3 course meal-all the things you love for $25-how can you say no? We split the Gorgonzola dolce to start, which comes with an apricot puree and a delicious raisin nut bread (don't quote me on the raisin portion). The cheese was served at room temperature and was divine-Gorgonzola's (or almost any cheese) is so much better at this temperature, can really appreciate the complexity and flavor profile of the cheese. We then split the burrata salad that comes with roasted beets and arugula-so refreshing and a great textural contrast. Finishing course was the house made tortellini with peas and prosciutto-the pasta was so tender and the snap of the peas really brightened the heaviness of the dish.

The next time we are in Madison, we will make a point of stopping again. Our tummies were full to the brim and the bill was less that $35. What a steal.

This place gets a 3.75 for food but a 10 for service!

Overall Food and drinks for this place were good and not anything superb! The price was cheaper than other restaurants we had been eating at and the environment and decor were amazing. The service more than anything was the reason why i'd come back!

My friend and I ordered a few items.
Half order of the meatballs
- Tasty and ate this with the bread they serve along with a little bit of the soup of top! It was perfect! I would highly recommend this.
Tortellini with Prosciutto
- Not my favorite dish. The pasta didn't come out hot at all and was only warm. The ricotta cheese inside the tortellini was thick and not soft or melted. I used the candle at the table to heat the pasta up a little so that it would taste hot.
Fennel and Tomato Soup
- This was some amazing tomato soup and I was shocked that I enjoyed this as much as I did.
Tiramisu
- WOW oh WOW oh WOW! This tiramisu was super super tasty and yummy! I am not a big sweets person normally but I know good food and desserts. This tiramisu was near the top for some great tiramisu that I've eaten.
Limoncello
- SUPER TASTY AND STRONG! Just the way I love it! Our server was freaking amazing and gave this to us for free!

Update:
Came back to Chicago again for halloween weekend and ate at this place again! This time we only got the pizzas and they were FANTASTIC! For the price and quality of food. this place is 100% legit! I highly recommend to anybody looking for a reasonably priced meal that will not disappoint.

Oh my goodness this place is fantastic. We came for a large party gathering up stairs. The food and drink started early and kept coming often. So delicious: 3 kinds of pizza, then a great antipasti platter, I had proseco, then two kinds of pasta followed by two fish dishes, then the meat chicken and beef. It was a lot of food followed by some the best Tiramisu I've ever tasted. It was a magical meal that demanded a nice evenings walk back to the hotel which turned out to be so pleasant and delightful. The staff here are so pleasant. And I loved the bathroom attendant. We, in California, don't see restroom attendants very often and I thought she was : a squirt of soap, hot water running and a towel, followed by a breath mint or stick of gum on your way out; delightful.

Wasn't terribly impressed.  Sangria was delicious.  Unfortunately, my brother and I both thought the food was particularly bland.  The short rib was nice and tender, just needs more flavor.  The tortellini with prosciutto and peas was alright, also bland tasting.  Shrimp risotto was watery and very bland.  Kind of disappointed.

The atmosphere is busy and loud, which was okay for us, would be a good place for a first date where there's action happening.  Great place to people watch.  I doubt I will return though.  Much better Italian food in the city.  Our server was friendly and outgoing, which is always appreciated.
Love this place! Has always been a fan love the chef. Went for a large group meeting years and everything including the service was 5 stars. One of my go to spots for late night bites and drinks

This place was packed when my date and I got here, and very loud as a consequence. It would be understandable if it was just busy, but every table is practically placed a foot apart. Frequently during dinner I ended up back to back with the person at the table behind me if I leaned back at all. It felt like a high school cafeteria with the noise level. My date's chair had an actual puddle of water in it when we sat down. To make up for it, the waitress comped our first round of drinks, which was great - she was a sweetheart and seemed to be trying her best with all the people. She had to step out of the way while taking our order multiple times because of how little room there was for people with plates to get past. The food itself was alright. Not amazing, not horrible.

So much could be improved, but nothing that could have been fixed immediately. They did end up taking $54 off of our check (we ordered drinks and three small plates), I think they saw how unhappy we were with everything. So I'm grateful for that.

Went back for a third visit, sat in the bar and went all out on small plates and wine. Everything was fantastic, totally redeemed from the so-so experience during my last visit. I really love how the wine is available by the 250ml/500ml/750ml/1L sizes, allowing us to try a nice spectrum of varietals/blends. Bartenders were helpful and friendly.

I had dinner here a couple of years ago during a visit to Chicago, and I visited twice last week while I was in town for a conference. I always sit at the bar, and the service has been great, even though they are serving drinks for a two-story restaurant. I had a pizza and polenta the first night, and gnocchi with arugula pesto the second. Neither were the best I've ever had, but the atmosphere, staff, service, and excellent wine selection made me a happy camper.

We really enjoyed Quartino for lunch! They had so many gluten friendly options. Not to mention super authentic Italian food! Everything from the menu to the champagne was absolutely amazing! We will be back!
Italian dining at its finest. Small plates to share with friends and family. Im a fan!

Made reservations for this place for a friend's birthday and found it a bit uncomfortable to have not been able to sit at our table until ABSOLUTELY everyone was there. Needless to say, I do not understand the point of making a reservation if we are not going to be seated until an hour and a half later.
Anyways, since we had a group of about 10 people we were seated in a little private area which made the overall experience a bit better considering we weren't in the busy crowd outside.
The limoncello martini is DELICIOUS if you love sweet and tart. I couldn't resist and needed to get another one. We went a little basic with our meal because we were in a time crunch due to the late seating and ordered a margarita pizza which was delicious. Cooked perfectly.
For such a large group, I am thankful that the servers were able to be attentive and nice to us.

Definitely worth coming back to this place again. If you come with a big group.. MAKE sure you all get there the same time. In general, no matter how big the group of people try making a reservation because there are always a ton of people waiting in the front area for a table.
One of my favorite places for pizza. The restaurant has also a very cozy feeling. I never feel rushed there regardless of how busy they are.

The service was okay but the food was less than mediocre. I got the Alfredo it tasted under cooked with diced chicken that looked super processed. I did have the espresso martini and that was excellent.
Lively atmosphere, great wine and cocktail list and delicious (but not outstanding) Italian tapas. Awesome for the gluten-free/vegetarians/dairy-free folks.
Excellent. Great gluten free options. Great service and everything we had was very good.

I arrived at 8pm. They said it would be a 30min wait for a party of 2.

Luckily we went inside and found seating at the bar. The bar isn't only the bar table, the random small tables to the right of the bar table includes the bar room. Full menus and amazing service.

The bread was so delicious. Soft and moist. Be sure to ask for vinegar because they don't give it to you unless requested.

The short rib was so small. It was very soft and the meat just melted in my mouth. The problem with this was that it was somewhat bland. There wasn't as much flavor as I had hoped. 6/10 on this

We also ordered the linguine with clams. The clams were awesome. Get the white rather than red. This was yummy. Extremely oily and greasy but good nonetheless. I don't think I would come back because it wasn't anything spectacular that I couldn't find in Los Angeles, CA but it's a good experience.

pics.caption: Short ribs. Very soft and tender meat

review.des: OMG. The food here is so delicious. The Fondue was so tasty - sweet apples and bread for dipping similar to pizza dough but better. The Green Salad was covered in fresh shaved Parmesan. We also enjoyed the spare rib which was marinaded well and very tender. The dessert consisted on Tiramisu, Vanilla Gelato and Doughnuts with chocolate and honey dipping sauces.

This is one of my spots in the city. There's usually never a long wait, the food is so delicious, and everything is so reasonably priced. The last time I went here was with some friends on a Friday night. Without reservations, we barely waited for a table. We got the bruschetta and burrata salad for appetizers. Both were good - the burrata was a little thick around the edges which made it hard to cut, but otherwise no complaints. We split funghi pizza, penne alla vodka, gnocchi, and a bottle of rose between 5 people for dinner and it was just the right amount of food. Everything was delicious but my absolute favorite is the funghi pizza. The tables are a little small and it's a little loud in there, but it's just part of the whole feel, so as long as those aren't deal breakers for you, I highly recommend checking out Quartino's if you haven't already!

Shocked by how down hill this place has gone! Or perhaps it was a bit of an off night? I used to bring out of town guests regularly for solid food and ambience.. found none of this last night. Rushed, uninformed and absentee waitress. She promised to return with an item that was missing/wrong on our charcuterie board and simply never brought it.  They were out of 3/4 things I tried to order. Many of our orders were either completely wrong, bad tasting or took an hour. Quality of food seems to have decreased majorly. I echo what others have said, for Italian food in chicago there are much better places to go!!

Great food, great service, great prices! What more could you ask for? This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. It's a perfect place to come with friends - tourists or locals - because it's fun and family style. You can't go wrong with any of the pasta or pizza dishes. The house wine is also priced very well and is very good! My one recommendation is to make a reservation a week or two in advance because this place fills up (for good reason!).

Great place, good food, very nice servers. Traditional Italian, wine by carafe, open until 2:00 for late night dining. Reasonable prices. They say the plates are small, but don't believe it when it comes to the pasta dishes, you'll go away full!

Prices were fare, but not cheap. Our waitress was very friendly, fast and when she was nowhere to be found her manager came by and helped promptly.

The food and desserts were very tasty and homemade (at least the sausage was) and my LaRossa beer was also very good.

There isn't a lot of room but there's enough and we were seated as soon as we walked in. We really enjoyed our visit and would visit again.

Enjoyed great drinks!
Polenta fries - awesome.
San daniele pizza - awesome.
Cavatelli - awesome.
Penne aka vodka - awesome.
Service - great!

Really nice Italian food with great service and friendly staff.
Ambience is a bit loud.

Quartino is great. Has reservations for 7:30 on a Saturday night. We waited just a little and then were seated. The staff is super nice and helpful, and the soccer jerseys on the waiters are a great touch. We got the polenta fries which were SO incredible. I highly recommend them!! We also got the stefano pizza which was really good too. One of the workers brought us their famous cheese to add on top of the pizza which added for a nice touch. It was a light dinner that tasted great. All in all, I definitely recommend the restaurant, and I think one dish plus a pizza is a perfect amount for two people. GET THE POLENTA FRIES!!

We came here on New Year's Eve. I had read all the raving reviews but decided I don't agree. The food was mediocre and the presentation was sub par. Service was ok. Waiters dressed in soccer uniforms. They could have dressed up for NYE.

We had
Calamari: eh
Caprese Salad: good
Bacon wrapped dates: terrible. Bacon tasted like plastic.
Frutti Di Mare: ok
Veal meatballs: good. best item
Flatbread (Margherita): good
On the simpler side in terms of Options and menu but the food was really good and really love the locale

Yesssss Quartino. Even though it's so close to Mag Mile, it's truly an Italian gem. Been here quite a few times and consistently loved the experience. Favorite dishes:

- Quattro Staggioni Pizza (omg could eat this whole thing)
- House Made Goat's Milk Ricotta (comes with fresh toasted bread, sooo good)
- Penne all Vodka
- Prosciutto wrapped Dates
- Wild Arugula Salad

The wine is really well priced, as is the food. And the food is truly DELICIOUS. You can't go wrong. Quartino is an amazing place to bring a group of friends/family as the small plates are great for sharing and you can really try a ton of the menu. It gets quite loud in here as the restaurant is massive, so that can be a little annoying. Otherwise, the food comes out fast and fresh and the service is great.

Quartino's is the BEST spot for a girls dinner. Let me explain:
- Get a few thin crust pizzas (all around $15)
- Get a few carafes of wine (the $10 ones)

And for the very low cost of about $30, you have a ton of food and drink per person. The carafes are about 3 glasses of wine. Get one for yourself. Don't worry about the judgement - it's fleeting.

Wanted to take my wife some place special for our Pre-anniversary dinner date and chose Quartino. We came here on time and were seated immediately. We were first given a small table which was good enough to place just glasses and glass water bottle, hence my wife requested a bigger table and we were offered one which was kind of them. The place was pretty loud and was crowded (it was Saturday night so not surprised). We ordered pizza, egg plant Parmesan, polenta fries, and the white bean and garlic dip. Of these the pizza was good, polenta fries was average and white bean dip was average. The egg plant Parmesan was not anything great, i have definitely had better. Though we were so full I wanted to get some desert to make us feel happy :P

So ordered the Torta al Cioccolato, which was like s scoop of venilla ice-cream on top of molten hot chocolate cake. That was really yummy and we both loved it. On the whole the place had great ambiance, great service, average food and great desert options.

we came here on a rainy Friday night and was so glad that they still had seats for two

we ordered a tasting salami platter, highly recommend it as you can try a bit of everything. we really liked the cheese and the salami, especially the truffle salami, it is very rich in the truffle taste. the olives are awesome too!

we also ordered the gelato in a cocktail glass, loved the chocolate flavor one!

One of my favorite meals while in Chicago! My friends and I sort of stumbled upon this restaurant and we were lucky enough to grab seats in the bar area. I love places that are sharing friendly and this restaurant is definitely that.

Red Sangria (4/5) - delicious and slightly sweet with bite size chunks of fruit  
Neapolitan Pizza (5/5) - I forgot which types we ordered, but we were able to get half and half two different types
Polpette al sugo di Pomodoro (6/5) - veal meatballs that are an absolute must get
Polenta Fries (4/5) - crispy and held together well when bitten into
Minestrone Soup (3/5) - average
Gnocchi (3/5) - passable
Tortellini (4/5) - prosciutto added great flavor
Shrimp Risotto (5/5) - shrimp cooked perfectly and all the flavors were delicious together

It's been awhile since I ate here, but my memory of the food here was great.

Amazing food and service! We will definitely return. So many food options for all ages. We were lucky enough to get a small room in the center of the restaurant for our party of 9. Love, love, loved it!

I've been here a handful of times, and I must say Quartino is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I love the Italian tapas style menu, where you can taste a bunch of small dishes and are not stuck with a huge entree.

Most recently, I took my mom here for a date night before we saw the Nutcracker. She loved it as well! We had a reservation for 5pm, but arrived 30 minutes early. We were seated right away, which was great for a Saturday night (the wait tends to get really long without a reservation). Our waitress was attentive and helpful. We started off with the quattro formaggi pizze, then ordered the tortellini (one of my favorites), potato puree (excellent), and the porcini & truffle risotto - which was too much food for us, but it did not stop us from eating 90% of it.

Overall, a great place for lunch or dinner! If you're going on the weekend, make sure you make a reservation to avoid the wait.
Awesome restaurant. Service and food were outstanding. Chris and Ian were both phenomenal!!  Thank you all for a great evening.
Amazing italian food! Tough for me to say because I am italian and rarely eat out for italian food. Pizza is amazing, service is great and any other food you order is bound to be good.

We made a reservation here about two months out for the night before the marathon. We arrived around ten minutes early and were seated right away. Our server was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive, but also allowed us to enjoy our meal and conversation without constantly checking on us. Food is meant to be family-style, but we found the portions to be small enough to enjoy each on our own. We did not care for the asparagus risotto, but both of our pasta dishes were delicious! Keep in mind that this is a true Italian restaurant - tables are close together and noise volume is loud as it's meant to be social like traditional Italian meals. We were glad we booked here and would recommend it!

The food at this restaurant is very good. The atmosphere is fun. They have a balcony that you can sit outside overlooking the street. It can be fun if the traffic is not too noisy. The night we were there there were all kinds of sirens and trucks. Very loud and obnoxious. The restaurant can't do anything about the noise. Just be prepared if you sit out there. The service is ok. But its important to understand that the food comes out of the kitchen when its ready. So your meal might be served right away, and your lady friend or your wife's meal might be served 20 minutes later. That's not a problem if you're sharing everything. But its a big problem if your date doesn't like what you ordered. She has to sit there and watch you eat. Not a great situation. I ordered spaghetti and she ordered pizza. She doesn't like spaghetti at all. So she sat there and watched me eat. When we asked the waiter about it he said "I thought you knew that". How were we supposed to know?  Pepperoni pizza was absolutely terrific. Spaghetti sauce was excellent. Meat balls in the spaghetti sauce were ok only. I make better meat balls and I'm not a good cook.
Wine was very good. They have an excellent Soave.

Aaaaaaaaaaaaammmmmmmaaaaaaazzzzzziiiiiiiiiinnnnnnn­nnggggggggg!

Date night with my husband.
Great atmosphere,  loved the vibe. A great place to go if you want to enjoy a great evening with good company.

I recommend the pizza, of course staff suggested it for me, but it was very helpful. I like that he was knowledgeable and informative, very polite. I will be back, the pizza was something different but definitely something to try.

I heard the pasta was amazing as well, I will have to  try it next time I go. And I do plan on going back soon.

Its good! We usually go there for group settings as its wonderful in accommodating Spain's dishes at its best. Its loud, always packed. Make a reservation on weekends unless you will come after 10:30 because yes they open late.

I had been wanting to come here for months, and on the first impression, I was kicking myself for not visiting it sooner!

Quartino looks every bit like restaurants in Italy, from the decor to the menu to the people working there. The main difference: the tapas style ordering. Honestly, I was confused by other reviewers on how to go about ordering, and looking around at other tables wasn't much help either! We ended up ordering two pasta dishes to share and then, still hungry, we ordered a third. But plus one dessert at the end, it ended up being too much for two people!

The good: I LOVE that this place is so gluten free friendly. Not only did they have gluten free pasta that could be used in any pasta dish, but a designated gluten free menu had more choices than I'd seen at possibly any Italian restaurant EVER. If pasta isn't your thing, there was a long list of gluten free meat dishes along with at least ten appetizers and five soup or salad options. Also, my boyfriend agreed with other claims that the tiramisu here is really darn good (although, confusingly, it's not on the menu!).

The bad: the service and quality on my one visit here was a little spotty. Our half-full water jug was taken away before we were finished eating, our silverware was cleared while we were waiting on another dish, and our waiter never followed up on more wine after we'd decided to do 1/4 liter "to start." Our first two pasta dishes were sloppily plated, with one vastly different in size than the other. The Alfredo one was yucky. Then, we waited for a solid 25 minutes for our third pasta dish, and our waiter was even confused as to why it hadn't yet arrived at our table. Also, the wine, while cheap, wasn't served with wine glasses which was just kind of weird.

Overall, I'd love to give Quartino another shot, but at $75 for two people, I think I'll have to save up a bit before I do. The quality of the experience just wasn't there for the price, so I'd be hesitant! However, it seems like it has great potential to be a date night spot or a fun spot for a group get-together.

The menu is great, and the staff is well versed in the food and drinks. I've been with large and small groups, but actually prefer larger groups because of the space. They really pack people in, which is really annoying because there's hardly enough space to get up. But if you're in a large group there seems to be a little more space.

The staff also sometimes seems to be going through the motions, likely because they have so many tables at a time.
Their vanilla gelato is Edy's double churned! We saw a worker run to the jewel next door to grab some. I think the food is ok, can get better in the city at this price point.

My friends and I were not impressed. I'm not sure if we just didn't get good dishes but the food was mediocre. We got the shrimp which was extremely shrimpy tasting. The veal meatballs looked almost raw, light gray in color, and didn't have much flavor. The pizza was ok. Our server was great and the place was packed the whole time we were there however our dishes were not something I'd order again.
This restaurant is a total dining experience. The food was excellent and the service was awesome! Aldo was our server and he was so great. Quartinos is on my to do list every time I come to Chicago.
The pasta dishes were amazing, the dessert was out of the this world (with home gelato) and the prices allow you to sample a wide range of menu option.

Quartino - is notorious for its distinctive Italian small-plates, awesome old school decor and a fun staff with a ton of buzz anytime, day or night. A great spot for a family dinner, date night or a fun Late night out with friends.

...and seats all through the bar, if you want to relax and enjoy a beverage before being seated. Or ask for the menu, pony up and enjoy! One of the best Bar atmospheres in Chicago.

What's a good Italian Restaurant without a Salumi and Formaggi plate (Meat and Cheese)! My go to is the Prosciutto San Daniele and the Soppressata a MUST! For the Formaggi  Gorgonzola and the Parmigiano Reggiano Vacche Rosse, WOW! Super fresh and Super Good!

Next we move on to the Roasted Baby Octopus...one of my favorites. I have eaten at Quartino every time I am in Chicago for YEARS and is always cooked perfectly, the spicy flavor is out of this world. I have eaten at some of the TOP seafood restaurants in the WORLD and by far this could be the best.

Time for the#1 at Quartino...The OSSO BUCO! I owned an Italian Restaurant and this was my BEST dish! It takes love to make a good Osso Buco and Quartino shows it.. and MORE! If you have to only try one dish, this is it at...

pics.caption: The Chef at his fave Late Night Eats in Chicago

review.des:
We were looking for deep dish... and this place wasn't it  On the upside, they still had really good pizza! We ordered 1 pizza to share between the three of us since it was 4pm in the afternoon and we weren't that hungry. We got the Stafano which didn't have any sauce, but had rosemary, mozerella, parmigiana, basil and spicy sausage. The pizza was really good. I love sauceless pizzas. The sausage was amazing! I think it was house made or something, but instead of little crumbles, they had thick slices of sausage. That was definitely my favorite part!

Overall, this is a bit of a nicer place. I'm pretty sure they expected us to order more, but it was a good heavy snack while we were here.

Quartino's small dishes make it a perfect date location or place to meet with friends. Order several of the dishes so you can sample a little bit of everything (think tapas, but Italian food!). Our favorites were the calamari, the margherita pizza, and the tagliatelle bolognese. They also have lots of creative sangrias, both white and red, in various sizes.

A little trivia for Bachelor tv show fans: Chris Soules and Whitney came here on her hometown date in Chicago! :)

My friend was really adamant about coming here, so we came here for dinner today. I was extremely underwhelmed. The tables were too close together and there was too many people packed into one place. There wasn't any room for people to walk around. However, I was pleasantly surprised by how we didn't have to wait for our tables.

I didn't, however, like how out of all the open tables in the middle of the room, the hostess decided to place us right next to the kitchen. Literally next to the kitchen. Someone in our group was continuously bumped into by the staff. He was pouring water into a cup when someone bumped into him, making him spill.

The food was also just okay. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't good. It's not worth the money or the hype. The pizza was too burnt on one side. The caprese salad came with 2 lumps of mozzarella cheese and 6 slices of tomatoes with some basil on top. The pasta we ordered was very...meh. The waitress specifically told us that the food was meant to be eaten family style... So we only ordered 3 dishes for 4 people. Those portion sizes were so small. She really shouldn't have told us it's meant to be shared. I probably will never come back. Ever.

pics.caption: The caprese salad. My friend took two tomatoes off before I had a chance to take a picture.

review.des: My favorite restaurant in Chicago. I have been here over five times and I have had great experiences every time. It gets busy but I tend to make reservations ahead of time to save the waiting time. I have walked in at peak hours and have been able to get a seat at the bar or at a high top table near the bar area. The restaurant is very large and can get parties in and out in a timely manner, so don't let the wait stop you. The food is delicious and affordable! I've enjoyed every option that I have tried on the menu. Despite it being very busy at dinner times I've always had a good experience with a server and no issues with food or service at all. The happy hour deals are great, too. I came here once in early summer last year and was able to sit on the outdoor patio on the second floor and it was so much fun! I love the atmosphere and the food is delicious. It's high quality food in a comfortable environment. Nobody is snotty or elitist. I can't wait to come back soon!

There are so many good restaurants in Chicago, and this is not one of them. Terrible food, terrible service, and a chaotic atmosphere led to an awful experience. I would highly recommend avoiding this place, especially if you are in a large group or if you value a clean environment.

Went there with 5 other people pretty cool place very big inside so expect it to be very loud and not quiet and romatic
Service was pretty ok sometimes slower than usual. Managers do come by and ask if we need anything so we ordered twice from the manager because no server around not a big deal.
Food was delicious lots of choices to pick from
Our table was very cramped 6 people and we were touching elbows no room to place all the food
Food 5*
Service 3.5*
Atmosphere 1* do to being extra loud and cramped space/no room
I will be back :)

Hate.  HATE!  H-A-T-E!

I suspect that this place might be "Hipster Heaven".  You decide -

1) Food was tasteless.  7 dishes ordered and I cannot even think of one that I would describe as "good".  Even the pizza was LIMP.  Mushroom risotto tasted like nobody had washed the dirt off the mushrooms.  "Baby octopus"?  How utterly gruesome.  Beet salad - why were the beets cut into paper-like strips?  

2) The noise level was utterly impossible.  They have no sound absorption whatsoever.  The place was loaded with bachelorette parties and they were screeching.  In a totally packed 2nd floor, there were like 5 men in the room.  Table after table of loud single women and their bachelorette parties.  OMG.  I could not even hear myself think, let alone chat with friends... which was the point of the visit.

3) Chairs - every uncomfortable.  Table - made round by flipping up side leaves. That meant that if we leaned in our our elbows, it tapered down.  

4) Waiting to get in - they over-book like crazy and don't have a good place to wait.  Even with a reservation, we stood like sardines for 20 minutes.  We would have left except people were coming in to meet us, including some having paid parking.  We did think about it though, wondering if there was any place to walk to together that might have had room.  We thought about going down the block to the old (wonderful) Su Casa.

5) Prices - dinner for 5 with tip was well over $200.  If the experience had been good - that would be fine.  But for a completely bad experience?  I'd have preferred to throw that money down a sewer.

The best Italian restaurant we have eaten, a wonderful place! We had a great time, Grace, the waitress was very nice and kind, we had an amazing Burrata, we definitely recommend this place , is a must in Chicago!!!

Top Highlights/Lowlights

1) gluten free pasta available
2) loud/energetic atmosphere
3) great service

We visited Quartino on a Sunday night right after the holidays. We made a reservation about three days in advance and man am I glad we did! Both floors of the two story restaurant were packed. The closeness and loud atmosphere is what we look for when we go out to eat (fun atmosphere!), but if you prefer a quieter dining environment this may not be the place for you. Our server seated us right when we got there and promptly got us menus and water. The theme of Quartino is essentially Italian tapas.

Our server got me a gluten free menu right away and the g free menu was quite impressive (especially for an Italian restaurant!). The g free menu had the "normal" gluten free things like cheese, salami, antipasti but also a gluten free fusilli (pasta) that could be prepared the same was as their normal pastas. COOL. We tried several of the tapas; the stuffed dates (AMAZING), asparagus risotto, caprese salad, gluten free fusilli with the sausage marinara, and broccoli rabe (spicy A F). The food was awesome and we loved that like a traditional tapas restaurant they brought the food out when it was ready so you can kind of graze the whole night.
Wine is purchased by the carafe. We did the half carafe and that was plenty for us!

I am definitely a person who loves to try new restaurants and rarely visits a place twice but I will definitely be making a second trip here.

Great tapas place. Was packed on a Saturday night. Sat outside upstairs and even though there is a "tent," still was chilly so tough to fully enjoy the meal. However, wine, pasta, brussel srpouts, spinach were GREAT, but I just got too full on the bread. I always seem to do that, silly me. But loved it here. Something about this place / italian food that is so relaxing, makes you want to enjoy the moment, sip on wine, take a few bites, and hang out for a few hours. :)

First night in Chicago, and we're looking for a restaurant that was still open. Decided on Quartino and we made it just before their kitchen closed. We had 5 minutes to order our food, so rushed into it, but I think we did pretty well.

We ordered the Margherita pizza. It was very good, and reminded me of New York's Grimaldi's. We also tried the Eggplant Parmigiana, which I thought was excellent. And then we had the Zeppoles for dessert.

Overall I thought the food was very good here. Service was nice too as they didn't rush us even though they were closing.

This was a great way to spend lunch. My wife and I stayed downtown for a couple nights just blocks away and decided to hit this place up for lunch on Friday afternoon. We weren't disappointed!

We enjoyed the prosciutto wrapped dates, beef short rib, and sausage risotto. All three were wonderful with the short rib being the highlight.

Cost was phenomenal! That is what put me over the edge of giving it a fifth star. For the two of us in this tapas style lunch it was $30. That can't be beat at this quality.

I've been to Quartino twice and I like it a lot. They offer a huge menu of affordable Italian tapas- come expecting to share food and leave picky friends at home. The vibe is trendy, service is good, but it's a little loud.

Food rundown:
Sopprestta and provolone cheese plate- really tasty and a good deal for the price. Served with unique garnishes. Definitely recommend picking a meat and cheese on the menu to start.

Orange and arugula salad- fruit was fresh and the salad was light, but it's probably not worth it. Save your money for more pasta.

Spaghetti pomodoro- meh. A sign of a good Italian restaurant is that the most simple dishes are incredible, and this one missed the mark.

Tortellini- really delicious. Definitely recommend sticking with their fresh pasta dishes. While it's heavy, I could have eaten a whole plate.

Profiteroles- big portion, high quality ice cream and chocolate syrup. Worth it.

Would definitely come back to Quartino again and again, but would look elsewhere if I'm in the mood for authentic, classic Italian food.

I came with my girlfriend on a Friday night and had a really great experience. We started with a small meat and cheese  plate. The soppresatta was especially delicious.

We shared the arugula salad. The orange slices and hazelnuts made for a very interesting flavor combo.

We had two pastas: the spaghetti and the tortellini. The spaghetti was just ok, pretty basic and probably not something I'd get again, but definitely not bad. The tortellini were bomb. They were served with prosciutto that melted in your mouth.

The waiter was a nice dude. Restaurant was very noisy, not somewhere I'd go for a first date, but it was a fun atmosphere.

I don't know what was more disappointing, the food or the service... both were equally bad. We arrived at the restaurant and were seated immediately, however we sat at our table for almost 20 minutes before even being greeted by our server. She came and "explained" the menu and didn't even ask our drink orders before turning around and walking away. We had to stop her and ask to place orders. 10 more minutes goes by, she brings our drinks and again walks away without asking for our food orders. An entire HOUR goes by before we get our food, my dish finally comes out but without my husbands food. 15 minutes after my food arrives, his finally comes out. Our drinks were empty the entire meal, our server never asked how our food was, if we needed anything after it was served. Instead she was too occupied by the table next to us that apparently was a group of her friends and making them a penis dessert. Yep, you read that correctly. Highly inappropriate and vulgar being the groups of families and children nearby in the restaurant. Probably one of the worst serving experiences I've ever had... and the food was pretty awful as well

If I could give Quartino 10 stars I would. My parents and I were in Chicago in July of this year for a Cubs game and after researching restaurants I made a reservation here. SO GLAD I DID. One of the best meals we have ever had. Started out with the Salumeria tasting which was an absolute delight. We chose roasted vegetables, cheeses, meats...the olives. Wow. They also brought out polenta sticks on the house - which was a nice surprise! My dad had pizza; mom ravioli and I had the spaghetti and added meatballs. Wine of course, was the perfect addition to the meal. Mom and Dad split dessert and I finished with a glass of Prosecco. And having to unbutton my pants. HA! Make a reservation for a culinary experience that is very similar to my Nona.

I love this place! The food is amazing! The concept of this restaurant is that everyone orders small plates to share. The pizza is great and so is the pasta. Make sure you also try their bread. The doughnuts for dessert are also fantastic!!

I see so many good reviews to this place that I had to go. Don't get me wrong, the food is great and the servers are too. This is definitely a nice place to go while downtown.

Would I recommend it? Yes
Is it the best Italian place I've been? No

First time I was here, it was a beautiful day and my friend and I were drawn in by the fabulous outdoor seating. Shared a pizza and the donuts for dessert and both were super delicious.

Went back again because I knew I had to try the pasta! Tortellini was sooo good and the caramelized gelato with biscotti was to die for.

Absolute perfect lunch spot - will definitely come again!

Tips:
-Pasta comes in half portions! (Super affordable and the perfect size with an appetizer and/or dessert)

Go for the pasta, seafood, and service!  We loved the gnocchi, one of their home made specialties.  Also, I'm not sure what they do to the mashed potatoes, but they are the best!  Large restaurant great for bit groups.  Bustling and staff running around quickly to get orders out.  My only complaint would be the pacing of the tapas.  Both times I've been they seemed to bring them out almost simultaneously when we specifically asked for a little room between each course.  Otherwise, love this place and will be back with a group of friends or family!

Our party of 6 dined here on a Sat night and it was hopping.  It was the night before the Chgo Marathon crazy pasta craving crowd I think.  The place has a cute outside patio area and two levels inside.  Decorated very old school Italian kitchen downstairs - upstairs becomes classic Godfather after dark with club music and lots of short skirts and stilettos.  Tables are close together, they really pack em in, and it's LOUD.  Which is one of the reasons why we chose Quartino, because we figured we might get loud and didn't want to disturb, nor offend.  We fit right in.  Our waiter was really nice and attentive.  

This place has small plates, so everything is meant to be shared.  I had heard a lot about the pizza so we def ordered one of those "the Stefano", and lots of other things like pappardelle, orecchiette, veal meatballs, porchetta wrapped dates, risotto, calamari, etc.  We would finish a couple plates passed and order a couple more.  We dined for a couple hours.  It was good, the standout was the pappardelle for sure.  We also had like 5 different desserts and those were a good time.  Favorite was the Gran Coppa Quartino and Coppa al Banana.  Delicious end to a great meal.

The bill for 6, no bottles of wine but plenty of drinks and lots of food was 333.00.  Not bad.

Delicious lunch time deal during the weekday! We got a nice lunch for $25 for 2 people. We started with veal meatballs (nice big portion in the white wine sauce with golden raisins that were very sweet and complimented the dish perfectly) and a 0.5 L bellini (very fresh and refreshing). For the pasta dish, we rooted for the one with lamb (forgot the name) and it was freaking amazing. The portion was huge for the tapas style and very cheesy. Last but not least, we had the dish with bread and an arrangement of seafood (octopus, clams, calamari, fish) and it was so yummy!! I dipped the bread in the soup and it's the italian version of tomato soup mmmmmm  getting hungry as i type this tbh
Average food, the chicken was terrible last time I ordered it. The drinks are pretty good

In my experience, the bigger your group, the better your evening. I went with 1 other couple the first time and 8 other couples the second time. The service and food were better the second time. I'll probably be back at some point. No matter when you're there, it is super loud and busy. I showed up and had a drink at the bar which was more chill, so I dug that.

Biggest complaint: the bathroom attendant in the ladies restroom. Please don't have that service. Millennial complain about it every time they come back to the table. It's uncomfortable because I feel bad for the women who do it and I don't want to pay to be handed a towel when I can get one myself. I would've given this place 4 stars but the bathroom attendant knocked it down.

The place has a nice Italian feel. A good ambience and decent quality food. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Some of the dishes are really good and others decent. They have a good selection of wine. Go for the ambience, wine, food is good(can be better)

We've been going to Quartino weekly for a few years now.  The food is amazing and underpriced.  The service has always been exceptional.  Liz, our server, knows us by name and remembers our favorite orders!!!

The steffano pizza, pork shank, salmon, shrimp, and sausage risotto are my favorites ;)
Delicious food, great Italian small plates to share.

We had reservations, but still had about a half hour wait because our table wasn't ready yet- which can happen anywhere.  Understnandable.  It would have been more tolerable had there been somewhere to stand out of the way and wait, but tis Chicago.  The place was absolutely packed, we stood in the entry/foyer area by the hostess stand because they call your name old school style and we didn't want to miss our table.  Would have been nice to get a text when table is ready or pager system.  They had a few large groups so that probably added to the crowd or that's just how this place always is.  The hostess was gracious and made rounds to everyone waiting assuring them they weren't forgotten about which I thought was a nice touch.  She was also able to snag us a complimentary bottle of champagne for our group and an awesome mocktail for my pregnant friend. I've had long waits at other restaurants and I'm happy enough for an apology or updated ETA.   I thought this was a nice and classy touch but not going to sway me to go somewhere should the food absolutely suck or something along those lines.  

They didn't have wine glasses; I hate drinking wine out of a regular glass.  I get that you're trying to be trendy, but that's wine 101 to get optimal flavor.  I did like their wine pricing- they do glasses, carafs, liters, etc.  All are proportional and you don't get a discount for larger quantity, meaning you can order multiple different wines and not be penalized that you didn't stick with the same one and order a large vat of it.  Dishes were moderately priced, some tasted better than others.  The pappardelle al sugo di manzo was a hit with the entire group.  The gnocchi was a little bland tasting, needed a stronger sauce or more seasoning or something.  The eggplant parmesan was mushy and had-dare I say it-too much cheese.

From the night I arrived in Chicago and randomly stumbled in here on a Sunday night, I clearly new this would be one of my favorites in Chicago.

Did Al Capone eat here at some point? Maybe, it certainly looks like he should have judging by the ambiance.

The tapas style entrees are awesome. I had duck prosciutto, mortadella, caprese salad and pizza. Not all at once of course! The portions are pretty solid, so don't over order. Everything was delicious and top notch. Lots of Italian wines on the menu to pick from also. On weekdays, the place is fairly busy, so id recommend a reservation. In either case, I don't think the wait will be overwhelming. Can't comment on weekends though.

By the way, this is a great date night spot. Laid back, alive and not overwhelmingly loud.
Gnocchi flavor is lacking but texture is good.   Cavatelli is much much tastier and awesome texture.  Also the Stracci was tasty!

Came here with a group of 10 and they placed us in our own little room, which was great for 10 loud girls, but not great for service. We ordered two large pints of the house wine, and ended up ordering two more about half way through our meal. We had both red and white, and for the cost, it was both delicious and cost effective. About half of the group ordered pizza and the other half entrees. One of the girls ordered salmon and received it about 10 minutes after we ordered. However, our pizza did not show up for about another 30 minutes. The pasta dishes did not show up for about 15 minutes after our pizza. It was really awkward because one of the people in the group  did not receive her food until almost everyone else in the group was finished, even though she had ordered the same dish as other individuals at our table. I ordered the Campania Pizza and really thought it was delicious. I really enjoyed the food, but I think the service just really lacked.

I was worried, as I hadn't eaten at this Italian restrauant.  Well the whole evening was spectacular. It's different a party of 2-4 being fabulous and forty to fifty being wonderful. Our room upstairs was cozy and welcoming.  A bar was set up for our group so there was no waiting.  The food was just breathtaking, it was all hot and plenty as they kept bringing out more dishes. Roberto was in charge of our party and deserves a ten rating.  He made sure everything kept roll along smoothly.  Roberto got me microphone to use for my speech, he asked about any special drinks that were ordered before getting them, and he found a prop I needed and left behind at the hotel. This was the best Italian food I have had in Chicago,  I have tried many.
Really great pasta all around. Tried the linguini with clams, eggplant parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs - all freshly made and really well done.
Not a place to linger.  Food is OK but it wasn't great.  Not sure why all the ratings are so high, the wine as well priced. Maybe it was just our selection of food?
So tasty! I had the Penne al la Vodka and it was delicious! The serving staff was great too! Absolutely would recommend!
I love this place. The food is always good and the service is perfect. One of my favorites restaurants in Chicago

Stopped in this local looking place while shopping in Chicago to get a late afternoon bite. What a find !  The staff were great and our bartender Rob very friendly and  personable.  My Old Fashion was made to perfection and our pizza was delicious.  One thing you HAVE to try is their house made grapefruit cello!  It's terrific!

I was slightly disappointed in this place. I mean the food was good but I thought the service was just not very good. Like we had a waiter but we didn't see him most of the meal. Like the kitchen people brought out the food and served it, so trying to order more drinks or more food was difficult.

We were seated about 30 min after our reservation to a table for 4, when we had 5 people. We had to ask for a chair for the 5th person as the host didn't even notice we had 5 people...they brought the chair never brought silverware or anything.

We were able to wait at the bar before we were seated which was very crowded. They have some small tables that have a waitress and you can order the full menu I believe.

Anyways the food was good. Besides the chicken, that was a little dry.   We also ordered the Bruschette, Dates wrapped in Pancetta, (which were never brought to us and we had to ask some random waiter, as ours was MIA most of the meal), Carpaccio, Brussle Sprout Salad, Penne Alla Vodka, the Chicken and the Salmon. It was shareable plates but things like the Salad, Bruschetta, and pasta were a little hard to share, so I would order 2 if you have more than 4 people, and are not ordering as much as we did.  We also got the hot chocolate cake for the birthday girl which was actually amazing.

There was a ton of larger groups here, so they are good at accommodating that. I also was told they deliver so that's good. I would go back eventually, just service last night was not that great, (I will give the benefit of the doubt, it being the 26th, maybe they were under staffed). There are just so many other Italian restaurants on my list to try, I am not jumping to get back here.

LOVE THIS PLACE.  every food option is great-- would definitely recommend coming in a group so you can try a variety of options since it is served "family style" where they bring out the food when it is ready.  Reasonably priced for the area and quality of food.

Solid 4 stars for amazing service + quality food.
You really can't go wrong with dining here. Our pastas met our expectations and everything was affordable! We needed to dine somewhere quick because we had somewhere else to go within an hour and we made it out in time although it was during dinner time :)

pics.caption: Orecchiette, sauce was good but not a big fan of the pasta shape/texture.

review.des:
W.O.W! Eat here. Done here. Experience here. Our server was literally the best ever. He was funny, patient, quick and accommodating. He literally took on the table of 7 tourists and guided us through the menu to have us sample delightful bite after bite. He even had the chefs make us Carbonara, not on the menu and it was some of the best I've ever had.

Some things of note: the meatballs and the goat cheese ricotta cheese spread. So beyond delicious. Add a little pepper to the cheese spread.

The polenta fries were ok but paired with their red pepper sauce and they went from ok to how many can I eat?

The tomato soup was not what I expected but it had flavor for days and I could not stop eating it.
The wine red or white was perfection and free flowing.
Loved this place. Every employee rocked and really made the experience for us.

Our favorite Italian restaurant in town. Portions are perfect size, so you're able to eat and share perfectly. The San Danielle pizza is amazing and the ravioli is awesome. If the restaurant is full you can have the full meal at the bar as well.

I don't know why I haven't reviewed this before since I've been frequenting this place for the last 3 years! A solid staple in my book!!!

Atmosphere: I wouldn't come here if I were claustrophobic. Definitely a lot of tables squeezed together. Also, it's quite loud at its busiest.

Price: Fairly reasonable for the location and food. Pizzas are $10-16 which is enough to feed 2. Tapas style plates range from a $5-20.

Food: I've had probably 1/3-1/2 of their menu options and for the most part, I've enjoyed all of the courses. The pizza is NOT deep dish and comes with many different options. You can do half and half on the pizzas too!!! Pastas and other dishes are also yummy. Tiramisu is a secret dessert item on their menu. Their lemon ice cream sandwich type dessert is also yummy!

Ate outside which was nice, extremely loud inside. Food was fantastic. Best linguine with white clam sauce I've had in a long time. Bolognese was excellent as well. Will definitely make this a regular stop on our visits here.

Absolutely delicious! This place is huge but reservations are definitely recommended. Prices are very reasonable too. I like Quartino because it's a great place for a big (and I mean BIG group i.e. 18 people) or just a table for 2. It is tapas but the portions are quite large. I reccomend the salads, pizzas, and you must must MUST get the braised pork shank!
Service is great too!

Fun ambience! Love the space. It has the old, classic mixed with the modern quality.
Also, this place is great for groups, all their small plates are meant for sharing, so you can get multiple plates of antipasti and share them among friends.
Friendly waitor, great service.
Eggplant parmigiana is a must- so delicious!

Good food, service, nice place. Casual, small plates to share. Veal meatballs for appetizer, great taste perfect for sharing. Fresh basil. Had Tuscan sausage risotto for entree, it was great. Bottle of wine followed by cappuccino, nice casual dinner.
Excellent late night eats! Food was amazing, Pasta, pizza and coffee! Service was excellent. Cannot believe I've never been. Love the tapas for Italian food..

Awful experience last night. Booked an 11pm reservation and ordered a few items and wine for the table. Before we sat down, we asked the hostess what time the kitchen closed so that we could be respectful with ordering/paying our bill - she says 1am for full menu, 2am for pizza, restaurant closes at 3am. We ate and paid our bill just before 1am. At 1am, the busser started making hand motions to our table and pointing to the door. He was visibly annoyed that us and about five other tables were still in the dining area (even though they serve until 2am). After he did this 3 times, we asked him what time they closed, he repeats that they close at 3. We explained that we paid our bill and were just going to finish our wine before leaving and there was no need to make weird gestures at us. He rolled his eyes, returned to the bus area, points  and laughs at our table with his coworkers and manager. Really uncomfortable experience. I've been to Quartino's 10+ times but will not be back after this experience. Super rude and unnecessary end to a great night. There are plenty of places on the same block that have everything Quartino's does without the condescending attitude.
Really good food especially if you are vegetarian. The service was amazing aswell. One of the best trendy late night food in Chicago. Def recommended!

Quartino is a great restaurant if you are looking for an authentic Italian cuisine experience. The food will satify any level of hunger since the choice of making your dish small or large is available. I recommend keeping the bread made in house coming to your table as they have great balsamic vinegar and olive oil to pair your bread with. If you are looking for spice ask for the spicy oil. The dishes are so delicious but don't have too much of a variety which is the only reason i wont rate this place a 5 (4.75 XD ). Overall though Quartino is one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago. Come in and not only enjoy the food but the italian film playing throughout the restaurant, the italian soccer jerseys, and candlelit dinner/lunch. Miguel (#9 Icardi inter Milan) was an amazing server so attentive, Gratzie.

Horrible service,  Food is not good at all.
The food runners literally slam the plates in front of you so rudely.

Quartino is Italian small plates. You get multiple dishes and share them among friends. You can also large carafes of wine (the wine we chose was $20/liter).

We went to Quartino with a group of 7 girls. Our server was super friendly and greeted us quickly. He came by often so we could order multiple rounds of small plates. Service was attentive. We always had water and bread even though the restaurant was full of lots of people celebrating.

Everything we ordered was very good. We had bruschetta, tortellini, wine, eggplant Parmesan, pizza, dessert, and more. Our server made great recommendations and helped pick out special things for our group.

I thought that my dinner was reasonable. It was $30 including tip and alcohol and dessert (we even had house made Limoncello- very good).

My only compliant is that the restaurant is very loud. It was difficult to hear the people across the table, and I like to be able to talk to my friends over dinner.

I would get reservations here and get the margarita pizza! Yum!

I've been to Quartino a handful of times now and it never disappoints.

1/2 liter of wine, some cheese/salami, Rucolina Pizza, salad, and their off-menu TIramisu all for under $80 including tip = great deal.  

the menu is all share plates and the food comes out at a good pace.  Great place to go for a dinner with friends or family.
Every time I go here the food is great and service is great. Good drinks love the Negroni.

I love this restaurant...I told the waiter right away that it was my favorite downtown and brought my friends from Wisconsin here to test it out...I was so disappointed with the service though...the waiter didn't come back to our table and we had to ask another lady for more bread and when we said thank you for the bill he just walked away...food delicious but service not so good

I've always like this place and still do for the service. Have tried a few things and have to say not that impressed with the food. However the service is awesome.
I've tried the asparagus risotto before and that was not impressive.
So this time we ordered the charcuterie for 2. The plate was huge and pretty filling. Couple of cheeses with apricot jam. Surprisingly great combination. Chopped Beets, salami, prosciutto, eggplant pate, olives, raising bread, and something else which I can't remember. It was pretty filling. We also ordered the gnocchi with pesto sauce. Big disappointment. Gnocchi was  okay but the pesto has no taste and was borderline disgusting. I think it was just ground basil they forgot the pine nuts.
The place was super crowded on a snowy Saturday. But not sure I want to keep dealing with mediocre food even though I desperately want to love this place for the friendly ppl and great service.
We had lunch here and enjoyed it immensely. The serving sizes were just tight for sharing a few dishes. The waiters were excellent and the food was very tasty. Highly recommend it.

This is a consistent place where I have enjoyed many of the classic Italian items on the menu. Great pizza and pasta.  Very nice bar area to enjoy a cocktail. The cheese platter is delicious. Service is prompt. Can be noisy but definitely worth a visit.

Quartino provided a great atmosphere and fantastic food. I imagine it is difficult to get in here during the dinner rush as we sat down at 10 PM and still required a reservation, not to mention all the tables were still very full.

The wine pricing and selection offers diners an easy avenue for trying and sharing wines to appropriately pair with the various tapas you inevitably order.

As someone with italian heritage who equally loves tapas-style eating, Quartino perfectly fit the bill! The menu options are great and it truly appears you cannot go wrong with whatever you order. Personally I drooled over the osso buco and the octopus the most. The meatball sliders were delicious. The penne vodka was okay, I think the sauce was a little weak, so I would not recommend that dish specifically (however, I am pretty biased because I make a killer vodka sauce).

I would DEFINITELY eat here again.

I've been to Quartino's dozens of times. I love their food; plenty of options, they're consistently delicious and reasonably priced. I love the option of wine by the quartino; we can try more of them! Great place to go for groups. It can be a little loud downstairs. For those with hearing difficulties, see if they have availability upstairs or outside. Excellent service; our wait staff has always been helpful, friendly and fun. They offered many suggestions to us when we were new, but now we know the whole menu. :)

One of my favorite dishes is the broiled octopus; it's tender and not too chewy. Difficult to find a place that does this well.

For those in the know, ask if they have tiramisu. It's not on the menu, since they make only a pan or two, fresh each day. If they're out, the rest of their desserts are interesting and delicious, too. Enjoy!

Love the food, always a good time when I stop by, I have dined here a couple times and celebrated a birthday as well. I always sit in the bar room area. Very nice interior and service. I appreciate the samples I've been given while there. Adds a nice touch to the experience.

Underwhelmed were we. Two on a balcony overlooking the boisterous street below on an Autumn in the summer, a Saturday's eve.

Since we'd been drink hopping, we were hungry but willing to share plates.  For mentions sake; we got the Manzo pizza with braised beef short rib, gorgonzola fonduta, roasted fennel and walnut pesto.  The braised beef aspect was tasty but that's where the buck stopped for me..  We also ordered the gnocchi (potato dumplings, green beans, potatoes, & arugula pesto), which my friend stated, tasted off.  She'd been on a trip to Italy and still reminiscent of the many fantastic flavors experienced overseas.  Although my Italian is limited to American restaurants, I too thought the gnocchi was pretty average.  My last time having gnocchi was at Frasca and they outdid themselves.  It had some kind of roasted pumpkin and a brown butter sauce which elevated it to the highest levels.  

Back at Quartino, food was alright but we couldn't see returning.  This is a popular intersection and I imagine rents are pretty high, which explains the extravagant cost of food and drink.  
And to think, the only reason we came was because of an recommendation from a host at SideDoor.  SideDoor has got some great drinks and plates but I can't imagine why he sent us here? It's so.. "chain-like"..

Been there a million times! Great menu with large selection for any kind of mood. It's open late, food is delish, there is always something good to try from the wine list, and you get the best service at the bar! Today tried a charcuterie platter, and it was amazing. Their pizzas hit the spot all the time. Beef medallions and potato puree will satisfy your hunger, but that chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream will take you to heavens!

Easy meal at the bar during my short visit to Chicago.  Came after 9pm and atmosphere was still lively without needing to wait for a seat.  Bartender was attentive.  Many great cocktail options and everything sounded delicious.  My top picks were polenta fries, gnocchi, tortellini, and the shrimp.  Opted for less expensive white wine sangria and my favorite tortellini.  Was not disappointed.

pics.caption: Tortellini with alfredo sauce and prosciutto + white wine sangria.
