review.des: Great place - like the earlier reviews state - its like tapas for Italian food. I went here once with a friend who knew the staff - so we were treated very well. The food was great. A little bit on the pricier side but its worth to try.
I liked Quartino, however I did feel it was a little over priced for the portions. I think I will likely go back to try other dishes as the pasta was excellent.

Great place! Very affordable and quality without being pretentious. As authentic as it can be.
The pizza is Neapolitan style which is my favorite pizza. The wine selection is inexpensive ( of course, you could also " Barolized" yourself and spend all you want, but I suggest to explore the garage options. Pasta were all al dente and smaller portions so you can order a few. Service was very fast, but professional. I'll be back when in the area.

In a city with so many great Italian options it can be tough to choose the right place to go, and continue to revisit. I think I found that in Quartino. It is extremely busy so make a reservation, especially on weekends! You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and it is encouraged to share plates. Our server was super friendly and knowledgeable, without being overbearing. The food and wine are affordable without sacrificing quality. I can't wait to go back again!

A surprisingly small food bill, but we blew the budget on liquor. Our 4-top ordered the Salumera tasting which is a great item permitting you to mix and match cheeses, salumera (the meat stuff), spuntini (the veggie things) olives, etc. Almost a meal in itself for the group (well not quite), it satisfied both the meat lovers and the vegetarian-inclined at the table. To this we added the shaved salad, house-made pappardelle, polpette (veal) and roasted baby octopus. All good, well maybe the octupus was a bit tough, but worth trying. You want pizza? Go to Due's and shut up. OK, we were seduced by the grapefruiticello, limoncello ("We make our own limoncello") and espresso martini's and then had to order another round after tasting each other's drinks, plus a decent pour of a shiraz. So, yeah, $84 for liquor and $60 for food. But we left happy and stuffed.

I was surprised. I am so completely jaded by most restaurants. And then walking into Quartino's in the heart of tourist Chicago, as a local I was not expecting much value or anything that wasn't over-salted. Service was attentive and even personable. The 1st floor room was loud (about 85dB - yes I have a sound meter app) but it registered more lively than lean-in-I-can't-hear-you.
Great restaurant . Lively crowd with traditional Italian options . We love the pizza as it is thin and very tasty. Nice friendly service in a great part of town. We go often and love the restaurant .

Love the variety and the pizza is stellar!

The RUCOLINO PIZZA is thin and the dough has a nice crunch then chew. Loved it. Very light cheese and sauce, with the dominant flavor being the arugula on top. Definitely needed some salt, but other than that, it was perfectly light and satisfying.

The TALLEGIO cheese plate was weird. While I liked the cheese a lot, the apricot purée and cranberry walnut bread was too sweet. Fortunately, the regular bread that's served with oil and vinegar upon being seated was still there, so I used that bread instead.

EGGPLANT PARMESAN was disappointing. Wayyyyy too much cheese melted on top of very thick slices of eggplant. It might be fine for many people, but I found it to be clunky

Husband also ordered the first SHRIMP dish with white wine sauce. The flavor was good but the shrimp were over cooked and tough.

Service was very good and lively patio atmosphere was perfect.

pics.caption: Shrimp with Pinot Grigio, lemon & olive oil
Tallegio Cheese with apricot purée and cranberry walnut bread

review.des: Pro tip: per-order the tiramisu for dessert.  It's not on the menu but it's AMAZING, as is everything else we ordered.  The gnocchi was my personal favorite: the braised ribs, veal meatballs, caprese, dates, and calamari were all delicious.  Definitely returning the next time I'm in Chicago!

I have been here a few times and have always had great food/drinks. First off, the restaurant is huge inside and is always packed! Great place to host a birthday dinner, the tapas style sharing is perfect for a large party or a small party. I honestly cannot remember what I have ordered from here because I've tried pretty much every dish, however, everything is good. The only downfall is the front desk gets overwhelmed when it's busy and they can mix up reservations, which creates longer waiting times. Other than that, this is a great place to visit if you go to the city.

I've been here twice and I have to say the first time blew me away, the second time was just ok. The duck prosciutto is an absolute must try thought! Eggplant Parmesan is delicious, very good marinara sauce. The first time I went and had pizza it was one of the best pizzas I've ever had. This time it left much to be desired. The desserts are not terrible but not great. Servers are generally pleasant. Overall I would give it another try, but not anytime soon.
Great place for traditional italian food and pizzas. The short rib pizza is delicious and the salads go really well with the pizzas. I would recommend this restaurant for a group.

- Beyond expectations -
Dropped in with a small appetite this place was perfect

Most dishes can be split into 1/2 portions.

The ravioli was excellent

Service was friendly helpful and fast

Tiramisu was perfect and plentiful even with a 1/2 portion.

Recommend Will as the bartender he will take care of you!

Would definitely come back!

Was here for a dinner for a friend who is moving away. The tears werent from sadness but more from being stuffed! So much amazing food! The fondue was amazing, meatballs were great, mushroom risotto, eggplant parm! We ordered so much I cant remember it all. Definitely a quality Chicago staple for Italian if you havent been!

I love the ambiance at this restaurant! This is a great place to have dinner and drinks with a group of friends. It's loud with a always a fun crowd. The food options are spectacular, and wine selection is very nice!

I've been here a few times now and have never been disappointed by the food. They have a great selection and I always love a place that starts you off with a basket of bread! My only dislike is that it can get a little pricey and loud, but it's great for a night out to celebrate something!

I love going here especially in the winter since it's so cozy and easy to get to from anywhere downtown. Definitely worth checking out!
This is a great place to go with a large group so that you can order lots of items off the menu and share plates. Definitely get a carafe of wine for the table & save room for dessert!

I loved this place. The service was awesome, very professional and focused on providing a great experience. I had one of my now favorite drinks, nautical nature I think was the name of the cocktail. The Bolognese was supreme as well as the frutti di mare, with a good balance of flavors. But I had to make a reservation, so, keep that in mind if you are going for dinner.

Oh my goodness. Authentic Italian food galore. My fiancé and I came here on a Saturday night thinking we would have to wait awhile since there were crowds outside (always a good sign), but we were seated right away! For those who are gluten sensitive like me, the gluten free pasta is absolutely mouth-wateringly delicious and we enjoyed every bite of our meal! I'm taking off one star just because of the long wait for the pasta (over 30 minutes), but it was overall a very delightful experience with our waiter checking in on us constantly. Highly recommend!
Amazing. Just great pasta and service. Fabulous house wines. It's probably one of my favorites in the city. It's certainly a Chicago staple.

A group of us were in town for business, but when in Chicago, you know there is phenomenal food all around. So we felt confident that we'd find something awesome - Quartino didn't disappoint!

Aldo was our server, and we fell in love with him right away. Who knows the food better than the staff, so we gave him a few ideas of what we were looking for and had him order for us. Great choice!! When you're open to opportunities, magic can happen.

Also, get a cannoli. They aren't on the menu, but they are heavenly.

I feel that I must preface this review: I saw Quartino through the NYC lense.

With that being said, the place wasn't too bad. Very large, nice venue. Serves up tapas style plates to share and a huge (DOC) wine selection to wash things down with. Not bad, but not as good as I'd hoped.

The service is a little slow and becomes less prominent once your order is placed. Our waiter promised that "the food comes out very quickly" but that wasn't the case. We finished two loaves of bread before our first pasta dish came out.

Wine is by the glass. Even if you order a pitcher (serves 4) or a bottle (serves 3) the price nets out the same. Our wine came a little corked. Our waiter was barely stuck around to ask us about it so we downed it anyway.

The dishes are okay. They weren't Lydia Bastianich but they also weren't Chef Boyardee. The quality was good but the flavors were closer to the meh-meter for us.

I was organizing a group dinner for 20 college students at Loyola, and was looking for a place where we could eat affordably and the food was good quality. Quartino was the perfect choice. Valerie the catering manager was very responsive and helped me preset a menu, even though we were just eating in the restaurant and weren't paying any extra. At the dinner, the waitstaff was very friendly and did not seem to mind having to deal with 20 outgoing students. We ordered a variety of pizzas and salads, we especially liked the funghi pizza and the kale salad. I would highly recommend using Quartino for a large dinner, they are very on the ball.

The food was great! Service was ok - super long wait even after being seated!
But I like that it's open late.

We were visiting Chicago and had eaten at Giordano's (for the sake of the popularity of it) but the next day we were walking around and ended up starving - went to two other nearby pizzerias which both had 90+ minute wait times, so we ended up here and got a table in the bar with no wait. The bruschetta was delicious and I had the best fettuccine Alfredo of my life. The white sangria is delicious also!

Our server, Derrick, was AWESOME!

He helped me pick out an awesome dish that the kitchen would make vegan and he recommend a great wine to pair with the dish.  The portions and prices were a lot better than we expected so that's always a great surprise.

I will bring my friends and family here for years to come!
So yummy!! I'm officially obsessed with the Eggplant Parm, it's the best! This place would be perfect for a date night, a romantic dinner, or a group of friends. I'll definitely go back!
Recommend going straight to the bar if you don't have any reservations and grab any table. Amazing, delicious pasta! Order the meatball sliders

This review is very belated... I came here with my college girlfriends (about 9 of us) around a year ago. It was the perfect place to share plates and consume massive amounts of wine! The food was pretty good. Service was not the best. The restaurant is super tight inside so getting around is tough, which might somewhat explain why our server wasn't very timely. Ultimately it was a great spot for a girl's night out.

Great organic choices, delicious food and not ridiculously expensive. It was so good, on our trip to Chicago we went twice so we could try more of the offerings. Really really nice atmosphere, great service, and to top it off, outrageously wonderful desserts.

Favorite place for italian tapas. They have larger items too, but we like getting small portions. They have excellent fun atmosphere. This place is good for groups, they take reservations too. My Go-To spot for parties, meals before going out, and last minute dining that I want good food but didn't get a reservation in on time. They are open late too.

Fried calamari was cooked perfectly! Not cheat and over cooked, I could really feel the texture and sweet flavor of the calamari. Get the hot chocolate cake with vanilla gelato, it's delicious!

The pasta, sauces, etc. are freshly prepared in-house. The fettuccine alfredo is really tasty. My husband got the tagliatelle and he wasn't a fan, so they let him switch to a different dish. The prices are awesome and the wait staff is great as well. We will be back next time we are in Chicago.

This place has a great atmosphere and good Italian food. There's lots of options for outdoor seating but it gets pretty packed so definitely make a reservation. It's tapas style so the dishes are small and meant for sharing. Fun for a big group of people.

I read a bunch of reviews before going to this restaurant and expected the pastas to be very good but honestly, the  pastas did not live up to the hype.  Also, the portions were not very big. However, I might give the place another try.

Tapas, Italian style!

This was our first time at Quartino's, and it certainly won't be our last. We were seated at a small table in the room that fronts State Street. The room was dark, cozy, and intimate-the perfect ambiance for our date night. I suggest trying to get a table in here! It's better than the main dining room, in my opinion.

We started with the dates wrapped in pancetta, delicious. Next was the wild arugula salad. It wasn't bad, but I was a tad underwhelmed. I was hoping there would be more farro. We then had the duck prosciutto. The prosciutto itself was great--salty and savory. It was served with a small pickled vegetable salad that was overly spicy and honestly, unnecessary. The shrimp dish was good, but the shrimp was overcooked. They weren't tender, as shrimp should be.

Now onto the highlights of the meal: pasta!! We had the tortellini and the orecchiette. The tortellini was served with Alfredo, parmesan, peas, and prosciutto and was literally to die for. It was clearly the highlight of the meal and one of the best pasta dishes I have had in quite some time. The orecchiette was served with a fennel sausage ragu and complimented and contrasted the tortellini well. Also, the pasta dishes here are quite large. I would say they are more entree sized than tapas sized.

And then dessert. If you are going to get only one dessert, get the Gran Coppa Quartino. I'm assuming it's what they're known for. It's vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate gelato served in a martini glass with fresh berries and a giant biscotti. It was fantastic and the presentation was beautiful. We also ordered the zeppole. The zeppole was good, but it's a huge portion. I think it came with eight pieces.

My only complaint? They pretty much give you shot glasses for your wine. If I'm spending money on wine, it has to be able to breath!

Had a great experience while I was in Chicago for a wedding.

Sat at the bar ordered a couple different things and had a couple drinks. The waitresses were all kind. Bar tender gave some good food suggestions.

Overall A+

I wanted to like Quartino more than I did. I'm hovering between 3 and 4 stars, but to be honest, they're more like 3.25 stars, so I gotta round down!

First and foremost, if you want to come here, make a reservation, even if it's a weeknight. My sister and I visited on a weeknight and the entry area was chaotic with people wanting to get a table and the place was hoppin'. We were definitely glad to be in the minority of people who actually made reservations.

Our service was friendly, but spotty. We each ordered the tomato soup to start, but they brought them out one by one, so that my sister was almost done with hers by the time mine arrived. That seemed really odd. The soup was really good with nice chunks of tomato floating in a thick tomato puree.

My sister also ordered a couple of veggie dishes and I ordered the Bianca Pizza, all of which came out relatively close together. My sister like her veggie items, but the potato puree she ordered was just too rich for her to eat much of it. My Bianca Pizza was ok, but not spectacular. They overdid it on the onions which would have been much better if they had been caramelized and the other ingredients, rosemary and chilis, were too sparse. I ended up taking most of it back to my hotel for breakfast and then ended up dumping most of the leftovers in the garbage because I just couldn't stomach more of it.

Our waiter took my sister's potato puree off the tab, which was nice. She hadn't actually complained about it and we would have been happy to pay for it. My sister gave me some cash to help cover her portion and I gave our waiter the cash and my credit card and he agreed to charge the difference between the bill and the cash tendered. When the credit card receipt was presented, the cash was gone and he had charged the entire amount of the bill to my card. I would like to think the best of people, but I kinda think he was hoping I wouldn't notice so he could pocket the cash. He did rerun my card, so I'm hoping it went through correctly and there are not duplicate charges. I will know in a few days.

This is a restaurant that I think probably has potential to be great, but the service was off and food wasn't consistently great. Next time I visit, I definitely will not make a beeline for Quartino.

Great find while visiting Chicago.   They specialize in small plates, great food and reasonable prices.

In addition,  the service is exceptional, from the servers to the manager.

We'll definitely be back the next time we're here!

It's so great to go to a restaurant where you feel valued and welcome. My daughter has a few food allergies- nuts,  sesame AND fish, so it is not always easy to navigate eating out. The people working here get it. We asked the expo about the bread- he got the manager(?) Joe who was on top of it. He ended up not only getting us one type of safe bread,  but two!  Then our server was  also clearly allergy aware, as she warned us from ordering speck with the Brussels sprouts (they slice the speck with the same slicer as the mortadella, which has pistachios).  We simply got it without. As a result,  our family ordered four different dishes that my daughter could safely eat and mom and dad split a half of libation. On our way out,  Joe offered us his card and said to let him know if we came back. Fantastic experience.
Amon was a fantastic server! Very knowledgeable & provided outstanding customer service! Overall great experience! Food was tasty & the red sangria was yummy!

Best Downtown Chicago Italian late night food. On a date, don't want it after drinks, out with friends or just want to explore a new place? Go to Quartino's! They have a variety of options, shareable, great tasting and also has a bar.  They have some basic familiar dishes but the rest is a journey you've got to explore! It'll keep you coming back without burning holes in your pockets.  I've never been disappointed here! I love how their pasta is always perfectly al dente! It's as close as you can get to authentic when you're having a late night out! Be aware, you'll get food coma for sure!

We went on Monday night for birthday  in this fabulous place. It was actually crowd, but they found for us table for 6 people.  
The interior of Quartino was transfer us to Italy. All waitresses were in Italian soccer teams t-shirts.
First what we try in this place was bread, so soft, fresh and taste good. Then we ordered couple plates. I ordered pasta with clams ( never try better pasta before), my friends ordered pork steak, which was for 2 people, but meat was so juicy and cooked perfect. Some of them ordered octopus, also was great.
And in the end of the night we ordered ice cream and fondue, it was probably the best part of the night.
Quartino was the  best place that I visited for the year.
Actually they also have huge glasses of wine.

This was my second time at Quartino, but first review. We wanted some classic Italian food, so we made reservations for dinner. The food was delicious and came out quickly although it was Friday evening. We started with bruschette and then shared  spaghetti pomodoro and margherita, all with a nice bottle of wine. Two bottles of wine, actually. Great atmosphere and good service.

Had a great time here for a bachelorette dinner! We had a 2 hour dinner, ordering another course whenever we decided we were still hungry. Our server was fun and helped us select the best dishes for our group! She even suggested a special bachelorette dessert! Although we opted for the tiramisu, which is not on the menu but is absolutely a must!

The only downside to the restaurant was that it was extremely loud; granted it was a beautiful Friday evening in the summer in Chicago.

We love this cute Italian tapas restaurant!

This place is surprisingly huge! There is inside and outside seating. Although, I do recommend sitting inside since Quartino is located at a busy intersection.

Their homemade bread with olive oil and vinaigrette is so good! We highly recommend ordering 2-3 dishes per person. My favorite dishes were the Soprano pizza, Veal Meatballs Napoli and Tortellini. I love how thin and crispy their pizza is. Dip the crust in the olive oil and vinaigrette, and you'll fall in love even more. The combination of the meatball with the golden raisin is quite a pleasant surprise. We loved eating the prosciutto with the tortellini. Also, you MUST get the Tiramisu. It's probably the best tiramisu I have ever had. AVOID the Angus Beef Carpaccio - it's super bland. I'm not a big fan of beets. But if you're looking for a vegetable dish, the beets are pretty good.

To be honest, there is a wide variety of dishes on the menu suitable for any guest. We highly recommend it for everyone! We will definitely come back and try some more dishes!

Visiting Chicago with my family and decided to eat here since it was open late. Loved the share plates as it worked well for us. Gave us the chance to try different things and the portions were still a great size.

Great service.

Looking forward to another visit!

We go to Quartino all the time and LOVE it every single time. Joe the manager is amazing. I came with my sister and her two toddlers and they were adamant about having peanut butter and jelly so Alycia, our fave waitress, went to Jewel down the street and bought PB&J and bread. Talk about service. We are treated so well when we're there and absolutely love going. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

I've heard many good things about Quartino, so I was disappointed to be very underwhelmed upon my visit. The food was very mediocre, and the service was extremely slow.

Calamari: I enjoyed the light texture of the breading of the calamari. The calamari itself was also well done, avoiding the pitfalls of hard chewiness that often is the issue with squid. However, I was not much of a fan of the tomato sauce; I appreciated their attempts to go beyond the typical cocktail sauce, but I felt like the sauce was missing the sour tang to balance out the slightly more rich nature of the breading.

Pesto gnocchi: I love love love pesto, so naturally I went straight for this. However, I was very disappointed to find the sauce far too salty, the gnocchi doughy and too chewy, and the vegetables a major distraction from the pesto flavors.

Paparadelle: I liked this one slightly better than the pesto--the noodles were a nice texture, and the tomato based sauce went very well with the tender braised beef. I found this dish also very salty, but not as bad as the pesto.

Tiramisu: This was by far the best dish of the night. Extremely light, slightly sweet, and very well balanced out with the more bitter chocolate and espresso flavors.

Overall, was quite unimpressed with the food. Perhaps I should've have gone for a pizza rather than two pasta dishes, but the food overall was extremely mediocre and too salty for the most part, with the tiramisu being the one saving grace.

Came here on a Friday night, very interesting crowd, everyone was either incredibly casual or very dressed up. Seating was way too crowded for me; very difficult to navigate in between tables. When I go to Italian restaurants, I mostly look forward to the freshly baked, warm bread to come to the table. Why I give this place 3 stars? The bread was dry and cold, no no no Quartino!

BUT the highlights of our dinner were:
-House Made Goat's Milk Ricotta served with warm honey (amazing) and REALLY good bread. The ricotta was so fresh, and so tasty with the honey.
-Porcini and Truffle Risotto was to die for. Rich, thick, and flavorful!!

Side note: the other two dishes we got were the Gnocchi with Pesto and the Cavatelli with Tomato Sauce. My girlfriend loved the gnocchi but I wasn't a fan of the gooey consistency. The cavatelli was also unsatisfying... not enough flavor. The dishes came out warm, but I like mine served straight out of the pan and piping hot.

Altogether, I would come back for the ricotta and honey appetizer again. I would consider trying other pastas to see if they turn out any better. I would also take the patio over the insanely crowded dining space.

Very nice place. The wait can be long. I advice to reserve it on open table. Portions are small and do not come out at the same time. So be ready for that. Prices are normal. Would totally recommend bruschetta and tiramisu.

I have to say Quartino is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in town! They made great Italian tapas!

We arrived a bit late of our 6pm reservation tonight, and seated immediately . Our waiter was friendly, got us water and menus right away.

Here's what we had tonight:

-Veal meatballs Napoli. Very juicy, the raisins added a slightly-sweet flavor.

-Linguine with clams. Fresh clams in the shell cooked perfectly together with the pastas.

-Braised pork shank. Always the superstar! It was so tender and delicious, the meat just fell off the bones.

-Gran Coppa Quartino. Three flavors of gelato(vanilla, strawberry & chocolate) in a big cup with fresh strawberries and whipped cream on top.

The blood orange soda tasted good, while the watermelon soda might be a little bit too sweet for me.

We've been here several times and every time we left with a good experience. So certainly we will be back again!

Italian tapas!? Where can I begin to even consider how friggin awesome your Margerita pizza is when shared about soon-to-be-bffs.
And wine in a carafe!? I'm in love.

Italian food... tapas style?! Quartino is a dream come true. My brother and I were visiting from Texas. We both love Italian. And we both have big appetites.... We ordered the bruschette, dates wrapped in pancetta, polenta fries, calamari, gnocchi, ravioli, Tuscan sausage risotto, and ended it with the zeppole. Every single dish made me drool. Did I mention you can get your plates in half sizes?? Bonus for the girl who loves to try everything.

The couple next to us saw our food and literally ordered the exact same appetizers. They couldn't finish it, and if we didn't have any decency, we would have finished it for them!

Our waiter/bartender was an absolute delight and very attentive, even though it was a crazy-packed Saturday night. He gave us a shot of limoncello, I upped his tip (that's how it works right?). I wanted sooo bad to come back the next day, but unfortunately we never had time. I promise, I will be back!

If you're ever in the Chicago area, PLEASE go here! Reservations recommended if you dislike waiting, because this place is so damn popular. And rightfully so.

pics.caption: zeppole with honey and dark chocolate sauce

review.des:
I typically do not write reviews good or bad, but in this instance I wanted to give a shout out to the gentleman who was the bathroom attendant last night. I placed my sunglasses on the counter and forgot to put them back on.  About 20 minutes passed, and he found me at my table before I ever noticed.

The food was also very good along with a very personable and friendly waitress.  Kudos on having a great team and good food.

We loved our experience at Quartinos. The shrimp risotto fell a little short of the mark. Needed seasoning. The short rib and mashed potatoes more than made up for it. Our waitress Spencer was definitely the highlight. She was fantastic. We will be back.

My boyfriend was recommended this place by a few of our co-workers so we decided to check it out for a nice Saturday dinner date.

We set a reservation for 5 pm, and as we were coming in we overheard the hostess telling another customer (presumably a walk in) that tables were pretty much booked for the rest of the night, but that the bar seating was first come first serve and had full dining service available. Reservations are probably best for this place, especially on a weekend. It was fairly packed as we came in, and even more so than when we left. It was pretty loud as well, but not so loud that we couldn't hear each other.

Service was very prompt, our server was with us right away and explained how tapas works as well as going through the menu. We were visited by many other employees throughout the meal, two of which I presumed to be managers due to their attire. At one point our server came by and asked how everything was doing, and I made a comment that some of the risotto was a bit chewy. He immediately offered to replace it, which I told him was not at all necessary. He instead offered us dessert on the house, so we were treated to fondue after our meal. Although I didn't expect it and felt kind of bad about having said something in the first place, I still really appreciated it.

We ordered the polenta fries as an appetizer, they were perfectly crispy and the red bell pepper sauce they came with was very tangy and complimented them nicely. The asparagus risotto, other than the chewy bits I had, tasted fantastic. The braised pork fell off the bone, the server informed us that it's roasted for about 8 hours. I also had the grapefruit martini, which was very sweet and pleasantly boozy.

Portions were perfectly sized, between the two of us there was nothing leftover. Tapas places are definitely good for groups as well, and if you're like me, good for people who don't eat a lot in one sitting.

Overall a very nice experience, we will definitely be back.

Group friendly, loud, tons of tables, open late. Quartinos is an Italian tapas and wine bar that can appeal to everyone! The menu is vast with pastas, pizzas, salads...foods not to miss: polenta fries with red pepper sauce (amaaaaazingly tasty!), margherita pizza (perfect and simple) and the paparedelle with braised beef(the beef just melts in your mouth).

The wine carafes are awesome in their variety but definitely can get a bit pricey.

My go to late night place (when I can snag a table!)

I dig this place a lot, especially the wine.

It's like tapa style, but with Italian dishes. The eggplant is fire, so definitely get that.

I have had the majority of this menu, and I have never been disappointed with any of the items.

Mix it up....get drunk....just make sure you have some good company with you.

Came in on Tuesday evening was seated right away.   The place is packed and loud.  Delicious pasta but the mixed seafood dish (fruiti di mari?) is the star.  It's soooo good the calamari and octopus were really tender and fresh so is the clams and shrimp.  Soak the crispy bread in the soup and I can eat it all day! Get it you won't regret! Service was excellent as the waitress kept checking on us and asking if we need anything.  Manager alysia also dropped by at the end of the meal to say hi and introduce the $25 3 course lunch special.

pics.caption: Get this dish!  It's a little spicy but the seafood is so fresh and the soup is so savory!
This balsamic vinegar is so goooood

review.des:
Very well done but standard Italian dishes.

Extensive menu and I liked that both the Campania pizza and housemade burrata weren't overly salty or too heavy... Although it did make the burrata seem more like a fresh mozzarella than a burrata. Pizza was thin crust but with a very chewy light pizza crust. Duck prosciutto served with pickled cucumbers also yummy with just a perfect amount of fat... Definitely order the warm prosciutto wrapped dates as well, which was our favorite. I also liked the self serve fresh Parmesan graters and the balsamic vinegar was nice and fruity.

Our server Jeffrey was also lovely and funny and apparently on weekdays lunch 2 can dine for $25.

Can certainly understand why this place is a classic!

I must confess- I judged a book by its cover, and almost left this place immediately after being seated. It was super packed and loud, we were seated at a tiny table, and I got the feeling it was going to be a chain-like Italian dining experience. I was wrong. The braised pork shank was fall of the bone amazingness. The house-cured Italian salami was some of the best I've ever had. Even the simple kale salad was delicious (although slightly overdressed).

Our server Paul was great. I wasn't crazy about the first cheese that I ordered (pecorino), so without question, he brought me over my next choice of asiago (free of charge), which was perfect. He was attentive but not overbearing. The manager stopped by twice to check on us, which I thought was great considering how busy they were.

Overall, great spot! Check this place out.

So as a whole this place is pretty wack. It tastes like chain food. Had the octopus and it was rubbery. Had the broccoli rabe and it was coated in butter. No go. The calamari was tasty.  Though the waiters all though differently about how the batter was applied. It's soaked in whole milk and then breaded. The olives were good and the bread freshly cut. But the Brussels salad is rough. Like large leaves. Little sauce. Rough. The customer service from the managers when I sent the octopus back was good. So they get a few stars for that. But otherwise.  Not worth ya money.

My friend is a long-time fan and got me here for the first time. Absolutely loved the charming decor and how the rooms are broken up so it feels more intimate. Food was very good. Loved the pork ravioli, polenta fries, roasted brussel sprouts, bread and more. This would be a 5 if service had been better. That seemed disorganized with multiple people serving us but no one seeming to "own" the table. We had a tough time finding our server for more bread or even the check. Excellent, reasonably priced wine with good choices. I'll be back though I'll probably try to avoid the busiest times due to the service issue. Good find!

I chose this place for my birthday dinner while I was traveling for business up in Chicago. The guys on my team never let me pick and put up a big fuss when I picked a "tapas" place, thinking it was "chick food" and they wouldn't get enough. Well tough luck boys, it's MY day!

Luckily we all walked out of Quartino completely stuffed and loved every course. We started with their Salumi selection and had the waitress bring her choices of meats, cheeses, and accompaniments. I also got us some malbec to enjoy - the wine list is super cheap and approachable ($40 for 1 LITER? Yes please!), but they also have a full bar.

We then each ordered a pasta dish and a couple of other items (pizza, shrimp) to all share. It is true that the plates will come out at various times so it's best to share with everyone so no one is left out when the food comes to the table. Everything was great, but my favorite was the tortellini with prosciutto.

There was a little mishap with the shrimp order where it was delayed and then came out incorrectly. The waitress was so concerned over it when we brought it to her attention that she took it off our bill and comped all of our desserts! Speaking of dessert, I ordered the off-menu tiramisu which was the best I've ever had in my entire life. Others ordered limoncello, house-made gelato, the gelato cookie sandwiches, and cannoli.

Long story short, the guys on my team now request Quartino at least once a week. Win-win!

The owner said that they were considering opening up in Frisco down here in Texas! Do it!!

What an awesome restaurant. The most European food and vibe I've had since I have been in the US while still staying true to what they are. Don't order a large dish or anything like that,  just order a bunch of small dishes and share. I'd advise to do so I  rounds of two because they are heavy.  

I've noticed that the tiramisu is not on the menu but please order that because it is divine, seriously.  One remark,  if you are already very full you might consider sharing because it's a big piece,  like really big.

Tasty pizza and appetizers
Decent wine selection
Loud atmosphere and buzzing place- a very good sign as many people come here to visit

Quartino is my go-to for every occasion. Out of town friend...book club meeting...date night, it's Quartino.

The food is consistently on point with plenty of choices for all appetites and restrictions. And it fits my tiny budget like a glove (excellent bottle of red wine for only $15)!  Split the roasted octopus, dates wrapped in panchetta, and white bean and garlic spread with the table before diving into the Neapolitan pizza and house made pasta. You will go home full and happy (and not broke)!

We came here after a night of bar hopping, as this was the only restaurant/bar open at such a late hour and with all the reviews, we decided to give this place a try!

The place had a cozy feel to it and the host/server was very friendly. After we ordered our drinks and food, the place seemed to get packed pretty fast! I think the server got so caught up with the crowd that she forgot about our drinks! It took about 15-20 minutes for one beer and a few waters. We ordered about 5 items off the menu...and we were not impressed. :( the food was tasteless and it seemed we had to keep adding salt, pepper, or cheese to our dishes. I believe the only thing we all enjoyed was the tomato soup.

It took a long time for our server to come back to our table if we needed a refill or more napkins. We decided to just ask for the check and that even took a good 15 minutes. :(

Probably won't be coming back.

This is our favourite restaurant in Chicago! The food, service and ambience are all exceptional. The wine selection is fantastic too. And the best part is that it is all so affordable. I would highly recommend Quartino for its wonderful Italian fare.
Amazing atmosphere, fantastic Italian food and the best manhattan I have ever had.  Maybe a little loud when crowded due to the gorgeous white tile.   But still fantastic.
I love this place. It is wonderful. I have eaten here upwards of 10 times over the past 4 years, and I have never had a bad experience.

We almost didn't eat here because of the ridiculously long wait, but we snagged a table in the bar area. I'm glad we did, because it was great. They were so busy but our server still made sure we were taken care of. From the wine & bread to pasta and dessert, Quartino did not disappoint.

I did not really like it here.

Food was good. The portions were super small though. I understand its a tapas place but everyone at my table (6 of us) left hungry and felt like we paid so much. I wish there was a family platter option or something.

I feel like they had the quality in their food but the quantity being served was not good enough, especially when compared to the price.

This post has been longggg overdue!
Overall - GREAT Food, AMAZING service! Great for large groups.

I've been here 15+ times - EVERY big occasion with a large group of family/friends where we don't want to spend too much money.

This restaurant NEVER disappoints no matter the time of day or year.

AMAZING family-style tapas italian dishes. There's something for everyone on the menu. The food has been consistent for the ~3 years or so I've been coming. The dishes come out as they're ready so it's always hot and fresh.

Unless you're drinking a lot, it's hard to spend a lot of money here. Somehow they make it a casual fine dining experience. I'm not sure if any other restaurant can pull this off.

From the incredible service and neighbourhood welcome its hard to be happier anywhere other then here as a local.  One of our daughters just cam back from Italy to beg for their tortellini, we just love the atmosphere and the warm welcome every time.  The food is wonderful, the wine "cheaper than water" and we have become family.  Love this place, cannot go wrong.

Chicago has definitely got some pricey restaurants. Went here on last day because there were so many positive reviews on yelp. Wine was decent. Food was average. Prices are very cheap. This is an ok place but would definitely recommend something else if it's your last day. And if you listen to me on one thing and one thing only.... do not get the risotto. It came out in like 2 seconds which is never a good thing and tasted like it was under a heat lamp. If your trying to dine out on a budget go here and go on the balcony to people watch.  I won't go back but I wouldn't say totally avoid

Service was great...Food was only ok.  Had dinner at Volare the night before and thought Volare was quite a bit better at the same price point.  I also found their old fashioned to be okkkk but not ok at $16.  We aren't in a cocktail lounge.  It is a family Italian joint.  Service was a 5 star and food was 2.5 stars.

We stumbled upon this restaurant near our hotel the last time we were in the city. It was so good that we had to go back this time! You cannot go wrong with whatever dish you order. Everything is delicious and quality. Not only is the food tasty, but the service was good, the tapas (sharing) concept with Italian is smart, and the wine was also nice. I highly suggest trying to get a table on the upstairs balcony - good view, fresh air, and away from the cars and pedestrians. Definitely share a bunch of dishes - the more delicious food to try! We enjoyed the wild arugula salad with hazelnuts and orange, the mixed olives, the (green) gnocchi, and veal meatballs. All the dishes were amazing and fresh. My favorite were the veal meatballs with red sauce and riccota. They were tender, sweet, and yet savory. Quartino is a must try when in Chicago! Enjoy
I enjoyed my experience at Quartino! The service was excellent, but the menu was almost overwhelming, there were so many options!

Great pizza. Thin crispy pepperoni. The olive plate was also good. They have professional and friendly staff. They took extra measure to find us can coke. I love this place.
The ambiance is very Italian. I had one of the best pizza.

Keeping it simple this time... Ranked in order:

1. Campania pizza - founduta and house made ricotta. Enough said, amazing! I will be back to just sit at the bar and have this pizza.
2. Prosciutto San Daniele - guess why I picked it? It was so soft, thin and luxurious I couldn't stand it.
3. Steamed Clams - Pinot Grigio and red chili broth. Not too strong but strong enough and the bread for dipping is wonderful.
4. Asiago Vecchio - lovely cheese, make sure you pair it with the apricot.
5. Manzo pizza - short rib was super flavorful, pesto was amazing but a little too much fennel for my taste.
6. Polenta Fries - they are what they say, polenta. The dipping sauce is needed. I guess I wanted these badly because so many people posted on yelp but I wouldn't go back for those. Much better options on the menu!

Lastly. Wine, service and atmosphere made me happy. We will return!

pics.caption: Half and half pizza campanina and manzo

review.des: This place came highly recommended on Yelp but I was personally a little disappointed. Pasta was really bland. The place was super crowded and very noisy. I've heard the pizza is good but we didn't order it. If I go next time, I'll probably just play it safe and order pizza

Came here last night on a whim, didn't realize that it was tapas all around. Never been to a tapas restaurant that didn't have at least a few entrees that weren't tapas so I thought it was interesting. Me and my father shared eggplant, linguine and Clams, and shrimp risotto. The eggplant was just alright compared to the risotto and the linguine and clams. My dad gets linguine and clams almost every Italian place we go and he said it was the one of the best he's had. I loved the shrimp risotto full of flavor and I loved the zucchini and sun-dried tomatos in it. My little brother (16) wasn't a huge fan of the menu but everything we had was good.

Sad that I am leaving Chicago.. But just before we went to sleep, my lady and I needed to grab a bite. To our delight, a very tasty and authentic Italian tapas was in sight. Sam was informative and professional, and steered us in all the right directions. The veal meatball Napoli are must haves. Thanks for my last dining experience! I'll be back when in the area.

The night started off with a girl in my group saying "I don't want to jinx it, but everytime I come here with a group, it seems that no matter how much food we order the bill per person is always $15-20"

Well, she didn't jinx it. Our group of 6 paid ~$16 /person pre-tip, and we were STUFFED. We also all drank. I love this place- it's perfect for large groups because all their small plates are meant for sharing so you can try a lot. Also, any place that will take reservations for large groups is a win in my book. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was PACKED! It also has a great bar you can grab a drink at while waiting for a table.

Rucolina Pizza- SO GOOD. I`m not even necessarily the biggest pizza or arugula fan, but this pizza was amazing.

Pepperoni Pizza- I didn't eat any, but it was gone very quickly and even our pickiest Pizza Connoiseur was happy

Eggplant Parmesan- Delicious, but not exactly the "vegetable" we were going after. Layers on layers of cheese.

Tagliatelle w/ Bolognese- Delicious. Handmade pasta with a sauce that wasn't too heavy-- I highly recommend.

Gnocchi- Good (and was devoured in about a minute) but couldn't compare to the gnocchi from Vivo in West Loop. That's now my gold standard in Chicago.

The white Sangria was also fantastic, and our service was great. The parmesan cheese graters they have which grate the fresh cheese is a nice addition, and I`ll definitely be back again.

We found this place on yelp with a lot of reviews. So the place is very nice outside and inside. There is an upstairs and downstairs.  The place does get busy as well but we found seating on a Tuesday night.  The waitress said the portions were huge as well, but it ended up being small and tiny that we were still hungry after the meal.  We ordered the specialites like the veal, baby shrimp and clam linguine.  They were all really good and tasty.  We ended up spending $50 dollars for the mean, but left hungry unfortunately.  The service was fast as well.
Great food and service! The calamari was by far the best thing we ordered! The linguini and claims was also very good. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a family friendly environment

We went here for a date night. The place was packed, but service was great. We started with polenta fries, which I really liked, but wish it had a different dipping sauce. The pizza was also amazing. The only drawback for me is that they bring each item out as it's ready, so no formal courses. That being said, it is more of a family style restaurant and they're up front about it when they seat you. We will definitely be back!
absolutely the best food!! and staff where so fun and friendly !!!wish you where in north carolina

Really good Italian small plates - fun if you're with a group that you're comfortable sharing with, like I was. We got a few pasta dishes, the ricotta (SO good) and a pizza. We wish we had actually saved some room for more pizza, it was that good. Service was speedy and friendly, and the wine we got was delicious. I think the best part about this place is the value - everything was very fairly priced and we were very surprised at the final tab, considering we got a liter and a bottle of wine.

All in all, good food and a great spot for a group that wants to be able to try a little of everything... all for a very affordable cost.

I've never had an issue getting a last minute table here (much appreciated when hosting out of town visitors that enjoy sightseeing without any sort of schedule).

The food is meant to be ordered and shared family style, typically 1-2 items per person. The variety is good (pizzas, pastas, salads, etc.). I highly recommend the cheese fondue - it always ends up being everyone's favorite dish.

Quartino can get a bit loud, especially in the downstairs dining room, but the convenience and solid food more than make up for that.

We came here on our first night in Chicago because we were both starving and it was relatively close to our hotel. We were really debating whether or not we wanted to try deep dish in Chicago. We opted to come to Quartino and we were really glad that they served thin crust pizza (which I love). We were able to get 2 flavors on the pizza and ordered half Prosciutto and Arugula and half sausage. Pizza wise, it was good and deserved 4 stars. We also ordered the gnocchi with pesto sauce and the flavor was just weird. We weren't a fan at all. Hence, I'd give this place more of a 3.5 stars. Service was great and attentive!

pics.caption: Gnocchi with pesto sauce - you can pass on this dish
We went for "thin crust" in Chicago

review.des: Good Italian place close to the embassy suites hotel. Good food and nice outdoor dining. Recommend.

I love Quartino's for larger groups.  The restaurant is loud, plates are shareable and there's a nice vibe to the place.  It isn't fancy -- you can walk in with jeans and be fine -- and the food and service reflect that.  There's no pretension.

The food is generally tasty.  I've liked all the pizzas that I had and the polenta is a fun starter.  The only real clunker is the gnocchi, which has a somewhat gritty sauce that lacks the bite suggested by an arugula pesto.

My favorite place when in Chicago!  I love the crowded, loud ,  aromatic fill of this place.  Everyone is buzy eatting, drinking, and enjoying their family and friends.  You need to expect the crowd, and welcome the close tables...and you can check out all the dishes your neighbors are getting!  We always try new dishes, and are never disappointed.   The short ribs topped this last trip.  Grab a bottle of the house red and enjoy the event!  No matter what we order, how many we come with, we always end up @30$ a person...every.time..Worth the trip!
Amazing food, amazing service! This is our go-to spot for girls nights out, date nights, etc! The GM Adam is THE BEST! So sweet, generous, and personable. Highly recommend Quartino!

Loved the patio and the ambience upstairs, and the service was wonderful. We had drinks, the lamb sliders (priced per piece), a white pizza and spaghetti pomodoro for the table - the food was fresh, came out quickly and everyone was super satisfied with the taste and portion size. I'd recommend getting a few different types of dishes and sharing, Quartino seems to be able to do it all!

Loved, loved, loved this place! Great food, good service and busy atmosphere (just how we like it). Our server was knowledgeable and the food was quick and delicious.

The table for our party of 4 was a bit tight with all the food we ordered, but that was only a slight downside to a great meal.

Plan on going back when we are in Chicago again.

Amazing place. Italian food of all kinds, most plates are for sharing. The cavatelli & veal meatballs are delicious, as is everything else there! Great wine at affordable prices (and available in all different sizes - you're not stuck with a bottle, nor do you have to buy by the glass). I've never been disappointed!
Service was good but food was ok. Some dishes were way too salty. You can find better in Chicago.

Quartino is so loud! If I go back, I'm going to heed all the advice and sit outside on the patio. My friends and I couldn't hear each other unless we screamed. Our waiter misheard our orders it was so loud. Pandemonium!

Most of the food we got here was really good. Be careful because it's small portions you may find yourself ordering WAY more than you can eat. That's what happened when I went with my girlfriends and we ended up with a lot left over.

Service was a bit disappointing. My friend had to ask 4 times for butter, the runner brought us the shrimp risotto when we ordered the mushroom. Sadly I'm allergic to shellfish so we were left waiting about 10 minutes to get someone's attention and then another 15 for the new dish. Eek gads! Once we got the mushroom risotto it was delicious. The gnocchi was to die for.

With our sangria (they have white, yay) and food, we ended up spending about $40 each, eek. Honestly, Quartino has some good food but it's not amazing enough to have me come back & not be able to hear anyone I'm with, pay a million dollars for parking and have mediocre service. There are too many amazing places in the city to keep me coming back here.

pics.caption: Gnocchi Potato Dumplings, Green Beans, Potatoes, Arugula Pesto, & Pork Stock - $10.75

review.des: Looks like a tourist trap, but it's some of the best Italian cuisine I've ever had. Just go.

To start off, I'm extremely disappointed. I walked in to a group of 40 people waiting to be seated thinking that this place was going to be incredible solely based off the crowd. I've had some of the best food in Chicago while traveling the country so my expectations were high. We decided to sit at the seats by the bar... a regular high top. For an appetizer we got the goat cheese ricotta cheese, which was fine. Not the best I've had, but ok. We split 2 of their "homemade" pastas, lamb rigatoni and pappardelle bolognese, both honestly tasted like a mixture of whole wheat pasta and cardboard. If this is "homemade," please give me De Cecco brand every time. I won't be going back... If you want Italian food go to RPM Italian.

I came here for a business dinner so the food was buffet style for everyone. The shrimp cocktail that they served was delicious along with their meatballs and shells & sauce. The waiters were attentive and informative with the food. The other items that I had like the salmon and chicken was mediocre--nothing special. The pizza is OK compared to the pizza that I have had in New York and Connecticut.

Quartino is a tapas style place w an Italian flair.
Food is good and the price was reasonable.
We shared the orchietta pasta, a pizza, and salad along w a very nice bottle of red wine from montepuciano Italy that was so reasonable (15.00)
And delicious! There are many items to choose from on the menu, so I think you can please the most discriminate of palates here!
The atmosphere is very chic and fun - however tables are close and it's hard to carry on any serious type conversation, so I would not suggest this for a business meeting venue.
I had been here multiple times but my daughters who live in Chicago had not.
They left saying they would def be back and I am hoping it is with me!

Let me just start off by saying I've been here a million times. We had Lauren tonight as our waitress , and her recommendations were spot on. Not to mention she was very attentive and was very helpful in choosing food items. I always have a great meal here, but Lauren's service was above and beyond .

Will be returning as always , but hope to get Lauren as a waitress again!

-table 39 on Saturday 11/26 at 7pm (want to make sure I have the right Lauren :)
Caprese salad was one of the freshest I've had. The beef carpaccio was okay but I have had better. But Oh my... The Peach Bellini!!!! Very fresh and smooth.

pics.caption: This place is packed on a Tuesday night

review.des:
I wanted to like it, and I remember liking parts of it, but once I got the bill I realized it didn't like it that much.

A loud and crowded place - not a in bad way - its happening!

The dishes were to good to very good. Nothing quite got into the great territory.

Waiter started out very strong and then kinda slipped towards the end of the meal.

Wish I had went to Purple Pig... would have received better food, better service, and a better value.

Great food and quick service.  Almost everything on the menu is a small plate and they come out as soon as they're ready. So if you want something first order it and then wait on the other items. Came here for a friend's birthday and we ordered the 1.5 liter of wine, caprese salad, truffle risotto, calamari,  and lastly beef filets. Everything was incredibly fresh and flavorful but the risotto and beef filets were my favorite.  Also we got the zeppotle..,fried donuts, they were to die for and the sauces seriously could be eaten with just your finger.

Pros: food, wine list, quick service
Cons: pretty loud, some pricing is expensive for the quantity

This was the very best of Chi town... from the Italian tapas and wine to the very BEST Espresso martini ...best saved for dessert.  Absolutely loved this authentic Italian restaurant.... the manager Scott was fabulous as was our waiter. The 3 sisters from San Diego

My husband and I came here for dinner and had an ok experience. First of all-it's a large restaurant with bright lighting, so more like a family restaurant rather than a date night. We were shoved in a back table feeling really claustrophobic to our surroundings. Everything is shared small plates so we ordered eggplant Parmesan, broccoli rabe, gnocchi, and porcini and truffle Risotto. The eggplant Parmesan dish came out piping hot and no one warned my husband. He burnt himself. The dish tasted great though, and the marinara was really fresh. The next dish that came out was the broccoli rabe. It was fantastic-definitely our favorite. Then the Risotto... we LOVE risotto! Theirs however was terrible. The rice was undercooked and the porcini mushroom dirt overpowered the dish. There were several gritty bites as if they put the rehydrated water into the dish and didn't discard the dirt debris. Lastly the gnocchi-it had undercooked potatoes and green beans that overpowered the dish and the gnocchi tasted grainy like it needed another minute to cook.

We gave the place a 3 for the broccoli, eggplant, the wine, and the service. The ambiance and the other 2 dishes were bad enough that we probably won't be back. Next time we will stick to Osterio across the street.

Went again and didn't disappoint. The spaghetti with meatballs was phenomenal. And the tortellini....forget about it (as in order it it's amazing). Sat outside with a bottle of wine what more could you ask for. Will be coming back again and again.
Just go there for the duck prosciutto pizza... Nuf said...

YUM!!! Came here for a bachelorette party. (So we already pre ordered everything) and their was TONS of food. We started off with bread and 2 types of salad. Then cheese and pepperoni pizza. Then 2 types of pasta. Bachelorette got a special dessert ;) service was fast and excellent. Definitely recommend this place for a bachelorette party dinner!

This is our favorite tapas style Italian restaurant in the city. We have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed. The gluten free pasta is so good, that I had to confirm with a manager that it was actually gluten free. The vodka sauce is phenomenal. Their wine selection is also very well thought out and the servers are very knowledgeable when you ask for recommendations on both the food and drinks. We have brought friends from out of town and they also loved the food and ambience. If you are looking for authentic, delicious Italian food with a relaxed ambience and great customer service, then this is the place to be.

I had dinner with a group of ten friends in the wine room and it was wonderful. We selected a four course dinner with the wine package and were so happy with the quality of the food and wine and the service.

I visit Chicago once a year for a shopping day, and this year I decided to try Quartino for dinner. I got there 15 minutes before my reservation and was seated right away. After being unhappy with where I was seated I was immediately moved to a better option. Our server was great, she was very knowledgable and friendly. I ordered the pizza with four cheeses and added mushrooms, and I also ordered the fettuccini alfredo and had garlic added to it. I was disappointed in the pizza, there was not much flavor. I've never had to salt pizza before. It was pretty flavorless, and considering what was on it I expected a lot of flavor. I won't order pizza there ever again. The pasta was very good but also needed salt, which it shouldn't. My mom who was with me ordered the chicken and fondue. The fondue was amazing but her chicken was so dry she could barely chew or swallow it. It was also pretty flavorless to. It got sent back. For dessert I ordered the chocolate fondue with strawberries and my mom ordered the hot chocolate cake. Her cake was not good at all, it had a very strange taste and was pretty flavorless. Chocolate cake shouldn't taste like that. The chocolate fondue was amazing! The food was hit and miss, definitely disappointing but there were enough positives that we will try it again on our next trip. We know what not to order again and what we liked. Hopefully next time it will be better, if not we won't return.
Quartino is the best place for girl's dinner! Yes! Great price, thin pizza and good wine!

Although I have only been to Quartinos twice, the restaurant has placed itself in my mind as a go-to dinner spot when I am downtown Chicago.

First of all, the location is great! It's a couple of blocks from popular tourist attractions like the John Hancock Lounge, Mag Mile etc which makes it a very accessible and easy to find place.

The food is also really good. Their menu includes delicious shareable pizzas to all sorts of pasta dishes. My favorite so far is linguine with clams.. which is saying a lot as I am normally NOT a fan of seafood.

Finally the price point of the menu and the fun, happening, lively atmosphere really makes Quartino a place you want to come back to!

Quartino was an excellent choice for our large group to grab dinner. We started off with some wine and ended up trying a huge variety of their plates. The cheese fondue, calamari and burrata salad were definitely some of our favorites. For dessert the chocolate cake was warm and decadent and the sorbet was very refreshing. Overall, we had a lovely dinner here and would recommend stopping by!

I went at Quartino 1,5 months ago to celebrate my birthday. I had a great night, the food was delicious and everything was fitting perfect: the wine, music, ambiance and plus that i had a nice view because our table was next to the window, how i requested. Our server was great, he was checking us several time and making sure that we are not missing anything.  The night was a success

pics.caption: The best birthday dinner ever, only at @QuartinoRistorante

review.des:
This place was hoping on a Wednesday night, reservations were not hard to get three hours before. I noticed a lot of collared and button up shirts, just not on the service staff! Who all seemed to be wearing Soccer jerseys and their back servers we wearing kitchen whites. Our server was Lauren, and this review is because Lauren earned the review for this Resturant. Attentive, great to help with our choices, informative, and friendly. I ordered an Esspreso Martini, which I absolutely suggest everyone try, even with the 9 pm hour approaching I joked with Lauren I shouldn't have another, she offered to make me a decaf, in which we both laughed and I said, no i'll have it the same way please. My girlfriend ordered the Bellini and really enjoyed hers as well.
We also had the Salumeria Tastings, which was surprisingly not finished between our table of four. I ordered the Tagliatelle alla Bolognes from their house made pasta section of the menu, and enjoyed every single bite of it!
My girlfriend ordered the Pappardelle, which I was offered a bite of, and after she mentioned it, I then agreed we both thought it may have had a pinch to much salt. This was our second visit to this restaurant, and will return if we are in the area again.

My husband and I are traveling to Italy this year. To plan and prepare, we have been visiting different Italian spots around the city. After going to Quartino, I don't really want to try anywhere else! I just want to keep coming back. I wish I could remember the name of our server, because he was a strong representative for the restaurant. An excellent guide through our meal, SO helpful with wine choices, very kind, always nearby when we had a question.

The portions were perfect--a great way to try a lot of their dishes without being overwhelmed. We enjoyed all our food and wine. I especially recommend the bacon dates. The ambiance was lively and fun, even on a crowded evening. Yes!

This is one of my all time favorite places.  I frequent the place at least 1x a month if not more.  I luv the atmosphere the quick service and the location and prices are just great.  It is a definitely a go to spot for a tasty Europe style pizza with the thin crust and all the great toppings.  The food comes out family style so when it is done it is served love that makes me feel like I am at home.  There is nothing bad on the menu and the place is just a all time favorite.

Quartino restaurant was recommended by one of the locals during our trip to Chicago. The ambience was of old Chicago and place was filled with customers. We tried three dishes from there menu, the House made Goats milk Ricotta  that came with bread and honey , Broetto Ai Frutti di Mare (shrimps,clams,calamarii, Octopus, & Whitefish Simmered in Aqua Pazza with San Marzano Tomatoes)on pasta, and finally a Beef Short rib in salsa verde. I have to say everything we ordered was amazing and Quartino is now one of our must stop restaurants anytime  we are visiting  Chicago. By the way let me tell you the service was also excellent they had up to three host walking the floor atttending to all the customers. One last thing, I do recommend a reservation.

pics.caption: House made goats milk ricotta with honey!
Beef short rib in salsa verde

review.des:
Amazing vodka sauce! Great calamari. Those are pretty much my Italian restaurant food requirements. On point here.

Def keep in mind the 'tapas' style of this Italian restaurants. Expect to pay normal portion prices for half size plates.

This is probably one of my favorite casual Italian restaurants in the city! My gf's and I have our annual valentines dinner here....4 years going strong! They are so consistent w/their dishes and services...I ALWAYS recommend Quartino's for those visiting from out of town too, its a great city vibe w/a tuscan feel.

Highly recommend.

Came back here a 'lil over 5 years later and had the sausage pizza w/a friend while sitting outside -- they do have a nice patio area. The service here is really great, but I still stand with my earlier review that the food is pretty good, but not necessarily great.

Really nice place, best for a doble date ir group if six, since to get to try a lot of dishes and flavors. Wine is great price, we got a montepulciano and we liked a lot, sliced salad, baby spinach salad, asparagus risotto, salmon, gnochi ( my least favorite) home made sausage, all were great and Michael the manager made us tried the zepolle and was good( not my favorite dessert since i dont care for deep fried) convinient fir us since we stayed at the embassy suites on state.
A must try place... And the hostess were all great... Nice blonde smiles

pics.caption: Soup of the day... Nice pot
Third page menu... To be continued

review.des:
Blah. Another Chicago spot that I am not sure why the reviews are so fantastic. We were packed like sardines (6 of us) into a room upstairs that had the feel of a pool hall. It was SO loud in there that the next day, some of us had lost our voices from screaming across the table the whole night. It sucked.

Nothing on the menu really sounded that great to me at the time and I ordered the tomatoes caprese. It was good- but really how hard is that to make? No one in my party said their food was anything to write home about. We had a good server is about the only real positive thing I can say. Big fat bummer.

We stopped by here for a late lunch in the summer and enjoyed a quiet meal outside.  We started out with grilled seafood, which was slightly charred, but tasted good.  We then ordered a Margherita pizza and Tagliatelle alla Bolognese.  The pizza tasted fresh and perfect after a long day sight seeing.  The Tagliatelle alla Bolognese was very filling and flavorful.  Overall, enjoyed our meal.

Excellent Italian tapas place. Came here with a few colleagues and really enjoyed it. We ordered the prosciutto wrapped dates, the wild arugula salad, the mushroom risotto, the gnocchi and a margarita pizza for 4 women. It was exactly enough for us and I thoroughly enjoyed each dish.

Dishes come out when they are ready, so you aren't starving before the food arrives, portions are enough to share so that everyone gets a taste.  The gnocchi was a hit particularly, they were smaller than the customary slobs of gnocchi and the pesto was delicious. I would absolutely get that and the  prosciutto dates again.

The only thing that irked me was how long it took to get the servers attention.  My party and I sat for at least 10-15 mins to get the bill.  Other than that, would love to go again when I'm back in town.

This is probably my favorite Italian food in the city. I love that tapas style and the food is always brought out fresh from the kitchen. Their menu has so many delicious items, you can get something new every time. Their outdoor seating is lovely and the service is quick and very reasonable.
Loud and Crowded. Full of tourists. Perhaps its just personal taste, but when out with friends, I would like more conversational sharing and less food sharing. Leave this spot to the out of towners.

I'm here on vacation from MIA with my boyfriend and we decided to try this place based on recommendations from friends and the reviews here. I thought the concept of bringing out our dishes as they were ready was pretty cool and i liked that they were shareable plates. We ordered the shrimp risotto, gnocchi, pureed potatoes, and the polenta fries. The food was tasty, although i don't think the puréed potatoes was anything special it was basically just mash potatoes and lacked flavor. Our waiter was very friendly, it was pretty packed, and if i lived in the area I would try it again.

Service was ok when I went in but that could be because the place was packed. Their food is on point! Paperdelle is out of this world. Haven't had paperdelle like quartino's anywhere else. I would say it's pretty casual dining.

My favorite Italian place downtown. It's boisterous, great for large groups. You can try multiple dishes. If there are enough people, the salumeria tasting platter is very good value for the money, and awesome to have while waiting for other dishes. Some of my other favorite go-tos are:
- polenta fries
- calamari
- bruschetta tasting
- any of the pizzas
- pappardelle
- roast chicken

Make a reservation on busy nights, but otherwise it's great for walk in.

Dessert:
- tiramisu
- zeppole

It also has wine by the glass or liter- sangria is good too! There's also a large selection of cocktails, depending what you're in the mood for.
Beautiful restaurant with great food and customer service.

First time visiting this restaurant for lunch and my wife and I really enjoyed it. The service was very attentive and extremely friendly.  Manager also paid a friendly visit to our table as well. I had the marinara pizza and my wife had the meat sauce spaghetti. Both were very good. We are planning to visit for dinner next.

Been to this restaurant before because it is so amazing. Today visiting was exceptionally special.  the service was over the top and the manager and Andy miller , was so very helpful. Our waitress was phenomenal and had all the answers for our questions. I don't know if I'm even allowed to say it but I'm going to say it all of their wine is sold at a retail price and they will sell it at a 50% discount if you are taking it out of the restaurant. How amazing is that? The food is fabulous one of the best places will always , every time I visit Chicago.

As we hungrily wandered around Chicago, my brother and I finally decided that we wanted something Italian for dinner. We pulled out our phones, checked the Yelp app, and decided to go to Quartino. Although it was getting late by Chicago standards and it was a weeknight, there were still a ton of people at Quartino. Luckily for us, we were still quickly seated. Our server was friendly and did a good job explaining the different types of cheeses to us.

We decided to order the Taleggio Cheese with Apricot Puree, Wild Arugula Salad, and Gnocchi. I enjoyed the cheese and my brother liked the apricot puree. The arugula salad was delicious and my favorite part of the meal. It was flavorful and fresh, and I loved the liberal use of oranges and hazelnuts. My brother loved the gnocchi. I'm usually a big pesto eater, but I didn't love the pasta. The gnocchi was soft and well-filled and I think most people would have liked it, I just tend to prefer something chewier and with a bit more texture that I can gnash my teeth into.

After eating our fill, we decide to peruse the dessert menu just to see what they are. Our eyes ended up being bigger than our stomachs and we ordered the Profiteroles, which were delicious! I loved the gelato and the toasted almonds flavor. The dessert was so richly decadent and afterwards, I was torn between wanting to pass out from a food coma and jumping around from a sugar high. The service was wonderful and all in all, we had a ton of fun getting Italian tapas.

pics.caption: Gnocchi Potato Dumplings, Green Beans, Potatoes, Arugula Pesto, & Pork Stock
Wild Arugula Navel Oranges, Farro, Hazelnuts, E.V.O.O., & Housemade Goat's Milk Ricotta
Taleggio Cow's Milk, Nutty, Aromatic, Semi-Soft

review.des: Unbelievable! We've been a few time and it defiantly is a stop when we go to Chi Town a few times a year. Small portions delicious to pass around the table. There were 6 of us again and we each got a taste of each plate. I think we got at least 8 or more things on the menu in which were tasty. Meatballs, spaghetti, sausage, veal, huge meat and cheese platter, octopus, gnocchi and a few more.  The drinks were good too. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. Def a place to try.

pics.caption: Manager was a riot. Forgot lemon slice so she brought a whole one. LOL.
A little bit of everything desert.

review.des: This was the perfect place for our family of five. We have one dairy allergy in our group and two picky eaters. All of us loved our food and drinks. Kids liked the Italian blood orange soda. Our group had shrimp risotto, penne with vodka sauce, spaghetti pomodoro, calamari and fettuccine alfredo. Everything was served steaming hot and tasted great. Service was perfect. Prices were reasonable, too. We will be back on our next trip to Chicago.

Had a good experience however some dishes knocked off a star.

THE GOOD - delicious bread served immediately. Soft w amazing olive oil. THE CALAMARI- is great, worth swinging by just for that. TORTELLINI - absolutely delicious. The prosciutto melts in your mouth, sauce and tortellini are sooo good. The dish works. Delicious. SHORT RIB w POTATOES - omg order this. If my Yelp reviewing can help you in anyway possible... Get the short ribs and get the potatoes. UNREAL !!!!!!!! VEAL MEATBALLS - incredible. Best meatballs I've ever had.

THE BAD - caprese salad; there was so much salt in my mozarrella it was inedible. Grossss. The other salad we had which was like radishes, beets, carrots... Soooo gross. It was so vinegary, tough, and the flavors did not work together. BOLOGNESE- this I was told to order but it was clear no one in our group really liked it. The sauce was VERY sweet and lacked any real sofrito flavor or if u like marinara bolognese it did not have that going for it either... GNOCCHI- ok the arugula pesto is really pushing it. It tastes like pure arugula which any of my salad eating friends out there knows tastes like DIRT plain. They should know a normal pesto w basil, garlic, and pine nuts would much better serve their hand rolled gnocchis. And when I say "THE BAD" I mean I pushed it away with my fork and did not eat it.

I think with this place u need to be selective. The marinara is great (meatballs) same w the cream sauce. Wine is inexpensive if you get house wine and the service is good.

I am really really sad.  My experience last night was most definitely a 3.  I have never had a bad experience, until last night.  90% of the food was bland, what the heck?!

So we ordered wine, i was pleased with both reds.  So that was good.

We start with  a meat/cheese/veggie tray, we had salami, proscuitto, cheeses and olives.  It was a tasty start, along with the white bean spread.  Then we ordered gnocchi...it was extremely bland.  Then the risotto with asparagus arrived, also very bland.  Next were the polenta fries, they tasted like nothing.  I was going crazy with the salt, and so was everyone else at my table.  The brussels sprouts we ordered were just fine.  Then we ordered the octopus, which was more flavorful, so that helped.  Finally, we ordered the cavatelli, which has always been a favorite, and finally we had a tasty item that was cooked perfectly with a really nice sauce.  At least we ended on a high note.  

I was really surprised because I have never had a blah experience there before.  I will go back because this was my first just ok experience, and I'll assume it was just a bad night.
If you love authentic Italian food this is your place. The food was simply delicious. Staff is so friendly. This is a go to place in Chicago if you're a Italian food lover.

The staff and food are excellent. We sat at the bar having delicious cocktails - especially the expresso martini! We also had carpaccio, polenta sticks and house made ricotta that we enjoyed very much. The bar and restaurant are lively and the interaction with all the staff enhanced our experience a lot.

This has been our favorite Chicago restaurant since we discovered it several years ago.  It has an atmosphere that you would only find in Chicago (possibly NYC).  It is noisy, crowded, cramped...yet the service is awesome and the food is always great.  Great wine selection and prices.  The thin crust pizzas are fabulous.  We typically share a salad and also an order of their Broccoli Rabe.  I have t had the pasta or meat dishes but everything looks great.  I would highly recommend Quartino to anyone visiting Chicago and it is great for locals as well.

The service was really slow here. The gluten-free pasta was actually surprisingly good - I tried it in the alla vodka sauce. The place still remains an okay neighborhood place because of its convenient location but not where I go when craving amazing Italian food.

Had a lovely lunch at Quartino yesterday. My waiter Lenny was very attentions and pleasant recommending drinks and suggesting to order half portions of the 2 pastas I wanted to try, which I did.
