The food was delicious and my app Polanta fries was very crunchy and yummii. For dessert a had their house made Tiramissu super creamy and very generous portion to share.
great spot for enjoying a late night menu and also the bartender made us feel very welcome.. great location and easy to get to.... They also offer hospitality discounts

I love this place.  Reservations are nice but not absolutely necessary. Overall I find that everything is well priced.

The sangrias are amazing.  The flatbread pizza can be shared with two people if you order another side dish or appetizer.  We got the polenta fries which were amazing.  They tasted like slices of breaded polenta which were dipped in an amazing sauce.  The margarita and vegetarian pizza can easily be shared with two people.  I would definitely come back for apps and drinks again.

If noise or close proximity both you, this might not be the right place. It's very loud and lively. Fine with me and my friends, but not the best when I brought my mom.

I'm a sucker for desserts and would definitely recommend the doughnuts and chocolate sauce. Yum!!
Food tasted below average, we ordered pizza, risotto, short rib, and eggplant parmesan None of them tasted good, we didn't enjoy the food at all, we will never go back again

Lovely outdoor seating!

Order:
Baby Spinach Salad
Tortellini
Sausage Risotto***

***fav

The food was delicious - great flavor and decent portions, especially the sausage risotto. We came here for a late lunch/quick bite and our server was very nice and sped up the order for us. All in all, if you happen to be around the area and start feeling hungry, Quartino is a solid choice. Might come back for their $25 three course menu for two.

pics.caption: Baby spinach salad. Tortellini. & Sausage Risotto

review.des: On a packed Friday night with a large group, we still had good service. Food and drinks came out in a reasonable time, and were all tasty. On a large group with lots of sharing plates, we had a bite of probably a third of the menu. This place is also a great patio spot in summer.

My first 5 months of the year were spent primarily in Chi Town. Quartino's was a place i was so happy that my crew had found. There are many choices in the city. Quarto's is a fantastic mix of Chicago's long time consistent restaurants with Excellent freshly prepared products from top to bottom.

Service is top notch and consistent. So let me just say this,, in the many times ( I clearly did not use my Yelp check in every time) I'd been there between January and June 2016, Ive not identified anything I do not like or really do not love.. With that, some of the can't miss items, are Calamari, Big, crunchy, tender, and full of flavor, any of the house vegetables, Brocolli Rabe, Spinach,  Eggplant, all winners..The Burrata is a MUST! Veal Meatball sliders! Incredible.
Any of the housemate pizza's are a winner, The Pizze Quattro Formaggi,, DAMN!!!

Unfortunately I cannot comment on the desserts because we've always been happily full. That's my mistake. However I have to believe it's all worthwhile. Priced reasonable acrsso the board, always a busy hopping place ( a great sign of a good place in a restaurant deluged town)  and one that I'll never forget with my opening crew of 2016.

The dining room harkens back to the 50's and 60's with the mini tiles and ceiling artwork of another era. It's pretty unchanged, and hopefully it never does. The servers are moving there. And the management is on the floor. The food speaks for its;f, but the service ties it up nicely in a neat unforgettable bow.

This place is basically Italian tapas. All plates are small in portion and meant to be shared. That being said the 4-5 that we had were very very good. Calamari and veal meatball sliders were excellent and the homemade pasta was awesome as well.

Would recommend for small or large groups, as its a great place to share plates. Would visit again!

3.5 stars
I had lunch reservation at 7pm for 8 people and we were quickly seated. We decided to eat family style so we could try as many dishes as possible. We ordered 7 different dishes.
Rustica Pizza - my favorite dish of the restaurant, just tasted right
Soprano Pizza - tasted a bit odd with the chili peppers
Duck Prosciutto Pizza - couldn't taste the duck at all, just tasted like a cheese pizza with arugula. definitely not worth the price.
Tortellini - this was decent but there wasn't enough of it
Fettucini - over cooked and not enough sauce
Cheese Fondue - this was okay. the cheese wasn't that tasty.
Duck Prosciutto - pretty good, but a bit too oily.

Also ordered a bellini, which was super fruity and couldn't taste the alcohol at all.
I feel like the quality of the meal definitely slipped since it was on July 4th and there were way too many orders going into the kitchen. For most of the night, it sounded like the dishes were coming out 20 minutes later than usual.

Went here for a friends' 20th birthday and only had to wait 10 minutes to be sat at our table that we had made a reservation for. It's a very crowded place, but we weren't bothered by that and it was still easy to hold conversation. The service was very good considering how busy it was and our waitress was attentive. They started us with some bread which was nothing special just a baguette, but it was enough to snack on. We ordered the pear and baby spinach salad to start with the fried calamari, both were very good. The portions are small so they recommend about 2 per person. There were 4 of us and we all ordered one entree and an extra to share. It was enough for us and we all ate a little from each plate. The prices aren't bad and the food was all very good!

As always Quartino amazes with a fantastic, fresh and extensive menu and excellent service. Annie the maitre d was extremely gracious while we waited to sit, and our server was continually helpful. A Chicago standby!

My husband and I love Quartino and bring people here every time anyone comes to town for a visit. The food is amazing (noodles are homemade, sauces are excellent, bread is freshly sliced) and everything is very reasonably priced for a River North location. The food comes out quickly and the service is always very attentive. Highly recommend the pizzas and all pastas!

Great pasta, cozy and casual inside, and they take reservations.

The menu is pretty broad, but I stick with the pasta, which is very good.  The table bread is great, as are the small salads.

Can't go wrong here.  If you like pasta, check this place out.
Love the shrimp rice (forgot the actual name) the only thing is the portion is quite little. For me, I might need two to be full

love love quartino. italian tapas are such a great idea because usually they come in such big portions that you have leftovers that are not delicious the following day.

have been to quartino on various occasions and most recently for st. patty's day to down some yummy sangria - amazing. the restaurant is always bustling no matter what time it is (especially on weekends) but its usually pretty easy to grab a seat at the bar when you have fewer than 5 in your party, which is what we ended up doing. plus - had to catch some basketball on tv! the service is fast and friendly, and everyone just seems to really enjoy being there, which i think is a great sign.

on earlier occasions i've tried the seafood stew, meatballs, various pastas and pizzas, as well as their yummy tiramisu - and you can get half portion, which is key to success after a lot of carbs... cant wait to come back to chicago to eat moreee - so much deliciousness in this city.

Fast service and great location but I would not come here solely for the pizza because it is not anything special. Vibes were good here. Bruschetta and chicken soup was fantastic. Can see sports on tv here.
Absolutely exceptional customer service! Amazing food. Fabulous service. If you're in the area Quartino is a must.

We ate in the bar on a Sunday evening and loved the atmosphere. My husband and I ordered several dishes and shred them all. Everything we had was delicious but our favorite dishes were the stuffed dates and the linguine with clams.  Our server was helpful when we asked for suggestions. We will definitely visit Quartino again the next time we are back in Chicago.

I've been to Quartino 3 times now and have had a great experience each time. The staff is always attentive and kind and the food is great. I don't think there is a single dish I've had here that I didn't like. One of my favorites are their polenta fries.

The first time I came was late at night with a large group of people, the second time with a smaller group, and the third time with just one other person. The level of service and attention we received each time was the same and that's one of the main reasons (the food too, of course) that I would keep returning to this restaurant in the future.
Very nice restaurant. The waiter was friendly and helpful. Food was tasty! Had the sun dried tomato soup followed with linguine and clams. The menu will please just about anyone.

I can't figure out why this restaurant is so highly rated. We had reservations for 3 for 7pm on a Sunday. First we ordered the fried calamari and the tasting special they have which is just cut meats, olives, veg and cheeses. And also some wine.

This took a good 45 minute to an hour to get out and we were not pleased. When we realized how long this took we decided to order the penne in vodka sauce and linguine with clams when the starters came out, which did not have such a long wait time.

The food overall was basic at best. The calamari was tender however the breading kept falling off and we had to be scraping it off the plate to get some crunch. The tasting spread was good. The penne vodka did not live up to standards I'm used to. The linguine with clams was decent. If you want an intimate setting, this is not for you as the restaurant is very large, crowded, bright and very noisy. Will not be going back.

One of the best restaurants in the city, hands down! Everything we had when we visited about two months ago was simply delicious from the pizza to the handmade pasta we both ordered and even to the blood orange sorbet. I have been dying to come back, especially in the beautiful weather we have been experiencing. I live all of the way in the Northwest suburbs and I have needed to stop myself from making a special trip into the city just for their pizza and some pasta to take back home. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone! We will definitely be back very soon! Thank you for having us and giving us an amazing experience with food and the service!

Super fun dining experience. Great for groups. Highly recommend making a reservation. Plates are meant to be shared, so they are smaller. Also, for a nice restaurant, the prices are extremely reasonable. You can go with friends, try tons of dishes, be super full, and not break the bank. The wine is also delish and reasonably priced. I recommend trying the chocolate fondue for dessert.

I am so shocked that I have never been here before a few weeks ago! It's everything you'd want in your friendly neighborhood Italian restaurant, and more.
First of all, the prices are beyond reasonable, our check was $55 for two people and that was 4 dishes, 2 desserts, and 2 glasses of wine, I was very impressed!

Secondly, the service is excellent. Our server was truly hustling with his huge section but he got everything done and was just so genuine. He took the time to help us sort through the extensive menu and choose wine, all with a smile (a real one).

Thirdly, the atmosphere couldn't be better. It's crowded and just the right amount of loud where you know every one is having a great time. You really feel like you are in an authentic Italian restaurant; complete with a bread slicer in the middle of the floor, meats and cheeses hanging everywhere and Italian football jerseys covering the walls and the servers. I love the funny black and white Italian movies playing on mute with English subtitles. My friend and I were trying to figure out the plot the entire time we were waiting for our food (we never got it).

Lastly, the food here is amazing. Start with the white bean garlic dip and you will end up eating all the bread and probably asking for more. The pizzas are full of flavor and really heavy on the toppings, which I think are the best parts. Save room for dessert as you won't want to miss the profiteroles or the Nutella sandwich; get both and you won't be disappointed!

I LOVE this place. I used to come here all the time in college and recently went back for a reunion and everything was just as wonderful as I remembered. It is a lovely spot for any meal, any occasion.

I have tried most of the options on the menu and there has not been one thing I was dissatisfied with. Fantastic pizzas, wonderful perfectly portioned pastas, and the shrimp is a must-try.
This is hands down my favorite Italian food in Chicago. The place is always busy. The bar is always packed. The food is always good. You will not leave there disappointed

Can't begin to explain how much enjoyment was received from dining at Quartino's recently.  This place is a can't miss for great food and even better atmosphere and service.  

Don't go as a single, two or three, but a party of four or more is perfect for this loud, raucous, Italian kaleidoscope of options and surprises.

Our waitress Amanda (and trainee Rebecca) were the perfect hosts to match our tipsy, chatty table and help us fund our way thru the menu.  

The concept is small, shareable plates that feed 3-4 comfortably....as long as you know many more plates are coming.  The beauty is you don't get bogged down eating one, large, rich Italian dish but get to try so many.  You're not struggling to clean your plate, you have a good portion and wait for the next dish with the stack of clean plates on your table.

New dishes were timed PERFECTLY to not overcrowd the small 4 top we were trying our best to overload.  The service was so attentive that empty plates were gone quickly, bread was plentiful as was water and wine.  The pace was amazing.  

Were having too much fun to not try desserts which also did not disappoint.  Just an all-around ASTOUNDING dining experience.  Thank you Amanda.  You should ask for her if you can.

I don't know why there is one bad review about this restaurant. I have been coming here for 9 years and the food is wonderful. It is always crowded so I recommend a reservation, I think the crowd says something about how great it is. The ambiance gives you a feel of what it's like to be in a crazy loud  authentic Italian household with mismatched silverware, and proper glasses to drink wine and beer out of. Highly recommend the veal meatballs, penne alla vodka, and the meat and cheese board which is a really decent size. The means and cheese are so fresh as well! Profiteroles are the best way to go with dessert! Highly
recommend
Amazing night on the balcony . The food was a amazing and the service was top notch. Can't wait to go back.

The perfect place for a lively gathering. The best bet is to be comfortable settling in for a lengthier, shareable meal. Dinner becomes a bit of an adventure as you sample a bit of everything.

The waitstaff is friendly and eager to provide helpful recommendations. You never feel rushed, but always feel welcomed, as if by a jovial Italian family.
Quartino was a perfect place to eat near our hotel on a cold rainy night . I love the italian tapas style menu and the price was reasonable. It's enough  for 2 people to share.

When this place first opened, almost a decade ago, the food and wine was fantastic. Admittedly, it was probably most fun for the loud scene, and the ambiance that the Gibsons Group are known to create.

Here's the issue:
1. The quality has gone way down on the food, as have the portions.
2. The beverage offerings have gone down even more. They plain suck, and lack any variety that Italy has plenty to offer, at reasonable prices.
3. The hostess team is clearly lost. They can't handle the door volume. It shows, and it creates unneeded issues in the small space people wait in, at the front door.

This place feeds on the tourist crowd with the hotels that surround it. They also have a tendency to bribe concierges to send you here, so be wary of that if a concierge seems overly excited to 'get you in here'.

Very disappointed in our lunch today. Food portions were very small for the price. We had the Penne w/Vodka, asparagus risotto and some other sides for three of us and not enough food. The fondue cheese was good, but not enough bread was included. There was no Parmesan cheese brought to the table for our bread and oil, the olive oil sitting on the table was in a slippery little can. Not overly appealing . Cute place but not overly impressed with the food or portions for the price. Will not go back anytime soon, there are a lot of better options in the area.
Love this place! Rob and Trevor are the best bartenders ever!! What a great Manhattan Trevor made! Will come back again and again ..anddddd again. :)

Great food we had to go back the next to get the seafood frutti de mare (not on menu). OMG. Best dish and best frutti de mare I've ever had (obviously since I went back two nights in a row). The sauce was ridic delicious. The best and most pleasant surprise was the bill - this restaurant has the best prices! I'm already thinking I need to go back to Chicago just to come here!
Everything was great. I tried 7 different things, all of them tasteful and well cooked. From the appetizers to the dessert, all five stars. Highly recommended

This is an awesome find! The food was delicious the atmosphere was awesome and service was great. Amanda, our server, was friendly and helpful. What a great personality! We enjoyed our evening on the balcony with excellent food and great wine. our water was kept full, and empty dishes removed by the busser. One of the other servers actually stopped by to chat about my dessert that I had, and a manager checked on us during our meal. The restroom attendant was very friendly as well. I would definitely recommend a visit to this awesome restaurant!

Great place for large parties to share a whole lotta small plates. On average, each plate can fill 1 (male) - 2 (female) people but heavyweights will need at least 2 plates to themselves. Good wine selection at good prices. Interior can get pretty loud however.

Gnocchi with arugula pesto: 4/5
Steamed Clams: 3/5 (small clams but decent flavor)
Pappardelle (flat pasta with meat sauce): 3/5
Brodetto (seafood soup): 4/5 (great seafood with better soup, especially with the bread, hard to share)
Braised Pork Shank: 4/5 (fall off the bone)
D'anitra (duck prosciutto with arugula) pizza: 4.5/5 (delicious but wish there was more duck on the pizza itself)

While the service was good, I was not impressed with the food here.  

My friend and I shared the vegetarian pizza (very bland and "blah"), white bean dip (decent), and polenta fries (also decent, but nothing special).  None of the dishes really stood out, and nothing was particularly flavorful.

The service was friendly, attentive, and prompt.

I met a friend for lunch on a Monday, and the location was pretty dead.

Given the positive reviews, I came expecting more and left a bit disappointed.

What they're good at: cocktails; tagliatelle; table bread.
What they're not good at: attention to detail.

Even with a reservation expect to wait for a table during the weekend. Luckily they have excellent cocktails (red sangria or limoncello martini) to tide you over.

The kitchen could stand to pay closer attention to detail, however. One of our pancetta-wrapped dates had no date or Gorgonzola in it; the baby octopus could have stood a bit longer in the pressure cooker (some tentacles tough, others just right); the risotto was undercooked and crunchy; the chair I was sitting at must have had some marshmallow on it from a previous party because when I got up the back of my pants were sticky.

Just a few seconds to wipe down seats, cook food a bit longer, and taste and inspect the food before going out could go a long way at this place.
Wow.. such excellent service and what's even better is the food. The eggplant parmigiana is a must have! And the chocolate fondue is to die for. I will definitely be coming back.

Food quality super fresh but portions are small (as they noted all meant for sharing - small plates style)...which means it ended up being a pricier lunch than we expected...but the experience was worth it.

Our server was attentive and informative of the menu.

Hosts were friendly.  

Ordered the following:

Duck Prosciutto
Mushroom pizza
Shaved vegetables
Grilled Salmon
Mushroom Risotto
Grilled Steak
Baked Eggplant
Pesto Gnocchi

Love the atmosphere of Quartino! It's fun, busy, good people watching and a good night out for a date or groups. The portions are a good size for mostly plates to share. I recommend the pasta and seafood over the pizza. I really like that you can order 1/2 bottles of wine. The problem is they are usually late seating with reservations when it gets busy. We had to wait about 30 minutes past our res time the last time we were there. Be prepared to possibly wait but it is usually worth it.

We visited with a large group and had a great experience.  On the plus side, they are clearly experienced dealing with large groups.  On the negative, this is probably because it is always PACKED - and they definitely jam the tables (and the guests) in the restaurant.  I also noticed an interesting mix of families with rowdy children (that's us!), and young, single people, looking annoyed about all of the families and rowdy children.
Otherwise, it is a "small plates" concept.  We ordered a lot of everything, so I had a chance to taste a lot.  We had several of the pizzas and those were great.  I was mostly impressed by how different each of them tasted (they don't just interchange toppings - each pizza has its own flavor).  The crusts are uneven and toasty - perfectly homemade!  I really enjoyed them all.  We also had a tortellini that was amazing - a perfect butter cream sauce that was not overdone.  Additionally, we had parpadalle that came with some kind of ragu.  Personally, I wasn't the biggest fan of the sauce (thought it lacked flavor) - but our table ordered a couple after tasting one - so I must have been outnumbered on that.  We did taste some calamari at the beginning, and that was really excellent.
I thought this restaurant was pretty solid - but nothing that knocked my socks off.  This is a good place for groups and for casual outings.  I would not suggest this for a date, unless you're afraid you won't have much to talk about :)

This is my favorite Italian place in the city.  Great atmosphere and the food is very delicious.  Quartino's serves a variety of options; all well presented and perfectly portioned. Its nice to go to place and you are able to try a variety of food without being overwhelmed.
I recommend going late at night so its not so crowded and chaotic.

Great food, great service. Reviews speak for themselves. We came on a Sunday, no wait. Server was very polite and made some great recs.
Mrs ordered: linguine w/ clams in white sauce-very good
I ordered veal steak: amazing !!!
Only thing to note is that portions are small so may want to order appetizers.
Will be coming here again !!!

Great place for a big birthday dinner or just a dinner with friends in general. It's tapas style Italian food. Can't really go wrong with much on the menu. It's not gonna be the best Italian food you have ever had, but definitely good quality! The wine is also DIRT cheap, surprising for the area. Which is what makes it such a great option. Also, it's open until 2am, so good late night dinner option. Reservations are definitely necessary for dinner though, because it's usually pretty packed!

This is a great Italian restaurant.... wonderful venue.... very good service ... and great quality food. We did not have reservations but were seated after a very short wait. Bread and oil were brought to our table within 2 to 3 minutes.... ordered our appetizer and had it within 5 minutes. Entrees were brought to us within another 5 -7 minutes.... we had the donuts for dessert.... mama mia... don't miss these with the honey or chocolate sauce!!

This is an extremely buzzing place! I have been here thrice and each time had to a good time. The atmosphere is hip, people are chik and food is slick!

This was my first time visiting with my family. Ordered vegetarian dishes. 2 out of 3 dishes were good. The bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar never fails. Service is fast, family style dining, a must visit place!
A bit touristy, but the food makes it all worth it. Charcuterie and pasta are my go tos

Quartino offers a full range of high quality Italian food and prices which are reasonable for the quality you are receiving.  This is what one would expect from a restaurant in the Gibson's family.  The service is always prompt and courteous, and the food speaks for itself.  Eating at the bar is always fun as the bartenders never fail to be friendly and very willing to offer up suggestions on what to eat, or for drinks.

My girlfriend and I dined here on a very quite and cold post Christmas afternoon. The atmosphere is extremely cozy, despite the restaurant being very big (there is both an upstairs and downstairs). The service is absolutely top notch. My gf and I were talking and catching up so we didn't even look at the menu for the first 3-4 times our waiter came over but she was more than happy to wait for us.

You get warm bread upon sitting....it was delicious. We gobbled it right up with oil, balsamic, and the parm cheese that was on the table. The menu is large for small plated Italian. Soups, salads, pizza, pastas, antipasto...you name it, they got it! We decided on the caprese salad and a spicy sausage flatbread pizza. Both were delicious and just enough for lunch. We didn't drink, nor order desserts but those of those menus were substantial as well.

Quartino is a great, cozy little spot in the heart of River North. A better bang for your buck too if shopping around Michigan Ave....as opposed to eating on the Mag Mile:)

Sorry, had high expectations judging from the reviews but perhaps our concierge recommended a different place for good reason. Parents are well travelled and I've been to New York but this place can't even compare to our Vancouver BC quality for pizza. In my 30odd years of pizza eating never had I left a restaurant with unfinished pizza. Well my parents did the same tonight. The homemade fettuccine was just as poor.
Pizza crust was the chewiest I've ever had, tomatoe sauce tasted raw and uncooked, cheese was so thin and flavourless, basil leaves (on the margarita) was also raw! A frozen pizza would have fared better.
Homemade fettuccine had a rough and very chewy texture. It was also unusually thick- so much so I thought we ordered bad handmade Chinese noodles.
They don't even have draft beer, maybe just good ambiance.
Oh and the washroom design was unique- so I liked that.

Was at Pizano's two nights ago- Very good deep dish and homemade pasta- though they're known for their thin crust I believe.  
or
Portillos hot dogs is just 2 blocks away and yes they're awesome. See my reviews for these two venues.

Quartino:
Food: 1/5
Service: 3/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Food most important overall: 2/5

Been here a handful of times, and the experience is consistent everytime. Dishes are tapas style. Ask me to choose among deep dish, NY, and Neapolitan style pizza, and 100% of the time, i will pick Neapolitan. Get the fennel sausage pizza!

Other must-tries are:
Tagliatelle alla Bolognese pasta
Orecchiette pasta
homemade tiramisu

What i realllllly love about this place is that i don't have to make a reservation and can expect to be seated within 30 minutes for a walk-in.

Warning: can get loud, but the place is extremely spacious with two floors and outside seating, so it's very tolerable.

Absolutely love this place.  Came here years ago and was very happy to find it is still just as great!  Ate in the bar and had a couple of small plates; then returned and ate in the dining room for a fabulous dinner.

Never had a bad meal here. Every pizza has been good, the food tastes fresh. The bartenders are good at recommending a good wine with your meal. The tortellini with prosciutto is excellent. The veal meatballs are too die for. The polenta fries are crisp and fresh. The zeppole for dessert is wonderful. This is a great night out restaurant!

Worth. It.
If you can, sit outside. Wonderful people watching. Food is spectacular and the service is even better. We ordered the Quattro Fammiggia pizza and choc fondue with strawberries. Such a great combo. Will come back next time I'm in Chicago.

pics.caption: Chocolate fondue and strawberries. So good!

review.des: Meatballs and pizza were made to perfection. Excellent waiting staff all around, manager was making rounds to the tables, which is rare nowadays. Everything was priced right, will definitely be back with friends and family

LOVE this place!! My husband and I sat outside and enjoyed the olives plate and calamari. We had a cheese selection and two dinners salads. The food was perfect and the outdoor atmosphere paired well with to our Chicago weekend.

pics.caption: Great restaurant!!! We shared calamari, salad, and a cheese plate.

review.des:
I came here with a group for dinner before heading out to celebrate my sister's birthday.  The idea of tapas kind of makes me nervous... will I like it?  Why do we have to share?  Will I still be hungry after?  Did everyone wash their hands?  Things like that.  Luckily, my worries were unwarranted as I did get plenty to eat and the food was good.  We ordered several dishes, from what I can remember we had some pasta, some bacon wrapped dates, margaherita pizza (that's probably spelt wrong) and another type of pizza I can't remember.  The pizza was my favorite (go figure) but everything else was good too.  It was definitely a type of food I've never tried before but was interesting.  They also had a nice wine list that I enjoyed.

On a random note, they had a bathroom attendant that was so sweet!  Normally I don't go to places that have bathroom attendants but she had everything you could imagine in that bathroom with music playing while she was dancing around with the other guests.  I don't know she was just such a happy nice girl.  I left her $5 and I think everyone else should too!

Satisfying food and outstanding customer service! I made the decision to try baby octopus and yes it was scrumptious. Sad to say though, Tuscan kale salad was common. Had a good time! I definitely will visit again.
awesome

Excellent choice. I recommend the bar area we walked in to an hour wait but the bar 1st come1st serve.we were lucky got a table and a great server named .Shenade it was a perfect experience for us .... fresh goat cheese ricotta delicious n pizza we did 1/2 4 cheese n 1/2stefano wine list is very good . I hope you try it you will be happy you did. We are coming back for sure

So glad I made reservations! This placed was jam packed. And I can see why after having to be rolled out of there. The food was DELIC! The tomato soup was the best out of the 7 courses we ordered. I wish I could ship some home. We ordered the sampler platter and had it hand picked by our waitress, Alessandra (which by the way is top notch! If you go here make sure to ask to sit in her section!). Next was the soup, and then shrimp risotto, gnocchi, penne vodka, broccoli rabe and margarita pizza. The pizza could use a little work; pretty crunchy on the bottom, the basil was way too strong, and there were no tomatoes. The "If You See Kay" wine was really tasty, as well as the Bellini. I will definitely come back here when in the area.
Great small plates. The wine menu is decent but could use a little more variety. The cavatelli were delightful and filling.
Service was great. Meal was spaced out well for small plates. Everything was delicious. Recommend the calamari, truffle risotto and polenta fries.

This place was well priced and really great for the quality of food. Loved the linguine with clams and felt like I had more clams than pasta. Would recommend the fettuccine Alfredo as a cheesy warm delight. The only thing I'd change? If the bread wAs warm this place would get 5 stars!
Packed place but we were able to find a seat at the bar and had great service and food. Eggplant Parmesan was amazing and the house made pasta was good too!
Worth a second try. Menu was decent. Service was not bad. Massive place, good wine options, not too pricy and the location is good.

Quartino is a tapas style restaurant where everything that you order is meant to be shared with your group. Obviously you don't have to do things that way, but that's the main gist of the place.

I came here with my family, and we ended up getting the Margherita pizza, veil, prime roast rib, and tortellini. Overall, the food was good. My favorite dish was the tortellini Alfredo with prosciutto. For dessert we had the Zeppoli with Nutella. (Fried dough)

The service of the food was okay. It did take a while for dishes to come out, and it didn't help that we kept filling up on bread. On the bright side, the bread was absolutely amazing. The tables had oil with sea salt. You can ask for cheese separately, in which the waiters give you your own grated cheese device. The cheese is Pana Di Grana, which is something completely new to me. (And I'm Italian!)

The ambiance of the restaurant was very packed. For being a Sunday night, we were so close together, we could hear conversations from other tables. It sometimes felt a little claustrophobic to the point that I wanted some fresh air or had to distract myself with my phone from the amount of people being backed into a dining room.

Our waiter, Adam, was really nice and answered all of our questions thoroughly. It was cool seeing him and the staff wearing Italian sports jerseys.

Quartino's feels like the place you go to when you can't check out your local Italian grocery store for the same products. Maybe I'm just missing the bandwagon on it. While the food was good, I wouldn't come back here for the tapas style service.

pics.caption: Fried dough with Nutella was delicious!
Margherita pizza with basil leaves on top. The crust was slightly burnt, but overall very tasty!
Tortellini with prosciutto was really good! Probably my favorite dish of the bunch.

review.des:
Quartino is a factory operation.  They churn large groups in and out with practiced efficiency, and so this is a place where large groups tend to congregate.  

They bring out dishes as they come, a la francaise, so that you have multiple courses in front of you simultaneously, getting colder and colder unless you eat like a maniac.  The food itself - pizzas, pastas, salads - is about on par with Olive Garden, which is not necessarily a bad thing. It is inexpensive.  The best tasting dishes I've had during my 3 or so visits here were the burrata and the chocolate cake.

The servers are either absent or impatient, or both, and will start setting the table for the next group while you're still finishing your meal.  If you have 15-20 people, give it a chance perhaps, but if you're craving good Italian food, there has to be better!

Excellent food and service!  We were visiting from out of town. We had the pork shank, mushroom risotto and doughnuts for dessert. They had my favorite wine and plenty of options on the menu. Only downside is that it is very loud.

This restaurant was so amazing. The best customer service I have had in a long time and tasty food. We thought we made reservations but somehow didn't. We explained this to the front desk and they found us a table within 5 minutes. Everything came out perfect and our waiter brought us tons of free desserts (that were great). I am vegan and they made sure my meal was free of dairy, meat and eggs and even brought me a vegan friendly dessert. Would definitely go back and would recommend this to anyone.

Absolutely delicious food. Perfect sized portions, larger than I expected since I wasn't very hungry and i was so full when done. Had the veal meatball slider which was great, a wild arugula salad and eggplant parm, both really very good.
Highly recommend this restaurant, excellent variety of dishes on the menu, most smaller size plates so you can have a few. Only disappointment was no pizza tonight as the pizza oven was not working. Excellent service too!

I have been to this restaurant twice and the food is always delicious! They offer shareable portions and the tables are set up to do so. I have ordered salmon and fried calamari and I must say that this is the best fried calamari I have ever had! It's is fresh and tasty, I can't wait to go back again! Great restaurant and nice atmosphere! Love this place!
The bread was really cold and doesn't taste good, but the main dish was alright. Their dishes only serve one person,, and if you eat an Italian way, make sure to get another side.

The place is okay. My wife is a vegetarian and this place has good options for vegetarians. The reason that I am giving this place 3 stars is because of the service and an incident. My wife and I went to this restaurant in non busy hours, around 4pm. We waited for good 5 minutes before a server gave us the menu. The server seemed busy with his friends and would check upon us only if I gave him a "can you serve us plz" look. When our entree arrived, the dish was very hot and the server, who was actually using a towel to hold it, put that dish in my hand instead of putting it on my side of the table. When I yanked my hand off the dish after putting it on my table then the server says - "please be careful, it's hot". Thanks for letting me know???
Should have at least apologized for it.
Poor service and manners.

My wife and I went here after a few recommendations.  We had the waiter recommend a few small plates. The eggplant spread but the two cheeses we had, along with the salamis were good, but not world beating. We had the tortellini with prosciutto and peas as our main dish, along with the wild arugula salad. They were both great.  We left satisfied, and also thinking it was very reasonable for a downtown Chicago restaurant b

One additional point. We ate outside, and the outside chair my wife sat in was filthy. We didn't find this out until we went into Nordstrom afterwards. I called the manager from the store, and he was very apologetic. I gave him the table number, and he was going to hopefully prevent another pants disaster after ours. He said to come on by with the dry cleaning bill, or if the pants didn't come clean, he would take care of it. I didn't have to do either, because we washed them back at the condo, and they came clean. So, if the manager happens to read this- no harm no foul- but I appreciate the gesture.

TLDR: good for kids, good food, good service, BUT food slow to come out and value depends on the dish

Big perk - stroller check. Just like baggage. Exchange stroller for ticket upon entrance and pick up stroller when done.

Big perk - went here with the lady and child on the 4th of July around 7pm and was able to get seated (inside not outside( immediately

After we ordered we hadn't heard anything about food or our wine for about 15-20 min. The manager came out and apologized for the delay, as they didn't have what I had ordered and offered me three different samples.

The food took a while to come out but was well worth the wait. The pizza comes out faster than the pasta.

The food was excellent. However, be careful what plates you order. A plate of tortellini is much more filling than a plate of pappardelle.

Typically the wait would turn me off but the atmosphere was great and management was on top of acknowledging any delays which is enough for me. We're all human and get behind sometimes.

6 GOOD AND 6 BAD
GOOD
1) Good for big crowds
2) lots of different alcohol
3) large selection of food
4) Attentive Staff
5) Inexpensive
6) Good location
Bad
1) Parking is expensive
2) Very Loud could hardly hear
3) To crowded
4) They said the food came out as it was ready but there was no rhyme or reaosn e.g. appetizer 1 salad 1 meal 1 meal 2 appetizer 1  meal 2 salad 2
5) The food was only okay not enough punch or real cheese for pasta garnish
6) Too cold inside

Awesome Italian styled tapas bar.

Wonderful Eggplant Parmigiana, Roasted Baby Octopus, and Neapolitan Pizze.

I had the pleasure of visiting Quartino for the first time while visiting Chicago for work just last week. I live in Pittsburgh and have literally thought about this restaurant every day since my return a week ago. So where do I begin....

My co-workers and I were looking for a great restaurant for dinner after we had spent the day traveling and working. Those of us who still had battery life on our iPhones were searching away on Yelp and Urbanspoon, trying to find a great spot for dinner. The first place that we found was small and had a 1-2 hour wait, so we decided to find another place.

We were exhausted and starving when we finally stumbled into Quartino. It was a Monday night, and the restaurant was pretty deserted. We were quickly seated on the upstairs balcony. (Yes, we were lucky enough to be in Chicago when it was 68 degrees in December!) They tried to seat all five of us at a tiny table, but I asked if we could push two tables together to have more room. I think the staff anticipated that we would just order a small glass of wine and tiny appetizer to share... but they had no idea of the appetite we had worked up all day. We were ready for some serious ordering and table filling.

Service was prompt and polite. The waiter presented our wine in a very formal manner, which I thought was interesting -- and a little awkward. However, once I began to eat, the food was so delicious that I entered an Italian food coma, ignoring all that was going on around me, including the fact that I didn't realize the balcony was completely filled until we left at 7:30pm.

The great thing about trying new restaurants with a group is that you get to try so many different things! We tried -- Margherita Pizza, Salumeria Tasting, White Bean & Garlic Spread, Caprese Salad, Gnocchi, Cavatelli, Tagliatelle alla Bolognese, Tortellini, Penne alla Vodka, and Beef Short Ribs. All of our dishes were at least good while many dishes ranked in the excellent-and-still-dreaming-about-it-a-week-later category.

I highly recommend ordering pasta here. Every pasta that came out seemed to top the previous. The Cavatelli in particular was a table favorite. As a pasta lover, my love of pasta is why I'm dreaming of returning in the future. I was disappointed in the Margherita Pizza -- it was a bit cold and bland -- but was told later by friends that the poor pizza quality is more of an exception than the rule. Apparently, they normally have fantastic pizza. I'll have to order a different type next time!

Most importantly, I can't forget the wine! My table ordered a bottle of red and a carafe of white and only spent about $50 or $60 for both. And finally, the total bill... this will blow your mind......

10 Dinner Items, ranging from Salad to Pasta and Meat
+
1 Bottle of Wine and 1 1/2 Liter of Wine
=
$200

Wow. Not sure how that's possible... we were delightfully surprised that we walked away completely stuffed from a tapas restaurant and only spent $40 each.

And all of the above is the reason why I will be dreaming of this restaurant until I return sometime in 2013.

pics.caption: View of half of our table at Quartino, including the Salumeria Tasting plate, Tagliatelle alla Bolognese, and Gnocchi
Half of our table - Beed Short Ribs, Penne alla Vodka, White Bean & Garlic Spread, Cavatelli, Tortellini, and Margherita Pizza

review.des: I've been here a handful of times with groups of anywhere from 2 to 8! It's great for all sizes. The food is tapas style italian and everything is pretty delicious. Great for vegetarians as well! Especially the penne vodka and the pizzas! Also, do not leave without trying the Torta al Cioccolato (molten lava cake). SO GOOD!

This place is soooo much fun. It's always busy and crowded, it's loud (but in a good way). Not the little romantic or neighborhood Italian dinner spot - Michael Corleone would not have been comfortable here - too many people.

The food is great, service impeccable, and the selection will knock your socks off. Be ready to share, the plates are on the table for. A reason - if you don't share; well you may not like this place (chances are you're going to be eating alone anyway if you're not a good sharer).

Be ready to have a good time.

See my rock reviews and subscribe @ m.youtube.com/watch?v=L4…
Absolutely the best Italian I've ever had....plain and simple! Great service and great food!

The food was amazing and our set Francesca was so awesome. Very attentive and super friendly. Would highly recommend to anyone.

MUST TRY the desert ~ profiteroles ! See pic attached

pics.caption: My desert was out of this world delicious

review.des: We came with a group, and tried at least 10 different menu items. Highlights were the pizzas, and calamari (the stuff that cant be screwed up).  I didn't think it was possible to have bad Burrata, but they served it. Texture was rubbery and required force to cut. The cheese lacked any creaminess because this was solid/old. Beets were sliced paper thin, and cut into smaller than skittles pieces. Risotto was ok, nothing special. I feel like this place is so busy, they have a had time cooking with any type of quality. Been here a few times, and not sure if I want to come back. Will suggest other places to friends next time. Bathroom on 2nd floor was kind of annoying as well.

First off, I really really really wanted to LOVE this place. What I loved about it: the ambience, the prices, the pasta bolognese, the diversity of the menu, the wine, the bread and olive oil.
What I didn't like so much, the veal skirt steak, the pizza, the calamari.
Most of the food was just okay to me. Nothing at all special. The pizza was fresh and had great ingredients, I know, but it lacked in flavor. It didn't taste like anything! The calamari was okay but the fried chunks were to big and there wasn't much of a crust because it was falling off. I was so excited to try the veal skirt steak! It was so tender but again no flavor whatsoever. It was so bizarre to me! Were we supposed to flavor the meat ourselves? Idk just not what I expected.
I think I will give this place another try since I came here on Valentine's Day and it was pretty busy. Everyone I know that has been here before loves it!
So far, the only thing worthy of coming back for is the pasta bolognese.
Great location!

I just ordered food to go. The short ribs are amazing!!  Also tried a rigatoni with lamb dish, it was outstanding. Staff was friendly and helpful. This place has a great vibe. I wish I would have been able to stay and dine in. Affordable parking right across the street. They also valet for like 15$. I will absolutely be going back.

Went here for dinner on a Sunday night w/ my sister around 6:30ish and we were seated immediately since we were okay with sitting outside. If we didn't, the wait would be around 45 min...and just before we had left our hotel we were contemplating on making a reservation but from availability, we decided to skip doing that--if it was colder, I would say it was a bad decision on our part, but since the weather was only in the low 50's in the evening, it wasn't bad at all!

WHAT WE GOT:
1) Salumeria Tasting: you get a choice of 2 salumis, 2 cheeses, and 3 spuntini .... we decided on mortadella and the duck prosciutto (so good!!), pecorino and taleggio, and the roasted peppers, beet salad, and artichokes campobasso. Loveeeed the assortment they give you--there was such a wide variety, plus olives and an apricot spread they give you--that we were never bored with what we had.
2) Gnocchi: with green beans, potatoes, arugula pesto--this was so good! The gnocchi were nice, pillowy bites of goodness. Mmmmmm.

My sister and I were looking around and admiring what all the other tables had gotten around us--we wish we weren't full or else we would have ordered more (especially the pizza!). Next time.... next time. Our server was nice and great with checking in on us and even apologized after our gnocchi came out before our tasting--we didn't mind at all!

It was packed when we got there but we got lucky and there were two seats at the bar for my cousin and I! The food was delicious and our bartender, William was amazing!! Super great service and very sweet!! Will definitely be coming back soon!
I really enjoyed the food this restuarant had to offer. Specially the desserts. Highly recommend this place. Its also very affordable and the service is top notch.

We always love finding new places in Chicago and this one was amazing. The food was delicious...try the clams and linguini! And prices were incredibly reasonable. This place does get crazy busy so get here early!

I can't recommend this one enough

Loved it! Food and service was amazing. Between the 3 of us we ordered the burrata, kale salad and arugula pizza. Everything was fresh and delicious. For dessert, we got the tiramisu, which was good but I've had better, and profiteroles, which disappeared really quick! Would definitely go back.

I love Quartino. As an Italian woman with extremely high standards for Italian Cuisine, that is saying a lot.

I was on the fence about coming here the first time because Italian food is not typically served as tapas, but that is in fact what makes this place so great. The first time I was here, my date and I ordered a bunch of different items ranging from pastas, meatballs, cheese plates, and a version of fruitte de marre. Delicious!

My date and I were back this weekend for our anniversary and utilized the restaurant week menu, which was a special with one appetizer plate, one pasta plate, and one seafood/meat/vegetarian plate PLUS dessert! At $33/person, this is a great promotion as most of the plates range from $8-$15. The promotion is going on until February 4, so if you're thinking about trying this place but don't want to break the bank, I highly recommend doing so!

Came here with a group of 20. The place on a Friday night was packeddd. (And no fewer than 5 bachelorette parties were occuring)
The place is loud. Really loud, I would not recommend this place for an intimate meal.
Party with friends? Sure.
Appetizers:
Assorted bruschetta - I liked the portobello mushroom one with shaved romano, delish.
Artichokes Campobasso - good.
Caponata, delicious, not too salty, lovely.

Pasta:
Potato gnocchi with argula pesto, I mean besides the fact that every server said gnocchi funny, they were homemade and delicious.
Fettuccine with fresh tomatoes and evoo. Yum. Fresh pasta makes all the difference.

Meat Course:
Salmon with black olives and tomato - delicious
Roasted Chicken with thyme - could have used some more salt, but better undersalted than over salted.

Dessert:
Dark Chocolate fonduta with pears, strawberries, pinapple, apple and biscotti. Yesss.

I saw some plates of octopus go to the table next to us, they made me jealous. They looked awesome.

I could see why there were so many parties going on.

Had dinner tonight and Alycia was amazing! Best service I've had in a while dining out, despite the restaurant being crazy busy on a rainy Tuesday night! Highly recommend the veal meatballs and cavatelli house made pasta. Thanks quartino!!
The pappardelle was outstanding. I loved the fresh pasta and beef was excellent. Sat at the bar and the service was quick and very friendly. Highly recommended!

pics.caption: P. & DJ at the bar at the restaurant in Chicago!

review.des:
Everything is better by the quart. Why? Because.. There are three more quarts to make one. I love Quartino and their small plate concept and alcohol by the quart/half liter/liter. It is perfect for sharing and trying.

I have been here a bunch of times with a bigger group and with just another person. It's definitely different experiences between the two and I had much more fun coming here with a bigger group. You can order a crapload of various plates and shared a liter of drink, or two. It ended up to be not so much at the end. When I came here with just another person, you tend to over order and the check gets to be more pricy.

I was here last Saturday with family and there were six of us. We had so much fun sharing the salumi platter, the manzo pizza, a couple of pasta dishes, the calamari, etc. The calamari was to die for! Big ass and fat round of squids fried to sheer perfection in my eyes. It was one of the best ever calamaris I have ever had! The pappardelle pasta with the braised short ribs ragout was also my fave! The pizza looked like a neapolitan brick oven style, but the crust was nice and intact. There wasn't any wet part. It was pretty damn yummy.

The drinks.. Mh.. I came here for the Bellini. I am not a huge drinker but I'd let my face get warmed and red for their Bellini. While waiting for my party to come, I patiently waited with a half liter of Bellini. They came and finished my half liter. Good thing, we ordered some more.

For desserts, we ordered the Zeppole served with honey and dark chocolate sauce that was worthy of a Soprano episode.

The service was fast and it's cool that way as you weren't afraid to order just enough as you could always order more and it wouldn't take forever. Our server was pleasant and accommodating and she was on it like white on rice about refilling our bread.

I gave four stars because I'm a fan. I didn't give five stars because some of the foods I had better elsewhere. It didn't mean it's bad, but it didn't mean five stars either. Plus, I think $40 for a liter of Bellini was very pricy.

We all had fun getting together, sharing some grubs and caught up on the latest in life. It was a fine Saturday lunch.

The pizza here absolutely blows me away! The crust is soft, but I love the flavor and texture. Quartino claims that it is a Neapolitan Pizza, but whatever it is, I like it better than what is served at Spacca Napoli.  I highly recommend getting a balsamic drizzle on top of any pizza. It's not too tart or tangy and it compliments the pizza nicely. An amazing charcuterie, cheese, olive, and Spuntini (these are miniature gourmet salads) selection is featured. If you are not a fan of pizza, you have several other fabulous options to choose from. This establishment also offers an excellent selection of wines by the glass. The servers are knowledgeable regarding the wines and happy to make a good recommendation. As other people have stated the $25 lunch option is a good deal and offers you a nice selection.

The food was about four and a half star but the employees working there were nothing but amazing and helpful that's why they get 5 stars the shrimp appetizer as well as the duck prosciutto was simply just amazing and very tasty got to give it up to Chicago Italian restaurants. This is 3rd restaurant  in just weeks time that have been nothing but impressive.

I went here on a suggestion for a sit-down Italian dinner with friends from California.  We made reservations, and although the place was packed we were seated right on time.  The service was impeccable, but the food...not so much.  I often ask the servers for suggestions (especially when it's a big menu), and her suggestions were not so great.  We had the candied dates (?) which were OK, some kind of meatballs that were OK (but very weird having raisins cooked with them), sausage pizza which was OK, and a wine (don't remember what kind) that we were unfamiliar with but specifically asked if it was dry which we didn't want...it was dry, SOOOO dry, and not at all what was expected.  The server took the wine off the tab, and she was so accommodating and awesome...too bad the food was not as good as she was.  The ambiance is LOUD (like a sports bar) and not recommended for a sit-down peaceful dinner.  Oh yeah, if you're looking for fast service, this is definitely the place.  We were done eating within 35 minutes of sitting at our table!!!

Came in for a birthday party.  The restaurant did they best they could to accommodate a party of 18.  we were able to get 2 tables next to each other to seat 9.  The atmosphere in here is really charming and cozy.  Definitely very inviting and a great date spot.  
We started off with a number of appetizers.  The meatballs were pretty good. we got them with raisins which made them a little to sweet for my taste.  I would just get them the regular way from now on.  The fried calamari was good and kind of the same as you would get at most restaurants.  The Burrata was ok, nothing special and I have had way better... The polenta fries were also OK but again I have had better..  I would not get either again.  
The margherita pizza was pretty tasty.. I really liked the Tagliatelle alla Bolognese it was rich and tasty! I also tried the cavatelli and that was pretty decent as well.
The portion sizes are medium.. not really enough to share but great for the price points!  The service is also very friendly and professional.  I like the theme of all the waiters wearing soccer jerseys.
There is also valet parking..
Overall this is a solid spot thats very cool and I look forward to trying more of their menu items.  Definitely worth a visit.

We found this place by searching Open Table for any restaurant that could accommodate our reservation for 14. We were given a list of choices and Quartino looked like it had potential.
This place vastly exceeded our expectations. Wow! Yum! We ordered family style and shared lots and lots of stuff. Small plates, pastas, meat/cheese sampler plates, salads, etc. You name it, we ordered it. I can't say I loved everything I tried, but I will tell you I didn't hate anything. The house-made pastas were the winners for me, with the bolognese being my personal favorite of the night. The papardelle with braised beef tomato sauce was also damn good. I tried the duck prosciutto pizza, against my better judgment, and it was actually really delicious. I don't normally tolerate lettuce (arugula) on a pizza, but his thing was a winner. Everything was fresh and imaginative.
We finished the evening with cappuccinos and zeppoles. Holy smokes, those tiny Italian donuts were phenomenal!
Our server was knowledgeable and informative and steered us in the right direction for the entire evening.
There were really zero defects, so 5 stars it is!

Came here for a friends birthday dinner with 9 ladies, and we loved this place!
It was tapas style... the Italian way! Can't say no to that.

The atmosphere and vibe got us excited the minute we walked in! All the tables are really close so the restaurant is quite loud but everyone looks like they're having a blast. We had dinner at 8:30pm on a Friday, so we expected there to be a crowd.

The food and drinks were fantastic. We shared 2 liters of wine: one red and one white. The toscana red wine was my favorite. As far as the food, our waiter knew there was 9 of us and 1 vegetarian so he made sure everyone got the try everything when it came out.

We ordered:
1) Campinia pizza (ricotta basil tomato): amazing!
2) Polenta fries: a little too plain for my taste.. basically a huge grainy fry
3) Eggplant Parmigiana: cheesy and delicious. not the best eggplant I've ever had, but still delicious.
4) Burrata and beets: I'm not a fan of burrata but the beets and mint were delicious.

The meat dishes were Pancetta-wrapped dates and pappardelle pasta which were both devoured by the party.

The service was fast and attentive, our waiter was knowledgeable about our taste and really catered to our party despite the crowd. He even suggested the best part of the night - the birthday girl's "cake". Usually reserved for bachelorette parties, this cake was a dose of humor and absolutely DELICIOUS. take a look at my picture for more information :)

Overall, fantastic food and service for an incredibly reasonable price and we were all stuffed afterwards.

pics.caption: Banana and creme puffs with ice cream...in a unique shape :)

review.des:
Visited this place last year when we were visiting (from Australia) and thought we would go and enjoy a meal again this visit. Staying nearby we actually dined here 2/4 nights we were in the city.

First night we enjoyed a selection of small plates, including the dates, which are a must try. The sides were also a hit, including the brussel sprouts.

Second night we ordered entrees and sides. I had the asparagus risotto which was delicious and the perfect side. Again, an order of the brussel sprouts and spinach. The meal was fantastic.  The Manager spent 10 minutes or so also talking to us and sent out a shot of the housemade limoncello (complimentary) which we enjoyed.

For a no-frills, consistant dining experience in the city, I certainly recommend this place. The staff are more than happy to accommodate requests and you can order smaller serves than what is listed on the menu.

Great, inexpensive Italian joint right in the heart of downtown Chicago! Place was booming, yet got a table without a wait. Staff was on the ball, quick and efficient on a busy Friday night. Ordered a 1/2 liter of wine for $10, and shared two plates: the Manzo pizza, with braised short rib, gorgonzola, roasted fennel, and walnut pesto; and the rigatoni with lamb. Both were solid and a nice foray into the untraditional Italian foods. The tiramisu dessert was HUGE and amazing, but a little heavy on the cocoa powder. Kinda caked your mouth at first with each bite. But still great!

pics.caption: Rigatoni with lamb sugo and stracciatella di burrata

review.des:
Reasonably priced with great service. It's great as a lunch spot, a date spot and a group dinner setting.

I recommend eating family style here, the plates are large and are designed to share. I've never been disappointed by the quality here and I always send people here for great, fresh Italian downtown.
Best of the best of Italian right off Michigan Avenue. Always crowded but worth the wait. Salmon is awesome as well! Great wine selection!

The wait was ridiculously long (1.5 hr@9pm on Friday) and the food quality was extremely poor. My mother and I had a wonderful envision in our head because of the menu and reviews. Unfortunately, we were both extremely disappointed. How do you mess up a Caprese Salad?! That's just the beginning...

I don't go here often, and this review is pretty much for the bar area only, since I've never had a sit down dinner here . . . and likely won't.

That's not to say the food is not tasty, the appetizers are quite appealing. This is a GIANT restaurant, but it's cut up into several bar areas so it doesn't seem as large as it is. Which is good.

I was here in the upstairs bar for a private event. Our bartender was GREAT, really friendly, dishy and flirty - just how a buncha girls like their bartender!

Nice wine list, this is all around a solid place for a drink or a snack.

What can I say about Quartino's? I have been coming here since 2011 and the food still remains exceptional. The wine, phenomenal! And the services, the best in Chicago.
The wine list is so extensive that I feel as though I would need an entire month of regular visitation to sample it all! And, this is a good thing!
I came here for an afternoon lunch with a friend on a Thursday afternoon and my friend was sold on the place. Our waiter, who became Manager during his shift with us was amazing. He even gave us his new manager card and promised a complimentary prosecco upon our next visit.
We nearly ate our way into the ER, the food was so good.
I would give this gem 10 Stars if it were possible. Well done Quartino! You have outdone yourself yet again.

Have been here twice now and really do like it. They serve everything tapas style and the waitstaff are always willing to give helpful suggestions for pairings and portion sizes. Great cheese and meat selections and the seafood dishes are worth ordering.
On our last visit, we got, in addition to a selection of meats and cheeses, the 4 fromaggi pizza. It comes out piping hot: simple and delicious. The atmosphere is fun and italian with all the waitstaff wearing italian jerseys and adidas shoes. The staff are also very accommodating in terms of seating. They always give cute postcards  to you with the check that I love! Would like to come back for dessert sometime!

This place was blowing up my Yelp from 6 blocks away as the place to go and it did not disappoint. They have great, fresh pasta and fun sauces that if you don't like them, they will fix them. With every plate being normal human size, its fun to get a bunch of things and swap them around with a large group and the waitstaff will happily engage you in picking some selections. Make sure you get the tortellini with prosciutto because it is just THAT good. Cauliflower is also a winner and while I wasn't a fan of the shank, everyone else was which makes me a mutant.
This is a great place for a group, the staff is tremendous and price point is perfect. Just try to avoid sitting next to the bread slicer cuz that buddy is LOUD.

This place is SO GOOD! The food is delicious and the waiters are friendly and really know their stuff. It is a little loud so it might not be a good place for a date but rather a night out with friends. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken and it was one of the best I've ever had. I also tried my friend's Tortellini as well as the Risotto and it was also great. We got a bottle of wine from Napa which was also enjoyable. It does get busy so try to call ahead, or visit one of the bars nearby and they'll text you when your table is ready, but trust me, it's worth the wait! The desserts looked delicious but I was too full to try.

Once we set foot into Quartino's, we could feel the bustle and vibe of the restaurant.  The restaurant has seating in the outside, but it was full and we were seated in the second level.  Quartino offers regional specialties from Italy including salumi, thin-crust pizza, and house-made pastas that are served in moderate portions to be served family style.  

After checking out the menu, we ordered:
Veal Meatball Sliders with pomodoro sauce and giardiniera.   The veal meatballs were tender and moist.

Romaine Hearts with shaved grana, honey, lemon and evoo. Very fresh and crisp tasting salad.

Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo - Tuscan pasta ribbons with braised beef and tomato sauce.  The flavors were subtle in this pasta dish.  Wished it had strong flavors.

Quattro Stagioni - artichokes, roasted peppers, grilled zucchini, Portobello mushrooms.  A tasty crispy thin crust pizza.  A good meatless option.

Profiteroles - vanilla gelato, chocolate sauce and toasted almonds.  Two large profiteroles filled with vanilla gelato and topped with dark chocolate.  Wow, one of the best profiteroles that I've had.

As the room where we were seated filled up which included there large parties, the atmosphere was lively and loud.  Our server was friendly and helpful.  The prices were reasonable and food came out fairly quickly.  

I'll be back to Quartino's in my next trip to Chicago.

My favorite weekly date night spot.

We always make reservations--and usually don't end up using them. This place is awesome, so it's no surprise its always jam packed. Sometimes the restaurant section gets super loud, especially on the weekends. We usually get a bottle of wine in the bar area, and try and get a bar top table to eat at. Surprisingly, it's a little quieter than the restaurant section. Servers always have great recommendations for new bottles of wine when we get sick of the usuals. We always order the maragatia pizza, it's soOoo good. They also have an awesome outdoor section when it's nice out. Love this place.

Service and food was great. Then before I left I went to the bathroom, seen an employee use the restroom fix his hair then walk out... Missing something?  Yup, didn't wash his hands. I walk out and tell my wife who responds that's the kid who brought out your meal!  It was!!! Horrible ending to a great meal. Young kid with highlights on top incase you want to remind him of the LAW!  Please ensure everyone attends classes if they are handling food.

I would like to thank the management for their professionalism in handling this review.  Although I will admit this was the one time I've had a negative experience here there were a handful of other visits that were all great.  I felt the need to update this review because I will not let this one time deter me from visiting one of my "go to" restaurants.

Very popular and can get very crowded.  Great staff always very competent and friendly.

Italian small- plates menu, vintage decor.  Food never disappointing.

Menu featuring Italy's regional specialties including artisanal salami, Neapolitan thin-crust pizza, house-made pasta, and seasonal dishes.

Menu items, served in moderate portions and meant to be shared, are perfect for adventurous diners ready for a unique experience.

Chef John Coletta has sat down with us several times and clearly takes great pride in the food he prepares.

Excellent atmosphere! Brought my significant other to Quartino for his birthday and I got a nice mix of fancy + affordable. Bottles of wine are not pricey at all, cheapest one is $15. $15 for a fancy-ish restaurant? Not bad at all. Their food was good but exactly what you would expect from an Italian Restaurant.

Different but still tasty. I decided I'd come check them out since I saw on the menu that they had pesto, which is my favorite. Although I ate in the bar, the restaurant looked quite spacious. For it being 4:30 in the afternoon, the crowd sure was lively. So the pesto dish I'm referring to is a gnocchi with potatoes, green beans, and arugula. I was a bit skeptical about the green beans but the waitress assured me that it's really popular that way in Italy... Sidenote, I've been to Italy many a times as well as lived there and I've yet to see green beans in a gnocchi but to each their own. The gnocchi itself was a bit disappointing. If it weren't for the pesto and arugula, it wouldn't have any flavor. The gnocchi was really chewy, which I didn't care for. The service was ok but could have been better. All in all, it was alright.

Like that guy friend in college you could count on to be your last-minute plus-one to a date function, Quartino is dependable, fun, (and comes at a reasonable price) but not all that memorable or fantastic.

The concept is tapas style, with an Italian flair.  So think roasted peppers, meats and cheeses, bruschetta, short ribs, etc., Neapolitan pizza.  Not a big fan of sharing?  There are pasta dishes that are a nice size for one person (or good for passing around).  The food is decently prepared and flavored, but nothing I continue to crave after I exit.  

The wine and beer isn't too expensive (especially considering the River North location) and the environment is bustling and lively (but not so much that you can't enjoy the company you've arrived with).  

It doesn't hurt to make reservations a day or two in advance, but you don't need to plan weeks and weeks ahead unless you have a big group (keep reading...)

Note: It's a fun place to go with a group (although ordering/sharing is tricky the more people you have), and they take big reservations, but they won't seat you until your entire party is there.  I was once with 11 people, and they wouldn't seat our party of 14 until the three stragglers arrived.  C'mon, folks.  You are missing out on early food and booze orders from ELEVEN PEOPLE.  But c'est la vie.

Always delicious! Romantic, fun atmosphere. Wonderful carafes of wine to start with your appetizer (yum caprese salad and cheese fondue). The portions are made for sharing (or enjoying alone) so you can try lots of delicious offerings. Make sure you save room for dessert.

This is the best spot in River North!

It's a small plates type place. Which is great because you get to try so many different dishes.

Honestly, order anything in the menu and it will be delicious. Can't go wrong at all.

The servers are all nice and hardworking. The restaurant gets really busy but it's a great atmosphere.

The wine list is superb as well. They also have a full bar.

In the warmer months it's great to sit on the patio or sidewalk.

Such a huge fan!!!  I would love, love, love to have this back home in Detroit.  Quartino will for sure be a new must-stop place every time I'm in Chicago.  I highly recommend the fondue- the mixture of cheeses was absolutely perfect.  Also really enjoyed the vodka penne.

If you like Italian food and you like tapas, then this is the place for you.

This place never disappoints. Been here few times already.  Classic Italian, served family style(meaning order bunch of different plates and share them with the table) because your going to want to try different stuff here!

It is very loud in here so talking to each other is a challenge....don't bring anyone here on a date, you will be too busy saying 'what' half the time.  The food is good and if your a wine person, you will love their selection.

The pizza is cooked in a firewood oven and the pastas will never disappoint.  Must try their dessert too....what was suppose to be 2 bites turned into 6 bites :-D (just sayin)

pics.caption: Rucolina pizza. It was yummy but I think that's a little too much Arugula

review.des:
Well, color me happy! Quartino is a refreshing change of pace from all the other high-brow and overpriced Chicago restaurants that I've been frequenting. This place is affordable, fun and most importantly, delicious! Came here with a large group for a friends birthday and we were all thrilled with our experience.

The server was extremely helpful and let us know that this tapas bar was the kind of place to order and share a bunch of dishes, which we did, happily. We had a table of 9, so he was accommodating when certain dishes only had 6 servings and he let us know in advance so we could get one and half orders or whatnot. First, we got two bottles of wine - one red, one white. They came out in interesting bottles and glasses, but as long as it tasted good, then we didn't really care. There was also freshly made bread for the table (always a crowd pleaser). Here's a rundown of what we ordered and had bites of:

1. Pancetta-wrapped dates: a little on the sweeter side for me but the birthday girl loved them!
2. Campinia pizza (ricotta basil tomato): tasty but nothing extraordinary, great thin crust though.
3. Polenta fries: really hyped up on Yelp, but, personally, it tasted kinda bland. The sauce was zesty and made the dish but the fries were kind of a  thicker, mushier version of french fries?
4. Pappardelle pasta: The flavors of the braised short rib was unexpected but quite interesting-everyone was a fan of this dish!
6. Eggplant Parmigiana: Let's be real, this dish is all about the cheese. I think there's eggplant somewhere underneath, but that glorious cheese just won't give it a chance to shine.
7. Burrata and beets: I don't get why this dish is all the rage lately, but no matter where I order this, I just can't get on board.

But the favorite of the night was the dessert. We secretly asked our waiter for a birthday surprise at the end of the night and what a surprise we got! What arrived was some creampuffs and a banana in a -ahem- phallic arrangement (oh yes, I posted a picture). The birthday girl thought it was hilarious and even better, it was delicious!

The eight of us split the check (excluding the birthday girl) and were all pleasantly surprised with the total - so affordable!

pics.caption: This scandalous dessert of creampuffs and a banana was quite the surprise for the bday girl. But it was actually really tasty!

review.des: Great place for sharing food! My bf and I ordered three plates and it was just enough. We had calamari, beef filets and tortellini and they were all good. One of the best Italian places I have ever had!

Love this place. Great food and great wine selection. The pizza is awesome. I am never disappointed here. However, they are almost always packed. Like to the point that you cannot get up to go to the restroom without climbing over other people. I don't know why they sit everyone so tight, but I suppose it's because of the demand.

Make a reservation. Try lots of wine. They generally do small plates and then you split things. Almost everything is delicious, and the chicken I had there once was some of the best I have ever had. Good for all types of eaters - there is something for everyone.

Come here off hours. We stopped by to horn in on some friends and I was over come with the loudness in the dinning room. Don't let the receptionist fool you! THERE IS A BAR UPSTAIRS as well as dinning. We could tell there is an upstairs balcony. So today I'm here for late lunch pizza and it's awesome! I can hear my thoughts. Awesome pizza and I love the Dry Borax hand soap in the bathroom; it's like soap  and an exfoliate in one. FERNANDO  was a wonderful bartender and server. I would definitely return especially since it's 1/2 block from Embassy Suites.

2nd visit : 1st review. Quartino is a reasonably priced, great dining and service experience.  Food is served a la tapas style, meaning the plates are shareable. This makes it a really fun experience if you are dining with a group because you get to try lots of different flavors. In my two visits, neither I nor my dining companions found fault with any dish and in fact, loved it all. Definitely try the pizza, pastas and salads. All are flavorful, seasonal and fresh. Service is top notch and friendly. You will leave with a smile.

The food here is quite good and very reasonably priced for the area. The menu is relatively "authentic" as far as Italian restaurants in the US go. I appreciated that they had a pizza marinara, which is pretty standard in Italy but seen as an aberration in the US. For $8 I had the delicious pizza marinara which was a very filling dinner.

Il problema è che nessuno qua parla italiano!! Perché non ci sono ristoranti italiani a Chicago con persone che parlano italiano?? Non è giusto.

We were in town for a couple days and didn't really know where to eat. I randomly chose Quartino. Are we glad we did!  We made an early reservation for 5:30 so the restaurant was still a bit quiet

The waiter was very attentive. When we asked for some help, he readily gave us some tips on what to order.  We ordered pizza for our son and then some dishes for my husband and me.  Yummy!  I took off one star because the pacing of the dishes was a bit off.  By the time we finished our meal an hour or so later, the place was packed.  I'm glad we dined early.

The three of us totally enjoyed our dinner here and if ever we are back in Chicago, we will definitely re-visit this place.

Matt, the general manager, called me personally to apologize about the incident. I think this says a lot about how this establishment is run - they could easily just ignored the problem, but they went above and beyond to make sure that I knew that they were sorry about the incident and that they were going to take care of it. He even took care of the cake, even though the other manager Joe had personally brought it across the street for delivery.
