Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant - I have eaten here in the past and the food as always been excellent. Now I know the management does right by their customers, which you cannot say for all places.

First time I've ever been there and I was blown away! Tapas Italian is outstanding. The restaurant has a great buzz-the food was amazing-plenty of choices to share!!(I highly recommend the fettuccine alfredo and the tiramisu-best EVER!!! Could have platefuls of both!) fun place with a small group!! Loved it and will be back every chance I get!!
It was fun to sit al-fresco. I was not too impressed with the food though. Good place to sit and convenient location. Food was average.

Gear spot for group dinners. You can either get an individual meal or have multiple small plates plus pizza. For a large dinner party it so easy to share, plus they offer crafts of wine that go a long way.

Things started well. Had a reservation even though we wanted outside, which they don't take reservations for.  However, when we arrived we were able to get a table outside on the upstairs balcony. The table for 2 is small and hard to put plates on.  

We ordered a salad, pasta dishes and veal skirt steak.  First 2 came out right away, veal was a wait. Food was all good.  Had trouble with the waiter refilling drinks. But overall th I ngs were going well.  Then we ordered a dish of sorbet for desert. You would think that would come out pretty quick.... well that took 30 min.  No attention from the waiter again.  Guess you have to be drinking alcohol to get attention.

My favorite restaurant by far and I'm so sad it's half a continent away.  The concept is so much fun...Italian tapas!  We had four people dinning and I think we ordered 2 salads and 4 entries.  It was enough for each of us to have 3-4 bites of each dish.  We also shared 3 desserts.  The Tora al Cioccolato was the best.  The Panino al Geltao Limone was a  close second.  The only thing we didn't try was the pizza.  They have a wide variety of wine and beer available.  It's loud so don't think of this as being a quite fine dining environment.  The only thing I would have wished for is a slightly bigger table.  It was a little difficult serving when you have 6 plates on a rather small sized table.

Great food and even better service! Scott took great care of us. We didn't even have to look at the menu, he said he would handle everything because we were so indecisive. He brought several different dishes (all very delicious) and treated us like royalty. I would highly recommend checking this place out!

I'll start off by saying if service was a bit faster I would have given five stars. I sat at the bar and the bartender was obviously busy but let me tell you, he held it down! Quite impressive due to him having to be the service bartender as well. I ventured into Quartino on a Saturday afternoon after my business trip wrapped up. I'm a transitioning vegetarian and my god it was so hard for me to find a place that sort of catered to vegetarians in Chicago! Conference food almost always sucks so I had a ravenous appetite from being stuck in Chicago for six days with hardly anything I could eat.

Most places on Saturday apparently serve brunch until around 2pm. I was at sable before I came to Quartino because of the lack of options. Anyway I sat at the bar and decided on my New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Shortly thereafter, I realized the items on the menu were too cheap to be legit and I asked the bartender, "Is this tapas?!" Perhaps he could see my displeased grimace and said they are generally half portions. I was hungry and saw a few things I wanted to try so this response sufficed.

I ordered the penne alla vodka and the garlic shrimp dish. The bartender served me my wine in a rocks glass from a carafe. I was confused for a moment because I've never drank wine out of a rocks glass.  I took a look around and saw that many people were drinking their wine this way and figured this MUST be the way to do it. I was given olive oil, cheese I had to shred myself and a plate of bread. I loved every moment of this seemingly traditional Italian establishment!

My appetite still not curbed, I pondered ordering another round of the pasta and shrimp and opted for the calamari. I made a good decision. It was delicious! I also ordered more wine. I don't think I've ever eaten so much in my life. I thought for sure I'd spent around $60 in this place. I was astonished to get the check and see only a $39 tab. #winning!

Quartino, see you later alligator!
Fav Italian spot in Chicago. Great location in River North. You can start with dinner and drinks here and walk to many other bars/clubs nearby. Plus, love dining on the patio in summer.

Went here with my mom for dinner. Got the margarita pizza, penne alla vodka and a bottle of toscana.

Cons: house bread..Ehhh. I've had better.

Pros: opentable points, service, food!

Penne was perfectly al dente. Being indian, we asked for more heat. Still not super spicy but it was flavorful. We added garlic to the margarita pizza (crispy and thin, which we love) and we both thought it was tasty. 2 dishes for us was perfect. The wine was decent (toscana) and we got to take the rest back with us.

2 dishes and bottle of wine plus tax: $46.

I'd come back to try more.

Friendly service, nice bar area and good food. Late night spot for those looking to eat something the kitchen can put together fast. Came in around midnight after drinking earlier with a few friends at another bar.

The ambiance is perfect embodiment for a downtown chicago drinking well with a simple yet delicious italian menu. It is dark inside, but it adds to the charm of this gem.

Prices are definitely on par if not a bargain for a downtown bar thats open late. I ordered the Quattro Stagioni and my friend ordered something from the antipasta menu.

My reason for the ONE missing star and most would have given more than one ... my pizza was unevenly cooked ... not to mention BURNED on a couple of slices..... thats a no-no.

I definitely will try you out again and give you an updated review next time i am in town.

Enjoyed Pizza  Bianco with arugula , garlic and black olives and a side  of fennel sausage. So fresh and delicious . Reminded me of Italia.
Visited with Yelp recommendations and found( as usual) the rating to be accurate .
Very busy, but bar seating is first come and no wait.
Extensive menu and attentive staff,
Absolutely terrific.  Salmon, fettuccini alfredo, sausage risotto, bruschetta, calamari, caprice salad  , Italian donuts, chocolate cake thing.  All outstanding !!!!!

Great Italian food. It will fill you up. The only negative is the bathroom tip guy! Why ? Why ? Why ? No one liked this except the bathroom tip guy ! Give him another gig in besides this! He is a great guy but it is time to retire this trend.

pics.caption: One of the best views on the patio !

review.des: Went here for an early dinner, place filled up quickly. There were 6 of us and we all shared a variety of dishes. The pizzas were great and the pasta dishes were very tasty, Prices were also decent. We will definitely go back to try some of the sausage platters and other appetizers.

On my last night in Chicago, I had an insatiable craving for spaghetti late on a Sunday evening. A friend suggested Quartino despite her fiance's reluctance to try such a touristy spot, but mannn, are we glad we went. This was technically Dinner #2, but really, who's counting? The spaghetti was so simple but SO amazing. The pizza had a nice consistency and good flavor. The grilled octopus was a delight. The gnocchi was a little too salty but the pesto kept us going back for more. The shrimp risotto was delicious as well. Every dish we shared was wonderful. I will definitely try to stop by the next time I visit!

If tapas, and Italian food are your thing, I'd highly suggest Quartino as a spot in Chicago to come and try. What's great about tapas is that there's so much variety and the dishes are small. This offers a lot of food tasting, and is really great to socialize with.

I came here with two of my other friends, and got seating right away because this spot is LARGE. There's a big first floor, and just as large second story. It's quite unbelieveable. Having such a vast menu, I would just suggest you not overly think about it, and just order what you think sounds good & have at it. That's the best way to do it!

Foods don't come in any order. It's what ever is cooked and it just comes out. For example our sampler plate of meat and cheeses came last while the pasta and baked stuff came first. Odd, but not bad at all!

Off our dinner adventure, I would recommend the following:
1) Eggplant Parmigiana - I'm enjoy eating eggplant, and when breaded, I love it even more! Rich with flavor. Excellent!
2) Steamed Clams - YES! Must get. Small clams, delicious in flavor. Rich! Save your bread and dip it in the juices. So much yum in a plate!
3) Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo - Pasta ribbons with braised beef in tomato sauce. As a pasta lover, this was devine. The braised beef was so soft. Very simple and well made.
4) Veal Meatball Slider - Different and good. Eat this when it comes out and don't wait on it because it will get cold!

Other tidbits -- if you are a Neopolitan Pizza lover, this spot may also be for you! The options for their pizza's were pretty large, so I'm going to assume that this is their bread and butter on top of tapas actually. For a couple that comes in, this may be the way to go if tapas isn't your thing.

Wine options galore. Middle of the road pricing in my opinion. Not cheap, but not too expensive. We had 6-7 dishes, myself a 1/2 Sangria, and my other friend 1/2 red wine, the total came out to $130 not including tip. $35-40/head ~ can't complain when the food is great!

Came here for dinner as it was right next to our hotel. The atmosphere is loud and family friendly. The cheese plate was really good as well as the pizza! Service was good and the the hot chocolate molten cake was amazing! A manager came over and checked on us while we were eating and gave us his card. Pleasant experience and my husband LOVED the food. We will most likely be back before the end of our trip!

Great place for large parties. Been here about 4 times and it's always deliciously consistent. Everything is good, from the pasta dishes to the veggie dishes.  The meats are so mouthwatering as they fall off the bone and melt in your mouth.

Had pizza for the first time on my most recent visit. We got the margharita...it was truly phenomenal. Great service too. Solid place and always a long wait....which tells you that there's something special going on here!
Came here a year ago during restaurant week and it was amazing to be amble to sample the menu!  I have been back multiple times and love the flavor of the menu!!!!

Went here for lunch today, a nice environment, especially if you have the opportunity to sit outside on a nice day. Had the salmon and sautéed spinach, wife had the oven pizza. The portions are extremely small, which they did warn us about, but in my opinion too overpriced for what you get. The salmon was too fishy and didn't have enough flavor. Overall, a nice place to go on a date if you're in the city and feel like Italian. The service was good

Amazing food, reasonably priced, perfect portions, and great service. I've eaten here several times during an extended stay in the area and enjoyed it every time.

They offer half orders of nearly everything, even dessert, and have a solid wine selection.

I recommend the sausage pizza, half wild arugula salad, and tiramisu!

Food tasted great! Portions are sized for toddlers. Wish we would've known the portions were so small. Would've ordered an appetizer or a side dish. The dish was as big as the palm of my hand. Had to make a pit stop for some food to fill up on the way home.

The character of the restaurant is what I enjoyed best. The lobby was brimming full of people trying to get a table. Coming to this restaurant with good friends was the main draw for me. The wait staff was pleasant and very helpful for first timers understanding the flow of the dinner. There are many small plates that you can order as you go through your meal. It was a great way to try a lot of the dishes and share with friends. Overall, the food was good although the risotto seemed to lack flavor.

Great Italian Restaurant in Chicago. This place was packed the day we were there. They did great with their service and food. Everything tasted like it was cooked to order with fresh ingredients. If we return to Chicago, we will be hitting them up again.

Have been here twice before, and came back again since we were staying nearby. It's loud and warm and packed as always, but the service was wonderful and the food was absolutely delicious. I ordered an Italian 75 cocktail which was cold and fresh and so good, I loved it. Followed by fresh and colorful caprese salad and then the server recommended house made papperdelle. The pasta and beef sauce were perfectly cooked. Only complaints are that my white wine with dinner could have been colder, and my chair kept getting bumped due to the table being so close behind us.

Quartino entirely changed my expectations for what a good dining experience entails. First, the food is exceptional, every dish is delicious and a good size to share. What I love most though is the people that work there. Somehow Quartino has accumulated an entire staff of the most friendly, accommodating, and interesting people you'll meet. I'm always disappointed when trying new restaurants because my expectations are for a complete and enjoyable dining experience, something I've had with every Quartino visit. Maybe I should take off a star for that?

We came to Quartino for a work dinner. It's pretty loud and crowded which can make for a fun atmosphere but not the best for a quiet dinner. The servers and wait staff were constantly making sure that we had everything we needed which was very nice.

The food was surprisingly great for the cost of Italian food - especially compared to other options in the neighborhood. Will definitely return!

A very classy environment at Quartino.
Service could be better... but the food was good nonetheless.

I thought the latte was amazing! The cappuccino that my bf ordered was also delicious. Very creamy and smooth.

We ordered:
SALUMERIA TASTING 3/5
The display of this platter definitely gives you a WOW *takes pictures*
But I only like a few of the selections within the 10 that were presented.
The sliced meat, cheese and marinated eggplant were my pick out of the tasting platter.

PAPPARDELLE AL SUGO DI MANZO 4/5
The pasta ribbons were very different - It's chewy! A tasty mix between the braised beef.

PORCINI & TRUFFLE RISOTTO 4/5
The display wasn't really appetizing haha.. but the taste was delicious - especially the truffle.

TORTELLINI 5/5
The Alfredo sauce was AMAZING :) Our favourite from the pasta selections.

STEAMED CLAMS - PINOT GRIGIO & RED CHILI BROTH 4/5
Fresh and yummy. The bread that comes with it is also very delicious.

We never hated a meal here. Although it caters to ther purist crowd we've always felt like we belong. If you want to meet friends for drinks head to the bar. More intimate, head upstairs. It's quiet.
Food is great, and I recommend ordering wine of the month!  Meatballs and Brussels sprouts are a plus. Pizza is what we stick with and have not been bummed yet.
One of my favs! I have been dining here for years. I love the atmosphere, location, food, wine and staff. My favorites dishes are the short rib and the potato purée.

I've been to Quartino a few times over the years and every time I get super excited to go but then leave a little disappointed.

The good:
- The restaurant is lively, loud, and fun and good for large groups. Love the old Italian style and the silly movies they play on the TVs
- The concept of Italian tapas is great
- Wine selection is pretty extensive with a wide variety of reds and whites in different price ranges and quantities

The could-be-better:
- Overpriced for quantity and quality of food
- Service has always been strictly okay. Given the large size of the establishment, I'm sure the servers are running around all over the place. But it's honestly extremely difficult to catch any of them when you need something.
- The pizzas are good but not the best or most authentic I've had.
- White bean and garlic spread - somewhat blah. Not enough garlic, which is a tragedy.
- Veal meatballs - these were good, as long as you don't mind meat paired with sweet things (golden raisins).
- Ravioli Filled with Braised Pork, Speck, & Fava Beans - this was delicious, but rather pricey for the quantity of ravioli you get
- Linguine with Clams: again, good but not mind blowing
- Eggplant Parmigiana: really tasty, but (you guessed it) not the best I've had

Overall, Quartino's is a fun place to go with a group to share bits of everything. It won't be the best Italian food you'll eat but it's fine!

Quartino's is a go to for many occasions. I have been here for celebrations to casual dinners/ This restaurant appeals to both locals and tourists so make reservations to be safe, even with reservations you may have to wait a couple of minutes.  Every time I have gone here I have had great service and food. The food is reasonably priced and there is something for everyone. This place gets packed and they manage large parties to small tables with efficiency and precision.

I tried their pizza with the meatball and giardiniera this last time and it was tasty. I had never had the urge to try their pizza before but this changed my mind.  It can get a bit noisy, but in my opinion it only adds to the ambiance!

The lobby is entirely too small. It was very crowded and loud while waiting for our table. The food was delicious, however, it would have been great if the waiter had guided us more when we asked how many dishes we needed for 7 people. I definitely did not like that one dish was brought out at a time. It made for a very, very long dinner. Not sure if we would go back. Although it was reasonably priced.

I went here for my 21st birthday, and it was a wonderful experience. The food was amazing (I absolutely recommend the Tortellini) and priced incredibly well. My party included myself and 10 other friends, and they seated us in a private section, which was very nice of them. The lighting was a bit dark, but our server was awesome and even gave me a shot of limoncello for free! Overall, I will definitely be back for the food and customer service alone.

Reservations are a must for Quartino especially for weekends. We arrived at 6:15PM for our Friday 6:30PM reservations and the door was packed with a long line. Thank goodness for OpenTables!

We were seated on the second floor by the windows overseeing the nightlights of State and Ontario. The restaurant has a very vintage touch with lights dimmed out and tables intimately aligned. The wait staff in white aprons was in and out of the dining hall bustling with orders. The food was oh-so-captivating that I fell in la-la-la-love!

The three of us ordered the Neopolitan Pizze with prosciutto d'anitra onion, duck prosciutto, and wild argula. It was per our waiter's suggestion and by far, the best pizza I've ever had! The thin piece of tossed flour was spread with tomatoes, parmesan, and mozzarella. Pieces of delicately sliced duck prosciutto were scattered across and baked to perfection. If you like bacon, you would like duck prosciutto. The onions were there but barely noticeable. That's a plus for me! I usually try to avoid dishes drowned in onions. The wild arugula put the whole pizza in camouflage but they were very fresh and crisp!

We also ordered the crisp calamari and linguini with clams, red chili, and red sauce. The calamari was seasoned with black pepper just the way I like it! It was superb when sprinkled in lemon juice and dipped in a side of marinara sauce. The linguini had a generous share of baby clams. The shreds of red chili were very welcoming and not a bit spicy.

For three people, those entrees were more than enough and it was just shy of $45 with tax and gratuity. For a great location with authentic Italian food for a reasonable price, what more can one ask for?

We had a late appetizer here on Saturday night! What can I say, the service and food was incredible. We were told to go here buy a few locals and get the antipasto. Great choice. You get to select 2 meats 2 cheese and a mix of other great goodies. Everything looked so good and we couldn't decide so we had our server pick for us! He brought out the platter with aged parm, Gorgonzola and some smoked duck breast with truffle salami. Everything was amazing and next time we are back in Chicago we will be back!

Great food and very accommodating to our party! The place was packed from the get go, so you know they're doing something right. I planned ahead for my sister's bachelorette party and was able to get a set menu down with a customized title for the menu. Food was brought out in a timely manner, and the wait staff was able to time it right for guests that were arriving to the party late.

The Veal Steak is a must and the Tiramisu was a crowd favorite for our party.

Went here for dinner with a friend on a Sunday and it was disappointing.  I love Italian food and could live on risotto.  I actually gained 12 pounds travelling through Rome and Florence (thank God for stretch pants!). Soooo, I was excited to eat here given the mostly positive reviews.

Maybe they had an off-night but I was disappointed overall.  They were packed and - our fault for not having reservations - we opted for the bar rather than waiting 30-40 minutes for a table.

Pros:
There's a good selection on the menu, there's outdoor seating, the waitress was friendly and informative, and they have one of  those old-style bathrooms with the attendant.

Cons:
Part of my dinner order came out a good 15 minutes before the other part and before any of my friend's food, so of course it was cold.
We ordered the sausage risotto which had zero flavor and the gnocchi which was meh
We had to ask 3 times for Parmesan cheese (different people because we could not find our waitress)
While the waitress was friendly, after we placed our order we did not see her again until we were 30 minutes into our meal
The portion sizes are small for the price point

There are so many great Italian places in the city, I doubt I would go back here.

If you are remotely claustrophobic, do not go here. Very small amount of space between tables. When pulling out of your seat you hit the seat of the other tables surrounding. Food was good for the most part..good pasta especially the vodka sauce. Shrimp were awful, tasted canned. Service was very quick to bring out the food but slow at removing the empty plates (frustrating for tapas setting as more food being served was piling on the table over empty dishes).

Came here with some buddies after a recommendation from a friend. Pizza was great, I had the "Manzo" and it was delicious. Also tried sautéed calamari but it was cut in bigger than average chunks which I didn't like but the taste was there. Tortellini was great with a generous amount of prosciutto

Service was good. Food was mediocre . We were pissed that this "Italian" restaurant didn't have lasagna . Chicken fettuccine was a disappointment. Pizza was decent . Ribs were weird yet flavorful . Menu nor food was satisfying. I will not return

Superb!! We were in Chicago for four days and came here for two meals! The tapas seem kinda pricey - $7 to 10 for most, $15 for meats, but they are fairly large. My mom and I got three for a dinner. Arugula salad, mushroom and truffle risotto, and a seafood medley. All three were very good and the service was superb.

Came back the next day for the $25/3-plate lunch special and had the gnocchi, summer shaved salad, and the pork shank. I didn't eat the pork shank but my mom said it was amazing and there were tons leftover! I think she ate if for three meals afterward.

Pizzas and the antipasti selection looked great also, but we didn't have another meal to try it out!

Check open table for reservations - somehow they're available while walk-ups are booked solid. Lively atmosphere, great food and service, and wonderful meal!

This restaurant was very good.   It is meant to order multiple pastas and share them, but the people in my group just got their own.  The sizes were small compared to normal pasta dishes, but still were more than enough to eat.  Everyone enjoyed their dish. Overall, a very good restaurant

The food was mediocre, and the atmosphere very noisy  The table for 8 was too small--we barely had room for the food and plates and could not get up without hitting other diners;; the service was semi-attentive.  Sorry, folks--I just don't see the value.
Lively place with pizza, olives, big wine selection, etc. Super crowded on a Wednesday night but found a spot at the bar for the 3 of us. Awesome!

A group of my friends planned to go to Quartino's for a birthday dinner. We had called ahead for a reservation and there none available so we decided to head up there anyway and wait. It was definitely packed but we got lucky and grabbed a table in the bar area within 5 minutes. We got a bottle of wine and each picked a pasta. All delicious and small plates to share with one another. The food does not all come out at once, but just as each plate is ready. The first two plates came out about 8 minutes before the last two.

Over all, I was very happy with the service and pleased with how quick the food was served. I enjoyed the atmosphere and would love to go back!

Tortellini was delicious! :)

Went there yesterday had such a great time and will definitely coming back for more. The calamari and the brussel sprouts were my favorite. I was also surprise to find out that this place is part of the Gibson's restaurant. No wonder the food were delicious!
Highly recommend this place!

This place had such great reviews and having no idea what I wanted for dinner, my friend and I decided to venture here because they offered such a wide variety of tapas and great prices on drinks. I had their red sangria that was pretty good but their food was another story.

We ordered their gnocchi and it was so thick and bland. The waitress was nice enough to give us a different sauce. We first tried it with argula pesto sauce but.. that was NOT happening. So we went with a red sauce instead. it was only slightly better. We also order their "crisp" calamari. I say "crisp" because it actually came out soggy.

Such a disappointment. The next day, my friend and I felt so sick. I don't know what it was... but I'm not coming back.
Nice place with lots of options. I will say I was disappointed in the porcini and truffle risotto. Average at best. However the past meals and antipasti plate were excellent.
Service was great! Wonderful wine list. The pasta was homemade and outstanding, but the sauce was less than I expected. Gelato was yummy. Definitely would return.

Very solid Italian restaurant.  Nice antipasto  selections.  Apricot Rosemary butter was very notable.  Was sharing with the family so very standard main courses but all was done well.  I consider myself a meatball snob as I make the best at home and the meatballs here were quite good.  Wine selection was decent.  Deserts were enjoyed by all at the table.  The espresso was quite good.  Wait staff was informarive and attentive.  Managers stopped to check in throughout the meal.  Tough to get five stars out of me but we'll worth the stop.

I did a good amount of research on restaurants planning my trip to Chicago. I was not let down with Quartino - the food and service was excellent. My only complaint is that I was limited by the size of my stomach. I would have ordered more if I physically was able to.

The manager (presumably) didn't like the way our pizza looked when it came out so he had a new one made and provided us with prosciutto wrapped dates to tide us over. It was a nice gesture and they were really good. Our server was attentive and great at providing recommendations, including strategies on how to try as much as possible (you can order half-size portions).

Below is a list of what I had and I would recommend everything. It's important to note the plates are smaller so you should expect to order 2-3 per person
1) Truffle Salame (really good), Taleggio cheese, and Pecorino Barone (served with apricot jam and pickled? vegetables)
2) Burrata
3) Prosciutto wrapped dates
4) Split pizza of Manzo and Soprano
5) Tagliatelle alla Bolognese
6) Beef filets
7) Zeppole donuts

Ah freaking amazeballs. The service here is impeccable. From the hostess, to the server. (Scott) Food A#1. Vodka martini with REAL blue cheese olives....Best EVER. Can't say enough. Go here, now. Yes, it's an order. :)

My first time with tapas. I'm so glad my boyfriend took us here to experience it! It's a beautiful place, the host is beyond amazing, attentive, and a great conversationalist. The food-TO DIE FOR! I haven't tasted food this good since my grandmother was alive and cooking. You HAVE to try the meatballs. They're literally the best thing I've ever eaten. So good, I ordered a second plate. Outstanding in every way possible. If I could rate higher, I would!
Delicious!  We were in the private room and the service was great. The steak was perfect.

I had such high hopes based on reviews of this restaurant only to be thoroughly disappointed. I had family in from out of town for the holiday and wanted to take them somewhere in the city for dinner and chose Quartino only to be basically embarrassed by my choice. we actually stopped at another restaurant on the way home to get food. We ordered the meatballs (veal) that were probably the best item and that is not saying much. We also got the tenderloin (filet) medallions, calamari, bolognese, spaghetti w/meatballs and the gnocchi with pesto and they were all tasteless and watery. I will add in that my husband's family is from Italy as well.  We also had an array of taste buds at this dinner as well, from a young adult who is picky to someone who doesn't have high standards for food to people who are foodies, like myself. We all had the same thoughts on everything. As far as service, that was a train wreck in my opinion. It was like you had to chase someone down and then no one knew what was really going on. After returning to work and speaking to co-workers about this restaurant, I found out that they had similar experiences. I would steer clear of this place unless you are a fan of subpar food and horrible cheap wine. I honestly have NO clue who would think their food is good on any level. It is cheap in the center of the city for a reason...

This restaurant was a surprise. I went last week to meet some friends after work and the wine was really good. I also ordered an authentic Neapolitan Pizza which was delicious. The staff was incredible and the ambiance better than I expected

Everything I had was great! Real Authentic fresh Italian food!! I especially enjoyed an anti-pasto platter which contained so many great nibbles! I also really enjoyed their pizza, which was very authentic to say the least! I also met Chef John who was very personable and nice, service was excellent! 100%!

I really like this place. First of all, make reservations as it is always packed!

I tend to describe Quartino as Italian tapas. There are so many great little items on their menu that you get a chance to order a few and share with the table. And their pizza crust is some of the best around.

You can graze as you chat because the dishes are brought out as they are completed, like tapas, so you are constantly getting new little nuggets to enjoy. We love taking clients here, and they seem to enjoy it, because it is relaxed and they have a lot of interesting items to try.

It's also a great value. Seriously, it's like you can try 15 things for the price of 4 regular dinner entrees.

Quartino is always in my Chicago rotation...

Just 2 words: LOVE IT!

The dessert is the best and have always had amazing food no matter what time I went and how busy they were.

One thing though it can get a  little tight as the tables are spaced really close to each other

With Yelp help we went to try this Italian Tappas restaurant.  Sat upstairs outside.  Plenty of heaters present to take the chill out of outside dining. Prompt service even though it was packed! Waiter very knowledgeable, and attentive. Nothing turns me off more then when you go into a Italian restaurant and the staff can't pronounce the name of Italian cheeses or dry meats, or Italian dishes.  Sorry, being Italian it's just bothers me.  We were just in the mood for a small tasting.  Bread was brought out immediately. Evoo and Balsamic vinegar was on the table already along with grated cheese. We got the antipasto.  We chose the 25.00 plate which satisfied our craving for something lite.  Wish I was hungry, because everything looked amazing!  Our choice of provolone, Asiago, olives, caponata, artichokes, beet salad, and prosciutto and dry duck prosciutto! Excellent!
Ottimo posto, ottimo cibo, ottimo servizio
(Great place, great food, great service)
This is a great place to go with a large group.  A lot of different options for sharing.  Wine is very reasonably priced.  Food wont knock your socks off, but it is still pretty good.

Quarantinos lived up to all the good things that were said about it. It was unique in the sense that it was served as Italian style tapas. We got the seafood mix (so good the sauce is to die for), octopus (amazing) and two pastas. You can taste the authenticity of the pasta - it's hand made and it is the tastiest thing ever. The wine was wonderful, we strayed from our norm (Malbec) and tried something new, the waiter suggested a white that was incredible. Not only was the service great but it was also affordable. This place is perfect for a date night.

Visited Quartino on a Saturday night with a group of about fifteen people. We had a reservation and were promptly seated, which was great. Because we were seated promptly, I didn't have a chance to check out the bar area but it looked lively.

For starters, we had the fondue which was tasty. They brought the perfect amount of bread so although we ordered for two, the whole table had a taste of it. As an entree we had the Manzo. It was really good. The short ribs were well seasoned and added a great flavor. Perfect size for two people. For wine we had the Amarone. It was good but not great.

One thing that really irked a few of us is the fact that we did not get actual wine glasses. Instead, they gave us small water cups. Super weird. It might seem like not a big deal but try drinking wine out of a small water cup. Yeah, I thought so.

Also, they don't split tabs which is kind of annoying for a big group like that. I know it's annoying for the waiters too but hey we're the ones paying, right? It really took forever to sort it out. On top of that, they added things that weren't ordered. Kind of annoying.

Food was good but not great. Service can use some work. And real wine glasses, dang it!

Now I feel like I am on vacation. Sitting outside and eating small plates and sipping wine. Unbelievably delicious. Service is over the top. I highly recommend the caprese salad, the truffle salami and fontina small dishes. They actually are not small at all. Fun place to share plates and enjoy beautiful Chicago. Ended with a wonderful lemon dessert and housemade limoncello. Could not have been better.

pics.caption: Caprese. Mine doesn't taste like this at home.
Tortellini with prosciutto. Peas. Cream sauce. Amazing.
Fontina. Salami with black truffles. Apricot purée and pickled vegetables. Four stars. Oh and walnut bread!

review.des: Sat on the balcony with perfect weather.  This night was pretty prefect from the company, view, food and drinks.  Ordered a class of wine but it was more like 2.  The veal meatballs were extremely good and so was the eggplant pizza.  Friend ordered a dirty martini which looked really good as well.  Service was okay as well.  Defiantly somewhere you need to visit if you're around the area.

pics.caption: Balcony, eggplant pizza, veal meatballs, olives and artichokes.  Awesome!

review.des:
I was planning a birthday celebration for my extended family (16 people) and Quartino Ristorante came very highly recommended.  After deciding that we wouldn't spend enough to warrant a private room ($2000 minimum) we booked a table in the main dining room for 6:30 on a Friday night.  Things started out poorly when our table wasn't ready when we arrived but a few of us headed to the bar to kill time (the rest hung out by the door...not the most convenient waiting area) and about 20 minutes later we were seated. Unfortunately, the table set up was more appropriate for 14 people than 16 so I went to speak with the host.  To their credit, they said that they would take care of things right away and about 5 minutes later, after a table next to us freed up, they pushed it over and we settled in, more comfortably this time.

While a bit irritating, I put the initial issues down to the fact that we were at a busy Chicago restaurant on a Friday night...unfortunately, things did not get better.  I had pre-ordered 3 Salumeria tasting (antipasti) plates.  A few minutes after we sat down the first plate arrived.  Maybe 5 minutes after that, the second plate arrived.  Probably another 6-7 minutes later , the 3rd plate arrived. So it was almost 15 minutes before some people had food!  These were pre-ordered and consisted of a mix of charcuterie, cheese and assorted pre-made vegetable antipasti (which were good)...there was no reason that all of the plates could not have been prepared and delivered to the table at once.  Very strange.

Then we ordered the mains.  The waiter warned us that the dishes would be brought out as they became available...which was fine.  That said, I was not prepared for the fact that my linguine with clams came out about 3 minutes later...and probably 7-10 minutes before anyone else got food.  I guess I could have understood it if everyone at our table who ordered linguine with clams was served at the same time, but that was not the case.  The best I could figure is that they had an extra one from someone else's order so they gave it to me. Needless to say I was finished before most people at the table were served.

Again, all of this would have been forgiven if the food was good, but it was not.  My linguine was way over cooked and bland.  My wife's shrimp risotto tasted like lightly seasoned rice that they put a couple of shrimp on top of.  I had a slice of my nephew's pepperoni pizza and it could have been something from the freezer section.  My daughter said that her tagliatelle alla Bolognese was also meh.  I have been to Italy numerous times and I know what good Italian food tastes like...this was not it (To the people who have written Yelp reviews saying that this is the best Italian food in Chicago, I have news for you - it is not even the best Italian food in River North).

On the plus side, the wait staff were competent and friendly.  They generously gave our table an extra pizza that was going to go to waste in the kitchen and they took a soda off of the bill that my young nephew ordered but didn't like. And the prices are very reasonable (most pasta and mains are between $11 and $15)...although the portions are not huge (the waiter said that things were family style but they were a little small to share between 2 people).

Despite what I had heard about this being a chef-driven Italian restaurant, I would categorize it as more of a mass market Italian-American restaurant minus the overwhelming portions. Food is okay but not especially memorable...certainly not if you have ever eaten in a real Italian trattoria or enoteca.

Really great restaurant with a large variety of food selections. It was a very friendly bar scene, and very busy restaurant scene. The only reason I did not give five stars was because it was quite noisy in the bar area. Prices were excellent and portions were large! Definitely visiting again!

Quartino's is absolutely charming -- the restaurant and bar were lavishly built but still manage to feel comfortable and cozy and the service is fantastic. The food, however, is just decent. I came on a Saturday night when all the reservations were full and managed to snag a tiny table at the bar and crammed myself and three friends around it. Our waitress was super attentive (but not overly so).

We had the calamari (which was fried perfectly and could have been absolutely delicious but was underseasoned), the sausage pizza, and the quattro stagioni pizza. The pizzas were generous with the toppings and the crust was done well but, again, lacking in flavor. The meal without drinks came out to $38 for four people, which was okay, but I would have been outlandishly underwhelmed if I had had to wait around for a table or restructure my plans around one of their hard-to-get reservations.

Walked in solo on a crisp December night, wasn't sure eating by myself was the best choice. The place is buzzing with young diners, not an empty table to be found.

My fears were quickly allayed; the hostess couldn't have been nicer. Unbeknownst to me the manager, Ryan, followed me to the bar, introduced himself, and made me feel like I had been eating here for years.

The food was very good, comparable to much pricier steak joints. This is a place I'll come back to as much for the people and high-energy atmosphere as for the food.

pics.caption: The manager, Ryan Scopelliti, knows how to keep customers coming back. Great service, great staff, great food.

review.des: Fantastic place to come with a group. Wonderful plates to share. Service is always top notch. Extensive wine list. They have food late night. It's a great place to meet with friends and not break the back in River North. Plus you can buy one of the amazing cheese graters! They are imported and soooo good!

Love this place! We've been here many times & the food is always amazing! For the location & for what you get, their prices are good. Our favorite is their margarita pizza with sausage added to it along with red wine. This place is great for a romantic dinner or for a group as their food is made to share.

I would rate Quartino as a solid three stars. Good food, good service, I just wasn't really blown away with any of the dishes.

We started out with the polenta fries with red bell pepper salsa. It was pretty tasty and came out very hot, so it clearly was made fresh. While the first few bites were interesting, it became a little bland and boring and my husband ended up finishing the dish. I will say that he loved these and thought they were very good.

We then ordered the veal meatballs, which were served in tomato sauce with basil and topped with ricotta. This dish was quite good, but again I felt it was missing some flavor. It also became cold quite quickly. Neither me nor my husband were impressed with this dish.

Next was shrimp with garlic, red chili, pinot grigio, E.V.O.O. and lemon juice. Very fresh, bright, and acidic with nice garlicky notes. Again, a solid dish but nothing special.

The gnocchi with green beans and arugula pesto was my favorite of the night. It was interesting and had a nice mix of flavors and textures.

We also really enjoyed the campania pizza, which had a very nice, tender and slightly chewy crust and was topped with fonduta, ricotta, roasted cherry tomatoes, and basil leaves. This was a very good pizza if you are looking for something a little different. I really liked the oven roasted tomatoes, it gave the pizza an intense tomato flavor.

We finished the meal with the zeppoles, which were deep fried dough balls dusted in powdered sugar and served with a side of honey and dark chocolate sauce. These were very good, but also very rich. They were excellent with the hot, strong coffee we ordered to accompany them.

Like I said, this place serves solidly good food, and you won't regret eating here. However, I think there are other restaurants that take the flavors a bit further and will create a more memorable impression.

pics.caption: Zeppoles served with honey and dark chocolate sauce.
Gnocchi. Potato dumplings with green beans and arugula pesto. Very tasty.
Campania pizza. Delicious crust topped with fonduta, ricotta, roasted cherry tomatoes, and basil.

review.des: Excellent wine choices! Our server brought 3 tastes so we could try before purchasing a bottle. We loved the wrapped dates, penne with vodka sauce, amazing tortellini, everything we tried was awesome! Each plate is a decent size for 4-5 people to taste. Only complaint is the tables are tight! Poor servers are fighting to get thru. But great service! Great food! Great wine!

Tapas tapas tapas, so i stroll through with a fresh outfut the prada loud blouse shaking somehands..... Well im pretty sure most of my yelpers have no idea what im referencing but the legendary Quartinos on North State street is still really consistant.

The service was B
The Food (veal skirt, shrimp scampi, arugula salad) strong B
The dessert (chocolate cake, lemon pie) C
The atmosphere B

Overall will go back for a late drink and snack...

This place is really good and not too touristy. When I lived in Chicago this was deifnitely my go to place in the downtown area. The italian tapas are really good and the wine selection as well. They also have a nice terrace.  The waiters wear soccer jerseys which is cute. I think anything you get is good, I remember meatballs were especially good.

An absolutely great experience!  The staff here was very welcoming with great service.  They also had a great wine list and the food was superb at a reasonable price! To top it off the atmosphere was a lot of fun.  I would recommend sitting outside on the patio where it doesn't get quite so loud when they're real busy which appears to be most of the time.

Awesome authentic Italian small plates LATE NIGHT! How could you go wrong. This place was Classic Italian Chicago. Sat at the bar tables and had an attentive waitress tend to us. We ordered a bottle of Syrah, Prosciutto, the Rigatoni and the veal. The rigatoni was cooked to perfection and the sauce that accompanied it was full of flavor but not over powering. The veal was cooked to a perfect med rare and was covered in balsamic and balanced well. The bread kept coming and we shared these dishes and left more than satisfied. Great resturant.

We stumbled on this place while wandering to try to find a place to eat. Great family feel. It has BUSY for a Tuesday which means it's a good place. Family style dining - share everything. The Brussels sprouts salad and tortellini were great. I didn't love the sauce on the gnocchi. We also sampled the pizza and it was excellent. It is not "Chicago" style though. It is "normal" which I like. If you want loud, family style Italian, go here.

The very best thing at QUARTINO IS The Manager ALICIA--HANDS DOWN!!!!
I was with delightful d (so read her review)
Food was just okay for me!!! We had shrimp, salmon, pasta in vodka sauce n a pizza --none of our dishes had meat due to us observing Lent.  
So now that Lent is over I will go again!!!!
Hoping to try a few different dishes with meat and hoping to love the food on my 2nd visit.
The restaurant is very kid friendly

Excellent. Old school. Affordable. Seated promptly for our reservation. It is loud in this place and it's rather casual but that's part of the experience. Pasta and pizza were amazing, plus the affordable wine selection was great.

Too many Italian restaurants in Chicago try too hard or are too expensive (it's pasta after all), but quartino does not fall into that bucket. Will definitely be back.

This is a great neighborhood pizzeria. They serve thin crust pizza in the Italian style with a great array of Italian dishes such as ravioli, spaghetti, etc. Their pizza is some of the BEST thin crust in Chicago. It is a bit oily and the cheese is a bit thick - but you are eating pizza, not a salad. If you are over the deep dish and want something delish, go to Quartino.

Recently had dinner here with a couple of girlfriends.
We ate so much and every thing we ordered was great.
Fondue, white bean & garlic, meatballs, pizza and plenty of wine and desserts.
I thought our bill was going to be pretty hefty because we ordered so much food (even more than whats listed) It was so inexpensive!
Service is great here as well. I will definitely be back here.

The only reason I gave this 4 and not 5 stars is that they really cram the tables in there. I really felt like everyone was on top of each other. (disclaimer: it was a Friday Night and they were packed) but I still don't want people all around me on top of me. I literally could touch everyone who was seated around me. One couple next to my friend was literally shoulder to shoulder. We actually shared appetizers with them and vice versa.

Everything they serve is Delicious and fresh the small plates to share are right up my alley. Pricing is reasonable and their Italian handmade pastas and cellos are by far the freshest and tastiest Ingredients provided  and served. Representative Alysia's customer service is outstanding and her knowledge and love for the food they serve and company she works for is represented boldly and gracefully.

We will be back again tomorrow night. This is definitely a must when I come into town.

Yelpers really saved me with quartino!

Staying at a nearby hotel, I wasn't sure where to start in terms of restaurants since there are so many in this areas. The yelp community steered me to Quartino and I am so happy they did.

This is a really quaint bar with fantastic food. We had a reservation but since we were there early we ended up just sitting at the bar and ordering there. Service was spot on, and dinner was great.   We started off with polenta fries, but they were not very impressive. Since we didn't like them the bartender actually took them off the bill, which was nice if him. I started off with their tomato soup, which was vegetarian and tasty, for my main I ordered their cheese tortellini with mushrooms and peas, omg it was to die for.... Not healthy but totally worth the calories!

Overall, this is a great spot for a date or dinner with friends. The food is served tapas style (but with generous portions) so it's probably better to go with a few people so you can try more.

pics.caption: Cheese tortellini with mushrooms and peas
Polenta fries... Not very tasty but interesting concept. They needed cheese and salt!

review.des: This place is fun and always great when you need a place to go as a group!  The tapas are delicious, the atmosphere is lively.  I've always had great service, excellent wine and so much fun!

Quartino' is in the perfect location. Shopping coma first, Italian food coma second. This was my experience:

-Early dinner on a Wednesday around 530- so no wait. Patrons who arrived around 7 had about a 20-30 min wait. Restaurant was fairly packed by 630pm.
-Wait staff was very helpful, responsive and quick. Didn't have to wait a long time to flag her down! Which was great.
-appetizer: chicken noodle soup. Really good flavor, risotto gave great texture. Not too salty, perfectly spiced.
-main: Arrabbiata spaghetti with meatball. Sauce was really good. Just a hint of heat, could have used some more. I added red pepper flakes to increase the spice. Meatball was great!
-dessert: lemon sorbet. THIS was great. Very light and refreshing. Wasn't too sweet or bitter lemon. A nice clean way to end my meal and close up the palate.
-wine: I did a 1/4L of the Pinot Gris and it was very good! Paired well with my chicken soup and pasta.

Thanks Quartino! 4 star instead of 5 because I've had better (spicier) Arrabbiata sauce. Otherwise service and atmosphere was 5/5!

We ended up here because we were in the neighborhood and it was one of the few places that was open and actually still serving food! Yay. We sat outside which was fun for people watching :) Also I LOVE that they offer wine in varying quantities just like Italy and not just by the glass or bottle. And the wine was great :) The pasta here is authentic so much better than other places. I forget exactly what the portion was called, but I was able to order a smaller portion which was very much appreciated. It was the perfect size. I got linguini with clams which delicious. I forget what my friend ordered, but she liked hers as well.

I'd highly recommend this place especially if you are looking for a late night spot for food.

My friend took me here for my last meal in Chicago while visiting, and I must say that this was a great way to end my trip. The food was awesome!

We started off with the prosciutto wrapped dates stuffed with gorgonzola and topped with honey. Such a delicious dish. The sweet and salty combination with the smooth taste of the cheese made this dish great. Not too salty and not too sweet, just perfect.

Linguine with clams was the star of this meal. The noodles were cooked perfectly and had a good amount of clams inside. There was a hint of spiciness which I loved. Didn't feel greasy or too heavy with the sauce they used. Definitely recommend this dish!

Duck prosciutto with arugula pizza. Thin crust pizza which I love because you don't get full off of the pizza bread. I always love the taste of arugula on my pizza so I enjoyed this dish too. Nothing too special about this dish, but still very good.

The restaurant is huge on the inside, but it gets busy during peak hours! Since it's tapas style, it's good to try a few plates and share with friends.

pics.caption: Banana with vanilla gelato and whipped cream

review.des:
Delicious food. The short ribs were the winner. It might be my mouth but things seemed a touch salty (the pizza with the duck prosciutto was define bit saline).

Joe was our waiter and was fantastic.

The manager came by to check on us and stuck around for maybe a long time (two or three times) and definitely seemed to be hitting on the gentlemen whom I was dining with. (Who wouldn't love such interest and focus and getting her card and giggling over their non-jokes? Hey manager, how bout don't make a huge todo about giving your digits via card to strangers, especially when the date of one is right there and the other is wearing a ring) I did not love it.

That part was a bit funny but didn't change how good the food was.

My husband and I decided to check out Quartino for the first time last night.  We chose it for 3 reasons...1. Our friend was in for work from out of town and staying in the area
2.  My husband and I were seeing a show at Broadway playhouse at water tower which is also in the area
3.  It had some great reviews on Yelp!

We got the mixed olives, burrata and beet salad, margarita pizza, rigatoni in vodka sauce and the shrimp.

Everything was very delicious...amazing vodka sauce!  
My husband and I got the Sangiovese for our wine which was a great price and smooth.  Speaking of price, the 3 of us got out of there for $100...before tip...to me that is unheard of in Chicago to have full belts plus 2 beers and a liter of wine!  Definitely worth it!

We can't wait to go back and explore the menu more (especially because our friend we were dining with is pescatarian so we didn't order any of the amazing meat dishes)...  I guess that would be the forth reason I chose the restaurant! ;-)

Visited on Valentines eve as all other places were full. Got a corner table for two, the light was dim, the place was congested.. Food was okay, not that great. we ordered a Fettuccini Alfredo Pasta and Gnocchi (got it customized with chicken). Limoncello martini was great though.. must try for vodka lovers. I am not a fan of Italian cuisine.

This was a solid Chicago dining experience. We chose it because of its proximity to our hotel and its overall Yelp rating. We also liked the idea of tapas style dining.
We ordered a liter of Sangiovese and a Salumeria Tasting. We chose: Sicilian caponata (eggplant salad), roasted peppers, salamette, spianata, prosciutto, taleggio and pecorino. My husband could eat this way every night, and especially loved the spianata. The meats are cured in house. I loved the eggplant salad. It was fresh, light and perfectly seasoned. We also shared an order of rigatoni with lamb sugo and burrata. It was spectacular! We ordered a margherita pizza (for our kids) and zeppoli with chocolate sauce to go. They disappeared quickly, so I'm guessing they were good as well!
Our server was friendly and attentive and the manager stopped by our table to say hello and make sure everything was to our liking. The tables are close together and it gets quite loud once the dining room is fully seated. But if you embrace the community atmosphere, you'll have an enjoyable experience.

Crazy good Italian food. Everything we had was exceptional, especially the Tortellini. The gelato desert was also out of this world. Will definitely be back. Elizabeth took great care of us with perfect recommendations.

This place looks like it's alive during the entire time it's open. The place has a very European feel to it. The food I had was delicious and not too small or too big of a portion. I had the linguine with clams and a espresso martini. The martini was a wonderful twist, it tasted very much like a Starbucks drink mixed with some light liquor. The linguine was delicious as well, they gave the option of white or red sauce ( I love that option). The linguine was meant to be eaten at more of a table rather than the bar area but nonetheless it was still really enjoyable. I would love to come back to try the other options they offer. The only downside was the service. It looked like at the time there was only one person servicing the bar area and that poor girl was everywhere- so it took a while for us to order anything.

After reading other reviews about this place thought why not... I so loved the food here that I wanted more the next day.

Being my first tapas experience I couldn't have picked a better place. Tried the spinach salad, cavatelli, salmon,artichokes campo basso, Taleggio and of course dessert of zeppoles with dark chocolate.

If your looking for a quiet place don't eat here the atmosphere is loud. It may remind some of family dinners.

The only down side to the experience was the server. Pretty personal and helpful in the beginning but then he did a disappearing act. So I guess "thank you"to the rest of the staff who picked up his slack.

Next visit to Chicago this will be on my list of places to eat

Food was excellent! More than the pizza any of the pasta dishes you can't go wrong. Definitely that home made taste. The only complain that I would have is that for a table of two the table is small so why not clear out our plates? We running out of room, I almost had to put our watter bottle on the floor.

I came here with some friends while in town on business. The food was delicious! Everything can be ordered either full or half portion.

I ordered the half Wild Arugula salad, which came with a generous portion (enough to share as a starter for 2-3), and the Orecchiete pasta, which was delicious. The plates are designed to be able to share with friends, or can also be ordered as individual portions. My friends and I also got a liter of their red sangria -- an absolute must! Prices were very reasonable. We'd definitely come again next time we're in town!

Quartino is a great spot for a date, or a group of friends interested in trying a number of Italian dishes... Went a few weeks ago, and along with some wine tried much of what is recommended in other reviews - bruschetta, veal meatballs, pancetta wrapped dates, a pizza, and the orechiette & sausage pasta dish. Give high marks to the dates, meatballs and the orechiette, for sure.

This place is especially good on an afternoon / evening with nice weather if you can find a spot on their patio. Add it to the rotation!
Just amazing. Get the pizza, get the pasta, get the house wine.

Meh.

I understand meh is not a word, but the sound you make when you say it is exactly how I felt about my dinner at quartino.

I went with a group of friends on a busy night.  We were seated before our reservation  time so the night started out great. We started with the board of lots of appetizers, which I loved.  They even gave the me gf crackers!  What what.

Then it slowly went down hill. Look, I'm an upper twenties girl and all about a good time. But I couldn't hear a thing in this place.  My ears were ringing for the noise and I couldn't even chat with my peeps without yelling.

Then the food came out and everything  was very bland. I had to add balsamic and parm to everything that came out.

Overall it was an okay meal, but I wouldn't go back.
Great for groups and can accommodate easily (we were 15 people).  The food was above average, as you would expect from a restaurant in River North.

We came here for a birthday party and had ten in our group. Even if you don't have a big group, make reservations! We luckily had reservations so got seated right away. The upstairs is less chaotic and busy than the first level. Our service was great! Our waitress had people helping bring out the food but was present the entire time to direct where the food and drinks went each time. We all ordered various items and shared amongst ourselves. It was a great way to taste different foods and socialize. The food was all excellent and good for sharing between 2-4 people. Among our favorites were the tortellini, gnocchi, prosciutto wrapped dates and meatballs! Our waitress also brought out a dessert for the birthday girl! She was very knowledgeable in all the menu items and helpful when it came to making recommendations! We had a great experience and would recommend this place!

My husband and I went to try this restaurant since it had amazing reviews. I ordered a gnocchi pasta and asked the waitress to add some chicken, so she said that was fine. When they brought out our plates I noticed the gnocchi was missing the chicken so I asked the waitress if I could get the chicken I ordered. She didn't take my plate to correct the mistake, instead she brought me out some cold chopped chicken with some cold pesto sauce over it. So I was technically eating cold chicken and cold gnocchi once I poured it on top. I didn't even eat the chicken since it was so gross. We then decided to get some ice cream and the waitress brought us lemon and raspberry sorbet. Don't get me wrong, it was good but I saved her the trouble of having to toss the sorbet out, so we ate it. The waitress then brought my husband a piece of a complimentary biscotti...in a very uncomfortable way. I have to say she was a bit too friendly with my husband, she even asked him before we left what was on the agenda for the night...it was almost close to midnight! I'm sorry but when you're on a dinner date, as a waitress you should be more respectful of the fact that your own customer's wife is sitting right there! And just observing the way she was inappropriately talking to your husband...so unprofessional. Never going back there again, I must say even my husband felt uncomfortable of the fact that lady came at him.

Food and service is always consistent and great. I miss being able to walk down the street to grab a bite for lunch. Favorite meal is the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo-YUM!! In the spring its great to sit outside and enjoy a glass of win and people watch while eating delicious food.

This place is excellent. It gets a bit loud and busy during the night compared to lunch but the service and quality stays the same. Dining in for a lunch was very quiet, the vege pizza is fresh and delicious, not too heavy, but big portion. Quick tip though, eat it while it's hot. When the pizza gets cold it has a different taste.
The pepperoni pizza is excellent as well, what else is there to say? The sauce, cheese, and pepperoni is proportionate to the crispy and golden browned crust. Highly recommended, coming from a New Yorker.

My buddies and I were in town for a long weekend and we entered this packed place pretty late at night and there were a ton of people still getting big dinners.

We ordered a couple of beers and I ordered a pizza, which was amazing. The crust was nice and fluffy and an awesome sauce.  My buddy got the white sauce pizza, which was equally as fantastic.

The only thing that made me angry was that there was a bathroom attendant in there. I hate these guys. I can wash my own hands thanks you!

Our service was great, super nice guy. We all really loved this place.

Great place for sharing!!!!

My friends and I went here for a late night dinner. I do really appreciate that they open so late. We were greeted by very friendly hostess who seated us right away.. Sweet! We were immediately introduced to our server, who had a good knowledge of everything on the menu. The menu is a bit daunting to look at first but he was able to walk us through the menu with ease.

Quartino specializes in Italian food and all of their plates are meant to be shared. For our appetizer, we got a sampler which came with two types of cheese, two types of meats, and topping such as jams, a beet salad and pickled vegetables. We were unsure on which cheeses and meats to get, so we asked for the chef to surprise us! The platter that came out was HUGE! Certainly enough for our group of 6. Everything on the sampler was delicious!

For our entrees, we order mushroom risotto, gnocchi, fettuccini with clams, tortellini, Brussels sprouts and braised short ribs. Out of all the dishes, the mushroom risotto, Brussels sprouts and the short rib were the best!!

Make sure to get dessert! The Italian donuts with honey and dark chocolate is TO DIE FOR! I wish there was a Quartino in my neighborhood

The Polenta Fries were my favorite thing we tried.

I could eat em all day.

The Halibut was also pretty good.

I made dinner reservations at Quartino for my birthday(weeks in advance) after finding it listed as a highly rated restaurant on Yelp and walking past the restaurant several times since moving to Chicago. My reservations were for 8:00pm but when we arrived, we were told our table wouldn't be ready for 15 minutes... they didn't end up sitting us until 8:20/8:25ish which I find pretty ridiculous after making reservations WEEKS in advance. I got the steak filet which wasn't very seasoned or tasty - our waiter was nice but the guy who ran our food out slammed the first meal down harshly after we weren't sure who had ordered it (didn't look like what we thought it would), pretty awkward. It was also pretty crowded inside. Overall, cool vibes and decorations but not worth how we were treated.

We won't be visiting again.

Every time I'm in Chicago , I try to hit this place . The outside sidewalk tables are a great place to people watch and have a bowl of seafood brodetto . Yum . Dip your bread In the broth or the yummy olive oil . The bathrooms are clean and look like they came from a different era . Beautiful place . Great service and yummy food . Prices are very reasonable too .  I Can't say enough good things about this place . I've never had a bad or even average experience there . Top notch  , all the way .
Love this place!  We have our office holiday here every year and the staff is so great to work with, the food is always great and we love the atmosphere.

We needed a solid meal at 11pm and Quartino came through. The pizza didn't wow me but was filling (a good size), and the tapas were a decent size as well - larger than I expected. Everything tasted good - not outstanding - so a 3 star rating. The wait staff was friendly and energetic even late evening, and the place was bumping for being the middle of the night on a weeknight, so they're obviously doing something right!

I have been here several times and it is always an eating experience. It is usually very busy, and I would encourage a reservation on a weekend.

The atmosphere is lively, with friendly waitstaff and fun, Italian inspired decor. We have celebrated birthdays, Mother's Day, and most recently my bachelorette party here. The food is phenomenal and everyone is able to find something they will enjoy, although it is a "small plates" concept and sharing is encouraged.

I would honestly say you can't go wrong with the food; it is all delicious and will leave you wanting more. Their house wines are also good (and cheap!).

It is definitely an overall experience and I love coming back here to try new dishes each time.
Chicago staple. Small plates to share the awesome Italian dishes. The noise level is high, but adds to the energy of the place.

I came here with a group of 7 on New Year's Eve to celebrate before 2016. The restaurant was bustling with lots of parties. It's always a great sign if its crowded on a holiday, but worrisome about actually getting food quickly. Luckily we had no issues with getting our table and food quickly.

We had reservations and ended up getting there early. We were able to snag a seat at the bar. I ordered a 1/4 L of their Bellini, which was delicious! What makes Quartino different than other Italian restaurants that I've been to is that the dishes are tapas style. While I'm used to larger Italian size portions, I found that Quartino's portions were just right for one person (if you don't share of course!). I ordered the Linguine with clams in white sauce and it was the perfect blend of clams and pasta. Going with a big group always has its benefits, it gives you the chance to try more. I had several bites of the Tuscan Sausage Risotto and Cavatelli. The risotto was good, but the Cavatelli was amazing! The fresh ricotta with the tomato and basil sauce was fantastic.

Overall our group of 7 ordered 10-12 tapas, a bottle of wine, a cocktail, and a pitcher of Sangria and it came out to roughly $240 including tip which is super reasonable. I would definitely recommend Quartino as a great place to grab dinner with a group of friends!

Great spot to host a private party.  Service and bartenders were very attentive.  Food was delicious and plentiful.  Between the calamari, paata and dessert i was stuffed.  Only negative was the AC went out in our area.  But management was very apologetic and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable.  Will be back!

My friend decided to have her bday party here and it was a food-wise decent experience. Since we were a large group, our table got a boatload of dishes to share.

We started with the salumeria which maybe I don't appreciate since I haven't developed that fine a palate yet, but the meats and cheeses were just fine. However, I did enjoy the raw artichoke hearts in EVOO with carrots and onion which is something I don't get everyday.

Next came the potato gnocchi which was a fine dish. The gnocchi were tender, slightly chewy and the pesto sauce was fragrant. Little bit on the small side though.

Had to have a meat dish so we ordered the beef short rib. Compared to other short ribs I've had before, this one just didn't have enough flavor. The sauce was light and the meat was pretty fatty.

The star of the show was the calimari which was wonderful, crunchy, and came with a tasty dipping sauce. Fried stuff usually wins!

The tortellini in alfredo was also decent. I feel like I could have made something similar to it in taste just by making a trip to the grocery store.

Pizza with sausage was meh. The crust was good but the pizza was pretty wet so eating it was a bit difficult with the end just flopping all over the place.

Dessert was good, I don't recommend ordering the donuts though since there's nothing crazy about a plain fried donut in chocolate dipping sauce. Someone at our table really wanted it though.

Food was decent, but the staff here are awesome and make sure you get everything you need asap. It was a good dining experience though I've had better food elsewhere.

I met a family member here for dinner, and was surprised how packed it was.  As a tourist visiting Chicago for the first time, this wasn't the type of restaurant I thought Chicago was known for, and when my ten year old son saw the wine bottle sign, he thought it was a bar.

They seated us right away (I had made a reservation) and we had a truly amazing meal.  Fantastic service, with attentiveness I have had in only a few restaurants.  Seriously, they were on all the needs of the table.

The atmosphere was loud, but comfortable.  Seems to be all types, all ages, from office workers to people on a date, to families.  

Tried the duck flatbread, a fantastic kale salad, and a few other things including a pasta dish that was fantastic.  Really a great experience all the way around.

Disclaimer: I don't know shit about Italian cuisine. But we had an awesome experience here.

VEGANS: There are lots of things you can get here. Our very helpful server (wearing a Juventus jersey) sat down and went over the whole menu with us, annotating every thing we could get as-is or with substitutions. We got the white bean spread, escarole, pasta with broccoli rabe, and olives, and this was the perfect amount of food for two people. Our favorite was the escarole. Oh, and plenty of wine. It was a lot of fun in a nice atmosphere and we would totally come again.

Love this place! Always one of my go-to restaurants when I have visitors in town. It's very accommodating for large groups. The servers are used to taking care of lots of people, so you don't have to worry. I've been here many times and tried countless dishes and haven't had a bad one yet. Plus, they have fairly priced wine in every size carafe you can imagine!

Note that it's a loud, fast-paced restaurant with lots of people, so it's not the best place for people who are hard of hearing.

I'm extremely torn on writing anything about this place.

On the one hand, our visit here was a mess. On the other hand, we received abundant apologies from one of the restaurant group's managers Alysia. In terms of post-dinner customer service, this place deserves more than two stars for their effort to change our impression. But, for the dinner-as-experienced, this place still earns a Yelp "Meh. I've experienced better."

We ate here late, after missing the kitchen at another restaurant during our recent visit to Chicago. It wasn't our first pick and a veteran of many a late-night eat, I tend to keep expectations fairly low no-matter the star-level because, well, staff get tired, people want to go home, etc, etc and so forth.

Even so, our visit here started out reasonable. They have outdoor seating and we were seated back towards what *is* an active driveway. Okay, not ideal. But, did I mention we were extremely hungry? Our server explained the menu to us - Italian tapas, communal serving, no control of the order dishes come to the table. Fine, fine, sounds good to us. But, the initial ordering was the beginning and end of consistent interaction with the staff.

To start we ordered, three dishes for the table. One broccoli rabe side order, one fettucine alfredo, one stracci di grano arso. As we had never been here before and were unsure of the portion size to anticipate, we kept the initial order light.

The broccoli rabe came out speedily enough. Parts of it were burnt to a crisp, not charred, while other parts were slimey. It wasn't great, it wasn't good, but, it wasn't awful either. Just inconsistent in texture in a non-pleasing way. Eh, fine, onwards.

Second order: was plunked down by a woman who seemed ridiculously harried to get back to wherever she had came from. It felt like she threw it down on the table and disappeared. This was the fettucine alfredo. My grandmother always said fettucine alfredo is not a "true italian" dish, it's a bastard american cousin. Even so, this second dish was hardly anything American or Italian. The noodles weren't 'al dente' they were just straight undercooked and clumped together in a fashion you'd see from someone who had only today learned to cook pasta. Parts of them were hard, parts of them were soft. My dining partner said the sauce tasted "doughy", like in a rush they had thickened it with too much flour. And to make perhaps the most pedantic complaint of all (so pedantic I'm cringing at myself), these noodles were pappardelle. There are philosophical arguments about what is fettuccine, what is tagliatelle, what is pappardelle and what belongs in fettucine alfredo - as they're all wider-flat noodles. But, what I can tell you is a super-thick undercooked-over-floured sauce is pretty unpleasant with partially cooked thicker-than-the-average-fettucine noodles all congealed into an inedible clump. This dish wasn't pleasing at all. But, as I said before, we were hungry and it was late.

Third plate: The third plate never came. An apology about the third plate never coming did come. But, by then we had pretty much formed the impression something here was broken tonight. Because of the way their ordering process works you really have no way of knowing if the kitchen is backed up and taking a long time or, as in our case, they've forgotten you completely and sent your dish to another table by mistake.

Pros:
-Their kitchen was open when we were visiting

Cons:
-In the spirit of being true to yelp, we didn't have a very good meal here. Or really enough to count as a meal here. We ordered three dishes, were served two barely edible ones and a third was forgotten about by the staff and/or misdirected to another table.

That said, we were abundantly compensated for our time and negative experience with apologies, comped half-dinner and a gift card to come back and try them again next time.

I've only very rarely seen such active image management at anywhere other than the finest restaurant in New York. For being so attentive post-dinner they really deserve all the stars. However, the whole experience did make me wonder if they retain such high yelp rating through effective 'damage control' or if we really did catch the fluke-of a fluke-of a fluke, of an evening.

We have a gift card. I can't say whether or not we'll be back next time we're in the Chicago area. Our experience was fairly disappointing.

This is Chicago, loud, vibrant, & serves late late night. In our visit to the Windy City, we came here twice. I'm not one for repeats, however, the loud vibe, Carrera marble, hexagone tile with bathroom attendant just lured me in.

Pizzas are not your cornmeal over the top, but they are delicious. The $15 duck prosciutto D'Anitra pizza with the arugula is to diiiiiiie for. The loud ambiance with outdoor seating is a must if you have been hibernating a hard winter.  It's right near the Red Head Piano Bar which is a great stepping stone for a girls night out.

Soak in all the cursing around you.., this is Chicago. Loud & in your face. Enjoy !

I'd visit this place again & again.

pics.caption: Duck prosciutto w arugula. Great late night eats.

review.des:
When we arrived at Quartino we went to the hostess stand and requested a table for two. Rather than ask our name for a list, the hostess simply said that there were no tables (and looked away). That should have been our first clue...however, we noticed that people were giving their names to another hostess outside for the patio tables. So, naturally that's what we did. After they called our name wrong over the speaker and a some confusion about whether we were Carley, Carrie, or Cheryl, we finally were seated outside.
